58.description: Saw the place (actually the other location that I think is now closed) on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. Tried the quesadilla with chicharon and cemitas arabe (spit pork and onions) that were on the show. Both were good, particularly the cemitas. Also had the guacamole and chips and a chicken taco. Liked the  10 choices for cemitas - there is bound to be a meat on the list you are having a craving for (less the veggie and cow foot ones; unless that's your thing). 3 homemade salsas on each table in squeeze bottles; good favors that complemented the food. Overall impressions - good Mexican food (can't comment on the authenticity related to the Puebla region because I have not been to that part of Mexico), really good for lunch, liked the feel of the place, tables were being bussed very attentively, don't care much for the neighborhood (parking is a bitch).  I'd definitely go back.

56.description: Tried the Cemitas Atomica. It was... Okay to say the least. Not the best, not the worst.  We also ordered the chips and guacamole. The chips was kinda stale, the guac was too creamy and lacked flavor.At least the people were very nice, and you get a lot of food for your money. So that's a plus!

29.description: Just tried for the first time today. Really wanted a salad for lunch but this place looked cute. We went in, both my friend and I got salads and split 1 chicken taco. Both things were great! Will be back.

42.description: I will start off saying that I ordered for my first time from Cemitas Puebla last Friday, it was AMAZING minus a discrepancy with the order- I called and mentioned it to the manager (Lee) and received ABOVE and beyond management experience! It is refreshing, as a customer to be heard, and compensation is a definite plus as well.Today I called to order lunch for the office, and spoke with Lee- he took very good care of us, and the food was definitely above par from the regular Mexican cuisine we're use to ordering. We had the Carne Asada Cemita, Atomica Cemita, Pollo Cemita, rice and guac/chips. Myself and the entire office were extremely satisfied with everything, and can't wait to order from Cemitas Pueblas again!

23.description: I'm showing a 5 but would drop a half star for consistency.  Portions vary in size from visit to visit.  Setting that aside, this place is great.  You could really eat here for extremely cheap.  The chips and salsa are a great value and the chalupas as well.   Everything on the menu is top notch.  Definitely a go to place in the West Loop.

47.description: Oh my! These cemitas (sandwiches) are absolutely delectable. My husband had Jamon and I had the Veggie...both served on a delicious sesame bread, piled high with chihuahua cheese. The flavor was outstanding. The only con: we split a cured steak taco and it was flavorless. Don't go here for the tacos. Get a sandwich and enjoy their three yummy hot sauces!

8.description: I used to go to the original location all the time and loved the authenticity of the food.  This place is great as well,  at least when it opened. I feel that they are putting less meat and less ingredients in the cemitas at this new location.  I felt like i was mostly eating bread. At the old location it was pouring out with meat and I loved it.  The most recent cemita barely had any meat.  I will give it some more tries but if quality continues to to be subpar then I may stop going here.  My only hope is my last visit was a fluke and the original quality returns as I used to love the food here.On another note getting an order from grubhub is not nearly as good as getting it fresh.

31.description: Very cute and clean restaurant. Admittedly, I only tried the Carne asada cemita, but I have to say I was a bit disappointed.  There was very little meat, it was barely room temperature and there was a lot of cheese.  Instead of avocados,  it was avocado spread and very little at that. It just was appealing at all. If I return, I will try the tacos instead.

34.description: So good I enjoyed this place I will recommend this to anyone. Sandwiches are so big you can share. Cheap prices

16.description: Honest review: i saw this restaurant on check please and dinners drive ins and dives so i had to come here and see if it was better then rick bayless's xoco it wasnt.  So this is more of a u order u sit down and they bring u ur food i dont like this type of service cause it always ends up with them forgetting something or like we have to get up and ask for like to go bags and clean plates etc. the service was a little mixed they werent really helpful or gave good recommendations and they forgot something we ordered and we waited a really long time for a to go bag like nobody came by and was like hey u guys are ok? Which i found odd because they were just standing in the kitchen not doing anything if ur gonna be lazy then at least hide so i dont see u or pretend to work. One good thing though was they exchanged something we didnt like for something else with no additional charge which is good because some places dont care. Regarding the atmosphere its cute i like the skull aspect of the restaurant its really cool and modern i would say a total hipster spot for sure. Ceviche: i was really disappointed with this. Im mexican so i had my share of ceviches in my life and this was nothing special like its basically a pico de gullo ( spicy mexican tomato salad) with tilapia. It says it came with octopus and shrimp i didnt see any octopus at all like none and there was like the tiniest amount of shrimp. The actual taste of it was really bland needed salt alot of seasoning heat and lemon or lime. Then there was hardly any seafood in it. The chips were seasoned good but were old dont ever serve me old chips no eww not im not an animal and they were kinda greasy  too wouldnt order this againCemita pata: pata is either chicken feet pork feet or cow feet in this case its cow feet. Ik ur thinking like omg why would u wanna eat that sounds gross like ewww i would never but the weird things always taste the best always try everything dont be afraid to try new things. Ive had pata before and its really good if done properly that means removing the hair yes sometimes it has hair and seasoning it properly. It tastes better on a tostada i was skeptical seeing it on a cemita and i should have just not ordered it but i did. My mom ordered it and took one bite and was like omg its horrible like she was so happy and excited because she likes this And she looked so sad like a child not getting what they want for christmas so then i tried a lil bite and was like eww no i cant. Something about it was just really off putting like there was no seasoning so it just tasted like straight from the jar which is not a good thing so we asked for something else and god was loving me extra hard today and the waiter gave us something else instead woot woot!Cemita atomica: this was amaizing i was really skeptical about trying a cemita because i never had one before so this was a complete new experience for me. Picture torta bread with sesame seeds and just having a better taste to it like its not bland ver delicous. This cemita comes with jamon, carne enchilada, melanesa. Omg it was huge like literly i couldnt finish it was so much meat!!!!! What i also enjoyed was there wasnt any of ur typical mexican fillers lettuce, tomato, rice, or beans just all tasty goodness! They put so much cheese on here like if u try to squish the sandwhich all the cheese would be acting like a spring which will make u not be able to squish it. All the flavor combinations worked beutifully together like it was so good. The melanesa was cooked perfectly not to thin not to thick not greasy seasoned really well. The jamon was tasty not salty or processed tasting. Only complaints were there was way to much jamon like it was mostly that and i didnt see any carne enchilada(grilled pork loin)?? Just put less jamon snd more of other ingredients and boom best thing ever!    Cemita melanesa(breaded pork loin): when the pata was a failure we asked for this instead. Ok the problem is that the melanesa was really thin think like paper thin there were two pieces but for a big torta? Just the meat to bread ratio was off either put more melanesa or another meat or make it into a toco instead because it didnt work still tasty though just needs more meat!Taco arabe(spit roasted pork and onions): be warned if u dont like spicy food dont order this! Because u might get a heart attack its not like omg u eat it and ur head explodes but it is spicy. omg this was heavenly. When i opened it up it didnt look appetizing but omg was it good it was seasoned perfectly not bland at all the grilled onions really enhanced the tacoChalupa: This was not a traditional chalupa it was just 4 tacos covered in cheese lol the carne asada tasted amaizing but some of the pieces were completely burnedCookie: i was expecting that typical dry flavorless mexican cookie polvoron but it was really good not the worst not the best the chocolate however wasnt so tasty tasted cheap Ricecrispy not goo

13.description: Been wanting to try this place out ever since they were on DDD (Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives). It was so worth the wait! I ordered the Atomica and the first bite was mind-blowing! The sandwich was bursting with flavor. I could eat it without the salsas, but I felt that I had to since they were good too. Hopefully, I will not take so long to visit again.

11.description: I could eat tacos everyday. I'm a sucker for a good taco & this place has them. The steak is top notch and the Guac is to die for. Horchata is on point and the avocado hot sauce is a must. I even bought a bottle for home. We have ordered for work events and the food came hot and delicious. The atmosphere inside is very chill and I love that they have a out door area. Great for a quick work lunch or date night. I only wish they had their music up a little higher to set the mood.

39.description: This is my now my go-to Mexican spot, which I just tried for the first time yesterday during lunch. The place is clean, the tables were solid (I hate rickety tables!), decor pleasant and very inviting, yet modern. Outdoor seating was available, though I opted out due to the weather. The food was great, simple (seemed like only a few ingredients), and delicious. I tried the chicken quesadilla and chicken cemitas. Three different chilled sauces were brought to my table and I had a very enjoyable lunch. I did like that there were cloth napkins and regular flatware, as someone else noted, since plastic is not only annoying but seems wasteful. The staff was very attentive.I guess my only criticism, if you can call it that, was that the dinner knife wasn't quite strong enough to efficiently cut the cemitas in half like I did. I mean I still managed, so maybe it doesn't matter.Will definitely be back again.

37.description: The food are really testy and truly authentic!!and the service can be better! Fast and friendly !!!

0.description: Their tortas or whatever they call them called are deliciousThe quesadillas are good too for a light snackLocation is convenient Staff is nice

38.description: The food and ambiance were great. I had 2 tacos - the taco orientales and the taco arabe, both very delicious. I docked a star for the horchata, which was way too sweet, as the guacamole, which was just average.

51.description: I hear raves.  Service was really great.  The cemitas was okay. Not earth shattering.  Just okay.  It's a good spot, and it wasn't crowded when I went like some of the places on Randolph.

27.description: After years of wanting to try these sandwiches, we finally made it to the West Loop location. It was the perfect fast casual lunch we were looking for. Even though there were lots of great sounding menu options, but we came for the cemitas. My husband and I ordered the al pastor and carne asada and swapped halfway. Both were really large and really good. The sesame seed rolls these come on are great too, rather than just being a carby afterthought. I wouldn't hesitate to order either of these again. The sauces were a hit as well. The smoky chipotle one is obviously their thing, but I liked them all. We also ordered the large chips and guac. Big mistake in that the portion is so big, we didn't end up finishing it all. Two people will definitely be fine with the smaller size.They sell alcohol at this location, but I opted for the horchata. It was sweeter than I'm used to (not in a bad way) and ended up being a liquid dessert of sorts. Glad we finally made it to Cemitas Puebla, especially since we were able to sit outside at one of their dog friendly sidewalk tables. Pricing was fair, especially with the a la card discount we used, and staff was friendly.

32.description: One of the best, if not the best cemita I've ever had.  Horchata was very good and the music was on point!

54.description: Honest review: i saw this restaurant on check please and dinners drive ins and dives so i had to come here and see if it was better then rick bayless's xoco it wasnt.  So this is more of a u order u sit down and they bring u ur food i dont like this type of service cause it always ends up with them forgetting something or like we have to get up and ask for like to go bags and clean plates etc. the service was a little mixed they werent really helpful or gave good recommendations and they forgot something we ordered and we waited a really long time for a to go bag like nobody came by and was like hey u guys are ok? Which i found odd because they were just standing in the kitchen not doing anything if ur gonna be lazy then at least hide so i dont see u or pretend to work. Something about it was just really off putting like there was no seasoning so it just tasted like straight from the jar which is not a good thing so we asked for something else and god was loving me extra hard today and the waiter gave us something else instead woot woot!Cemita atomica: this was amaizing i was really skeptical about trying a cemita because i never had one before so this was a complete new experience for me. When i opened it up it didnt look appetizing but omg was it good it was seasoned perfectly not bland at all the grilled onions really enhanced the tacoChalupa: This was not a traditional chalupa it was just 4 tacos covered in cheese lol the carne asada tasted amaizing but some of the pieces were completely burnedCookie: i was expecting that typical dry flavorless mexican cookie polvoron but it was really good not the worst not the best the chocolate however wasnt so tasty tasted cheap Ricecrispy not goo

48.description: Meh-underwhelmed and overpriced.  Have had better tacos in my day.

44.description: Let me preface this review by saying that I did not order the tacos, chalupas, quesadillas, or ceviche. Go for their namesake, and get Cemitas here. Specifically the Cemita Atomica. That sandwich alone is enough to warrant the 5 stars. So how do they make their sandwiches here? First, start with a sesame bun which is large enough to hold all the meat, while still being soft and flavorful. Next, a layer of fresh avocado, which brightens the sandwich and adds a healthy dose of fat and creaminess. Then your meat. Of course, at this point you've already decided to order the Atomica, which has 3 meats(ham, breaded pork loin, and grilled pork loin). And then top with Oaxaca cheese, the perfect texture between melted and stringy, and another bun.You order at the counter, and then they bring the food out to you and clean up after you as well. They also provide you with 3 house hot sauces, which are all delicious. I like to mix the orange and red one, and spread it generously on my cemita as I scarf it down. The portion is also quite sizeable; you will not be hungry after one of these sandwiches. Next time I come by, I think I'll give the Carne Asada Cemita a try. Or maybe just stick to the Atomica again. 3x the meat, 3x the deliciousness.

24.description: This place is spiraling down a deep dark tunnel into a mess of half-assed bland "Mexican" food. Each visit has been progressively worse and I'm officially signing off for good. The main issue here is the quality of the food. Today I tried the carne asada cemita, arabe cemita, taco al pastor, and taco orientales. The food was just plain bad across the board - shockingly bland, lacking any seasoning, and lukewarm bordering cold. I'm not a picky eater by any means, but I couldn't even get myself to eat half the sandwich.The carne asada in particular was extremely disappointing. It just tasted like little chunks of mediocre steak and there was nothing carne asada-esque about it. You can't just slap pictures of skulls on your walls and menus and call the food Mexican. Cmon guys. Cemitas Puebla needs to step it up and do some quality control, especially with all the good eats around West Loop.

7.description: After years of wanting to try these sandwiches, we finally made it to the West Loop location. It was the perfect fast casual lunch we were looking for. Even though there were lots of great sounding menu options, but we came for the cemitas. My husband and I ordered the al pastor and carne asada and swapped halfway. Both were really large and really good. The sesame seed rolls these come on are great too, rather than just being a carby afterthought. I wouldn't hesitate to order either of these again. The sauces were a hit as well. The smoky chipotle one is obviously their thing, but I liked them all. We also ordered the large chips and guac. Big mistake in that the portion is so big, we didn't end up finishing it all. Two people will definitely be fine with the smaller size.They sell alcohol at this location, but I opted for the horchata. It was sweeter than I'm used to (not in a bad way) and ended up being a liquid dessert of sorts. Glad we finally made it to Cemitas Puebla, especially since we were able to sit outside at one of their dog friendly sidewalk tables. Pricing was fair, especially with the a la card discount we used, and staff was friendly.

49.description: We had Cemitas Puebla cater a party for us yesterday and it was a big hit. They did a great job; the sandwiches, rice, beans and guacamoe were all terrific.

40.description: We went to Cemetas on North ave all the time.  While the food is still very good and the restaurant is nice, we felt that the food was so much better at the one on North ave. We were already driving over half an hour to get there and now's it's further away.  Not worth the drive for us.  But if we lived near by, it would be a regular place for us.   We miss you.

53.description: The party's over. The food quality doesn't match the original location (my tacos arabe were loaded with fat) and guilting people into leaving a huge tip with an iPad cash register is an unbelievably awful way to treat customers. Most of your customers will just go away quietly without telling you that your stupid register was the straw that broke the camels back. You still have a chance - here's what to do: 1: Beg the boys from the old place to make the long drive and start cooking again. 2: Get rid of the stupid iPad register and put out a tip cup. The Google drones aren't idiots who will come back because of your technology - they just want good food! Unfortunately you won't take my advice and that makes me sad. :(

30.description: Not happy at all with their takeout process.  My coworkers and I just waited 45 minutes for our food and all we got was "sorry for the wait."  They did let us know that it would be  a 15-20 minute wait but c'mon, people are on one hour lunch breaks. You'd think that considering the wait time our food would at least be hot but not the case.  I used to frequent their old location and could say nothing bad.  Definitely not the same for this place.  Wish I could get my money back.

46.description: There are many things more satisfying than a $9 sandwich served all by itself on a huge empty plate. The cheese on my carne asada cemita was ice cold and the meat wasn't warm enough to come anywhere close to melting it, so I feel like that was a lost opportunity. My friend's tacos were alright, but tiny, and one of them had overcooked, crunchy tortillas. The sesame buns are delicious, but not enough to improve the experience. Customer service was poor, no help with suggestions or add-ons, but they did manage to strongly hint that I should  leave a tip. Atmosphere is attractive, but extremely noisy and conversation was difficult. If this was a $5 sandwich served with chips and salsa, this would have easily been a 4-Star review; but the price, flavor, portion, service, and atmosphere left me wanting something more. I doubt I will return and I can't recommend.

1.description: I was really disappointed in this place.  After having such great tacos at places like Del Seoul, Mercadito Kitchen, and passing my various taco joints in Chicago, I expected better.  I ordered 2 chicken and 1 chorizo taco.  The meats were grilled nicely but just nothing came together.  The food experience wasn't very cohesive so the meat tasted great but they just dumped it on a corn tortilla, nothing else was on the taco and you ate it with the condiment that were provided.It tasted nothing like the other places where I had great tacos in Chicago.  Also saw what my co-worker was eating, a ham sandwich, and it didn't really look appetizing. Out of all the places I dined at so far, this was the most disappointing.

55.description: A frequent visitor to the original location, I was so disappointed to hear that it had closed.Visited their new spot today and while the decor and people have changed, the quality of food has not. They have a nice little patio area for small groups to sit outdoors and the menu is basically the same as the last location just in a different style. The Atomica is as good and HUGE as ever, my only complaint albeit slight, was the amount of queso fresco added to the cemita. I suppose it was supposed to melt a bit more, but I ended up with a giant chunk on top. If you never got a chance to visit the original one, it is definatly worth checking this one out!

9.description: I went for lunch with a colleague who had been there before and had tacos--mini-tacos on a double-tortilla, that is. The cecina was done surprisingly well (4/5), and it tasted very good with their green salsa. The orange-red salsa tasted like it had tamarind maybe, so I do not recommend it unless you like the modern Mexican mixtures of sweet and salty together. (Perhaps this is also a region-specific salsa recipe, in which case, then I could just not be used to it.) Also, the dark red salsa was pretty if you want a smokey and hotter salsa--perhaps guajillo-pepper based. Anyhow, from there the food honestly got bland (2/5). The al pastor meat was a bit harder than I'm used to and didn't have enough of the distinct al pastor sauce it's supposed to be prepared with. I could also tell that it wasn't prepared on a shawarma-like Mexican spit with pineapples and shaved. Lastly, the carne asada taco was very basic. I recommend just going for cecina, trying other tacos, or just do cemitas. I'll give this place another shot for the cemitas it's known for next time. The service was pretty fast and friendly, and the place is a clean, modern, small-medium location.

26.description: This review is strictly for the Uber Eats Cemitas Puebla delivery. I got a al pastor sandwich. The bread was good, cheese was good, green sauce was awesome, BUT the sandwich legit had 6 tiny (and I mean tiny) pieces of meat on it - like almost NO meat. A little redic. I won't be ordering delivery from them anymore, but I'll check out the restaurant to see if it's any different on portion sizes.

25.description: It's a real shame how far Cemitas Puebla has strayed from its original brand from Humboldt Park to become this incredibly unimpressive version I've experienced today.I visited the new location on Fulton Market for lunch today expecting to get a slice of heaven in the form of a delicious cemita to fill a gap in my soul.  But the experience turned out quite disappointing.  We ordered 2 tacos and 2 cemitas, in fairly standard variations like al pastor, carne asada... etc.    To kick things off, our food took an surprisingly long time to prepare considering we were one of the only 3 groups that was in the restaurant at the time.  Luckily, we also ordered some chips and salsa that kept us preoccupied for the 15 mins wait.  The tacos came out first.  With a squeeze of lime and some heavy handed salsa-ing, they were actually fairly decent.  I'm not sure if I was just too hungry to be well calibrated, but the tacos' opening act actually got me excited for the main attraction, the cemitas...Finally, the cemitas arrived looking like a million bucks, but that's about where my good mood came to a screeching halt.  At first bite, it struck me... the sandwiches were not hot, and also the sandwiches don't taste like sandwiches.  They had all the components to a good cemitas, but just without ANY flavor!!!  The meats were a bit dry, flavorless, and worst of all... cold!  That set the tone for the entire sandwich... the cheese never got a chance to get going and just also ended up sitting coldly in between the buns.  In a desperate attempt to fix the situation, I must have unloaded an entire bottle of salsa in my sandwich, but things just weren't the same.  It actually became a punishment to keep eating, so we stopped and left half of the cemitas sadly in the cold tray to wallow in shame.The wait staff was nice though... Sad to say, I will never return again.  I will still keep the good memory I had about the original location in a safe place in my brain so I can maybe tell my kids about it one day... To do so, I need to not let these new locations tarnish it!  So this is how Cemitas Puebla will no longer see one another. Good bye...

12.description: Wow...not much to say because the reviewer Annie below said it all perfectly well....This is totally NOT Mexican food..it just has an identity problem....in its attempt to cater to the non-Hispanic clientele, Cemitas Pueblas at least this location, has managed to become a BLAND washed out version of what truly Mexican food is supposed to be. The last time I dined at Cemitas Puebla..was when their North Ave location was still open. I think there they actually would toast the bread a little. Here you get none of that..plus the meat lacks any flavor...This place now ranks up there in the same category as the Taco Bells who think they sell Mexican food.

59.description: Cemitas getting fancy I like real fork & knife no more plastic, smile girls taking your order  nice clean place on Fulton market $$$$

21.description: I went in for lunch on a Tuesday, and asked the woman at the counter to suggest what she likes and so I ordered a cemita with chorizo and carne asada.  This was super tasty, the carne asada was a bit overdone, but I liked the crispy bits and so I decided to give it another go next day when I took my colleague with.  I was so disappointed when I ordered the same exact thing and the meat was actually too chewy to eat, I had to spit out the chewy bits in every bite.  Chorizo was still good, just be aware of the carne asada...

17.description: This is  contemporary Mexican takeout. It's very clean and chic inside. You order food from the counter,you seat yourself, and food will be served. Credit card is accepted.Cemitas arabe: popular for cemitas which is homemade sesame bun loaded with your choice of meat. I chose the popular Arabe which is a spit roasted pork, which was very tasteful. The cemitas is like a size of a burger. The combination of oxacan cheese, avocado, special sauce on the tablet, and the warm soft sesame bun was full of flavor. Quesadilla with chicharron: This is a jumbo size quesadilla that can cover your whole face. The cashier rcmd ordering with chicharron (pork rind). Sounds heavenly and ready for a heart attack. It was delicious with the chihuahua cheese and the crispyness of the pork rind. Minus one star because I was only able to eat half the cemitas and half of quesadillqa. This is quite a heavy meal, perhaps would be a good choice for hangover.

10.description: The flavors where there. I just really wished the cheese to chicken ratio (I got the cemitas  pollo) would have been different. Way too much cheese, too little chicken - for my taste!

5.description: Let's discuss what makes a great sandwich. For me, it starts with the bread. Bread is so much more than just the transportation device that seamlessly shovels deliciousness into my mouth hole.  You need both a decent bread to filling ratio as well as something substantial enough to stand up to the filling without overwhelming it.  Next comes what's in between the bread...I subscribe to the school of keep it simple. You've got me with quality ingredients in the right proportion to one another.Cemitas could write a how-to book on sandwich construction.  The sesame rolls are fresh and hold up well even when you over do it with that insane chipotle sauce.  The meat to bread to cheese to avocado to sauce ration is spot on. The Arabe I had today was loaded with porky goodness topped off with lightly melted Oaxacan cheesy perfection. Admittedly, I am heavy handed with my sauce use...but only because it is so good! Long story short, if you're in the West Loop with $7 in your pocket that you don't know what to do with I highly suggest you 1) contact me and give me the $7 or 2) go to Cemitas Puebla and gave you a delicious bite to eat.

3.description: Huge Cemitas fan. when I first visited their Humboldt Park location, I immediately wanted to order another sandwich after eating my first. With that being said, I had expectations that their Fulton location would be just as good as the original. The design is sleek, and branding has definitely been focused on. It feels new and hip but still approachable. But looks aside, I was disappointed for a cold, dry sandwich to show up in front of me. Perhaps they are pre shaving meat to save time? I would understand if it was deep into the lunch rush, but it was a lazy Friday night with no wait. The boozey drinks are a welcome addition. Though my spiked horchata was far too cinnamon-y, the price point was fair and I'm sure the other drinks have potential.All in all, I think that if the urge to cut corners is minimized for the sake of food integrity, this location can be just as good as the original.

35.description: $3.95 for a plate of chips and guac that is 10x better and 2x bigger than chipotle! good mexican food, order at the counter, and clean interior design. friendly staff, good prices! taco arabe on point! i will definitely be back :)

19.description: Been coming for years when it was on north ave.  Much nicer atmosphere although I liked the pics of luchadors with the owner.  The cemitas is just outstanding.  Been branching out since they moved and really like everything bit get a cemitas first time.  Great service

28.description: Live Cemitas! Have a craving for it? There's no substitute to cure it! Yummy food, fantastic salsas. We have had the veg chalupas and veg cemitas every time, and it gets better every single time!

45.description: Stopped in with a visiting friend after I saw a bunch of posts from local food bloggers. Sometimes, you can trust the Instagram. Cemitas Puebla is terrific. The portions are large, affordable and varied. Service lacked because the order-taker didn't seem too knowledgeable about the various options, but the food came up quickly once we got to our seat. I had the very mild but tasty cemita abela, and it was great to try the various hot sauces available at the table. My friend went for a hotter option, and my quick sample of it was positive. No, that's not cabbage piled on -- it's cheese!This place is casual and definitely off the beaten path, but it's worth a diversion if you are out exploring or are cool enough to live in the growing nearby neighborhood. This is definitely a place I will bring friends to again!

33.description: The Atomica. That's it. The apex of human achievement in sandwich construction.There may be other sandwiches that are *as good* as the Atomica, but there are none *better*.

43.description: Was there a month ago, what a great spot for Mexican food!! Great prices, amazing food and friendly staff make this a solid stop in the Fulton Market area.

2.description: This place is what it is. Super expensive. 3.95 for tacos that have the small tortillas, barely any meat, cilantro and onion. Taco Arabe is the same prices but has a bigger hand made tortilla with decent amount of meat. Same or less amount of cilantro and onion. Horchata is good but be aware that they don't give you the very last batch (see picture attached) of horchata that has all the cinnamon, grinded rice and vanilla at the bottom. They should also offer a Puebla discount

18.description: Let me preface this review by saying that I did not order the tacos, chalupas, quesadillas, or ceviche. Go for their namesake, and get Cemitas here. Specifically the Cemita Atomica. That sandwich alone is enough to warrant the 5 stars. So how do they make their sandwiches here? First, start with a sesame bun which is large enough to hold all the meat, while still being soft and flavorful. Next, a layer of fresh avocado, which brightens the sandwich and adds a healthy dose of fat and creaminess. Then your meat. Of course, at this point you've already decided to order the Atomica, which has 3 meats(ham, breaded pork loin, and grilled pork loin). And then top with Oaxaca cheese, the perfect texture between melted and stringy, and another bun.You order at the counter, and then they bring the food out to you and clean up after you as well. They also provide you with 3 house hot sauces, which are all delicious. I like to mix the orange and red one, and spread it generously on my cemita as I scarf it down. The portion is also quite sizeable; you will not be hungry after one of these sandwiches. Next time I come by, I think I'll give the Carne Asada Cemita a try. Or maybe just stick to the Atomica again. 3x the meat, 3x the deliciousness.

41.description: Quality depends on the type of cemitas gotten.3: I was there a couple weeks ago, and had the beef tongue cemita. It was served cold, almost chewy and raw. Complemented by the green salsa. It was interesting but I would not be ordering it again. I wish it were better seasoned.My friend got the Atomica and loved it. Now they had a half priced promotion on Doordash. I ordered the maximum possible.4: the Al Pastor Cemita was decent. It is a very large portion, the bread is soft and doughy, but most of all, the meat, cheese-string patty, and some avocado are fried to a very nice combination. It's definitely not quite Xoco's level, but then again it's a lot cheaper.2: Milanesa Cemita .. Very meh. The meat was not very fresh, and it did not make my tastebuds happy. 3.5:  Veggie Cemita. Zucchinis, onions, green peppers, and button mushrooms. It is overall, done very well and will satisfy many a vegetarian. There's the right level of umami goodness, and with the green and red salsas, it goes down very well.

52.description: So good.  They cater too!  Love their food.  Outstanding chips and guac.

50.description: If you're looking for authentic Mexican cemitas this is NOT the place to go. I originally visited the north ave location they were attentive, the food was amazing after living in Puebla for two yrs it was great to try the food again however, the Fulton location is not good. The food is flavorless, papalo being one of the main ingredients in a cemita was not put on or offered although they had it in stock and it was really expensive. Very disappointed in how Americanized this place has become yet again another authentic place fell for the profit and forgot about the authenticity and quality.

4.description: I've never had a Cemita before. It was pretty good! Only thing I did not like was all the bread (which I realize that's how Cemitas are). Flavor of the steak was good and the sauces they came with added an extra spice.

6.description: Came here on a Sunday for an early lunch with a friend after church. We strolled in around 11:10 am and were their first customers of the day. It's a bright, cozy little place down in the Fulton Market area. It's not very big so I can imagine it gets pretty busy during other times of day. The people at the counter were very friendly and helped us through the menu and gave some suggestions. I went with the Al Pastor cemita (the cemitas are the giant sandwiches you see in the pictures). For $2.99 you can add chips/salsa and a fountain drink which I thought was a great deal. Everything on the menu is very affordable, which is a nice change from the vast majority of places in that area.The cemita was massive and really delicious. The bun is nice and crisp and they give a generous amount of their house cheese on the cemita (I forget the name for it). They give you three sauces at the table to try and all of them are pretty solid. I didn't find any of them to be particularly spicy if you're concerned about that. Lastly, the pork was well cooked and nicely seasoned on my sandwich. I also really enjoyed the chips and guac! You can definitely tell the chips are homemade. I would totally buy them by the bag if they sold them.Great place! I wish they had a location in Lakeview!

22.description: I know I should have actually tried the cemitas, but I was really craving tacos. I got the steak, chorizo, and al pastor. Of course I also had to get the horchata as well. Everything was really delicious and flavorful. Of course this is a bit pricier than some of the other local Mexican spots. I am pretty sure I will be back to try the cemitas. The staff was nice and service was relatively quick even though there was a short line.

15.description: I have been to both of their locations and I have to say WOW! they are both equally as delicious!! I dont remember if the other has alcohol but this locations drink selections were on point!The chalupas were a pleasant surprise as I was expecting some drive thru concoction lol but instead I got lightly toasted tortillas with onions and cheese ( I also got meat for an extra charge) and their delicious sauces..it was a great appetizer!I am partial to their taco arabe...my bf always gets the cemita which I was lucky enough to try.point is, eat here! its really delicious...prepare to be stuffed and definitely try the sauces.

57.description: I only had one taco arabe, but it was really, really good. Tender meat cooked with onions that did not need any additional sauce. I'd love to try some of their other stuff, too.

20.description: Great spot to grab a bite on the cheap before going out for upscale drinks nearby. The concept of this place is great... imagine a burger joint done with legit mexican food... rather than ground beef patties, cheddar cheese and day old buns this spot has Cemitas sandwiches stuffed with seasons meats like Al Pastor and arabe (spit roasted pork) and freshly baked sesame seed rolls. I highly recommend!

36.description: Love the cemitas, love the three sauces... BUT there was way too much cheese on my sandwich. Not to mention, later after eating my milanesa cemita I had extraordinary food poisoning. I will not be returning.

14.description: Quality depends on the type of cemitas gotten.3: I was there a couple weeks ago, and had the beef tongue cemita. It was served cold, almost chewy and raw. Complemented by the green salsa. It was interesting but I would not be ordering it again. I wish it were better seasoned.My friend got the Atomica and loved it. Now they had a half priced promotion on Doordash. I ordered the maximum possible.4: the Al Pastor Cemita was decent. It is a very large portion, the bread is soft and doughy, but most of all, the meat, cheese-string patty, and some avocado are fried to a very nice combination. It's definitely not quite Xoco's level, but then again it's a lot cheaper.2: Milanesa Cemita .. Very meh. The meat was not very fresh, and it did not make my tastebuds happy. 3.5:  Veggie Cemita. Zucchinis, onions, green peppers, and button mushrooms. It is overall, done very well and will satisfy many a vegetarian. There's the right level of umami goodness, and with the green and red salsas, it goes down very well.

58.description: 8fifty8 is not my typical scene but I had a lot of fun. I went on a Saturday and the music was amazing. I danced the whole night. My friends and I had a table and a bottle so I can't really rate the bartenders or the drink. It seemed like a lot of women were in the bar and the selection of men were pretty gross. There were probably 4 attractive guys in the bar and I only thought that after drinking a lot. There were also a couple of older guys in there 50s or so. I spent the most of the night upstairs. The service that we did receive was good though. Overall I had a lot of fun but I don't foresee myself going back anytime soon.

56.description: I'm not even sure the place is still called 8Fifty8 because there's a sign on the outside that says "vip"-something.  I have only been here a few times on the first floor for special one-night-only events promoted by a friend of mine.Needless to say, the only reason I would go here would be to catch whatever acts this promoter will present.  Aside from that, I'm not a fan of places with bathroom attendants that try to chat you up as if they are your long lost brother from another mother (I can get my own paper towel thank you).  While I'm on the subject of the bathroom, guys beware, there are drink shelves located above the urinals which sound like a great idea, that is until you've had quite a few drinks and forget they're there because they blend into the black wall and bang your damn forehead on them!Bartenders are pretty good for the most part, I haven't had any trouble getting served and the mixed drinks are strong enough.Sound system is actually decent for a loungey place, you don't really want overpowering sound for a place like this. thumbs up on that.They should get rid of the douchey doorman with all the "product" in his hair and staff appropriately for whatever event they are hosting.

29.description: Pros:- Great Music- Large seating areas- Large dance floor- mostly very attractive Latinas with poorly groomed men. Where were the hot men that work out and shave on occasion? I'm guessing at another bar, because this place was packed with men that looked like 3's dancing with women that were perfect 10's.- Multiple levels- strict dress code keeps most white tee wearing thugs out- sexy decor- heavy security - safe!- appropriately lit (dim - passionate not too dark)- they have costumed club dancers. The women were adorable in their matching pin up girl outfits. The guys looked nice in speedos, muscles and body oil. ( bites fist ) I'm not even going to tell you what was going through my mind. Yummmmmmy! Heck yeah - two thumbs up for the sexy oiled bodies dancing on the bar! - Cons- Mostly Hispanic club ( Lack of diversity is NOT cool)- very attractive Latin women that look like they dance in music videos or model in their spare time. Seriously, not the club for Plain Janes it will ruin your self esteem! Ha- I saw far too many pregnant women that were at least six months or more. Public Announcement: There is no reason to see a woman swaying side to side in a night club pregnant. Sit yo butt down somewhere, seriously! Take your vagina home and sew some baby booties and finish your nursery no one needs to be worried if while dancing they bumped into your fetus by accident. So, the bridal shower is in an actual club they didn't expect you to show up 7 months pregnant, it's okay to cancel. Talk about "blocking" all evening, ha ha. - $20 cover free. I wouldn't have paid that, but I was given free admission for a party.- too many short men. I'm 5'1. I wore three inch heels and I was able to glide through the crowd, because I towered over MOST of the men there, but with heels I must have been 5'4 at the max. I'm extremely short and I was taller than most of the men! Ha that's a first in my life!- the weak drinks are over prices average per drink price is $9 - 13. They don't have drink specials and do not serve wine. - it's slightly west of the Loop and at night super dark over there and not safe to walk down the street or anything else. Cabs do not frequently stop here so you might be waiting a long time.

42.description: Short n sweet!! This place sucks!! Very small very crowded... Got kicked out bc a drunk girl pushed me.... Makes no sense!!....Once I got kicked out I ran into a few other ppl who also said they got kicked out for bs......What's the reason???.... The line was crazy long and the place was crazy packed so what do they do kick ppl out so they can charge cover for the new ppl!!! Very bad way of managing ... Will never go there againBouncers and bartenders went both ways---half nice half rude as ever....

23.description: So I was out celebrating my girl's birthday. She bought a package deal, or what we THOUGHT was a package, that reserved two tables and seating for 12 and lowered the cover fee. There was confusion over the servers and it seemed like they almost rejected to acknowledge that there WAS a reserved table for 12, trying to fill us at one table that sat 4. At the end of the night, bill was $500, with a $150 mandatory gratuity. The only problem is that there was NO service at all. We didn't know out server's name, and we weren't being checked up upon. Terrible customer service, but it's up to you. I had a good buzz, and I think it was the crowd of people that made this club a bit more entertaining. On the other side, I recommend a different club because the people who worked there acted like they're better than you, looking down at you with their noses in the air, while trying to charge you too much. At the end, I'm looking for quality over quantity. Pros:-Large dance area-Air conditioned-Double floored-Attracts fun people(and a con)Cons:-Over priced for the quality of service. It's like paying $10 for a PBR tall boy. No one likes paying more for piss water. -Body guards trying to charge more than the agreed price. -Attracts fun people, but only if your standards are low. It's a pretty ghetto bar. There's nothing classy about it. If you think the body guards cared for classy, You'd see less underdressed people in there. But nonetheless, they're fishing for money. -Also, overly crowded. People had no room to walk. Again, this might be because the place is desperate. I encountered many crowds before I entered, shouting about their negative experience. ( I should have listened)Again, if quality over quantity is your thing, I'd enter with caution. I wasn't drunk enough to be fooled by this place. At the end, it was the people that made it pleasing.

47.description: I remember coming here when this place was called Mansion. I've been here a couple times since it's changed names and I've had a pretty good time.If you are paying a cover to get in before 12 you need to do your research. Anybody can get in before 12 most of the time, if you have a text. The night I went girls were free all night.They usually have both floors open which is good. The upstairs had top 40 and dance music. The downstairs played spanish music and whatever else. I never had to wait too long for a drink and the min. for credit cards is $20. Drinks are overpriced which is nothing unusual for a Chicago club. The club isn't huge, but there is still room to dance. Not like those places that cater to bottle service and there is absolutely nowhere to dance. There was a diverse group of people which is always good.

8.description: Went here last night for a friend's birthday. Had a reservation that included bottle service, and expected to have a great time since, you know, friend's birthday + a reservation + another person in our party having arranged all the details in advance. Did we get a bottle? Yes. Were we offered literally anything else? No.Our server, Chan, asked for a credit card to start a tab for the bottle service. This is normal. She then ran the card and presented the birthday girl/credit card owner with a check immediately after presenting the bottle. This is not normal AND really bad business. It's mostly insulting. Our ice and mixers were refreshed throughout the night by bussers, but we never saw Chan or our host again. No drinks were poured for us beyond the first round/bottle presentation, and nothing else was offered. (And, no, it wasn't a particularly crowded or busy night.)The last insult was another host trying to seat a party of 8-10 in the space next to us, which sat 4-6 people, instead of on another neighboring and totally empty banquette. One member of our party and the party of 8-10 had to intercede with that host and explain the obvious to him -- don't cram us all in here when the club is not hurting for bottle-service space. The club itself is fine, but we all left insulted and disappointed in the service we got on what was supposed to have been a special night.

31.description: Club does bad business and fails to pay their bills and the DJ's they book.. Do not work with them #TOTALCROOKS

34.description: Had an all white attire party there spend a lot of money on party favors and my own delicious cake to find out the day of my big day that I could not bring in my cake but that is not what I was told at the time of reserving. There for, they had to let me bring in my cake or we were taking our party else where. I reserved 4 tables, you need to buy at least one bottle per table and the cheapest bottle is $250.00. First of, the girl that failed to communicate with the others about my cake introduced herself, never apologized and so she introduced our server for the night. Very nice friendly guy, helped us decide on buying 5 bottles plus informing us of the 20% Gratuity he did take care of us in the beginning before disappearing he brought one bottle then a female comes and says she is our server she brings out the second bottle. They only serve you the first drink when they bring the bottle and then disappear. My guest got tired of waiting for the rest of the bottles and so they started walking over to the bar to buy their own drinks. It got so crowded in there when we bought our drinks and walked over to our tables half of our Martinis were spilled. T-E-R-R-I-B-L-E if you ask me, all that money plus gratuity for very bad service. People were trying to sit at our reserved tables and when I informed one of them of the tables being reserved the lady tried to punch me and headed towards my face. My fiancée pushed the lady back but she still got to pull hair out. Where was security? Where were the supposedly CLASSY people? This is a very bad choice to have a classy party in. Can't dance without getting bumped into and so we danced by our tables and seats. LOL My cake and champagne bottle was the only good part of my party up until we had to leave. My cake was smashed in a plastic bag, Disgusting! Valet was very fast and I do suggest getting valet parking because there is a lot of homeless people asking for money in front of the club/lounge. Is good to give and also you don't want to get robbed just because you said no. We find out later that even though we ONLY got 3 bottles in total my fiancée was charged for 5. Now is that very classy? I don't think so, more like very thirsty! LOL You live and you learn and Thank God for websites like this one that allows you to tell your experiences so smart people read them and not make a wrong choice like myself. :) I believe if you are not rich and we all work for our money we all want to spend it where people appreciate your business/money and not make you feel like you are making bad choices with your money. Just saying....

16.description: Pros:- Great Music- Large seating areas- Large dance floor- mostly very attractive Latinas with poorly groomed men. Where were the hot men that work out and shave on occasion? I'm guessing at another bar, because this place was packed with men that looked like 3's dancing with women that were perfect 10's.- Multiple levels- strict dress code keeps most white tee wearing thugs out- sexy decor- heavy security - safe!- appropriately lit (dim - passionate not too dark)- they have costumed club dancers. The women were adorable in their matching pin up girl outfits. The guys looked nice in speedos, muscles and body oil. ( bites fist ) I'm not even going to tell you what was going through my mind. Yummmmmmy! Heck yeah - two thumbs up for the sexy oiled bodies dancing on the bar! - Cons- Mostly Hispanic club ( Lack of diversity is NOT cool)- very attractive Latin women that look like they dance in music videos or model in their spare time. Seriously, not the club for Plain Janes it will ruin your self esteem! Ha- I saw far too many pregnant women that were at least six months or more. Public Announcement: There is no reason to see a woman swaying side to side in a night club pregnant. Sit yo butt down somewhere, seriously! Take your vagina home and sew some baby booties and finish your nursery no one needs to be worried if while dancing they bumped into your fetus by accident. So, the bridal shower is in an actual club they didn't expect you to show up 7 months pregnant, it's okay to cancel. Talk about "blocking" all evening, ha ha. - $20 cover free. I wouldn't have paid that, but I was given free admission for a party.- too many short men. I'm 5'1. I wore three inch heels and I was able to glide through the crowd, because I towered over MOST of the men there, but with heels I must have been 5'4 at the max. I'm extremely short and I was taller than most of the men! Ha that's a first in my life!- the weak drinks are over prices average per drink price is $9 - 13. They don't have drink specials and do not serve wine. - it's slightly west of the Loop and at night super dark over there and not safe to walk down the street or anything else. Cabs do not frequently stop here so you might be waiting a long time.

13.description: A group of us went here for New Years Eve and it was terrible.  We bought pre-purchased, $85 dollar tickets, arrived at the door (the line that had formed) at 8:45 and didn't get into the venue until 9:40.  Our package included all you can drink from 9 to 2, for the record they weren't serving drinks outside.When we finally arrived inside where we were given 10 drink tickets and were required to check in our coats for $3 a coat.  Mind you, that line was another 45 minutes. Around 10:30 we were able to start drinking, socializing, and exploring.  What we soon found out was: it took on average, 20 minutes to get a drink (this was based off purely waiting at the bar and doesn't include traveling to and from), 50% of the customer venue area was blocked off for security, staff, and vip tables, and the entire place was overcrowded. Every where you walked was like trying to get through a crowd.I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

11.description: I've been here a few times and i must say it's a nice club. Dj's are great and there's always a good crowd. Ladies must wear heels and of course it's a 21 and older club so they have a wide variety of liquor at the bar.

39.description: Decent. No cover (if you're an attractive group of girls, anyway). Moderately classy inside, and plenty of places to sit. Kind of dead for a Saturday night, though. Didn't stay long enough to find out what the drinks were like, we went someplace more happening.

37.description: This is my first time ever writting a review on yelp!! I was so mad and dissapointed i shouldve... Listen to all the reviews of this club So i called the club to get info about the dress code just i had read all the reviews about this club being "elite" but there wAs nothing ELITE about it on friday it was my birthday& i decided to go all out there and get a party bus. When we got there they had a problem wit us being on a party bus but i could understand that... Well w.e. we went in line then they started to ask if we were gonna get wristband or bottle service but we decided to do bottle service...well on there iphone app amd the txt messages i was receiving said it was free cover charge until midnight! Well its 11:15 and only 12 of us got in for free while 7 had to pay $10 bucks? What i didnt understand is why anyone had to pay when the website and txt said FREE COVER TIL MIDNIGHT. They couldve said something to me before we got outta the bus :/ & its not like the club was packed cuz it wasnt! It was pretty dead & when i went downstairs to talk to them why 7 of my guest has to pay the bouncers where rude and just pointed me to "the manager" & all he had to say was since im doing bottle service and only buying 2 bottles only 12 of could get in because we were a LARGE party and he hoped i have a good time? Really thats not even answering my question but w.e. i went back upstairs to just get even more annoyed to find out that they werent gonna let us go outside to smoke!?! Wtf! I had never had that kind of a problem wit any club! At this point it hAd been ridiculos i told my party we were leaving when a promoter i guess? Comes rushing quickly to me asking me what was going &  he went to go talk to them downstairs so they can let us smoke... He gave us a free bottle of champagne and treated me to sum free shoots. They arent organized & need some lessons on customer service skills. I felt so embarrased with my guest but im glad everyone had a good time I was so dissapointed it was my 1st and last time thereBut i dont recommend this club at all for any bday or any large group occasions! There are plenty of other clubs in chicago that wont make ur life complicated when all u wanna do is have fun...NIKKIS is lke 3 miles from there & will definetely have a great time witout the fuzz

0.description: Came here for a friend's birthday. She booked a table, so we got there pretty early. Overall, music was ok drinks were ok. Not my preferred location. I honestly liked the smaller room they have on the lower floor!

38.description: Ok, this place is a riot. It may annoy some people but I just laughed at how "elite" this place is. Great people watching! The drinks were overpriced, not surprisingly. They had dancers walking through. The bouncers kept everyone in line. They had a bathroom attendant & I hope she gets paid a lot to deal with that place. Downstairs is a completely different scene: completely Latino as opposed to the "Hollywood" party upstairs.

51.description: i was at this club on a friday night for a birthday party, it was free until 11 since i pre game hardcore i was straight when we arrived, it was quite a few people there for 10:45, the music was nice all night long and nice blend of hip hop and r&b, the place filled up quickly, we were able to move to the vip area near the front door it was a lot of seating and the area was comfortable. it was a nice crowd, nice music and nice people.

27.description: Everytime I go I have s blast with awesome people! Its wonderdully diverse unless u go on Latin night or soul night which is self explanatory lol. The sound system is amazing and there is always great DJs here! Yes the drinks are on the higher end but with how cheap the bottles are pitch in with a few friends , and it works out for a great experience with more bang for your buck.  ,look your best! And leave the doucheyness for downtown!  The decor,atmosphere,and music keep me returning

32.description: My husband was wearing a "designer shirt" and was told he could not be let in. He was too dressed up apparently for this club. Second, the DJ sucked! He kept playing song after song but only for about 30 seconds and then he'd scratch some other song, spoiling your mood to dance! There were primarily Hispanics in this club, & not a lot of culture mix. I'm pissed off that they called this place 858 because that's San Diego's area code, & being from S.D., this club does NOT live up to SD's night life. It is FAR from being a dress to impress club, no good DJ's, and not elegant or classy like SD, LA, Miami, SF, NYC, LV, or any of the good nightclubs I've been to around the country. The bartenders were nice and easy to get to but I won't be partying here anymore.

54.description: HORRIBLE!! Do not go here! My friend and I went here to celebrate a couple birthday's in our group. We had a huge group- atleast 30 people. As soon as you get in they force you to check in your coats. This would be an ok request if the line for the coat check was NOT 45 minutes long! Very unorganized and inefficient staff. We finally checked in our coats after a long line and when we went to get them back they had lost them!! After 45 minutes of waiting- they were still unable to find them. I had to force them to let me into the coat room to look for the coat myself- and it was the first coat!! During the 45 minute wait- our group that was waiting with us was treated very poorly. People were asked to move atleast 5 times and i was not allowed to wait by the coat check! I can forgive a mistake- but I CANNOT stand my friends being treated poorly and not a single apology for the inconvinience!Never going back!

48.description: So, I'd have to say I had a good time while here based on the company I kept. The people looked nice and it has an atmosphere that caters to sexy woman. If you want to dance the DJ has a good selection of Hip Hop, Reggae, and Pop music, however, the line up is a bit bizarre. Im not sure what the DJ was thinking not playing songs that ideally go together. As a House, Pop music, Hip Hop and Techno in moderation listening New Yorker who didn't come to just wave my hand in the air, I can say this isn't the place to "wave 'em like you just don't care." This is an official stand around and look cute kind of an establishment so DO wear sexy heels and find the perfect location against the really nice walls to post up and profile. DO expect to get a full dosage of haterade if you do more than one in a half step.  DO listen to the first eight bars of all your favorite songs and DON'T expect to dance better and longer than the caged dancers on the dance floor and if you DO, you may get a dirty look or two.

44.description: Nice environment for a lounge/nightclub - chandeliers, nice detailing on the walls and ceilings, a long bar for leaning and mingling, and dark decor, but not too dark.The night that I went, an average DJ almost ruined the night by failing to set a mood (any mood) with the most annoying DJ habit: playing the right songs in a weird pattern, and often only playing a minute of songs as if he was trying to squeeze everything in.Honestly, a well-planned playlist on an iPhone would be better (or since he played a lot of old-school hip hop and r & b, I could have loaned him my my discman.)Now the sexiness of the place and the door issues that many have complained about: unlike a lot of places in Chicago, this place aims for the Miami/West Hollywood strategy of letting in the pretty people first. Ladies should wear tight dresses and stilettos and fellas should look like they have money to spend. It's elitist and tough, but that's what they are going for.  The reward for getting in is one of the sexiest atmospheres in the city. Upstairs, there is space for go go dancers on two platforms and a glass box for a feature dancer in front of the bar. I'm not sure if there are always professionals in there, but they were talented. If you feel like dressing up, I say go for it.

24.description: First time to Chicago and I will never go here or recommend this club to anyone. It is not diverse at all. And the not the bouncer but someone who they apparently pay to stand outside and watch people told my friend she couldn't get in on her birthday because she was in flats. However there were plenty of girls that were of a certain race wearing flats that he let right in. It said nothing about this ridiculous "dress code" policy on their website, twitter and when I called it was not mentioned to me. I can't tell you how this place is from inside and I never will! Go to 8fifty8 at your own discretion. This is my first review on anything and it was only because this policy confused me to anger. Hope this helps.

7.description: Bartender that does parties and 40$ all you can drink does not want to work... Guy acts like he has a better job around... Get rid of him terrible guy second floor back area by the camera.

49.description: Don't  bother. Guys, call in for dress code.  You gotta love it when they pull you out of the line and tell you that you are dressed too casual.. but a guy with pants half way down his butt gets right in.

40.description: Ended up here celebrating a police academy graduation with friends. Place was awful. Only person that could possibly give 5 stars has to be an employee. Drinks were weak,  $20 cover (for some of us anyway..some people including guys  just walked right in), "Security/bouncers" were douchey as hell. Was told cant stand here, keep moving like 4 times...including while I was standing in line for coat check. Pretty low class, only thing missing was a pat down when entering. Bottom line is there are tons of other upscale clubs I'd rather spend my money at and be treated like an adult instead of an 18 yr old. Amateurs enjoy!

53.description: I've been here before, but I didn't realize it was two different sides. The first time I was "upstairs" I guess...and this time I was on the "lower level" I assume. I came here for my cousin's birthday on a Friday night.  It wasn't that bad. The music was decent. They played techno, hip-hop and top 40. I signed us up for the guest list online and we got in free. Which is always good! It was snowing that night, but I found a park right across the street! (SCORE!) So that made the night even better. :-) PLUS, they had a bar special or something until 11 where any kind of juice mixed with Absolute Vodka was FREE! Which was AWESOME! To top off the decent night, a random drunk guy from Miami ended up buying us a bottle to celebrate my cousin's b-day. Nice night indeed.

30.description: Normally I'm the complete opposite of that 50 Cent song. You can rarely find me in the club with a bottle full of bub. Every once in awhile though, I'll follow a pretty girl behind the red ropes hitting up the type of atmosphere that I usually hate. Rolling in with awful expectations for 8fifty8 I was surprised to have actually had a pretty good time. They played a pretty decent mix of music when I was totally expecting a headache concocted of EDM and dubstep. Bottle service was actually relatively affordable, and the servers were actually nice when I was totally expecting snooty. Yes..it is a club so you can expect the same dress code/wait in line song a dance, but once you get in I don't think it's the worst place on earth to be and that's probably one of the nicest compliments I've ever given a club.

46.description: I visited this spot a while ago for an Eric Benet event. So, I don't really know what it's like as a club. The SpaceWalking into this place, I was pleased with what I saw. A long Corridor takes you to the main floor, with 2 bars. Decor is cute and modern. There are plenty of places to sit, (if you're the lame one of the group and go out to a club to sit) and a nice amount of dance room. Downstairs, it appears to be more of a lounge. There is another bar with more couches but TVs were added here. The event was great and the DJ was great, so I had a great time. Because of the space and the vibe of 8fifty8, I will definitely be back here to try it out as a Saturday evening spot.

1.description: So this is pretty much a mixed review. My sister decided to have her birthday celebrations here over the Halloween weekend. She booked a table a few weeks in advanced with the manager Gabriel. Everything was set, she got an email the day of to confirm the table and it looked like everything was good to go. They advised us to get there from 9-11 for a free entry. We got there around 9:30ish and we got in with no problem. We let them know we had reserved a table only to tell us that we had to wait till 11 pm because our table was downstairs and they don't open that section till that time. Okay no biggie, we'll wait till then. So we all pretty much just huddled around the bar area, grabbed some drinks and waited. Here comes 11 and we advise them again that we had reserved a table. So they bring us downstairs and they lead us to the VIP tables only to sit us at the very end corner of the table. We had a group of 9, how were 9 people supposed to sit in a very small corner table? We literally were taking over the empty table next to us. So here comes this guy with a clipboard and a headpiece telling us that we all had to move because there was going to be another party next to us. I advised him we booked a table for 9 how are we all going to be huddled in one corner. He advised me they only ask us how many people per table because that's how many they are going to let in for free but none of there tables fit 9 people. Okay so if that wasn't enough they then told us that they would eventually have to move us from the table they originally gave us because the party next to them would have more people expected. Okay by that time I'm pretty pissed. They had us move to another table right across the room ONLY to tell us that AGAIN. We would have to be moved eventually. My sister was asking them why would you move us around if we paid for a table just like everyone else? Why do we have to sit at the table for only a limited amount of time. After they finally got themselves organized we got moved to ANOTHER table, one that we wouldn't have to be moved from for the rest of night. All the while, the server for the night was explaining to us that the manager ALWAYS books reservations for big parties when they don't even have tables for that size and it makes they're jobs harder. She advised us that he would be showing up later on and that she would tell him to come talk to us. So when we finally settled in, we got our bottles and TRIED to enjoy the rest of the night. Mind you, some of our party still had to stand around the table since our spot was still very small. The only good thing about this club was the music. They had a good variety of music on all the floors. This was our first time going there and it just so happened to be on Halloween day so yes it was pretty packed. I'm not sure how it gets on any other days. So the night was coming to an end, my sister asked our server if the manager ever got there and she told us that he never showed up. Very professional. So all in all, come here to dance and for the music but I don't advise you to book a table for them because they are very disorganized especially for big parties. Kudos, to our server who seemed to be the only person that cared about our situation and giving my sister a free shot at the end of the night:)

55.description: Horrible! This place advertised complimentary entrance if you get on the guest list and arrive by 11pm. So we got there and the doorman said that it was only until 10:30pm, and it was still 10:15! I don't mind spending money but I don't like being lied to. This place tries anything to get you there. Mandatory coat check, which is fine, but when I paid the girl tipped herself and never gave me any change. They're scammers, spend your money somewhere else.

9.description: We went here for New Year's Eve and was HIGHLY disappointed in the entire event. We ordered our tickets online for $85 each and were told the event included unlimited drinking from 9 pm to 2 am (only got 10 tickets to use on drinks - what happened to unlimited), included gourmet appetizers (fried pickles, pizza, and mozzarella sticks are not gourmet), were told we'd get New Years part horns and didn't get that, and the worst part of the whole thing was standing in line outside in 4 degree weather with no heat lamps for 45 minutes...this is unacceptable! We also were required to do a coat check that cost $3 and you couldn't get your coat until midnight or later (why?). Oh, and apparently it's acceptable to have sex in their booths - complete #trash #byegirlIf I had to pick one good thing, it'd be being able to leave! I will NOT be back and would highly recommend anyone to not go there either! Good day!

26.description: this place can be run a little better the location not ideal if you are looking to go to different clubs.  I recommend looking up which Dj is mixing. I have been here multiple times and try to go when Dj image is mixing.  Wristband special is great and I would update guest on valet parking I would have drove my car if I knew you had valet parking.  overall great place to dance and have good drinks.

25.description: Ehhh with all the hype surrounding this place I thought it would be a blast... Not! Came here for my bestfriend's birthday and the scene was just bad. Floor was half empty on a Saturday night and everyone was just standing around! I blame the Dj. Good thing the cover was free.

12.description: They say one price then charge you another , do not come here if you want to leave with all these taxes gratuity left hidden in your bill . They charged me 250 for a bottle then don't even mention the extra 75dollar tip included ? Isn't that illegal in this state ? They will definitely be hearing from my attorney if I don't get my money back from this scam they are running

59.description: The only thing I remember being good was our own party because we managed to have a good time regardless. Well, also, their sound system was good. Besides that, obnoxious bouncers who would give you a hard time just to get a stamp as you're walking out, very drunk people going on dropping drinks from the bar, weird line-seating, horrible slow music because the DJ himself looked bored and like he couldn't give a damn about being there, and the music wasn't even dance music!

21.description: Idk I don't like this place. Wassup with the bathroom attendants... I'm not antisocial I just don't like that every time I go in  the bathroom the attendants asking for a dollar or two for handing me a paper towel nd opening n closing the faucet for me. I feel obligated to give them something. This place focuses on taking your money, shots are 10-12$, mix drinks  I think were 12 I can't remember I got wasted lol. Point is I spent over 140 in a few hours. BTW . Doormen are cocky  power hungry boys.

17.description: Normally I'm the complete opposite of that 50 Cent song. You can rarely find me in the club with a bottle full of bub. Every once in awhile though, I'll follow a pretty girl behind the red ropes hitting up the type of atmosphere that I usually hate. Rolling in with awful expectations for 8fifty8 I was surprised to have actually had a pretty good time. They played a pretty decent mix of music when I was totally expecting a headache concocted of EDM and dubstep. Bottle service was actually relatively affordable, and the servers were actually nice when I was totally expecting snooty. Yes..it is a club so you can expect the same dress code/wait in line song a dance, but once you get in I don't think it's the worst place on earth to be and that's probably one of the nicest compliments I've ever given a club.

10.description: Went for NYE with a purchased ticket with an "all you can drink package" starting at 9. Despite the fact that my group of 9 people had tickets in hand, we had to wait outside for 40 minutes while they only let it people who had tables. It was 4 degrees. I almost went home despite the pricey ticket already purchased. Additionally, the "all you can drink" promise translated to 10 drink tickets and 40 minutes taken away from the deal due to the lengthy line. Needless to say I will NOT be coming back and will advise others to do the same........

5.description: We decided to give this place a try after seeing an event listed on allevents.in. It clearly said entry was free until 11pm. Upon arriving they said a text was required to enter. After very calmly and kindly explaining that it didn't say a text or RSVP was required anywhere on their ad,  all they offered was a careless and all too comfortable "I'm sorry" while turning their back. It leaves the impression that they do this often. I'm not sure if maybe they do this just to get you there after what might've been a long drive, forcing you to uncomfortably decide between paying a cover if you even can or having wasted gas, time, energy and money as you figure out whether to go home or find another place.

3.description: Came by to check out 8fifty8 on a Friday night when they open, as listed on their website, with a party of six. There was no one at the door but it was wide open, so we went inside upstairs assuming there would be a door person up there. Well, when we got upstairs, some guy yelled at us as though we were bad children. Couldn't imagine a worse first impression; we just got in a cab and went to a different club.Thanks but no thanks.

35.description: As opposed to many other clubs in Chicago, 8fifty8 is relatively classy and upbeat. They have two floors, in the winter the first lever is cooler and nice but the music between the floors is the same genre just different songs. I love the decor and the style of mood in the place however be warned because it does get crowded and drinks take for ever even though there are three bars. Ladies: the men here seem to be more stylish and cuter variety for every kind of woman's taste. :}

19.description: Although we reserved a table for bottle service and it was advertised as free before 11 we were forced to pay $10 at the door (we arrived before 11). The management did nothing to correct the mishap. Seriously!? I opened a tab and at the end of the night I was given the wrong card and ID. I didn't realize it until I got home so I had so go all the way back to get my stuff. There was no offer to pay for my cab, comp my drinks, nothing. Customer service is not their thing.

28.description: This place is terrible. Rude security everywhere and they wont protect you from the creeps outside the place. Coat check was filled by 11:30p - the room is smaller than my closet - and despite people leaving early, the closet girl refused to take more coats or even add a friends coat to an existing checked one. Cover is way too high - even if youre going for a birthday party you have to pay. Save your money - handing it over to these clowns won't do you any good. Head downtown where youre much more likely to get treated with respect and will be among much better looking people.

45.description: Went here on Saturday for their "50 Shades of Grey - Fantasy Party" The club layout is nice....we had VIP on both floors and I loved the ample amount of bars (but weak drinks). The only issue is I am not big on techno, I mean it was okay earlier in the night but we were promised some top 40 stuff

33.description: I went here on a Saturday and had an okay time. I heard good things about this place so I was so shocked at how boring my first time here was. I heard Friday nights are way better. But my complaints are that the drinks are way to expensive. A vodka and pineapple is 10 dollars. Every mixed drink is 10 and up. For this area the drinks should not be this expensive. Also the music was horrible. It was all techno. I'm just a hip hop head and top 40. Also the people weren't friendly. It wasn't one of those clubs where you go and people are dancing and people make conversation.
