No one was really dancing, However, on the first floor they were playing like reggae and reggatone type music. It was somewhat better down there. However, i don't recommend this place for a Saturday if u don't like techno. I think it has potential to be good on Fridays from what I have heard.

43.description: I would give them 0 stars if that were possible.  I was there on Saturday night with 2 friends and they did not let us in because I was wearing flats! Really? no flats.  That made no sense to me at all since I was dressed very nicely. And I'm actually recovering from a sprained foot so I couldn't wear heels even if I wanted too.  I don't recommend you go there, the bouncers were very rude.

2.description: Why send out text that says "Fwd: Baby, won't you come my way. (2nite) "EXCESS" @ *8fifty8 ft. *DJ GORDO* (Free all nite w/Text) Stay Tuned! "ASYLUM" 10.29 @ JOES + HALLOWEEN 10.31 @ 8fifty8.com"Then say we still have to pay at the door? Clearly says free all night.. don't send false advertising.

18.description: This place is a dump!  Drinks are overpriced, staff is unprofessional, crowd is so-so...  There are much better options in the neighborhood.  I feel like it's an unsophisticated audience they target and it shows.

41.description: Zero stars!! This place was supposed to so great too  had a party with 30 good looking women and the security wouldn't even let us stand or even dance where we wanted to! They literally were pushing done of the girls heads to tell them to move!! What a joke! Then they said they were going to give some of the girls a section with a table then decide we have to buy 4 bottles when most of the other girls bought wristbands and they're own drinks! 4 bottles between maybe 10 girls ?? Who drinks that much! Then they kick out the bachelorette "groping " a security guard! ?? Bullsh**!! I never really give places a review but after a month of planning a party just to walk in and get kicked out for no reason !! No way.

52.description: TERRIBLE! DO NOT GO HERE!  From our experience this weekend, I can summarize why:1. If you book a party, you will not be receive anything that you are promised. Bottles are $275 even if you are told they are less.2. Tables are tiny and the space has to be shared with bordering tables, in a very close proximity.3. Girls have were forced to pay at 12:01am even though the table was booked for the party4.  Bouncers were extremely rude, close the door in your face on the outside regardless of the fact that a $275 bottle was being purchased. 5. $40 credit card minimum at the bar. $10 drinks and shots, which for this place is so not worth it. 6. Demographic of the club makes you feel that you will be mugged at any moment. 7. Small club, bad music, terrible overall!

50.description: I've passed this place a few times before but never realized that it was a club. My friend had a birthday thing here and we were all on a list for free cover- there were no problems cutting the line to get in. The music on the second level was a lot of fun, mostly hip hop and top 40. Drinks were decent, the staff really nice (they have guys hanging around on the landing between floors to hold your hand as you get to the last few stairs, which I suppose could be helpful if you're super drunk). The only thing that made this night a short one for me and one of my friends was the crowd- super sloppy and pushy, and it got JAMPACKED. We couldn't take it anymore and left to meet up with friends at a more chill spot. I might just be getting old but I was really not going to stay much longer after the tenth person shoved into me and heeled my foot. It really felt like my college clubbing days...and I am (unfortunately) not in college anymore. Over it. *$3 for mandatory coat check

4.description: Celebrated my friend's birthday here about a year ago on Sat Not sure the cover since we were a "birth day party". Was a pretty good night. Nothing special but cool none the less. Good spot for hip hop music. Not the most  spacious place and can get a bit clustered into the later hours. We were a party of 4 and seemed a lil clogged especially for dancing. Dress code is not too formal but if you want to dress up you won't be out of place and if you want to dress down the same applies. Was accompanied by my lady but looking around did not notice too many attractive women (incase you fellas were wondering).  Drink prices for a night spot are fair (Scotch is no more than 10 dollars). All in all, Not a bad selection if your date or you wants a fitting site for rap music.  Probably, would not recommends it for a "guys night out" since , lets be honest, we go where the nice looking ladies go.

6.description: I was there for NYE. It was so terrible that I decided I would write my very first Yelp review. With taxes and service fees, my ticket cost about $105. You would expect some kind of satisfaction for that price. No, sir!My friends and I arrived at 9:40PM. We waited around an hour outside. It was so cold that night, I saw a polar bear cry! Bouncers were taking bribes to let people cut-off the line. And nothing warms you up more than having to wait longer because some idiot chose money over ethics.Once in, after having lost an ear and two toes in the cold, I thought I could finally enjoy the night which had started in the worst possible way. I thought wrong. 45 more minutes for the coat check. What was infuriating is that they ran out of space in the locker-room exactly when it was my turn. I was so pissed-off, I thought about taking an entirely new direction with my life, maybe move to India, or become a farmer...  In addition to that, like other victims of this scam mentioned here, the drinks weren't unlimited, they weren't even drinks actually, but rather sodas with a hint of liquor in them; I didn't see any food (probably because by the time I got out of the coat check line, it was 11:30PM), the photo shoot was over as well, the bartenders despicable and the whole place completely overcrowded.I now hate this place passionately, which might be the only good thing I got out of this. At least I now know that I'm not a robot, that I'm capable of very intense feelings.

22.description: Horrible!!! I just left this place the ladies that worked in the front did not know anything about the club. They were extremely rude & on their phones the whole time when asking what promotion agency they worked for! False advertisement on their website / txt. The only reason they received one star is the security guys outside of the the club helped us by directing us to the manager. The bar tenders sucked as well! They did not know how to pour drinks and would ignore clients by being on their phones! Word to the owner do not use this promotion agencies until they hire a professional staff!  Hire new bar tenders!

15.description: So we went here for New years and what a lousy experience. I have always had a blast for new years but this place made it hard to enjoy! The ad for new years was a joke martinis were not included even though they said it on the NYE package we paid 80 dollars for! Sex on the beach drink was also not included according to the rude bartender upstairs, she wanted to charge us 48 dollars for 4 drink is she stupid? She called it a specialty drink I'm sorry we paid  80 a person to be there and all sorts of drinks were off limits! nothing complicated about sex on the beach at be she just doesn't know how to make one smh! Joke never been to a place like this. The dj on the first floor was also a jerk they advertise all this variety music and that is also a lie!!! Same crap over and over and similar to what they play on the second floor I asked for Latin music and he gave  me a dirty  look and rolled his eyes and yelled NO! Worst experience for new years! Never ever again. Bathroom attendant was rude as he'll she told me I have a tip jar u can tip u know... rude!!! My husband  had all the money I'm sorry but she didn't have to be so dam rude. I don't need her pumping soap in my hand and giving me a towel I can do that myself! Just a bad experience for all the  money we spent I'm so fustrated at the lousy experience we had we spent 360 dollars for the 4 of us and we had more fun at patrons on a regular night... Smh lesson learned and I will never come here again I don't need to be treated rudely when  I'm the paying customer. And don't LIE ONLINE AND PROMOTE SOMETHING  YOU CAN'T FULFILL!!!

57.description: I was so excited to come to this club i had been hearing fun things about on twitter! I was so excited when i got there to experience it. I get there, and I waited in a very unorganized line, and i get told your "foot-wear is inappropriate" I ask them why? They said they don't do flats for insurance purposes, I promptly told them i had knee surgery a year ago i can't wear heals because its not safe for me. They told me i had to leave the line, the guy was like oh you can speak with my supervisor, I said no where on your website says what type of shoes are required or dress. I left feeling very humiliated and very angry, i told them on twitter what terrible and rude service they had, and i was very dissatisfied with them and i will never return there. I had rode the train an hour to come, and i got turned away 10 minute later. 8fifty8 is a ridiculous and rude place, and does not get my vote of confidence.

20.description: A group of us went here for New Years Eve and it was terrible.  We bought pre-purchased, $85 dollar tickets, arrived at the door (the line that had formed) at 8:45 and didn't get into the venue until 9:40.  Our package included all you can drink from 9 to 2, for the record they weren't serving drinks outside.When we finally arrived inside where we were given 10 drink tickets and were required to check in our coats for $3 a coat.  Mind you, that line was another 45 minutes. Around 10:30 we were able to start drinking, socializing, and exploring.  What we soon found out was: it took on average, 20 minutes to get a drink (this was based off purely waiting at the bar and doesn't include traveling to and from), 50% of the customer venue area was blocked off for security, staff, and vip tables, and the entire place was overcrowded. Every where you walked was like trying to get through a crowd.I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

36.description: Do not go here! This place is a waste of time and money! Drinks are super expensive, people weren't even dancing and men are creepy here. There are plenty of other bars in this area, to to one of those instead!

14.description: Went here in February, the place was awful,  security rude. And it's all about who spending money on bottle service....  would never go back again.

3.description: i've been meaning to check out the retail meat packing stores on and around fulton market and finally stumbled across this one. i was peeping thru the glass door as i saw two men wrapping pigs of all sizes from my height, 5'8'' and smaller. each pig was hanging upside down on a moving rail on the ceiling. lol. what an interesting sight! i love blood and gory things so if you can't handle things like this, don't even bother coming in. anyway, the workers were very welcoming, gesturing me with their hands to come inside. they let me and my friend take pictures with hanging pigs.. ha! and showed us the way to retail meat.this is a perfect place to purchase good quality, large quantities of pork and everything else edible inside a pig plus meat and sausages! when you walk in, it's like a buffet of raw meat. everything from liver, hooves, feet, intestines, ground meat, ground pork, ribs, etc. were all neatly piled in orderly bunches. prices are not that much cheaper than jewel but it's better quality for the price you pay at jewel. next time you're throwing a bbq, stop in here!

1.description: If you are looking for a clean, customer-oriented place with signs and so on, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for parts of the pig that most butchers dont have fresh (jowls, back fat, kidneys, etc.), this is one of the best places in Chicago to go to. They have every part of the pig you can imagine and at extremely low rates! The whole thing is an experience--you walk into a refrigerated hall with blood soaked floors and dozens of people are hurling pieces of pig around... its a dream.So, if you're like me and want to make guanciale with jowls or cure a bunch of belly, or do confit with it and don't want to pay huge amounts, this is your place. Plus, everything is super fresh since they usually sell wholesale and therefore have enormous turnover (they process several thousand hogs a day).If you want a shopping experience more exciting than usual and want to buy parts you are worried you won't find elsewhere, this is the place for you!

2.description: This place is great! u can pick up whole pigs, lambs, goats you'll see em hanging from the meat hook when your walking the store.  They specialize in pork, and if you are interested in making you own sausage they sell huge bags of unseasoned ground sausage pork + boxes of casing.  I buy a lot of my steak here. Yesterday i picked up outer skirt steak for $2.70 a pound!  When you buy beef here it comes vacuum sealed, and requires some more trimming when you get home, but it is well worth it. In the case of the  outer skirt steak i picked up yesterday i grilled it with all the fat on no trimming at all tastes amazing just like tango sur!  Go here and have a look if you want to save some $$$$ and get top of the line product.  Check out there web site to see what cuts the sell grantparkpacking.comdon't be shy ask questions i found the staff to be very friendly

0.description: Keep in mind what this place REALLY is, and if you are still in the market for what it offers, it maybe the best place in Chicago for it.Allow me to explain in simpler terms...What this place is or has:- Wholesale meat distributor- Plenty of on-site butchers to keep up with cutting on demand- Their business is primarily for restaurants who order in bulk- This is a PROCESSING facility, which means the nitty-gritty work is done here (though, I'm unsure if actual slaughtering is done here)- Almost every cut and part is available for purchase here since they are dealing with the whole animalWhat this place is NOT, or does NOT have:- An overtly sterilized showroom with butchers in gleaming white coats packing pre-cut meat for you to take home- A clearly marked door for outside consumers to walk in and get what they want (just walk in, and someone will point out where to go to place your order or to see what they have ready)- A comfortable area to wait in line to buy your meat- A household consumer friendly one-stop-shop for all things BBQ (this is meat and only meat)When you put these things together, in my opinion, you have EXACTLY what you need to buy fresh meat (these people distribute to restaurants and probably many grocery stores directly) to go about your cooking, BBQ, recipe, etc., and to get it done at a fraction of the price you'll pay almost anywhere else.I'd call this place dirt cheap, but adding a word that means unclean is not accurate.  The entire operation is an icebox (felt damn good walking in there on a 90 degree day) and nothing looked to be dirty at all.  I'm confident things are "clean" and fresh and when you consider how much cuts are, you'll then see just how steep a standard mark up is at places like Jewel, Dominick's and other grocers.Considering this place's specialty is the pig, you can get a lot of pork for very little money.  Hams for about $1.50/pound.  Pork Butts for about the same.  Pigs ears, kidneys, livers, skins, etc.  They also had a lot of cuts of beef available, and I watched as someone had a butcher cut individual steaks for him.If you are a little queasy around raw meat or feel a little twinge in your stomach during that scene in Rocky where he runs through the meat plant punching a side of beef- then head on down to Olympia shiny store front where you'll find those butchers with the bleached coats.If you are looking for tremendous value and pretty much any cut of pig/beef/chicken you want- come to Grant Park Packing.

4.description: Just talked to a gentleman there. Probably one of the rudest people I have ever talked too.  I guess it takes a pig to know a pig!  I wouldnt eat their product is it was givin to me for free...Good Luck with that quality service!

58.description: i paid 105$ to change my I5 screen and when i paid they promised a 90 days guarantee .. after 2 weeks the screen cracked i went back to them and they said no cover pay again .Im so disappointed .

56.description: I found this place online and decided to use them instead of the Apple store to replace by iphone battery.  The price was about $20 better with the Yelp coupon they had online.  I had some concern with the quality of the battery.  The woman at the counter said it's guaranteed for 90 days.  That day I was happy, as the new battery was an instant improvement. My old battery would last half a day, and this new one was getting me through the whole day.  That is up until 3 months later.  I think my battery starting showing problems on the 91st day...no joke.  It is is now been 4 months since I replaced the battery and my phone is back to barely getting me through a morning.  It's almost as if this place purposely using batteries with a 90-day usage shelf life.  Anyway, the lesson I learned is not to go for the good deal.  I would have been better going across the street and having Apple replace the battery.Update:  appreciate the owner's comment and concern to my review. I ended up getting an iPhone 6, so not never went back for my iPhone 5s battery. But increased my star rating as it seems they do care about customer service.

29.description: I just walked out of Ubreakifix. And I'm typing this on my phone. An hour ago, I was convinced I wouldn't have a phone. Apparently, the sound of panic is the sound you hear when your phone takes a dive and slaps screen down onto a concrete floor. My poor iphone was completely spiderweb shattered. After first calling my provider and being told the only way I would be able to fix this would be to pay $700+, this place was my second call. They told me to come right in, and I just beat a weekend rush because it was all fixed within about 40 minutes. It's seriously like it never happened. I will say that I was lucky, as a rush did roll in while I was waiting, but the miracle workers employed there upped the estimate time and offered next day pickups with courtesy and professionalism. An hour after something happened that I have literally had nightmares about, it was fixed. That's insane! My only regret was that I wish I called this place first. I could have saved myself a little bit of stress.

42.description: I have never written a bad yelp review before, but I am so disappointed with this place that I felt i needed to tell others. My experience with this store was always good. I never had too many problems. However, this time around... It was horrible. Absolutely nothing went well. I dropped my iPad off because the LED light had become unplugged. The iPad would turn on, but it wouldn't light up. When I dropped it off they told me one week max, to give me a diagnosis. I thought that was a little long, especially because I told them what the problem was. But I agreed to the wait time and submitted the iPad to them for a diagnosis. After a week, I never got a call to tell me that it had been diagnosed. I called and they said to give them a couple more days, and they would call me by the end of the following business day. The told me that the technician was currently working on my iPad, and that he didn't know what the diagnosis was yet but would let me know very soon. I agreed to wait longer. The time came and when again. No call. I called a THIRD time. I was told they had never got to my iPad and hadn't had a chance to diagnose it. I stated that I was told a couple days earlier, that the technician was working on it. They didn't have an explanation for that and simply said "well we haven't gotten to it yet. We're understaffed". I said "well how much more time do you need?" They said 3 more days. I agreed to wait longer... Again.Three days later... No call. I called again, they said they STILL hadn't had a chance to look at it. I stated that I'd just come pick it up and to forget about diagnosing it, I'll be taking it somewhere else. When I went to pick it up there was a woman in front of me dropping her device off for repair. I couldn't help but notice that they said they would have it fixed within an hour. I thought "An hour?! I've been waiting 2 weeks just for a diagnosis. An hour?!"I got my iPad back after two weeks of them doing absolutely nothing. They were dismissive in their willingness to understand my frustration and did NOTHING to accommodate me, despite false quote times and false promises to contact me. This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had with a company. I'll never go back.

23.description: After scouring the internet for a place to fix the cracked screen on my touchscreen laptop, I came across uBreakiFix in LP. I was pleased with the yelp reviews and saw they even had a discount deal. I saw that they specialize in cell phone screen replacements, but that they also work on the type of laptop I have, so I went for it. They were quick to work on my laptop - leaving me without it for just a few hours - and were very friendly and attentive. Unfortunately, in the process, a part of my laptop was broken. Needless to say, I was upset and concerned that I would not be taken care of, stuck with a functioning, but aesthetically displeasing laptop. This was not the case! I was contacted by Ron, the district manager who was incredibly informative, attentive, friendly, and personable through this process. My issue was solved in a timely manner, leaving me very pleased and gracious. Would definitely recommend to others.

47.description: I shattered  the screen of my phone and had to order a part from china. I called  and  asked one of the techs at UbreakIFix if they could repair my screen and they  made sure I ordered the right part. The part finally  arrived and I called them to make sure they could fix it. They reassured me they could and told me to bring it in. I brought  it in and they looked at the phone and the part and said I needed an additional part and they couldn't replace my screen. I told them  this was the right part and all they needed for the repair.  They insisted I send the part back for a refund (to China )  and send the phone back to ASUS  for a repair.  I told them there was a young lady on youtube who performed the repair with no tech experience.  They insisted the repair couldn't be done properly by them. I called several places and all of them were scared or didn't  want to bother with fixing my phone. I called NOVAFIX , told them I had the part and asked if the could fix it. They said  "sure bring it in , we'll have it done in an hr or less". They  fixed it in 35 seconds and couldn't understand why  UbreakIFix couldn't fix it. Glad I got my phone fixed , no thanks to the people over at UbreakIFix, Lincoln Park location.

8.description: This place is super honest. I took my phone in and they offered to take a look before replacing anything. The battery was depleting in a matter of minutes. They warned me that it may be a motherboard issue and replacing the battery may not do the trick. I told them to go ahead and replace the battery anyways. Also, they were closing in 35 minutes and didn't give me any sort of run around about closing soon. I even asked and they said it wasn't an issue. I visited a nearby coffee shop and when I came back, lucky for me, they had reinstalled the battery and it worked! Yay! They also upsold me on a glass screen that has protected my actual glass screen. It has saved my screen, so I'll be going back to get that replaced. That only takes about two minutes and costs $40? 50? Not much in comparision to another iPhone screen.

31.description: Good service & only took an hour for Iphone screen repair. Thanks for the fix!

34.description: I am extremely upset and disappointed in this store because I would bring all my devices here and recommend them to all of my friends and coworkers because of the great customer service and the quick turn around for my devices being fixed and back to me. This time though it wasn't the case at all. In June I broke my gfs iPhone screen and took it to ubrakeifix, I've had a MacBook that needed to be fixed as well so I decided to kill 2 birds with one stone. My gf was able to pick her phone up the same day but they said the MacBook would be ready in a week. I called a week later and asked if my MacBook was ready, the way the person spoke on the phone it was like they were clueless of MacBook even being there. They put me on hold and 5 mins later they find the MacBook and said they haven't had a chance to look at it yet and proceeds to ask me what is wrong with it . I remained calm and explained the issue they said ok we will take a look at it and we'll give you a call in a couple days, I never received a call. I called a week later again and asked about the MacBook, again they told me they had techs look over it, and they didn't see the issue I explained they said the hard drive just needed to be replaced. They told me the amount of the services and when the parts would be in to get my MacBook up and running, again I was told I was going to get a call back, never received that call. So 2 weeks later I call back and asked about the status of my MacBook and they say the part still hasn't come in... A month later I call again and ask the status of my MacBook, they tell me they put the hard drive in and it didn't work still. They said the techs looked over it again and IT WAS THE ISSUE I BROUGHT IT IN FOR AND EXPLAINED TO THEM OVER THE PHONE OVER A MONTH AGO! So now they have to order the parts for that. It is now the end of August and I still do not have my MacBook. I went to the location a few days ago so I can speak to someone in person to see if the were really bull shitting me, I was GUARANTEED that my MacBooks part would arrive Monday 8/24 and I would be able to pick up my device at end of day. I called twice to see if that part was in and the 1st time I was told it would arrive at 3pm I called after 5pm and was then told no shipment has arrived. My frustration is through the rough and it's taking everything in me not to go up to the business and give them a piece of my mind for wasting my time. Especially since I told them the issue in the beginning and they still made their own wrong diagnosis. I just want my device back and it's now been almost 3 months. My time has been wasted and my patience tested and they want me to pay full price. I think not. Ubrakeifix get it together! I don't think I'll be coming in anymore after this. If anyone knows any good places to take my devices too please let me know.

16.description: I would like to give negative review to ubreak because of customer service . I booked an appointment from their website for fixing a water damage of my HTC mobile. When I get at ubreak north cl office ,a guy on reception said he sent an email saying they can't fix my cell, I was thinking may be I forgot to check my emails , I came back and searched a inbox and junk folder and found no email saying same. This is really a unprofessional and makes me sad for seeing this kind of customer service. I won't recommend anyone for going to this place.

13.description: While ubreakifix was not able to fix my iPhone, it was still a good experience and I wouldn't give them lesser starts because of it. It's not their fault that my phone ended up in my puppy's water bowl and no amount of rice could save it. This shop has really nice people working there, they are open late for those of us who work, and were able to do a diagnostic faster than the 48 hour time frame they gave me. It costs $0 for a diagnostic if they can't provide a solution, which is better than other companies in Chicago who charge $29.99 to just look at the phone. Hopefully I won't have to come back here, however if my new 6S ends up in water again, I would definitely use this company.

11.description: I can't even with this place.  I cracked my screen.  It was fine for a while.  But then the display started to go.  Then it was unresponsive.  I bought a repair credit for UBreakifFix, but didnt really expect that they would be able to help.  I took my phone in, and they fixed it while I waited.  Granted, I waited for about an hour, hour and a half.  But, they fixed it.  Brilliant.  Will definitely go back.

39.description: It is very hard to find electronic fixers that are not money hungry and excellent service. Thank you ubreakIfixit and Rob for showing that! Before taking anything into apple, I highly recommend that you consider this amazing team! Excellent excellent excellent.

37.description: Let me first start by complimenting the young lady at the counter, Ms. Alena was very pleasant and professional. She assured  me that my shattered cracked screen on my iPhone 6 wasn't too bad (I was having a meltdown). With the yelp deal the price wasn't bad, just under a hundred. Verizon wanted $200 and apple wanted $150ish. Not only did I save money by they finished in less than a half hour. My phone looks brand spanking new. Thanks Guys (and gal). I hope I never experience this again but if I do, I know where to come. I would definitely recommend this place

0.description: Always a great feeling to get your iPhone screened fixed, and even a better feeling getting a coupon off Yelp!!! Make sure you're ready for leg day when you go up to the store! Staff was super friendly and great to talk to.!! They really know what they are doing and they are there to help!

38.description: This place is awesome! My iPhone was broken (the screen shut off, blank) and i was really worried. I went to Apple Genius Bar on North Ave. They said my phone is dead and suggested me to buy a new one (of course!) however i didn't think my phone was dead because i could hear when it rang but i could not pick it up because the screen was blank, i couldn't swipe open the screen.luckily I found this place, EDDY who looked at my phone, went in the office then a few minutes later he came out and said its fixed!!! Really? Unbelievable!!! Apple Genius Bar couldn't fix it! EDDY wouldn't even charge me for this because he said it took just a few minutes to fix!!! Amazing! This place is good at what they do, nice and professional. I highly recommend. Apple Genius Bar? Not so genius.

51.description: My iPhone battery hadn't been able to hold a charge for weeks, I thought it needed to be replaced.  Phone just needed a little cleaning, which took just a few seconds.  They could have easily changed out the battery, but Jon solved the issue quickly, free of charge.  I appreciate the integrity.  They also fixed a broken iPod too in the past, which has worked great since. I highly recommend this place for an honest appraisal, good work, and quick turnaround.

27.description: I'm so thoroughly unimpressed with this store. I came in for a screen replacement on my phone. They didn't put the screen on correctly. So I return and drop my phone off. 3 days later they call to say that they need to fix the battery, and that's their reason why the screen wasn't on right After the battery was "replaced" they call me in. I travel all the way back to this store, just so they could tell me they didn't check to see if the new battery worked. And lone behold, the new battery didn't work. So now I'm waiting ANOTHER week to get my phone back This has been a long and painful process that wouldn't have happened if the workers had done their job correctly and hadn't have called and lied to me about my phone being "ready for pickup"I'm angry. I've wasted so much time traveling and have had my phone there for way too longI will NEVER bring another phone here. Ever.

32.description: So, two days after I write the review, I get a call from corporate. I spoke to Jill, who was nice, polite and sympathetic. She forwarded me to the location in the South Loop, where they replaced my front panel and display.They then told me even that might not stick because its probable that the body frame of my phone was damaged in the last repair, and I'll need a really good phone case to hold it together. When I told this to Jill, she sent a Otterbox Defender case to me through the mail. The phone looks good and is better now, but all this could have been avoided in the first place. I'm adding two stars to the review for the extraordinary service I was offered by Jill. Thanks a lot.

54.description: After driving all over the city, visiting countless repair shops that were seriously overpriced, I was recommended by a friend to visit UBreakIFix. Thank you so much for repairing my cracked  screen and doing it in such a great time frame. The location of the business is great, so while you wait, go shopping, have a beer or a mani-pedi. All in all, great service. Would definitely recommend them in the future.

48.description: Took my Mac in for service June 26. Having not heard from them I called July 10 to find computer was ready and they tried to leave a message. When I was picking up the lost my charger and accused me of not leaving it as they do not take chargers. Then why did the clerk ask me if I left a charger?  When I refused to pay full price and said I would leave if they didn't agree the guy said they would call the cops. Wait, call the cops because you lost my charger?  I asked to talk to the owner. I still want to talk to the owner.

44.description: Talk about customer service! So, semi long story- I shattered my iPhone screen (for the second time- I'm a klutz) and took it to uBreakiFix for same day replacement at a lower price than Apple. It was ready promptly in less than an hour and looked great! However, problems arose when I took it home and the screen was occasionally a little "glitchy" in a way it hadn't been before (a Google search tells me that this can be known to happen when replacing the iPhone screen). I called uBreakiFix and they were totally nice about me bringing it back in for them to look at it. After some time waiting for it to get glitchy again so they could see what was going on, they agreed to replace the screen. This is where things went downhill for my phone. Apparently, when they tried to swap out screens, my phone flat out refused to work! Ahh! To make matters worse, I was leaving in less than 48 hours for a 5 week trip and desperately needed a working phone. My tight timeline meant that they didn't have enough time to run diagnostics on it and figure out what was going on. So, because they're the best and they stand by their work, they decided to just replace my phone with a brand new one- at no cost to me. AND, because they could only get an appointment at the Apple store after they closed, the manager Eddy stayed late and drove it to me.  I repeat- HE DROVE THE PHONE TO ME so I wouldn't have to go out of my way. Unbelievable. I honestly have never had better customer service. They took a stressful, potentially disastrous situation and turned it into one that I am constantly raving about to my friends. So, in summary, should I ever need any further iPhone/iPad/whatever work done, I will be taking it to uBreakiFix for the best customer service imaginable, and you should be too!

24.description: They were great. Efficient, professional, got the job done fast and right! Would definitely recommend.

7.description: I would highly recommend this place.  I brought in my water damaged Iphone and in 30 minutes I walked out with a completely working phone.  The guy that I dealt with, Robert, was kind and extremely helpful.  Now I just need to keep my phone out of water!

49.description: I DONT HAVE TO JUMP TO THE IPHONE 6So my iPhone 5 seems to be fading, I have trouble getting a good connection for a charging and I'm now wondering if the battery is still ok.Went into uBreak and the staff was really nice, even changed the tv to follow the cubs-sox game.So they assure the battery is ok and I'm wondering if I can defer the expense of an upgrade.Then I tell them about the problem with the power port.  The guy goes in the back and returns to tell a me there was a lot of lint in the port.  Cleaned it out.No charge for the battery check or power port issue.  Great place!  Will be back when other stuff goes wrong.sJust north of North Ave on Clybourn

40.description: My phone screen was fixed without an issue.  I did price match with another cell phone repair service because they advertised this on their site like crazy.  $99 for an iphone 6 screen repair.  They didn't make me feel good about the price match and gave me problems with it because the guy I dropped my phone off with was not the one that gave me my invoice.  They quoted me an hour, it took 2.  I don't mind waiting 2 hours.. just be honest with me about how long this will take.

53.description: Shattered smartphone screen? "Accidentally" giving your phone a bath? Didn't buy phone insurance? U Break I Fix is for you!! Same day repairs (I was quoted an hour with an appointment but they were already behind when I arrived. Took hour and a half). Still not bad considering. Prices are a little high- $149 for glass repair on my Samsung Galaxy. But if you check in on Facebook they'll give you 5% off. I guess that saved me half of the sales tax the lovely city of Chicago charges. Make an appointment online or just walk in. I'd suggest an appt because this place is hopping. Too many clumsy phone users out there. Line out the door and all the seats in the waiting area filled when I walked in. Also, just in case they need to order a part make an appt. They'll call you if they have questions prior to your appt. Located above a nail salon and insurance agency right across from the North and Clybourn red line stop. Street parking available. Plus you can grab some eats or do a little window shopping while you wait for your phone to be fixed. 90 day work guarantee. Now don't be so clumsy and drop your phone again after getting it fixed!

30.description: Easiest thing in the world. Screen cracked into a million pieces on my iPhone 6. Pricey but it's worth it for the convenience and professionalism. In and out in under 40 min. Do it. Get the voucher.

46.description: I dropped my iPhone 6 and shattered the glass.  uBreakiFix fixed it for me in 45 minutes.  They were fast, friendly and reasonably priced.

1.description: This place is the real deal. It's funny because I would have never found/heard of it if it wasn't for an employee at the Apple store down the block who recommended it to me too.  So I dropped my phone at Big Star one night, went into Apple and they wanted $175 to replace the screen!! I gagged. That is wayyyyy to much for a screen swap.  I took the Apple employee's advice, walked a couple blocks down to UbreakiFix and now I tell all my friends about it. They did the screen replacement for only 100 bucks. Heck yes. This place is tight. =)

55.description: I broke it and they sure did fix it in 30 min. My iphone looked good as new. The only thing was that they did not give me a work order form and insisted on not giving me my phone without an ID and were kinda jerks about it.

9.description: SOMETHING HAS GONE SERIOUSLY WRONG AT THIS PLACE SINCE MY ORIGINAL REVIEW.In short: brought my phone in for a simple repair.  They fried it.  Then (probably knowingly) gave me an obviously defective phone as a replacement, and refused to admit it is defective.  Along they way they did not keep commitments, gave me the run around, and kept me without the use of my phone for weeks.  I would never use this place again, there are plenty of other places that repair phones.  Unless you are willing to risk having this happen to you, AVOID AT ALL COSTS.  AVOID AVOID AVOID.The longer version:I brought my phone with a broken screen to this location.  They replaced the screen and gave it back to me. When they handed it back to me it would not turn on, which they told me was because it needed to be charged.  When I got it home I discovered it would not take a charge and when I brought it back, they looked at it and concluded that their technician had actually ruined the phone and that they would replace it.  They told me they would call me when they had a replacement.That would've been fine.  But what really happened was:* They never called, I had to finally call them to see what was going on.* They gave me a phone of the same model and told me that it was 'brand new' even though they did not give me the manual, charger, etc. that would come with a new phone.* The phone they gave me clearly suffers from well-known problems that some phones of this type have: camera light sensor does not function properly so picture quality is terrible.* A related problem is that phone auto shut off function (for when you stick it in your pocket) is triggered by same light sensor issue.  So the phone turns itself off unless it is opened in very bright light.* The phone I brought them did not suffer from either of these problems.* I demonstrated the problems to them. First they told me that it had to do with the phone case, then they told me that they swapped several camera parts in and out of the phone and couldn't make a difference.  Then they told me that there was nothing wrong with the phone.* Repeatedly told me that they couldn't help me until they spoke to their "District Manager" who they would NOT put me in contact with.  A silly ploy ripped from the pages of used car sales, which should give you a pretty good sense of the ethics of this place.Again:  AVOID AVOID AVOID

26.description: I imagine they're great at changing a screen on the iphone, but they mangled my laptop when I went to have the screen replaced.I give them 2 stars instead of just one because after some back and forth (they fixed the screen but destroyed the WiFi antenna) they replaced my machine with a refurbished one.That machine however was not equal to the machine they mangled (smaller hard drive, etc.), and has since died after only a few months. I can't speak to phone repairs, but I would avoid them for laptop/tablet work.

25.description: Great customer service. Super quick fix. I think the phone screen was fixed in 25 minutes!!! It was very expensive, that's the one downfall. :( There was a Yelp coupon for pay $35 and get $50 I used to save a little. This was a Samsung screen fix for $180, I believe. I had my iPhone 6 screen redone at an Apple Store for SIGNIFICANTLY less than the $180 here. (Maybe that's just the Samsung vs Apple IPhone pricing?) I got it fixed for a friend of mine. She seemed to think that price was comparable to other prices she received elsewhere. So she had no problem with me taking the phone there.

12.description: I'm so thoroughly unimpressed with this store. I came in for a screen replacement on my phone. They didn't put the screen on correctly. So I return and drop my phone off. 3 days later they call to say that they need to fix the battery, and that's their reason why the screen wasn't on right After the battery was "replaced" they call me in. I travel all the way back to this store, just so they could tell me they didn't check to see if the new battery worked. And lone behold, the new battery didn't work. So now I'm waiting ANOTHER week to get my phone back This has been a long and painful process that wouldn't have happened if the workers had done their job correctly and hadn't have called and lied to me about my phone being "ready for pickup"I'm angry. I've wasted so much time traveling and have had my phone there for way too longI will NEVER bring another phone here. Ever.

59.description: I shattered my iPhone 5S screen last weekend when I was leaning in to smell some lilacs I was walking pass and BAM my phone falls out of my pocket and kisses the pavement. Very very sad. My fault for not having a case on it, but still so sad. I was kicking myself twice considering I am definitely still paying for the darn thing (thanks ATT new upgrade plans), when a friend told me that I could take it to uBreakiFix and get a new screen for around a hundred dollars. So not a free repair, but better than spending hundreds on a new phone amiright?Made an appointment for a Wednesday afternoon and got an email right away asking what color my phone was.  When I got there, they pulled up my information quickly, and let me know it would be about 30-40 minutes. I bunkered down in their little waiting room and just worked while they fixed my phone (Shawshank Redemption was on their TV - great movie). Everyone I interacted with was really friendly and helpful - both in my interactions and also other customers I saw come in (one older man came in for a new iPad battery and the associate helping him was really honest and helpful, saying that typically they don't like to change the battery other than a last resort because usually it doesn't fix the problem and has a high risk of damaging the machine. He gave suggestions on power saving tips and suggested the customer go to apple to see if there was something diagnostic they could do that was covered by their warranty).Overall great customer service, my phone was ready in just 30 minutes (looks almost new!), and there is a Yelp offer to get $15 off your purchase (buy $50 for $35) and if you check in on Facebook you get an additional 5% off. The only reason I'm docking a star is because I tried calling several times the morning of my appointment to confirm, and every time no one picked up and the VM was full.  But once I got there, customer service could not be better.  They take walk-ins too. Highly recommend.

21.description: This place is crazy fast with reasonable prices. The customer service is spectacular. They are amazing!!!!

17.description: I have never written a bad yelp review before, but I am so disappointed with this place that I felt i needed to tell others. My experience with this store was always good. I never had too many problems. However, this time around... It was horrible. Absolutely nothing went well. I dropped my iPad off because the LED light had become unplugged. The iPad would turn on, but it wouldn't light up. When I dropped it off they told me one week max, to give me a diagnosis. I thought that was a little long, especially because I told them what the problem was. But I agreed to the wait time and submitted the iPad to them for a diagnosis. After a week, I never got a call to tell me that it had been diagnosed. I called and they said to give them a couple more days, and they would call me by the end of the following business day. The told me that the technician was currently working on my iPad, and that he didn't know what the diagnosis was yet but would let me know very soon. I agreed to wait longer. The time came and when again. No call. I called a THIRD time. I was told they had never got to my iPad and hadn't had a chance to diagnose it. I stated that I was told a couple days earlier, that the technician was working on it. They didn't have an explanation for that and simply said "well we haven't gotten to it yet. We're understaffed". I said "well how much more time do you need?" They said 3 more days. I agreed to wait longer... Again.Three days later... No call. I called again, they said they STILL hadn't had a chance to look at it. I stated that I'd just come pick it up and to forget about diagnosing it, I'll be taking it somewhere else. When I went to pick it up there was a woman in front of me dropping her device off for repair. I couldn't help but notice that they said they would have it fixed within an hour. I thought "An hour?! I've been waiting 2 weeks just for a diagnosis. An hour?!"I got my iPad back after two weeks of them doing absolutely nothing. They were dismissive in their willingness to understand my frustration and did NOTHING to accommodate me, despite false quote times and false promises to contact me. This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had with a company. I'll never go back.

10.description: I had a great experience here!  They checked my Wii U unit within 4 days after dropping it off at store, and then called me to discuss the problem. They were able to fix the unit and it cost half the $ Nintendo wanted (not including shipping the unit to/from Nintendo). I was very pleased and would definitely recommend them to anyone for repairs for game systems!

5.description: I set an appointment to have my shattered iPhone screen replaced.  After receiving a confirmation email, I also received an email asking if it was a white or black iPhone. Not seeing the email until the morning of my appt I responded and showed for my appt.  when I arrived they didn't seem to have my appt in the system and then told me that they could not repair it. They then went on to tell me that I didn't respond to the email inquiring about the color of the iPhone quickly enough and THAT is why the part was not held for me.   Seeing that they could have called me BEFORE I came in for my appointment but didn't I feel that that care very little about their customers.  Also, I then went and walked in the Jet Device repair and had my phone fixed immediately.  They also informed me that the COLOR of the phone didn't matter so long as they had the screen for generation/ model in stock. Which I also called and confirmed with my phone carrier.  Basically, U break it I fix it screwed up and then blamed me.

3.description: Every excuse in the book used to not meet their price match policy.Was misquoted over the phone and told a much higher number in person.  I do not recommend going to this store.  So many better options elsewhere.

35.description: My phone screen was absolutely shattered and I did not want to have to buy a brand new one. I found this place on Yelp and saw that they had a $50 for $35 voucher and the reviews were great. Thought I'd give it a try. I didn't have anything to lose considering how bad my phone was broken. I brought my phone in and they were able to fix the screen within 30 minutes. It looks brand new and the customer service was great. I'd definitely recommend uBreakiFix!

19.description: My iPhone screen was shattered in a million pieces so I brought it here for a repair at 10am. They didn't have the part so I left my phone with them. They told me the part would be in at 3pm but it came early and my phone was ready for pickup at 1pm. They did a great job on the screen and the price is the same or cheaper than anything else I've researched.

28.description: They fixed my phone FAST! Very grateful!I thought I was going to have to buy a whole new phone but john hooked me up and within minutes I was out the door. Happy customer.

45.description: Did great work! Honored their quote even though the repair was more complex than originally expected. Have recommended them to many of my friends.

33.description: Came in Saturday afternoon, rather busy. I needed a glass repair and they quoted me 45 minutes. I arrived 50 minutes later and they said the phone would still be 15 minutes. I waited very patiently, but they did not address me after 15 minutes and only paid attention to the 2 new customers that came in over the extra 40 minutes that I waited. The wrong phone was grabbed and she said via the receipt it matched. It was not my phone. She went back to look for my phone, grabbed it and apologized. She also said it had been ready FOR A WHILE! Took a total of 90 minutes for me to get my phone, and I waited an extra 40 minutes for it in the store, when it was done. The employees have to address their customers and pay attention. My phone is fixed and good to go, but I feel like I just wasted so much time.

43.description: Long time Yelper, first time reviewer.  But I'd say it's warranted given that uBreakiFix fixed my iPhone 6 for free - in seconds - just a minute after I walked in the door.  It wasn't a huge/serious issue, but still.The slider button on my phone to toggle between silent and non-silent mode had apparently gotten jammed, and was stuck in silent mode.  I suspect a grain of sand got in there while I was out at the beach over the weekend.I called, they said to bring it in and they'll take a look for free.  The employee (didn't catch her name) was very friendly, immediately took it to the back of the store, and came back seconds later saying she was able to remove whatever debris was in there.It was free of charge, and she wouldn't accept a tip, so I offered to write this review!  Cheers.

2.description: Have taken my iPhone here twice already. Awesome (friendly) staff, clean space, reasonable rates for the work they do. However, the only reason they don't get the full five stars is because both times I got my iPhone back fixed but with minor mistakes. The first (on my iPhone 5) the home button was able to move around (the little design on it was sometimes a square sometimes a diamond), on my iPhone 6 when the screen was put back on it wasn't pressed all the way so now it feels "clicky". These mistakes aren't earth shattering  but still a little annoying. UbreakIfix does have warranty so I'm sure they would've fixed it if I had the time to go back again, but it's still better for the more busy people nowadays to have things done right the first time. Regardless, I do recommend them. Go there if you need any phone repairs, just make sure to double check the work thoroughly before leaving!

18.description: Excellent costumer service!! Will definitely return for future repairs!

41.description: Broke my iPhone 5SThey fixed itJob well done

52.description: I went there to get my iphone camera cleaned from the inside because it was dusty and I could no longer do video conferencing. I asked if it is something they do, how long and how much it would cost. The answer I got was "20 minutes, free of charge".For a first impression, it really worked. It will be hard for me to go somewhere else when my iphone needs a repair!

50.description: My phone is fixed! For that, I'm happy. It took about an hour and I was able to do a little shopping on North Ave. However, their prices are the exact same as Apple. As just a dealer, their prices should and could be a little less than Apple's. Otherwise, the I'm happy. CS was great.

4.description: Great experience and efficient turn-around. Rob was professional, courteous and kind. Would recommend to a friend or family member (I was sent here by family recommendation). Consider going here first before getting ripped off by your phone company!

6.description: Shattered smartphone screen? "Accidentally" giving your phone a bath? Didn't buy phone insurance? U Break I Fix is for you!! Same day repairs (I was quoted an hour with an appointment but they were already behind when I arrived. Took hour and a half). Still not bad considering. Prices are a little high- $149 for glass repair on my Samsung Galaxy. But if you check in on Facebook they'll give you 5% off. I guess that saved me half of the sales tax the lovely city of Chicago charges. Make an appointment online or just walk in. I'd suggest an appt because this place is hopping. Too many clumsy phone users out there. Line out the door and all the seats in the waiting area filled when I walked in. Also, just in case they need to order a part make an appt. They'll call you if they have questions prior to your appt. Located above a nail salon and insurance agency right across from the North and Clybourn red line stop. Street parking available. Plus you can grab some eats or do a little window shopping while you wait for your phone to be fixed. 90 day work guarantee. Now don't be so clumsy and drop your phone again after getting it fixed!

22.description: This place delivers yet again! Visiting Chicago and had broken ipad2 screen. Took a taxi from hotel and dropped off iPad. It was fixed in a hour. Grabbed lunch nearby while I waited. Tons of shops and stuff around to enjoy while waiting.

15.description: Excellent service and quick turnaround! Cracked my iPhone 5s screen which rendered it inoperable. Brought it in on a Sunday at 11am when they opened. It was ready in a half hour and scored a Yelp deal they had running. My phone came back to life and all was right with the world. These guys are consummate professionals!

57.description: These guys are great. Not only have they done a great job fixing my daughters iPod screen but also when I went in the other day because my phone wasn't charging they fixed it right then and there for no charge!  Thanks Joe!

20.description: While ubreakifix was not able to fix my iPhone, it was still a good experience and I wouldn't give them lesser starts because of it. It's not their fault that my phone ended up in my puppy's water bowl and no amount of rice could save it. This shop has really nice people working there, they are open late for those of us who work, and were able to do a diagnostic faster than the 48 hour time frame they gave me. It costs $0 for a diagnostic if they can't provide a solution, which is better than other companies in Chicago who charge $29.99 to just look at the phone. Hopefully I won't have to come back here, however if my new 6S ends up in water again, I would definitely use this company.

36.description: Quick fix for a broken screen. Prices are cheaper than insurance and can be completed in under two hours.

14.description: I just walked out of Ubreakifix. And I'm typing this on my phone. An hour ago, I was convinced I wouldn't have a phone. Apparently, the sound of panic is the sound you hear when your phone takes a dive and slaps screen down onto a concrete floor. My poor iphone was completely spiderweb shattered. After first calling my provider and being told the only way I would be able to fix this would be to pay $700+, this place was my second call. They told me to come right in, and I just beat a weekend rush because it was all fixed within about 40 minutes. It's seriously like it never happened. I will say that I was lucky, as a rush did roll in while I was waiting, but the miracle workers employed there upped the estimate time and offered next day pickups with courtesy and professionalism. An hour after something happened that I have literally had nightmares about, it was fixed. That's insane! My only regret was that I wish I called this place first. I could have saved myself a little bit of stress.

12.description: The ladies who run Natural Beauties are both professional and extremely sweet. They can craft wonderful floral designs no matter your budget and will do so with patience, care and love. Definitely use them!

7.description: ... a follow up to my previous review and to Natural Beautie's business comment:I received the following in email form from the 'owner':"Hi Marie,Congrats on your engagement!Thank you for inquiring about Natural Beauties Floral, Inc.  We would love to schedule a floral consultation with you to discuss your wedding day flowers.  We will work with you to create a customized proposal based on your style, color palette, and overall floral vision.  May we ask what your what your maximum budget is?  On average, to do a full wedding they generally start at $2000 and go up from there.  We want to make sure we can meet your budget before we schedule an appointment.  Please let us know if we will be able to work together.We look forward to hearing from you!Florally,Jan"*** and when told that I did not have a $2k budget ***"Hi Marie,Thank you for sending over your info for your wedding flowers.  Unfortunately, we won't be able to meet your budget with everything you are requesting.  We wish you the best of luck in planning your wedding!Best Wishes, Jan"Sounds like they are NOT willing to work with all budgets as they state.  I stand by my previous review.

19.description: I don't have enough nice things to say about Jan and Jillian from Natural Beauties and they blew me away!(This part is not about Natural Beauties) It all started when my mom and I booked another florist and gave them a cash deposit. Needless to say when I was three weeks away from my wedding I received a call to finalize everything. The girl that I was working with at this florist in Oak Park told me because I was having an evening wedding church started at (6:30pm) she would have to set up that Friday night before the wedding. My first instinct was that it was okay...... but then after thinking about the whole picture, for my reception I did three cylinder centerpieces that were submerged in water! The flowers would look horrible if I walked in on Saturday evening to see them all ruined.SO I started to freak out. What was were my wedding flowers going to look like with this horrible florist?!? Who was I going to find three weeks prior to my wedding?I couldn't get my deposit back so I ended up just using them for my rehearsal dinner, glad I did only that! The flowers were a joke!LOW AND BEHOLD I was told by a friend of mine that she was using NATURAL BEAUTIES FOR HER UPCOMING WEDDING IN AUGUST OF THIS YEAR.She told me she had great things to say about them so far and they had great reviews. So of course I called. Jan called me back right away! I told her my situation and she was very professional about the whole thing. At first she didn't want to step on any ones toes as I'm in sales and I appreciate that. She even guided me on the process of what to do with the other florist.Luckily they were able to do the flowers for my wedding! She was very detailed. We exchanged emails back and forth. I will say that I am very detailed myself. In fact too detailed! I am a hard person to please. You can probably get the picture with how long this review is sorry... I'll get to the main points!Anyways I came in to their cute studio and that's where I met Jillian. Okay so don't let their hair colors throw you off, but yes they are identical twins!:) So cute!Anyways I met with them and told them what I wanted! They listened to me, confirmed there ideas and whipped it all up together. On my wedding day I had trust in them and I wasn't worried with how they were going to turn out.I was super excited to see that they were everything that I was looking for and more!My church that we got married at had some strict guidelines that the photographers and the florist had to follow. It only allowed them literally a 15 minute window to get in there and the isle bows with ivy set up. They looked really pretty!They met us at the hotel where we were all getting ready too! They dropped everything off when they said they would and even had time to put the guys flowers on them as well.Natural Beauties was to put rose petals all along a window sill that had an area of about 200 ft. I thought they were going to put a few to make it look really pretty. I will tell you they weren't shy! They made it look AMAZING! They had enough to cover the whole ledge all the way around the entire room. It looked so pretty!I had the three cylinder vases on each table submerged in water with a floating candle on top. The quality of the flowers SHOCKED me! They looked almost fake because they were all so PERFECT! They used such great flowers. They were everything I was hoping for and more!I also had them do two larger arrangements and everyone was STUNNED! They were so pretty! We are two weeks since the wedding and I still have some of the orchids in a vase and they are still alive.NATURAL BEAUTIES did such a GREAT JOB on my wedding! You won't be disappointed!Their professionalism, experience, quality, prices, and art will make you a happy bride and or customer for their upcoming event!Check them out!

1.description: We used them for our wedding.  They were great to work with and the arrangements were beautiful.  The only issue we ran into was that they delivered the flowers a bit too early to the hotel and some members from the bridal party had to run over to get the flowers from the salon.  Overall, a great florist to use.

2.description: I picked Natural Beauties as my wedding florist. They were a little more expensive than the other florist we met with, but I just got a better vibe from them. When I met with Jan and Jillian, I found them to be very friendly, engaging and overall just very helpful. They are truly passionate about what they do and it shines through in their work.Communication was a breeze. They responded to every email quickly and accommodated my special requests, including wrapping my bouquet with my extra wedding dress fabric, flowers for the cake, flowers for the aisle runner an roses for the rose ceremony.The girls were prompt and worked very hard to get everyone ready for the ceremony. My flowers (bouquet, centerpieces, ceremony flowers, cocktail flowers, etc) were gorgeous. Stunning. The boutonnieres were also nice. I would really love to be giving Natural Beauties a full 5-star review because I would use them again in a heartbeat, but the corsages for the moms and my step-daughter all fell apart before the ceremony. It was not the end of the world by any means, but I wish they would have held together because they were very unique and pretty.On a side note, my husband (then-fiance) sent me flowers from Natural Beauties a few months before our wedding and the bouquet was nothing short of beautiful.I highly recommend Jan and Jillian for your floral needs. If Yelp would let me give incremental stars, I would give at least a 4.5 star-review.

9.description: My wife and I got married this past fall and used Natural Beauties as our florist. Preface: I know nothing about flowers. We first met with them in their unassuming office where we went through a quiz about our personalities. It was a little hokey, but it really seemed to just be used as a starting point (and, incidentally, the results were in line with what we were looking for). We have a large family, and were looking for 15 formal pieces, as well as flowers for the tables and altar. We found the people at Natural Beauties were extremely helpful. They worked with the vision my wife had and put together a proposal that was practical and more realistic (they could have sold us hydrangea or something, for example, but suggested a heartier and cheaper alternative which worked wonderfully). We found all of the options available to us to be a bit overwhelming, and the staff made firm but extremely helpful recommendations (otherwise it would have taken us 3 hours for the meeting!). In the end, the quote came back higher than what we wanted to spend. Natural Beauties worked with us to scale back the proposal, and seemed willing and happy to do so. At no point in scaling things back did they make us feel at all uncomfortable; they handled things extremely graciously and professionally. The flowers themselves, were great. I can't really speak intelligently about them (again, I know nothing about flowers). However, my wife and everyone who knows about these sorts of things loved them, and they look great to me. In all, we had an extremely positive experience with Natural Beauties. Great to work with and a great product.

6.description: Jan and Jillian were the best. We went to three florists in Chicago and decided on Natural Beauties as soon as we had our first meeting. Through a short round of questions we figured out our floral needs and we were never pushed into anything we didn't want.  Communication was easy with Jan and Jillian, someone always replied to my emails in less than 24 hours. The day of our wedding the floral arrangements exceeded our expectations. In addition to the amazing flowers, Jan and Jillian were accommodating to last minute changes. Thanks.

18.description: This is a floral company owned and operated by two sisters.  My husband and I were a little lost when it came to planning the flowers for our wedding.  Jan and Jillian really worked with us patiently to find out what our style was and what we wanted out of the flowers even though we were quite vague in our initial descriptions.  The flowers were absolutely beautiful and were just what we wanted!  My sister began planning her wedding shortly after my own and she used Natural Beauties as well.  I felt they also did a wonderful job on her flowers.  My only concern for both weddings was that they arrived at the venues with very little time to spare.  My sister and I are the type of people who are always early, so when people arrive without time to spare it makes us very nervous (especially on a wedding day!).

10.description: Jan and Jillian of Natural Beauties are the best! They provided the florals not only for my own wedding, but for my brother's and a friend's as well. Each time the arrangements exceeded my expectations.Jan and Jillian are sweet, professional, and extremely talented florists. They are detail-oriented and creative. Since I had seen their work a few times already, I pretty much trusted them to create arrangements based on our colors and style. So glad I did!! Everything from the centerpieces to the bridesmaids' hair flowers were beautiful. Furthermore, the ladies of Natural Beauties are organized and so easy to work with. We ended up having to change our contract multiple times, and each time they were completely understanding, patient, and prompt. Ww were so pleased with Natural Beauties and will continue to recommend them in the future. Thanks Jan and jillian!

13.description: We used Jillian and Jan for our wedding at the Trump.  Our wedding coordinator said our flowers were one of the most tasteful arrangements she has seen there.  My wife picked everything out and the price seemed pretty reasonable to me, but what do I know?  We have recommended Natural Beauties to all of our friends who have been married since.  About half have used them and they are all equally as happy as we are!

16.description: The fantastic gals at Natural Beauties did an absolutely amazing job for our wedding.  We got married on June 18, 2011.  The ceremony was at St. Josaphat's and the reception was at Germania Place (both in Chicago).  The church and ballrooms looked beautiful!  Although I did not know much about flowers, I told the girls that I wanted different shades of purple and white and they more than exceeded my expectations!  The bouquets, centerpieces, etc.  were simply gorgeous!  I HIGHLY recommend them!  Thanks Jan and Jillian!  :)

17.description: Beautiful flowers that were exactly my style. When I first met with Natural Beauties to be the florist for our wedding, I didn't give them a lot of ideas on what I was looking for. They took the time to meet with me and get to know my style. They worked with me on my budget and on the design on the flowers. I put complete trust in Jan and Jillian and they did not let me down! My bouquet was just gorgeous and the flowers at the ceremony and reception were gorgeous as well. They did all the set up and were just so great to work with. I 100% recommend Natural Beauties as a wedding florist.

15.description: We used Natural Beauties for our wedding in September 2010 and we were so happy we did. My husband and I had no ideas about anything floral. We walked in and basically said, "no roses and no calla lillies." However, after a short questionaire, they were able to determine what our style is and give suggestions on what flowers we should use. When we went in for the preview of our centerpieces, I wasn't blown away. However, I told them what I was thinking, they made changes and on the wedding day, they were perfect. They really nailed it and I couldn't have been happier with our flowers.Also, as an added bonus, Natural Beauties gives you flower arrangements for the bathrooms at your wedding venue for no extra charge. We met with several florists that all cost the same, and some more, than Natural Beauties and no one else offered this. Sometimes it's the small additions that really make a difference.

0.description: We used Natural Beauties for our wedding floral arrangements and we couldn't have been any happier with them! Prior to meeting with Jan and Jillian, I completed a pre-consultation quiz about what types of colors I like, types of dates I like to go on, how I like to decorate, etc. It helped give them a better idea of my style and preferences. When we did meet, they were so nice, descriptive and excited! Every other florist we met with talked about flowers without showing any specifics. Jan and Jillian have these great flip books with all the different flowers in so many colors, it made it easy to understand the vision they were talking about. We signed with them nearly on the spot and they did a beautiful sample for us a few months later of our centerpieces. Then, come our wedding day, they were prompt, on time and the flowers were BEAUTIFUL. I got so many compliments on my bouquet, our chuppah was absolutely perfect and the table centerpieces (we had three varieties) were perfect. Best of all, I thought they were so perfectly priced. Of course anything bridal is always more expensive than it should be, but they came in way under the other similar proposals we got from other vendors. I would HIGHLY endorse them for your wedding!

5.description: Both my husband and I were in awe of the stunning job the Natural Beauties did desiging our wedding at the Modern Wing of the Art Institue. We had a very loose vision of what we wanted (unusual garden like flowers) and they were able to refine it for us in their proposal and then bring it to life on our wedding day. Even weeks later people (other than us!) are still talking about how spectaular and different the florals were from the show stopping birch chuppah to the flower crown for our precious flower girl. Jillian and Jan did not miss a detail. Leading up to our wedding they were alway responsive and patient with any questions we had along the way (we had tons because our venue had lots of restrictions) and were flexible to make any changes when we changed our mind about certain things. They also had about an hour to set up our ceremony, cocktail and dinner area due to schedule restrictions at our venue and everything was completed on time to perfection which totally blew us away! Coming up with a spectacular design is one thing but executing it flawlessly is a whole other thing. We truly could not have been more pleased. Jan and Jillian are not only insanely talented at what they do, they are total professionals, fun to work with and amazing business women which makes them the total package in my opinion!

11.description: My fiancee and I went in for a wedding consultation. They started off giving us a quiz that seemed like it was straight out of Cosmo. Frankly, I don't understand how these irrelevant questions could help choose flowers, but it seems like a lot of people on Yelp fall for the gimmick. In addition, they didn't really take our input, their attitude was "this is what the quiz says, so this is what you're going to get."One weird thing is that they had absolutely no flowers they could show us in person. All they could show us is pictures. They also wanted to charge us a ridiculous amount to show us what our flowers would look like, even after we would have signed a contract.Ultimately, what turned me off was that as soon as they realized we weren't spending an insane amount of money (although still a decent amount), they were very condescending and cold. The best part is that when we got the quote back, it was double our budget!

8.description: My review is much-delayed since I got married in July, 2011, but I feel like I have to write a glowing review for Jan and Jillian.  Jan and Jillian did a fantastic job at my wedding at The Newberry Library.  The bridal party flowers were beautiful and stood up to the hot July weather.  I particularly love the arrangements for our tables - they were unique without being too crazy.  I think Jan and Jillian did a great job of helping me figure out my floral "style" so that they were able to pick arrangements that would fit my personality and vision.  With a venue that requires you to bring in every vendor, I really appreciated Jan and Jillian's professionalism and that I did not have to worry about them getting the job done.  On a day with so many things going on, you want to be able to relax and  not worry about any of your vendors!  I would work with them again in a heartbeat.On the price, I thought I got a lot for what I paid, especially in Chicago.  Great value, great service, and great memories.  You can't go wrong!

3.description: Out of State orders BEWARE! Terrible Experience. My daughter ordered an expensive arrangement for my Bday. By the time it was delivered, the water was half spilled, flowers were over packed and half of the stamps did not even touch the water. Obvious technical mistake. Majority of flowers were diferent carnations, which most of them were dead by 10 am next morning. When contacted the shop with short detailed video, their response was "Thank you for sending your images and video. Based on the sources of information you have provided, it appears all of the flowers are in mint condition as when they left our floral boutique..." Dead flowers on the countertop they called "in mint condition"?!?!? Bad service!!!

14.description: Jillian and Jan designed all of the florals for my August 2009 wedding at the Trump Hotel in downtown Chicago.  They WOWed me from the very first intimate and detailed consultation.  I went into the first meeting with a vague idea of the type of atmosphere I wanted the florals to create- Jillian and Jan took this idea and designed florals that perfectly complemented what I envisioned! In fact, they exceed what I imagined! My bridal bouquet was exquisite, the most beautiful I have ever seen.  And the centerpieces in the grand ballroom were incredible! They truly set the tone for the fun, chic and elegant wedding we desired.  Natural Beauties' prices were reasonable compared to other floral companies I looked into.  Initially my husband did not think we even needed to have flowers on our wedding day to save money somewhere...and even HE was pleased with both the results and the price.   I would recommend Natural Beauties Florals to every bride who envisions beautiful, artful and unique floral designs at her dream wedding.  Two of my girlfriends have used Natural Beauties since my wedding and have both been very happy with the design, service and price point!Oh...I forgot to mention that my husband sends me floral arrangements regularly from Natural Beauties and they are exquisite! I also had them custom design a silk floral centerpiece that incorporated the flowers from my wedding...it is gorgeous and on display in our living room!
