4.description: Natural Beauties made our wedding absolutely gorgeous!  Some of my favorite photographs from the day feature my beautiful bouquet in some way.  Our wedding venue offered candelabra centerpieces free of charge, so we used Natural Beauties for our bouquets, boutonnieres, and ceremony flowers.   Not only are Jan and Jillian true artists, but they are also so easy to work with!  I had a few ideas for my bouquet, but knew I wanted something unique - what they created for me was beyond extraordinary!  I was truly blown away.  Natural Beauties is very reasonably priced for such a high quality of craftmanship, attention to detail, and style.  I've read a few accounts of upset reviewers that Natural Beauties refused to work within their budget - this is not at all the experience that I had.  I provided them with my price point, and when my initial proposal came back a bit higher, they made suggestions of flowers that could be substitiuted for less, without sacrificing the aesthetic (i.e. there is this gorgeous deep plum carnation, yes carnation, that was the perfect filler for my bridesmaids' flowers!)   I have only positive feedback for Natural Beauties.  I would put my trust in their hands again in a heartbeat!  Thank you Jan and Jillian!

58.description: Glazed and Infused a doughnut favorite! Delicious doughnuts great coffee what else is there to say! The Fulton location is a neighborhood favorite for a great treat on Saturday mornings. With the changing seasons so do the doughnut flavors with a few originals that always stick around. Check out the GoGlazed promo starts Jan 19th and runs for a week. Free coffee and doughnut holes, who can resist!

56.description: I've been meaning to try this place for a long time. I travel for work so I took a 10 minute side stop to grab a bite. This week they are promoting free donut holes and coffee. I stopped in, but wanted to use the bathroom first since I was on the road for almost two hours. The lady was disappointed to say they don't have public bathrooms! I was a bit upset about that especially when I'm about to give them my business, but oh well. This won't be a spot I would stop by again. It's kinda of like been there, done that! Although, the neighborhood is pretty industrial and has wanderers so I can understand how they don't allow public bathrooms, but if your're a paying customer, I don't understand why not. Anyways, I got the Maple Bacon Long John. Ever since my friend took a picture, I have been dying to try it. It was good, the sweet and salty mix had a nice flavor to it. The bacon had a hint of spice to it but still enough to give it a kick. That was quite a surprise! I also got the Salted Caramel Dark Chocolate Almond which I actually liked better. The chocolate was very rich and lots of almonds! The only dislike was that the dough is a bit thick for my tasting. I prefer the lightness of D&D better. Lastly, just those two donuts cost me over $6!! I was like WTF! They were good, but not $6 good! The free coffee was okay, but I'm sure they have better coffee options since they probably sampled their regular coffee. They also gave me three free donut holes. I ate the chocolate covered one which had a nice twist than the other plain chocolate and glazed, but they were all good. Overall, I like the creativity of each donut, but  I'm not sure if I would head out of my way to stop here again. Like I said before, I tried it and that's that. Another thing to note, the location is not the best for drivers. It's located in  Fulton Market which I'm not too familiar with, but the area is very grungy, industrial, and the parking is hard. You also have to be careful of men on fork lifts because they will come out of nowhere! If you have to walk, the streets are filled with a bunch of crap from the factories. Not the best place for a young woman like me!

29.description: Quite possible the best doughnut I have ever had. I had the Red Velvet cake doughnut - delicious. Service was great, friendly and eager. The selection was limited to six flavors, but when the doughnuts are this good, you don't need 25 options; plus it was after lunch time so I imagine that they probably have an expanded selection in the morning. Prices are steep, but you get what you pay for.

42.description: Finest donuts in Chicago. Comparable to any new age donut shop in America. 1 predominant difference. These suckers are huge. Huge huge huge. Who can say no to bacon on a donut??

23.description: These donuts are amazing, maybe the best I've ever had next to a place called The Fractured Prune in Ocean City, MD. They are huge as well, and a really good price for cake donuts in downtown Chicago that are as big as they are.

47.description: Glazed and Infused is a Chicago staple in many circles.  I've lived in Chi for about a year and half and decided it was time to get out of bed and take a stroll over to their flagship store on the Fulton Market.  Right off the bat I liked that there weren't 100's of choices but rather a decent selection of very large, very eye appealing donuts.  One thing I respect is the craftsmanship that was obvious on every donut in the display case.  By this I mean that when they were topped they clearly made the effort to create some consistency and tact.  The store is simple, the staff is friendly, and there is even a couple of seats on the sidewalk if winter ever ends.  This morning I went with the peanut butter bismarck.  The frosted top with tiny peanuts was in every bite.  The peanut butter filling was to die for.  The donut itself was very tasty, not to oily, spongy, or anything like the frozen donuts out of box IE: your dunkin run of the mill.  I will definitely come back again and try something new.  I think this is the kind of place where you really have to keep working through the flavors and find that special donut.  But I would certainly recommend giving it a try if you've never been.

8.description: I literally wandered into the shop while waiting for a seat at the Publican for brunch. I was lured in by the sweet smell of donuts on the street, from whenever people opened and closed the door. I went inside, and let me tell you, the donuts here are HUGE! And the entire shop just smells amazing.I ended up getting the  maple bacon long john and the vanilla bean glazed donuts. That vanilla bean glazed donut was perfect. It was airy inside, and the vanilla bean made the glaze special. It looks plain, but vanilla is one of my favorite flavors (so don't you ever dare say "plain as vanilla" in front of me). The long john was really good too. Very maple-y, but the bacon was perfectly salty and actually very spice-y. Spice-y is different from spicy, fyi. The former means that they seasoned the bacon with spices, which gave the donut a different dimension, while the latter means the usual.It was a great find, and ended up being a great snack on my way to the airport later that day lol

31.description: Stopped in for a few donuts on our way out of town and I'm so glad that we did! Our group enjoyed the Chocolate4 and Cajeta Fried Ice Cream donuts the best.

34.description: I will forever be your patron..... sooooo yummy. sign me up for insulin; but I gotta keep eating these yummified yummies

16.description: I like donuts, especially gourmet donuts.  The donuts here are creative and large.  1 star off: They look delicious, but I think they look better than they taste.  After eating one, you feel more of a sugar rush than anything else.1 star off: $4 for a donut, really?These are donuts that you post on Facebook so people can get jealous of you, but not really donuts that satisfy a craving.

13.description: Darn.. came here around 3pm on a Friday and all was left was the bacon maple, vanilla bean and old fashioned... got all three and in the order above is bestest to best. The bacon maple had a strong maple taste w/ a bit of saltiness from the bacon. Add a pumpkin spice latte and youre all set. The other 2 doughnuts were just ok.

11.description: Glazed and Infused is a Chicago staple in many circles.  I've lived in Chi for about a year and half and decided it was time to get out of bed and take a stroll over to their flagship store on the Fulton Market.  Right off the bat I liked that there weren't 100's of choices but rather a decent selection of very large, very eye appealing donuts.  One thing I respect is the craftsmanship that was obvious on every donut in the display case.  By this I mean that when they were topped they clearly made the effort to create some consistency and tact.  The store is simple, the staff is friendly, and there is even a couple of seats on the sidewalk if winter ever ends.  This morning I went with the peanut butter bismarck.  The frosted top with tiny peanuts was in every bite.  The peanut butter filling was to die for.  The donut itself was very tasty, not to oily, spongy, or anything like the frozen donuts out of box IE: your dunkin run of the mill.  I will definitely come back again and try something new.  I think this is the kind of place where you really have to keep working through the flavors and find that special donut.  But I would certainly recommend giving it a try if you've never been.

39.description: At the suggestion  of a customer , we tried Glazed and Infused.An old fashion suprise for a Sunday morning . Fresh dounts with great flavor.They are giant and a real treat. Alot of nice flavor combinationsThe giant donuts can easily be shared by 2 people.

37.description: I went on my lunch break to avoid the craziness this morning of national donut day and because they are open until 5pm; and when I arrived to the Fulton market glazed and infused location around 12:45pm they said they were closed and sold out. Why the f didn't you keep making donuts especially with it being national donut day?!??!??!?!?! Very dissatisfied and disappointed. For a well know and highly recommended donut shop like glazed and infused you would think they would've been prepared. #potbellyswasbetter

0.description: Huge donuts. Great flavor options. Pure heaven. I love coming here because staff is so friendly every time. I usually get a coffee, and some kind of donut. Glazed are always good. Red velvet, maple bacon, and chocolate are among our favorites. You really can't go wrong!I've order a donut cake from here and it was so cool. So cheap for how big it is. Better than an actual cake in my opinion! Might have to use one for my wedding sweet table :)

38.description: For a business with a lot of buzz and hype, this establishment has gradually become one of the least organized I have ever patronized.     As a place that's near my morning commute, I used to like to stop by for a coffee and whatever fun new things they had. I liked their products and was happy with the service.      The last 3 times I have stepped in (over the past 5 months) I have been met with staff who were extremely inexperienced and undertrained, or who maybe just don't seem to care.      In February the guy working the counter misheard me and rang me up for an extra donut, and since I had already given him my credit card, didn't realize the over charge until he gave me my receipt. No prob. Except he had no idea how the store's POS worked, there was a line out the door and no manager on site. After trying to figure out what to do and telling me directly that he wasn't really trained, he apologized profusely and then took a piece of receipt paper and wrote "good for one donut" on it. This actually happened.     The next time I came in, there was a film crew who weren't filming but clearly took prescient over the guy who just wants a coffee and donut. When I was finally waited on, the barista kept asking me repeatedly what kind of milk I wanted in my Americano, until I told him to just put some espresso in some hot water. Then the phone rang and he left my shots just sitting there while he took the call, despite there being two other employees behind the counter who didn't seem to really be doing anything.     Today I walked in at 10:30am and there were no donuts. It wasn't even like they had just sold the last donut, there were no signs, no trays, nothing. Just a clean, empty display case. It's like there never were any donuts. Since 3 other people were in line in front of me, I figured there must be more donuts coming. Maybe. I'd have to wait and see since behind the counter were two employees each on separate phone calls and a third making coffee. Another patron came in behind me and asked where all the donuts were, and the woman at the front explained to the group that they were all sold out and she was just waiting for coffee. Then the store cleared out.      I'm not faulting the business for not being able to keep up with the demand of one day or providing a popular product. My bottom line is that their in house staff just doesn't seem to get it. Why are you open when you don't have anything to sell? Why are you allowing customers to come in and line up for nothing? At least you can make a sign saying you're out of donuts, or delegate maybe one employee to deal with disappointed customers.      Their donuts aren't worth $4. Just go to Mariano's. They have the same ones for $1 and are just up the street.

51.description: This is a good good place for doughnuts Im a fan., there coffee is good as well smells are awesome far more roomier than doughnut vault easier to find than firecakes. For doughnuts a  little better variety and innovation than calumet bakery,entemann bakery pierres bakery angelicas bakery and Morris bakery. For taste doughnut vault and Kirschbaum bakery tantalize my taste buds a little bit more. But Glazed and infused is closer more accessible and more spacious. I frequent there often.

27.description: We ordered the minis platter for the morning of our wedding.It was perfect! Perfect 2-3 bites sized doughnuts for the bridal party.  It was a definite hit!Everyone was able to sample 2-3 donuts.$38 for 50 mini donuts.*must order 48 hours in advanceWe did it all online through the website.  I believe they deliver too but we just picked it up.

32.description: If you want your choice of donut flavors, be sure to come early. I came in around 1pm on a Saturday, and they were already mostly sold out of the popular flavors (bummer... I really wanted to try the Maple bacon). By the time I left around 2pm, only about a third of those varieties were left. They had samples of their PB&J and chocolate donuts when I went. The PB&J was a wonderful combination of sweet and salty -- definitely not a taste I'm used to having in donuts. :D They also have a (limited) selection of mini-donuts that go really fast. I got a mini apple fritter and really enjoyed it. The donuts here are really big (I think you can even order a birthday donut cake, haha).There is free, reliable wifi. It's a good cafe to sit at to do work, but the lighting is a bit dim. No bathroom either, so you have to go next door.

54.description: Great little donut shop. We sampled 5 flavors: chocolate, maple bacon, strawberry paczki, cinnamon nutella packzi, and red velvet. All were good but the maple bacon was my favorite. I wish there had been a few more "out of the box" flavors. I loved the vintage WWII-era decor and the chai tea latte was really great too! Would definitely go back for a sweet treat!

48.description: It smelled so good in here. They don't even have to convince you with words and you would want to buy their donuts. The donuts are massive! I was so glad they had mini donuts!! I had the Raspberry chocolate one and it was delicious! Super fluffy and not too sweet. Next time, I'm definitely going to try the red velvet and blackberry cheesecake ones!

44.description: I will never be back here, especially this location. The service was terrible. Ariel waited on us and when we decided to add more donuts to our order she was pissed and actually huffed because she had to get a box. Then she spent the rest of the time glaring at us while we were waiting for our coffee. If it wasn't for the sweet guy running the register we would have just walked out. The only time Ariel smiled was she a friend of hers, who apparently also works here, came in. I'm pretty sure she's some kind of manager because she was arranging the breaks for the staff. If she stays in this position I look for business to steadily decline. They've definitely lost our future business.

24.description: My friends dad would always pick these doughnuts up after a long night. Classics to seasonal, these are the best doughnuts around. I have never once had a bad doughnut here..I can not speak on the wait or the service but I can say these doughnuts are to die for. Glazed and infused is a great addition to Chicago and an even better addition to my stomach!

7.description: Came here to try a donut, and by around 1 pm, they were already sold out on so many flavors! I ended up only getting an apple cider donut as they had nothing I wanted.The donut was like an old fashioned but with apple bits and glaze on top. It was delicious and doughy, but I don't understand how it tastes like apple cider (it just tastes like apple). Other than that, it was very filling and heavy. Too bad I can't come back to try the other flavors!

49.description: Yet to have a bad experience here! Great atmosphere, great selections, and friendly service! They have the typical classics, but they also put together unique and masterful flavor profiles that create a wonderful experience. If you visit, get a traditional flavor, but go out on a limb and try something new! I would highly recommend them at this location, and I am very excited that they are expanding and opening new stores.

40.description: Had the maple bacon donut, vanilla bean, and raspberry cheesecake donuts. All delicious but a bit expensive. Well worth the trip!

53.description: Greatest donuts I have ever had. Period! Pure deliciousness and great friendly workers! I always come back and recommend it to anyone stopping by in Chicago!

30.description: Best Donuts in the loop and pretty good coffee too!

46.description: Went about 15 minutes before close and there wasn't much of a variety of flavors. Understandable though, because the donuts are to die for and the good ones get snatched up early. Had the donut holes and the carrot cake donut. Carrot cake was good but my favorite is anything with the old fashioned as the base like the Key Lime donut. Must try. My absolute favorite donut shop. If all else fails, go for their old fashioned donuts, you won't be disappointed!

1.description: Glazed and infused, you have two jobs. 1. Be open. 2. Have old-fashioned doughnuts. Most of the time you fail because you are never open (you close at like 3pm). Today, a Saturday, you happened to be open, but you're out of old-fashioned donuts. And this is why I hate you.P.S. When available, your donuts are tasty.  But they are never f***** available. Ugh.

55.description: My boyfriend and I just moved to chicago from michigan and our first donut experience was awesome. The guy was super friendly and all of the 5 donuts we tried were amazing. Highly recommend :). Maple bacon donut was my favorite

9.description: Before you think, "How good can a doughnut really be?"...just wait until you try the red velvet doughnut. I could hear angels singing in the background!!!!! The flavor combinations are inventive without being overly ambitious for the sake of being different. Special thought and care is poured into every decadent bite. Just a little tip....go with friends and share a half dozen. That way you can sample 6 doughnuts and can honestly say that you only ate 1 doughnut! How great is that???? They are a little on the pricey side, BUT the doughnuts and the friendly staff more than make up for it.

26.description: If 4.5 were only an option. I've been at G&I 7-8 times (usually how many times I frequent a place before leaving a review). The red velvet is absolutely money. The cream cheese frosting is killer. Possibly my favorite donut ever.  The old fashion is heavy and dense and rivals any other out there.  The vanilla bean is on point. Fluffy and the perfect vanilla taste. Not overpowering. The other donuts are good and very well done but just aren't my forte. I give a 4 (real vote is 4.5) because the coffee is way off of par and the donuts at time can be a bit inconsistent. (Ex. Cream cheese frosting sometimes is heavy and very cream cheese and other times much lighter and fluffier). All in all. I continue to take people back here when they come in town. If they like fancy donuts, you can't go wrong.

25.description: These donuts are GINORMOUS. We stopped in at about 11:30 Friday 9/18 to check out G&I as I was in visiting Chicago and I can honestly say if I lived near by and they suddenly became calorie free, I would be in there every day. They were so tasty and fresh and classic. A few of the flavors were already sold out but there were plenty left to choose from. We got the vanilla bean which was light and melted away into calorie heaven in your mouth. Old fashioned raspberry was my fav. the old fashioned is more dense and cakey but moist and delicious, but the raspberry glaze was tangy yet sweet and full of raspberry flavor. The chocolate icing with the little chocolate and white chocolate curls was so tasty and so pretty. my second fav. was the maple glazed bacon. This donut is like 6-7 inches long with a beautifully cooked piece of thick cut bacon adorning it. We cut that bad boy into 3 and it was still the size of a normal size donut. I do have to say that they were a bit expensive in my opinion 4 donuts were about $12 (+ tip). You can definitely tell that a lot of care and love goes into making these donuts. It was a great experience and I'm so glad I got to stop in and experience G&I and will def. try stop back in next time I'm in Chicago!

12.description: If you want your choice of donut flavors, be sure to come early. I came in around 1pm on a Saturday, and they were already mostly sold out of the popular flavors (bummer... I really wanted to try the Maple bacon). By the time I left around 2pm, only about a third of those varieties were left. They had samples of their PB&J and chocolate donuts when I went. The PB&J was a wonderful combination of sweet and salty -- definitely not a taste I'm used to having in donuts. :D They also have a (limited) selection of mini-donuts that go really fast. I got a mini apple fritter and really enjoyed it. The donuts here are really big (I think you can even order a birthday donut cake, haha).There is free, reliable wifi. It's a good cafe to sit at to do work, but the lighting is a bit dim. No bathroom either, so you have to go next door.

59.description: If Glazed and Infused's yeast/raised doughnuts were as good as their cake and old-fashioneds, they'd get five stars from me. But the raised doughnuts are always too doughy, too dense, and/or just not flavorful enough. But they excel everywhere else - the cake doughnut with rainbow sprinkles is amazing all the time, and the old-fashioneds are excellent too. I do like the maple bacon bar, as well. Way to go!

21.description: Fresh, delicious donuts! The donuts are larger than typical donuts, but surprisingly not heavy and not greasy.

17.description: I've tried an embarrassing number of doughnuts on Glazed & Infused's menu, and I've yet to be let down. The doughnuts are sweet, but not cloying, and always fresh. The selection ranges from staples, like fruit fritters and old fashioneds, to more exotic and decadent types, like maple bacon long johns, red velvet and crème brûlée. They rotate flavors frequently and have a seasonal menu that includes apple cider in the fall, gingerbread old fashioned in the winter and passion fruit pistachio in the spring and summer.My family are G&I loyalists. I have a soft spot for the apple fritter. It's simple, but it brings together fruit and fried dough in the best way possible. It's also almost as big as my face. And whenever I visit my mom in the suburbs, I have to bring a box of maple bacon long johns with...or else.The prices are higher than the average doughnut shop or grocery store, but the portions are generous (and I don't know of too many places that sell a caramel pumpkin pecan doughnut). Most importantly, if you show your ID with DOB on your birthday, you get a free doughnut of your choice. The only downside is having to choose just one.

10.description: Been in Chicago this May and I simply fell in love with this place. Definately best donuts in town. I must say, they are not cheap (2,5/3 dollars each) but they are very big and worthy for sure. A must go for every donut lover!

5.description: We stopped in after visiting the fish market across the street.The inside is pretty simple, but still a really cool atmosphere.We took a chocolate dipped and a red velvet to go.I really liked the chocolate. You can tell these are really great donuts. The inside is light and fluffy, the topping was rich and sweet. The staff was nice, we couldn't really decide what we wanted but they were patient and accommodating with us.The doughnuts come at a hefty price, but this is the West Loop and I'd be scared to eat more than a whole one in a day, anyway. Nice! 4/5

3.description: Really nice staff who bore with me while I agonized over which donut to get.The selection is mouth watering and you really have a hard time deciding if you're indecisive. Donuts are $2-$3 each and are HUGE. I ended up with plain vanilla which was really good. The crusty frosting was delicious and flaky. The inside was very light and airy and definitely was more cakelike than I was used to having. Something I really liked was that the cake portion wasn't too sweet. Definitely going to try some of the other options the next time I come - the one with the bacon and maple was calling my name. There's an eating area in the back and also a small patio.

35.description: A great selection of donuts. I am a huge fan of the maple donut and vanilla bean glazed. I've had voodoo and blue star donuts from Oregon and this knocks those donut shops out of the park. Overall, both the quality and freshness of the donuts are present.

19.description: It's soooo good but soooo bad!!I had two donuts at 9am and I'm still feeling it in my chest at 5pm. I've been drinking water but damn, there's a lot of sugar in these donuts! I'm serious, it's REALLY sweet. You can feel the sugar crystals grind in your teeth slowly eating your enamel. It's a bit pricey but it's worth it. You can get the old fashion everyone and that's okay. If you like variety, they have a nice set of heart-attacking goodness. Another plus is the nice service and clean dining area. Downsides are that it'll kill your wallet and every time I've eaten it, I fear the diabetes that runs in my family.

28.description: This is the premier spot to get donuts in Chicago. Their bourbon glazed bacon donut is to die for. The maple infused bacon sits on top of a lightly crusted maple donut. My tastebuds scream with happiness.  I wash all of this down with some good quality coffee!

45.description: Great spot for donuts! And the best part - there is often plenty of parking in front of this place. I love their donuts and the great variety here compared to their other location on Damen Av.

33.description: I like donuts, especially gourmet donuts.  The donuts here are creative and large.  1 star off: They look delicious, but I think they look better than they taste.  After eating one, you feel more of a sugar rush than anything else.1 star off: $4 for a donut, really?These are donuts that you post on Facebook so people can get jealous of you, but not really donuts that satisfy a craving.

43.description: Delicious doughnuts. The old fashioned cake doughnut is worth the trip, and perhaps the best, despite its lack of frills. Friendly service from the delightful young man behind the counter - who gave us free doughnut holes! - sealed the deal. The coffee is a bit overpriced, but you've gotta buy some to dunk the doughnuts.

2.description: 4/5 for overall experience.We stopped here on a Sunday afternoon and grabbed a couple of donuts for under $10. Well worth the $ given the size of the donuts; they don't skimp on ingredients or toppings. Staff was very friendly and the sweets were tasty. They only had about 6 different donut flavors to choose from. Not sure if this is normal for a Sunday, or because it was 12pm. The shop seemed like a grab-and-go kind of place, even though there were tables for customers to dine at. Highly recommend the lemon-blueberry fritter!

18.description: I'd been to another Glazed & Infused location the last time I was in Chicago. This one was just as good with just as friendly service. Unfortunately they were all out of their famous maple bacon, but it was noon on a Saturday so I wasn't too surprised. The guy working there was very nice and said that if you call ahead and say how many you want, they'll hold them for you! That's really cool.

41.description: In the heart of down town Chicago as an adition to a rustic restaurant/ bar 'Glazed and infused' has some of the tastiest donuts around.

52.description: The donuts were awesome. So large and tasty.

50.description: Best donuts around.  The staff was super friendly and are always in such a great mood.  Walking in and seeing the staff truly having a good time is a plus.  Now about these donuts! First off, they are huge!!!!!! But getting only one is nearly impossible because well you must try them all.  Very creative with their different types of donuts     A few of my favorite are the vanilla bean and the maple and bacon. Bring some friends with you so you can share all of the goodness and try a few different donuts.

4.description: I like temptation but...those doughnuts are SCARY!  Huge empty carbs.  I don't bother with the price.  Clean divey place.COFFEE -- a specialty blend from Sparrow that will be drowned by whipped cream that is suggested but never added.  It's actually a clean brew, NO unnecessary add-ins.  Good fancy Seda coffee lid that turns to the left and right to avoid spillage.HONEY PACKETS -- one of the good things in here.SERVICE / STAFF -- another good thing here.  Very friendly, approachable and knowledgeable.Carbs and Calories galore!

6.description: Evan is the cat's meow! I'm not usually a die hard fan of red velvet because I think it's just trendy without having any distinct taste personality, but I was digging their red velvet minis with the cream cheese frosting. also loved the Boston cream donuts as recommended by Evan. decent coffee, huge donuts compared to what I'm used to.

22.description: Been in Chicago this May and I simply fell in love with this place. Definately best donuts in town. I must say, they are not cheap (2,5/3 dollars each) but they are very big and worthy for sure. A must go for every donut lover!

15.description: I've been meaning to try this place for a long time. I travel for work so I took a 10 minute side stop to grab a bite. This week they are promoting free donut holes and coffee. I stopped in, but wanted to use the bathroom first since I was on the road for almost two hours. The lady was disappointed to say they don't have public bathrooms! I was a bit upset about that especially when I'm about to give them my business, but oh well. This won't be a spot I would stop by again. It's kinda of like been there, done that! Although, the neighborhood is pretty industrial and has wanderers so I can understand how they don't allow public bathrooms, but if your're a paying customer, I don't understand why not. Anyways, I got the Maple Bacon Long John. Ever since my friend took a picture, I have been dying to try it. It was good, the sweet and salty mix had a nice flavor to it. The bacon had a hint of spice to it but still enough to give it a kick. That was quite a surprise! I also got the Salted Caramel Dark Chocolate Almond which I actually liked better. The chocolate was very rich and lots of almonds! The only dislike was that the dough is a bit thick for my tasting. I prefer the lightness of D&D better. Lastly, just those two donuts cost me over $6!! I was like WTF! They were good, but not $6 good! The free coffee was okay, but I'm sure they have better coffee options since they probably sampled their regular coffee. They also gave me three free donut holes. I ate the chocolate covered one which had a nice twist than the other plain chocolate and glazed, but they were all good. Overall, I like the creativity of each donut, but  I'm not sure if I would head out of my way to stop here again. Like I said before, I tried it and that's that. Another thing to note, the location is not the best for drivers. It's located in  Fulton Market which I'm not too familiar with, but the area is very grungy, industrial, and the parking is hard. You also have to be careful of men on fork lifts because they will come out of nowhere! If you have to walk, the streets are filled with a bunch of crap from the factories. Not the best place for a young woman like me!

57.description: Specialty donuts!! My favorites include the chocolate mint, eggnog, and the vanilla sprinkles. if you are lucky, they sometimes have the bite size mini donut that taste just as good as the big ones.

20.description: I like temptation but...those doughnuts are SCARY!  Huge empty carbs.  I don't bother with the price.  Clean divey place.COFFEE -- a specialty blend from Sparrow that will be drowned by whipped cream that is suggested but never added.  It's actually a clean brew, NO unnecessary add-ins.  Good fancy Seda coffee lid that turns to the left and right to avoid spillage.HONEY PACKETS -- one of the good things in here.SERVICE / STAFF -- another good thing here.  Very friendly, approachable and knowledgeable.Carbs and Calories galore!

36.description: Their donuts are good, but not the best I've ever had.  Tried the creme brûlée one today and not nearly enough filling.  I like the filling to gush out, and this one had just about as much as a Dunkin Donut donut.  Kind of disappointing.  I live their vanilla bean donut better

14.description: Tried the maple syrup with bacon donut. Truly delicious and really heavy.... But worth the calories and loved the staff there, super nice!!

3.description: Krystle is seriously amazing! It has been so long since I have actually liked my hair, but since she did my hair yesterday I can't stop looking in the mirror. She really listened to what I wanted, and gave me the beautiful blended balayage highlights I wanted. I love my hair cut too. As someone who has been trying to grow my hair out for years, it's always really annoying when a stylist cuts a lot off when I ask for a trim, but this was not one of those times. Krystle took all those pesky split ends off, and the difference in my length is barely noticeable.It was my first time at Axelle + Ivy, but it definitely won't be my last.The salon has a great atmosphere. The modern interior is so beautiful and elegant! Everything is super clean, and all the girls are so nice. I especially liked the long table of assorted magazines that you can sit at and browse while your hair color processes.

1.description: I just got my hair done by Tanya today and I am in love.  She is awesome and really knows her color and how to give a great haircut.  She is also really easy to talk to and a nice person.  She is my new go to girl.  I love my hair!

2.description: There's a line from Seinfeld where George Costanza says "These are not scraps. These are the historic remains of a once great society of hair. "I'm a dude and unfortunately I relate to George's lament far too well.  So what am I doing going to a salon and not a cheap barber shop?  One word: Tanya.  I have been getting my hair cut by Tanya for about 3 years now.  She's nice, cool, fun and makes getting a haircut seem like a day at Six Flags, but without the long lines, crappy food or long drive to Gurnee.  Ok, in retrospect, getting a haircut is nothing like Six Flags, but getting a haircut from Tanya is still like riding a roller coaster, but without the queasy feeling that you can get, especially if you've had a lousy hot dog.  And you don't get to go upside down either.  And no rickety tracks.  Eff..just trust me, Tanya is good.Note: it is generally pretty easy to find parking around the area .

5.description: This is THE only place I will go to for color in the city of Chicago. Marla is hands down the best colorist (especially for blondes). I trust her recommendations and I always leave with beautiful, natural looking color. I highly suggest giving her a try, you won't be disappointed! Aside from the talent here, the salon is beautifully decorated and clean. It is hard to get to via public transit for me, but I generally don't have problems finding a parking spot.

6.description: Ashley Brown is the best there is. She's incredibly talented and has gotten to the point where I come in and she tells me what she's doing. I trust her and in 5 years have never been disappointed! I recommend everyone I know and they always rave about her too! This salon is chic and has the best products. The staff is friendly and their customer service is top notch!

7.description: I have been seeing Tanya for several years now, and she does an amazing job!! Axelle+Ivy salon has a great vibe and decor! Tanya is always professional and understands what color and cut I want for my hair. Her execution is always right on, and she gives great recommendations!  My color has never looked better! I even started bringing my toddler in to see Tanya, and she is always patient and gives him a great cut. I would highly recommend Tanya!

0.description: I have been faithfully visiting  Cass for years. She is excellent. She has done an awsome job, on cuts, color, trims, blowouts and I love her..Thank you Cassie for all of these years.

4.description: Axellle + Ivy Salon may have just opened up in August of 2014, but I've been seeing Krystle for YEARS.  Seriously.  She's the longest relationship that I've had with a stylist ever.  I think it's been at least since like 2007ish. Maybe before.  I can't remember that far back... She cuts and styles my hair effortlessly.  So much so that when it grows out, it still looks great.  While I typically get my hair just cut, I've had it colored a few times, and it looks beautifully natural.  I have thick hair, and taming it sometimes is less than fun.  Krystle listens to what I want, and will throw in suggestions as to what would look better (let's face it, I have no clue what I'm looking for when I get my hair cut.).  Thanks to her, she even encouraged me to grow my hair out, and I receive many compliments on it (but short was SO MUCH EASIER! :-)  ).The new salon is bright, and the crystal chandeliers are an added bonus to brighten up your day!  Super easy to get to as the El stop is literally right there, but come a bit early, as street parking can be tough, especially earlier in the day.It's easy to make appointments through the genbook site, and it even sends you email and text reminders!

3.description: I ordered this for a few weeks.  I tried to give them a chance, I really did.  Unfortunately the food was subpar and sometimes inedible.  I hated more meals than I liked.  There are much better food delivery services out there.  If you want tasteless food without any seasoning, go for it.  Otherwise, do not order from this company.

1.description: Purchased 2 Tipprs for 5 days of Meatless Lunches/Dinners for $59. Via email, asked when delivery for my area was. Was told 10am-12pm Mondays OR Thursdays. Asked whether my order could be delivered the first Monday before 11:30am & before 9:30am the following Monday. First order was delivered at 7:30am which sat on my porch until I got home at 10am. When I confronted them about when the order was delivered, was told I had requested specific delivery times & that my next deliveries on Thursday, Monday & Thursday would be between 7-9am. Never received a follow-up as to why the delivery window changed.The food was so-so & packaged in non-microwaveable plastic containers that were much too large for the small portions & awkward to transport. VERY high in carbs (lots of breads, rice & pitas), decent caloric, protein & fat count, VERY low in fiber. Most meals didn't even provide a single serving of vegetables. Romaine salad consisted of 2 romaine leaves & 3 cherry tomatoes. Piece of fruit was a tiny slice of cantaloupe I finished in 3 bites. Apparently chicken is not considered a meat!Half the meals tasted good, especially the "meat"loaf, tortellini, butternut squash cous cous, chicken patties, lasagna & veggie burgers. While meals containing tofu, soup & veggie protein were bland & difficult to swallow.Would reorder if:~Customer service was better;~Meals contained a minimum of 6 servings of fruits/veggies a day;~Meals were lower in carbs & higher fiber;~Containers were microwaveable & easier to transport;~Am called when the order is delivered.

2.description: For months now they have not been accepting orders saying "Choice Eating is under new management and undergoing major renovation . At this point , all deliveries are suspended until further notice."

5.description: EDITED:  I originally has this company at 3 stars based on my experience.  In a 24 hour span, I have gotten 2 calls and 1 email from them about my next order.  I'm finding this to be kinda pushy - if I wanted to order for next week, I would have.  This has annoyed me to the point where I'm knocking off a star.  One email or one call would've been fine - but 3 is overkill.  I don't like being pressured.I've been getting delivery from this service for a week now.  Here are my impressions so far.  The price is great for what you get.  The portion sizes are reasonable and I haven't been unsatisfied after a meal.  The drivers have always been right on time.  And some of the food has been really good!  I've especially enjoyed the veggie lasagna and the chicken burger mexicali.  There were some tasty muffins for breakfast one morning, and the portabello sandwich was really good too.  Sadly, though, some of the food is really, really off the mark.  Like Lauren mentioned, the Mueslix is gross.  Last night's meal of turkey and brown rice was pretty flavorless.  And I wish there was some variety in their fresh fruit selection - every meal I've had with fruit has come with melon, which I don't care for.  I also received a salad with really, really brown lettuce (although to be fair I also received a salad with lettuce that was fine).  The other thing that I don't like (and I'm sure this is just a personal preference) - you don't get many veggies.  I tend to fill my plate with half veggies, quarter protein, and a quarter carbs.  Most of what I've had here has been pretty carb heavy and there haven't been a lot of veggies - I've been supplementing that with veggies of my own.  Overall, I think this service is pretty uneven.  I like the convenience, and some of the food has been quite good!  But sadly, I'm not really liking some of the food, which kind of seems like it defeats the purpose of having meals delivered.  I'll probably still use it once in awhile, if I have a week where I'm too busy to cook.

6.description: bought a coupon for a discount on the ten meal package for after my baby was born and it was so convenient and good.  so nice to have a weeks worth of meals ready to go.  Would definitely use again!

7.description: So, with the exception of the review before me, I don't know what has changed or what the deal is but I really enjoyed the food!I did the living social deal and also picked out the 1200 calorie plan.I was curious to see how to a) plan a decent meal for 1200 calories and b) how it would help with health, weight loss, etc.The food is delivered twice a week, everything fresh, you just put it in the fridge. Ummm, i kinda loved it. Deliveries come with a sheet the explain the calorie break down, etc. I was surprised so many things actually were the calories they stated. I definitely lost a few pounds.Overall, the taste is pretty decent. Carrot bread, amazing. The chicken fettuccine dish, awesome. Other things, I mean, if you're picking low cal, you know what this is.  There was never a dish I did not eat because of taste and I think overall it was a great view into what to prepare for yourself, how you can have decent healthy meals that are under 1200 calories. If I had more cash, I would definitely do this all the time because it was one less thing to worry about, and really healthy and tasty!

8.description: As a busy new working mom trying to lose the baby weight - this service has been IDEAL.  I am on the 1200 cal low fat plan and LOVE it.  It's easy and that I don't have to think about meals when I have to think about 2 kids, a husband and a job, is awesome.  I tried Seattle Sutton but I like this one much better.  SS was more hospital food like and CE has lots of middle eastern influences, which I love.  Not everything is a wild success but 85% of it is delicious.  Even my husband, the biggest food snob there is, eats the lunches I don't get to and likes them.  The delivery is prompt, the food is fresh and tasty and for about 20 bucks a day - I get all three meals prepared, delivered and measured out to help me lose weight.  LOVE this service.

9.description: I have tried Choiceeating.net for the past three weeks and my experience has been mixed.  This is a bit lengthy but I hope you will benefit from my experience. I will start with the positive: The delivery service is outstanding...they were nearly always on time and the one time they were going to be 5 minutes outside the window they called to let me know. .The food for the most part was wonderful.  The cost is reasonable and the variety was very good.  Cooking for myself It would have cost much more for the variety of foods I received. The negative: I am allergic to salmon and asked for a substitution which they were happy to do at the time for a flat $5.00 fee  I did have a very negative experience with a lunch I received that was a oriental shrimp salad.  When I opened the salad there was a VERY fishy smell as if the shrimp had gone bad.  I did not feel it was safe to eat so I threw the meal out and immediately emailed them 'ziad', the only contact I have with the company.  This was Tuesday at 1pm Central.  I also asked that they put NO seafood in my meals go forward so that I did not chance another 'shrimp' experience.  I received a response the next morning at 9am Central stating that this would not be a problem and could be done for the same $5.00 flat fee.   When my next order was received I did still have tilapia delivered which I was going to overlook since it could have been a question of timing. I had also asked 'ziad' about the nutritional information of their meals.  They claim that the low carb meals are 1600 calories and that there is a dietitian closely involved in the menu creation yet they are unable to provide me with any nutritional information for each meal.  I was also very surprised that on the 'low carb' menu I would receive hash browns (the potato is the greatest low carb no no second only to wonder bread).  'ziad' assured me that the carb content was between 80-120 grams per day and that the 'brown' was 15 grams of carbs.   'ziad' also asked me to be patient as there were a number of things they were working on since taking over the company and that the nutritional information would be available soon.Week 3:Monday's breakfast did not contain all that was stated on the package, I understand that there might be some variance from time to time on the meals as ingredients might not be available but the turkey sausage links were completly missing and the egg dish was much smaller than similar meals I'd received.  This led me to question the accuracy of the nutritional information I'd been quoted and what was advertised on their site.   I once again questioned 'ziad' who seemed more irritated with me than interested in rectifying the situation or providing any customer service.  The response instead was (and I quote) "you are the only one who is complaining" and I was then told that they will no longer provide a "no seafood" option which is ludicrus considering the number of people with seafood allergies as well as pregnant women or women who are nursing who need to limit their seafood intake.I am very disappointed however in the customer service I've received from Choice Eating and this is the primary reason fo the low rating.  There is never anyone answering the phones and the only method of communication that has worked at all was to email them.  My only contact was with 'ziad@choiceeating.net' and I found this to be a less than positive experience. It is unfortunate that my experience with customer service and 'ziad' in particular has been so difficult because I think that the concept is very good and the food aside from the rotten shrimp has been very good.  Had I not had such a terrible time with the customer service I would surely recommend this to a friend.

0.description: I have used this service off and on for several years now.  I would give them 3.5 stars but will round up because I think they are trying to improve.  CE is a food delivery service--you can pick low fat, low carb, or meatless, 5 or 7 meals a week for 2 or 3 meals a day, etc. (you can see sample menus on choiceeating.com).  I think prices are quite reasonable, less than other delivery services I have explored.  The taste of the food has definitely improved--there are only a few items I don't care for (breakfast stuff like mueslix or nutty fruity ceral which was a gross mush to my palate), and many (especially the lunches) are quite tasty.  Besides making it easier to watch what I eat during the holidays in terms of calories and portion sizes, it is also nice to wake up in the morning or come home at night after work and not have to think about what I want to eat or have to make the food (even though I do love to cook).  Meals are delivered 2x a week, Mondays and Thursdays.  I had some issues with them being delivered later than I requested, but they resolved this issue (which they hadn't to my satisfaction a couple of years ago), and I can tell they have really tried to improve customer service.  A good service if you like the convenience, or if you want to get back on track to eating healthy.(if you decide to try it, message me and I will give you my name for a referral)

4.description: I am finishing up my 7 days of food delivery with Choice Eating. I bought the Groupon and wasn't sure what to expect. Overall, I've enjoyed to food quality and variety. There isn't much seasoning to the dishes, but that speaks to the healthiness of the dishes. I picked the 1200 cal plan, which helped me with a calorie reduction plan I had started about a month ago. I lost 5 lbs. I can't attribute this all to Choice Eating since I only used it for a week, but it did help me stay on track and not have to think or plan what I was going to cook & eat. I'd definitely use them again.I wish I could request certain dietary restrictions such as no dairy/cheese.

3.description: I stumbled across two farmers markets one near the finical district and the other near the Museum of Contemporary Art. Walking past all the beautiful berries and veggies, because I can find those in Bay Area easily. I wanted something regional and special to Chicago. Grabbing a beautiful focaccia I realized I need something else to make this special and there it was slightly melting in the sun a table of cheese.  I asked for a couple little samples and was sold. Okay so the cheese is from Wisconsin but that's close enough to be local in my eyes. mmmm smoked string cheese, fenugreek goat cheese and an amazing wisconsin cheddar all smuggled back to California. I'm slowly savoring them over the next couple of days because once they're gone I won't be able to find them until another trip back to Chicago.

1.description: By far, my favorite booth at our neighborhood farmers market....I have developed an addiction for the Goat Milk Gouda....fabulousness!! So glad to hear they are going to do a winter cheese drop for the Printer's Row neighborhood....I don't know how I would get through the whole winter without their cheese! Next time you pass their booth somewhere, you MUST try them out. Ask for a free taste, and I guarantee you'll become a fan!!!

2.description: My farmers market list consisted of brie and string cheese. I happened upon Stamper Cheese and my world changed. I randomly sampled some apricot brie and the combination of flavors was delicious. I've never tasted anything like it. Yum! Next I asked for some string cheese. Let's just say that my purchase never made it home. I ate all 8 pieces of the smoked string cheese before I left the market. I went back to buy some more, but they were sold out before noon. Apparently, I was the only person who didn't know about Stamper Cheese and their smoked cheese. Sigh. Needless to say, next time I will be first in line to make my purchases so that I can get double of everything and sample their other cheeses as well. I'm officially a big fan of Stamper Cheese.

9.description: We visit the booth at the 61st Street Farmers Market and the guy who works it is as great as the cheese. We love the curds (squeaky!), the horseradish havarti, baby swiss, goats milk gouda, and more. Thanks for coming to our market, we love your cheese!!!

10.description: I pick up my cheese at the Glenwood Sunday Market in Rogers Park, and what a tasty treat.My most recent purchase was the marscapone/garlic/herb cheese blend - a spreadable, tasty delight.  It's so, so tasty.I also picked up some smoked string cheese, which was also super tasty. The guys behind the table are great, and I look forward to future munchies!

4.description: The tomato and basil curds were squeaky wonderful straight from the bag. And added an excellent flavor to a spinach casserole later! And at 6$ a bag I couldn't say no.They have excellent string cheese for the real connoisseur as well, all in a fun community market setting. Get some!

6.description: The Stamper Cheese folks are at every farmers' market in this city. I love their brie with blue cheese stripes. It's so flavorful and good. The prices are high, but fair for the quality and creativity of their cheeses.At the Daley Center market this week, the salesgirl had this really long and ranting sign advising people not to take more than one cheese sample. It was kind of aggressive and rude. I'm thinking, if the people taking too many samples is really that hard on you, maybe you should just not give out samples. Cool?

12.description: I picked up some Stamper Cheese (Big Ed and Garlic Dill Cheddar Cheese Curds) at the Division Farmers Market on Saturday and it's delicious!!  I highly recommend trying these two and I can't wait to go back next weekend to try some other types.  Enjoy!

5.description: I'm from Wisconsin and LOVE squeaky cheese curds!I've been stopping by their booth at the Logan Square Farmer's Market for the past few weeks and rocking the garlic dill cheese curds. Today, by surprise, I found out they're not only based near my hometown, but owned by the brother of my high school history teacher!! crazy!Mr. Stamper remembered me, and my siblings, and it was so exciting to see a vendor at the market from NE Wisconsin!!

11.description: Absolutely delicious.  Wholesome and healthy.  The cheese curds are heavenly!  Something I'm so happy to eat!

8.description: Hmmmm, Stamper Cheese.I discovered the Stamper Cheese Dude at the Northcenter Farmer's Market a couple of weeks ago, and now I've gone and got myself addicted.Baby Amish Swiss is the main liner. It is the sweetest most flavorful rendition, I've had the good luck to taste in Chicago and maybe anywhere.Forget your high- falutin' Caprese salad, just turn loose with a chunk of this Swiss, a fresh tomato and a salt shaker-- too good to pass up!Chipotle cheddar, pepper interlaced into the cheese actually looks like art.  with a good bite but not a lot of heat, smoky aftertaste that, at first, put me off a bit, but hey it's chipotle. It's smoky!8 year cheddar just turned 9 and it was worth the wait.Can't wait for more visits so I can update the cavalcade.and continue the jones

0.description: Cheese, marvelous cheese! Are you that person with at least five varieties of cheese in your fridge, just in case? Well, I can straight up de-mystify the Stamper Cheese agenda.  They are cheese pushers.  Like so many artisanal fromage purveyors, their wares suck you in, and you just crave more. Must have fresh mozzarella cheese balls, that is my personal mantra.Twice a week, at either the Federal/Daley/ or Willis Tower Farmers Market, I shuffle up to their booth to score my fix, satiating the gnawing jones of a cheese fiend. The days in between, I try to make it last, stretch it out. Mostly, the fresh mozzarella balls will do.  Occasionally, I might venture into a goat cheese gouda,  apricot brie, or a nettle infused variety. You know what nettles are? Yeah. They STING you. And apparently, they're good for you too. Only Stamper Cheese would have the cojones to use stinging nettles in their cheese. Get some. It's good. It's a hard cheese variety, and quite tasty. No store front, but they have a Printer's Row Cheese Drop Off. Check their website, Facebook, or better yet, email them for details, since the outdoor Farmers Market season is now over.  The winter is that much bleaker without you, Stamper Cheese.

7.description: Although it can be a bit pricey for the fancier cheeses, it is always, absolutely worth it. I will not ever buy cheesesticks from ANYWHERE else. Seriously. For the past 3 years, it's these guys, or nobody. They are perfect (chewy, stringy, and with a perfect salty tang). They even have a smoked variety.

58.description: Great for dinner, but their drink selection is mediocre at best. I recommend visiting Fulton Market Kitchen down the block instead.

56.description: This place is good enough, but it seems a bit bland for Fulton Market. The decor is ok, the food and drinks were ok (but VERY expensive!), the service was ok, the clientele is ok... It's basically just inoffensive. I normally think of Fulton Market/Restaurant Row places to be edgier or more innovative, and this place was exactly like 10 different River North bars I've visited. If you have to go here, you won't have a terrible time. But if it's your choice, I'd choose somewhere else.

29.description: We stopped by for drinks after dinner recently and enjoyed our experience. Service was good, bartender was great, and the ambiance is chill. I'm a sucker for the library feel so took it all in. I will say, the area away from the library has some really uncomfortable chairs. Not sure if they're trying to drive you out quickly?

42.description: I was so utterly disappointed in this place. I went for dinner on Saturday night. When we walked in, there were three tables total inside, and several two tops outside. We elected to sit outside, where we were sat at a table for two (there were four of us in the party; the table was probably 18 inches in diameter). The waitress came promptly and we placed our drink orders and the cheese plate. It took about 15 minutes for the drinks to come, and even longer for the cheese plate. And let me be clear about this "cheese plate". There was literally four tiny triangles of cheese. Total. We were literally enjoying "nibbles" of cheese. Not quite what we were hoping for. Also, once we had our drinks and the "cheese plate" it was very evident that the four of us and our food were not going to fit on the two top. We asked if we could bring up another table, and while we were obliged, the server seemed annoyed.After we ordered our drinks, we noticed that the waitress had also taken our menus away, and we had to ask for them to be returned so we could actually order the meal. The other members of my party ordered a variety of plates, including the beef special, which was supposed to have peaches. No peaches could be found. I ordered the octopus and gnocchi, and while it was okay, it was nothing I would consider returning for.Overall, for a Fulton Market restaurant, I found the Betty to be rather pedestrian and the service to be sub par. While the inside has a cool ambiance, there are too many other great restaurants literally within walking distance that the Betty would not be a place I returned.

23.description: This place was a nice start to the evening. We came pretty early, and managed to snag a table with the understanding that we could have it for 45 minutes before the reservation it was being held for showed up. I started off with a glass of Rosé, which was light, floral and crisp. A few people at my table decided to try the gin service, which was a nice twist to the classic drink. Basically you are served a small tray with everything you'd need to mix up your own G&T, tailored exactly how you like it. The tray included Q Tonic, gin, a small bottle of bitters, lime juice, and possibly one other ingredient I think I am forgetting. The drink menu seemed interesting with different concoctions and witty names. I enjoyed my experience here, and would like to try it again to see if I can try out a few more items.

47.description: Amazing staff! So knowledgeable and great craft cocktails. The drinks change seasonally so there is always something new. I loved the craft liquor list.

8.description: If you are into the whole lumber sexual craze, then come drink at the Betty. It must be a pre-requisite to have a full grown beard in every fashion to work here....because these beards are legit. The feel of the Betty is very 1976 chic upscale moose lodge. Does that make sense? Not really - but you will see what I mean upon arrival. It's packed with old records, cool booths, peacocks, and a serious bar! The drink menu is pretty gin heavy so if that's also your thing, then the Betty is for you.Being anything BUT a gin gal...I was happy to find a whiskey drink. The coffee + cigarettes was right up my alley. And not to mention, after just one I was feelin no pain;) my girlfriend went with the maximillion which was an unsuspecting light and delicious tequila cocktail. Both were perfect!We didn't eat at the Betty this time but judging from the unique and tasty cocktails, I could imagine their food being just as pleasing. The Betty is uber cool...I highly suggest it for good dranks and chill vibes.

31.description: Went on a quieter night. All food items we had were very good, including the cassoulet.Didn't like my drink, the Cigarettes & Coffee, but hey, it did sound appealing on the menu, as did many of the other offerings. Will try something else next time I go in for sure.Would go back again, and order a different cocktail.

34.description: I'm just here to rave about service. I asked about the pita from the baba ghanoush, she asked if I had any allergies, I said I'm vegan, she said she didn't think it was vegan but she'll double check. Now this is a typical response. What wasn't a typical response was what happens next. She comes out with my incredibly strong, incredibly delicious Maximillon cocktail, tequila and wine with a hint of bitters, and says that the pita isn't vegan but the pizza dough is. Less than 10 minutes later I was brought the most delicious bowl of warm pizza crust, cut into vegan friendly, pita resembling strips. That is the definition of above and beyond.

16.description: Haven't had a bite to eat here yet but the drinks are delicious!This place a wonderful jem tucked a little ways away from the bussle of randolph street.  I absolutely fell in love with it the moment I walked in the door.  From the decor to the menu they have everything for your liking.  Small bites to eat and concoctions to sip on.  Outdoor seating is a plus as well!.  You could be here on a sweet intimate date, a night to catch up with your girls or a group gathering at a communal table.  The service is quick and great and the place is got the right vibe.I have already let the secret out with my friends that we must go back!

13.description: Betty?  Is that your name?  Well it fits you perfectly as this bar has an old fashioned vibe just like the moniker it has.Based in the old Lumen space, trust me, there is nothing here to remind you of that contemporary offering.  For once you push past the heavy green curtain, you'll find yourself in a huge space with plenty of little places to mix and gather.  At one end, library books fill the shelves.  On another is the bar stretching across the length of the room.  And across the front are windows looking out onto the street.  And all the dark wood makes the place feel vintage although the cool light fixtures will have you thinking otherwise.We were a group of 6 and were seated in a comfy hightop booth right behind the hostess stand.  And speaking of the hostess, this place has a gem of a hostess.  I think her name was Kiera (?) and she made our night from welcoming us to the place, taking our coats and hanging them on hooks nearby, and pretty much welcoming us into "her space" like it was her own home.  If this was our first impression of how the night was going to go, we knew we were in for a good time.The food is all shareable and share is what we did.  We ordered a wide range of the menu from the cheese plate, to fried cauliflower, to croquettes, to the Tika Masala, to the pasta with beef ragout, and the squid salad.  All were good although the croquettes and pasta were probably the favorites.  And if that wasn't enough, we ordered one of each of the 3 desserts and all were terrific although my favorite was the pistachio cupcake.And let's not forget the drinks.  For you gin drinkers out there, this is a gin paradise.  They even do a customizable gin and tonic that you can do at the table.  If vodka is your thing, as is mine, there is a limited selection of vodka but they do a nice job in making speciality cocktails with it.  And go with the server's reccos on the cocktail list and you won't be disappointed!I also liked that the manager came over to welcome us to the bar and made sure that we had everything that we wanted.If you drive, there is valet parking out front that will run you about $14.  Also know that after 8pm there is an 18 and older rule.Check out the Betty.  She's as cool as her name suggests in that simple, old school sort of way!

11.description: Mehhhh. We walked in later in the night and, since nobody greeted us & it's a bar, headed toward the bar. A back of house member snapped at two members of my group, "Ladies, check in with the host!" So we get seated. It's fine; not crowded. Three more colleagues show up after we are seated and head to the bar. I went over to speak with them and when a table adjacent ours opened up, we all went to sit down. At that point, our sever came by to say, "Just to let you know, this is a table service area," which seemed inappropriate since nobody who had been seated went to the bar to order - we actually recruited new customers for her area. She then disappeared for at least 15 minutes when several people needed another drink, and didn't return until we asked for her to come back.After she finally returned and took our order, she forgot half of the orders but didn't own it. My drink arrived 30 minutes after ordering.And to top it all off, she added 20% gratuity because we had a group large enough to do so. When we approached the manager for an adjustment, our server tried to interrupt the conversation! She stated that the auto gratuity was noted on the menu despite her poor service. THE NERVE!!!!Too much attitude, not enough service, slooowwwwwww, and nothing unique enough to have me coming back. The woman with pink tips in her hair has to go (and leave the service industry)

39.description: Upon a recent visit to Chicago we got to visit The Betty with some friends who recommended it for the cocktails and small dishes. The recommendation was a shinning success! The Betty is a quaint bar with a great cocktail selection and a great, hip atmosphere. We were not disappointed by this choice!The cocktails at The Betty should be your main draw. Our party of four ordered Gimlet, Maximillion, The Oathkeeper, and Life During War Time. I personally had the Life During War Time made with genever, green tea syrup, aperol, and fennel bitters. It was well balanced and the perfect blend of aroma and spices. I highly recommend this cocktail to those who love anise flavors but want something more subdued.For food we went with a pair of small plates and one large plate that my wife and I shared. We ordered Shishito Peppers, Kampaci Crudo, Pierogi, and Lamb with falafel. The stars of our meal were the Kampaci Credo and Pirogi by far, while the peppers and lamb left us with something to be desired. The peppers just really felt like they were missing something because the dish honestly felt like I was munching on a bowl of green salad. The lamb had a very small portion of falafel served with it, and it was over done and slightly bland.On the other side of the spectrum, our Kampaci Crudo was prepared delightfully. The ceviche was well executed, and I loved the pairing of small bits of watermelon, serrano, cucumber, mango, and beets. The pierogi was spot on, and I loved the addition of sausage under each pirogi. The addition of mushroom was a bit odd, but I couldn't really taste it anyways!For dessert we ordered the peach cobbler. The top was a little burn (too much caramelization!), but it was overall an okay option. I just expected more from what we were paying.The service was on point and attentive. I don't think we felt like the server was hovering either. The music was 70s and 80s rock, which our party loved. The drinks coupled with the soundtrack were the real stars of the night. I would come back for sure for a drink, pirogi, and the kampachi crudo. I would also be interested in exploring the menu a little more.

37.description: Gorgeous setting and good service, The Betty was a great place to meet friends for a Friday night dinner. Go with a group that will share small plates. Prices are high for what you get. Best dishes were the "fried" cauliflower which tasted more like it was dusted with spices and baked - delicious - and the crudo - light and flavorful. What seemed to be the centerpiece of the menu was the cioppino and at $38 I expected a heaping bowl of seafood. It was delicious but the portion didn't fit the bill with mussel shells filling the bowl with little seafood underneath. The squid salad was also delicious but disappointing portion-wise: I could barely find the pieces of squid mixed in the warm frisée. Net net: great setting, good taste, over order and prepare to shell out more than you would for other restaurants of this quality.

0.description: My friends and I had dinner at Gus' fried chicken, and were looking for a place to grab a few drinks afterwards. It was cold out and lucky for us, The Betty was one door down. I was really surprised when I walked in at how big and inviting the space was. There's a ton of tables and the lighting is just right--not too bright, not too dark. We were quickly given a table for 4. I had the Maximillion, which was a tequila and sparkling wine cocktail with a hint of ancho chile. It tasted like a margarita meets champagne, and the heat was nice but not overbearing. I also tried the Blank Space, which was a sparkling red base with I think gin. I really loved this drink. It was dark and rich but also was easy to drink with a refreshing citrus aftertaste. The others had Coffee & Cigarettes, and a few Manhattans. Everyone loved their drinks. Overall I was really impressed by the quality of the cocktails and how many flavors were in each. I also thought they were very reasonable at $13. The service was a tad on the slow side, but I honestly didn't mind so that I could sip and enjoy my cocktails. The Betty is a great place for a group, or even a date, and I love that it didn't feel pretentious at all like other bars in the neighborhood can feel. I'll definitely be back.

38.description: Haven't had a bite to eat here yet but the drinks are delicious!This place a wonderful jem tucked a little ways away from the bussle of randolph street.  I absolutely fell in love with it the moment I walked in the door.  From the decor to the menu they have everything for your liking.  Small bites to eat and concoctions to sip on.  Outdoor seating is a plus as well!.  You could be here on a sweet intimate date, a night to catch up with your girls or a group gathering at a communal table.  The service is quick and great and the place is got the right vibe.I have already let the secret out with my friends that we must go back!

51.description: Spent 11 minutes tonite sitting at the right end of the bar inside The Betty with nary a bartender or a server bothering to acknowledge my presence or take an order. After staring in the direction of the bartenders for a few minutes (mind you: at 9:45 on a Friday night, it was pretty quiet at the bar so I'm pretty sure the two guys back there saw me), and then sitting with my hands clasped for a while to no avail, I walked out, but not before voicing my displeasure to the hostess.Chicago's a big place so I shouldn't have too much trouble finding someone to take my money, but this was the strangest experience I have had at a bar since moving here three years ago. Parts bad service, part racist (what can I tell you, watching other white customers get served while I sat and waited was a bit appalling), and part wacko? No need to come back.

27.description: I LOVE this place.  I have now been to The Betty twice and I have really enjoyed it both times.  The cocktails have been fantastic on both occasions, this past weekend I thoroughly enjoyed the Coffee and Cigarettes concoction.  I had food on my first trip to The Betty and we loved everything we ordered.  I especially liked that the chefs came out of the kitchen to deliver our food and describe it to us, that was a nice touch  The menu seems to change frequently, which I also like, but I can only hope that someday they bring back the Chicken Tikka Masala dish because it was absolutely incredible.I will recommend The Betty to anyone without hesitation.

32.description: Grabbed a couple drinks here while waiting for a table at Au Cheval. The cocktails were great and I really enjoyed the cheese board. Looking forward to going back for the full dinner experience.

54.description: 3.5 stars.  Not a bad place, not an amazing one.  It just sort of perfectly fits into that ok category.  The plates were good, octopus a bit tough and a bit too much kale in the dish.  Really nothing was bad...server did enter the wrong order but came out and told us right away.  We didn't even notice and were fine sitting outside for a while.  It's a tighter squeeze outside but hey what place with outdoor seating isn't?It's just fine really.  The decor inside is great but the it's not likely a place I would seek to go out of my way.  One note is that we did not try any drinks so cannot comment there.

48.description: We celebrated my husband's 40th birthday at The Betty with 15 of our friends. When I called to book, Katie was very friendly and helpful. I called again to confirm the count a few days before and pre-order some appetizers for my guests and again Katie was super helpful. The night went off without a hitch and our friends had a great night!  Thanks for everything!

44.description: Lovely room. Great  outdoor space. But seats are SO uncomfortable outside!  Please replace them.  Now I'd at all possible!

24.description: So I wish I could give this place 5 stars. The MANAGER gets 5. She was wonderful. The hostess with the huge eyebrows was so rude and poorly dressed. Our reservation was lost or didn't process .. Whatever no biggie. But asking for it seemed like an ordeal. She scrolled through like I was inconveniencing her. She didn't ask how many people or try to help at all. Not my problem you hate your job. So my friends and I left and were going to go somewhere else. The lovely manager walked outside in the cold (which she didn't have to do) and said there was a cancellation and could accommodate us. She had a great recovery! She came by and checked on us and was so polite. The food was good, not great. I liked the pasta, melted cheese, fried cauliflower. The drinks were yummy. I like cocktails with spice to them. The atmosphere was nice too. I'd go back to try it again.

7.description: Excellent service, food, drinks, and amazing ambiance. I'm in love with this place! It's a tad pricey, but I mean... You pay for what you get, so I'm not complaining. I love that the food is served family style. If I go anywhere that doesn't serve like that, I tell the waiter that's how we are eating, or else I'm gonna have to stick my fork in everyone's plate. Things we ordered: Coffee and cigarettes to drink - LOVEFried cauliflower - LOVEOctopus - LOVE Drum stick ice cream desert - meh Wish I didn't have to complain, but the dessert wasn't worth it.

49.description: Good place for quality drinks especially for a big party. Good cocktails, but there's something off with the ambiance. It might be a little too big for the vibe that's it's trying to set. Almost as if it belongs in river north. It's like a Sportsmanship club on steroids. That's why though it's good for big parties. Definitely a good go to place, but nothing unique that the city doesn't already offer.

40.description: Attractive room, intriguing food and drink menus. Servers are engaging, but scattershot food-running suggests undertraining. We'll be back, @thebettychicago

53.description: It's all about the drinks and ambiance here. The interior decor resembles a posh library and offers a romantic, classy, and inviting mood.  Drinks: Coffee + Cigarettes (definitely get your money's worth). Drink is strong as hell, but easy to sip on. The other one that i tried was Life During War Time - super refreshing but could feel the alcohol creep up. Food: grilled squid (GREAT!) Loved the acidic coating and tasted Chinese? Not that it's a bad thing, just didn't expect it to taste Chinese. Cauliflower and buttered noodles with clams were just okay. I think they forgot to rinse the clams b/c they were packed with sand...we couldn't eat them.I would return in a heart beat for their drinks, given The Betty is only a 7 min walk from my apt, but would skip the food. Food wasn't bad, but nothing to rave about and selection is limited.Warning: slow service on bringing food out. Each dish took about 15 minutes to come out and the place was only 20% full.

30.description: We went for drinks and some light snacks. The Cocktails were excellent and the food options were narrow but delicious. This seems to be a place that is better for larger groups. We were 2 and we were sat right next to the wall along a main walkway where it appeared they had all their two person tables set up.

46.description: Someone once said happy hour is the best hour. Damn were they right. I work near Betty but never had the urge to visit until our governor finally did something right and brought back Happy hour. The ambience is very chill at Betty, and you feel like you're sneaking booze into a library or basement. I'm all about drinking around books so it worked for me.  The Betty offers an $8 cocktail of the day, 1/2 off craft beers and $8 wines.
