The cocktail they offered last weekend was like a Manhattan but drier. While those drinks aren't my cup of tea, I had a sip and for $8 it will get you tipsy if that's what you're out to accomplish. I had the organic wine which was tasted like a deep cab sav. Pours were decent and the staff was very attentive. We shared the cauliflower which everyone raved about. Yes, it's bomb, especially after a couple glasses of wine. I would definitely return to Betty for an after work drink and bite. I just wish the happy hour drink list was a little more extensive, not that I like to mix liquors or anything..

1.description: This bar is down the street from the Aviary so it is a nice place to wait for your name to be called.this place is huge and a lot cheaper than the Aviary aha. I recommend the Cobbler which has amontillado sherry, rhubarb liqueur, and strawberry peppercorn shrub over crushed ice. I love ice, especially when it is hot....and when we went during labor day weekend.... it was hot. Bartenders were too talkative but they do like to show off! One was throwing their shaker around and behind their back. Good place to kill some time and the drinks were good.

55.description: Had a girls night out to celebrate one of my bestie's b-day.  I picked The Betty based on their reviews and wanting to try some place new in the West Loop.  The drinks were great, the menu consists of small plates and large plates, and very limited.  We ordered the small plates so that we could try a little bit of everything.  We ordered the fried cauliflower, which had a very interesting flavor, the squid salad, and the lamb flatbread.  All were great and enough to share amongst us all.  The ambiance was nice, beautiful bar.  The service was a little slow but overall a great experience.

9.description: Got a hot date and don't know where to take her (....or him)? Ponder no more!The ambiance is very cozy and romantic. It has an industrial and antique feel to it. I love the library-like decor on the back wall. The lighting is dim, where the source is predominantly from small candles and lamps. If you're taking someone with you who looks better in the dark than in bright lights, look no further. This is THE spot for it (but you have to come when it's dark outside).If you're going as a group like us, try to opt for the light-colored lounge chairs on the back side of the wall instead of the high chairs/table. They're more comfy!I didn't order any drinks because I was going to be driving back to the suburbs afterward (I know, lame). Maybe that makes my review not even legit??? Buttttt, I did try out one of their desserts, which turned out to be delicious! I ordered the mini pie, which varies in selection by the day. The one I chose was chocolate malt. It was a little cool, soooo incredibly smooth and creamy on the inside and had just the right amount of sweetness. It's a small dessert that I can personally gobble up in two big bites, but you're better off taking small bites and savoring the flavor.The service was good. Our server was very attentive and wasn't overbearing but came at the right times. My water was refilled in a timely manner.Would recommend!

26.description: The atmosphere of this place is amazing. Very cool and vintage with record albums, etc lining the walls. The menu is very limited which often implies good options served in a timely manner. When we got there it wasn't too busy and we order several small plates and our main courses right away. The appetizers came out but at such a slow pace by the time the main course arrived everyone was ready to leave. The food was decent. There wasn't anything I would have to try again. Several of the small plates used the same sauce which I found disappointing.

25.description: Stopped by on Thursday night and was able to get a table upon walking in. Loved the rustic  but refined interior. Perfect place for cocktails and drinks in the neighborhood. The food was just okay, the cauliflower sounded and looks good, but  tasted a little off. The peirogie with kielbasa was also okay but not as good as Tete down the street. Service was also attentive. Overall would come back for drinks with friends but not for dinner.

12.description: This place is exactly what the neighborhood needed. Spacious, focused on drinks, and the perfect place to kill time before a dinner rez in the hood, or for a nightcap after.

59.description: Can only speak for the drinks, but very quality cocktails and nice atmosphere. Nice outdoor area in front and plenty of space inside. The create your own gin and tonic was very high quality and unique. The menu of cocktails had nice variety as well.

21.description: We really liked The Betty.  A cool and unique atmosphere and great menu.  Drinks were inventive.  The pierogis and cauliflower were highlights.  We also had the peppers, flatbread, and mousse which were all tasty.  The only thing we didn't really care for were the croquets.  We'll definitely go back for the atmosphere alone.

17.description: Made a stop here on Saturday night for a friend's birthday. I wanted to love it like a good young hipster should, I really did, I just...didn't. The vibe and atmosphere was chill; great date night decor, but the food and cocktail menus fell flat for me. Coffee and cigarettes is probably the worst concept for a cocktail I could think of, among other odd drink choices. Nothing jumped out as outstanding to eat, either. Tough to say you'd be back when you don't like their offerings. Not my personal cup of tea.

10.description: I am torn on this review...its like a 3.5So I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the space.  Its like library meets bar, meets restaurant, meets lounge.  Reminds me of "The Office" but much easier to get into.  The chairs comfortable and the space just seemed rich.  LOVE...or as the young folk would say...its so fleek.They recently are allowing reservations but they must only have a few available online because they had none on the website, but when I called, it was no problem.  I hate having to call for a reservation...but I really wanted to check out this place.  I also suffer from FOMO.  heheheThe host staff...I have to say...I love them.  They make you feel the vibe and they make you feel like you are important.  We had a few people that looked like they were important come check on us...which was nice.  Ha.The service was spotty.  Server was nice...but just kind of absent and then all over us.  It was weird.  Like no drink refills for awhile and then trying to take full drinks away.  The tables are tiny...so I understand the need to feel like clearing the plates, drinks, water, etc...but when you have a table of 4 girls...we like to pick and talk and sip and pick.  I thought the coursing out of the meal was meh and the order of things was also odd.  This is how it was laid out.Flatbread-surprisingly delish and HUGE!  I loved the spice in the sausage.  It was perfectFried Cauliflower-people are raving...I thought it was good...but not the best dish.Croquettes-not impressed.  Not much flavor at all.Cheese board-extremely unimpressed.  It just didnt go together.Squid Salad-YUM!  It was the perfect dish.  Crisp and light.  Tikka Masala-great flavor...I wasnt a fan of the messiness of the dish.  Bones, etc.  I also didnt see any chicharones...maybe they were hidden?I know its just getting started so I think it will work out all the kinks and be fantastic.  Its just not there yet.

5.description: I stopped in here last Saturday for a drink and really found this place to be charming.  We were here early so it was not crowded and we had our pick of seats. We chose to be festive and sit by the large Christmas tree which added to the charm of the place. Our waitress was wonderful and made some great recommendations. I went with the "Life During War Time" and it was delish!  I don't like sweet drinks and this one was the perfect balance, with just a hint of green tea that added to the cocktail. There were so many intriguing cocktails on the list I want to try, but we had dinner reservations elsewhere, but I will be back.I will note the one odd thing is the storage closet is in the women's bathroom, so I went twice and  both times there was a man running through with paper towels or something.  It didn't bother me, but I found it odd they didn't check first to make sure no one was in there first.

3.description: Cool hip spot with great drink items.  Food items were delicious.  Our waitress was good but nothing out of this world. I ordered a Manhattan and it was perfect.  The flatbread was very rich in flavor and quite good.

35.description: I like the space, I like that there is always room to sit, and I like how close I am to this bar.I've been here a few times and service is fine, the appetizer we had was fine and the drinks are fine. I wanted a blue cheese olive martini and they didn't have that. Surprising to me.I will be back because it's close by and a nice place to get a drink but I prefer the cocktails at the other restaurants in this group.

19.description: Cozy, lovely cocktail spot with a large selection of interesting alcohol concoctions. The decor reminded me of someone's (very grand) living room and library. The mixolologists are also willing to make drinks off the menu, as long as you can provide them with instructions. Also, note: the happy hour is just during the week, despite some other reviews.

28.description: Only had drinks here based on a recommendation from a friend. Loved it! Just a cool rustic looking space, the library was a nice touch and my wife was loving just all the decor in general. Great drinks and great service as well. I'll definitely be back here with some friends.

45.description: In for an early, pre-Girl & the Goat drink. Can't remember the games of the drinks but they were great, served by great waitstaff.

33.description: Cute and cosy spot to get drinks. The waitstaff did a decent job managing the party size which quickly jumped from 10 people to 30 people. I wish they placed us in another area of the bar since we were constantly asked to move to keep the hallway clear. FYI - my friend really enjoyed her mocktails.

43.description: I did some research on finding this place for our next date night! I was super excited to try it after reviewing the menu and reading the yelp reviews.I loved the atmosphere of the whole place. Definitely my style. Very cool with retro vibes. Let me just say the food was absolutely delicious. We ordered several small plates and grazed for a couple hours. The octopus and masala were my favorites! The tikka missal was beautiful,..the chicken just fell off the bone, perfect.  The cocktails:delicious! I ordered an Alpine Coffee at the bar..they did the coffee in a French press so it takes longer to make..but boy was it lovely. I recommend it as a night cap!I'd give this place five stars if it weren't for one thing:terrible service. We had this blonde waitress, who I refer to her by hair color because she never bothered to even tell us her name. The whole night, from start to finish, she acted as if she just hated her job and life in general. We would go 10-15 minutes without seeing her anywhere. And when we did see her, she would pretty much avoid eye contact and we'd have to flag her down. Her attitude was terrible and barely spoke to us. It got to the point where my boyfriend had to go get our next round of drinks from the bar.Everyone else at The Betty was very helpful and lovely. Even the gentlmen that cleared our table had gave us more smiles and conversation than our waitress.I don't know if she was quitting soon or having a bad day. It shouldn't matter. I've been in the service industry many years, and you don't let your bad day effect your work...because then it reflects very poorly on the business. Service is everything.Other than her,...A message to the owner..I love the place. It's beautiful and you've done a great job. I heard The Betty is still a baby, and wish to see it thrive.  I hope to come back and try the rest of the menu in the future!

2.description: I hate the give this place thee stars, since I loved the decor and ambience when we walked in! I was super excited and ready to pay the $13 a drink price for a good cocktail.My mood changed after my drink came. I got the waypoint, which essentially is a cup of bourbon and rum mixed together with a banana chip thrown in. I get people want a stiff drink for the price, but for $13 im looking for something creative and complex in a drink... Not sipping a cup of whiskey. Everyone at my table of 4 felt the same of their drinks.Service was great, and overall I would come back to try their food and just get a beer.

18.description: Spent 11 minutes tonite sitting at the right end of the bar inside The Betty with nary a bartender or a server bothering to acknowledge my presence or take an order. After staring in the direction of the bartenders for a few minutes (mind you: at 9:45 on a Friday night, it was pretty quiet at the bar so I'm pretty sure the two guys back there saw me), and then sitting with my hands clasped for a while to no avail, I walked out, but not before voicing my displeasure to the hostess.Chicago's a big place so I shouldn't have too much trouble finding someone to take my money, but this was the strangest experience I have had at a bar since moving here three years ago. Parts bad service, part racist (what can I tell you, watching other white customers get served while I sat and waited was a bit appalling), and part wacko? No need to come back.

41.description: Recently, we went here with some good friends and took our dinner. The place was cool, because of its lighting. Good food at a good price, wealthy ambiance and very relaxing. Got a complementary wine so decent.

52.description: Vegans beware! This bad review is 100% based on the waitress. The ambiance was nice and drinks were good... Once I received a vegan drink. I asked the waitress if the wine was vegan. She said, "Yes, I am absolutely certain they are vegan." I ask again becuse most people do not know most red wine is Not vegan. She assures me again (she says she works at a winery), so I ordered it. After I drank it; I decided to check and its NOT vegan per barnivore.

50.description: Great vibe. The gimlets were the bomb. Friendly knowledgeable wait staff. Cool retro furnishings .

4.description: The Betty was fine, but not exceptional.The restaurant is crowded and the tables seem a bit cramped.  The tables are not very big--for that reason, I might suggest The Betty more for a drink, and less for dinner.  We went as a group of four, and we could not fit all of our dishes on the table.  The service was pretty bad.  The wait staff were inattentive, a bit slow, and not super friendly.  It took us ages to order and get our food.  A meal that should have lasted just over an hour took three.  That was kind of a bummer.The food was fine but forgettable.  No one was wow-ed.  The real rub was when the check came.  The food was really expensive, and not that great, with pretty poor service.  Disappointing.We might be back for drinks, but I wouldn't rate this place for dinner.

6.description: Someone once said happy hour is the best hour. Damn were they right. I work near Betty but never had the urge to visit until our governor finally did something right and brought back Happy hour. The ambience is very chill at Betty, and you feel like you're sneaking booze into a library or basement. I'm all about drinking around books so it worked for me.  The Betty offers an $8 cocktail of the day, 1/2 off craft beers and $8 wines. The cocktail they offered last weekend was like a Manhattan but drier. While those drinks aren't my cup of tea, I had a sip and for $8 it will get you tipsy if that's what you're out to accomplish. I had the organic wine which was tasted like a deep cab sav. Pours were decent and the staff was very attentive. We shared the cauliflower which everyone raved about. Yes, it's bomb, especially after a couple glasses of wine. I would definitely return to Betty for an after work drink and bite. I just wish the happy hour drink list was a little more extensive, not that I like to mix liquors or anything..

22.description: Excellent service, food, drinks, and amazing ambiance. I'm in love with this place! It's a tad pricey, but I mean... You pay for what you get, so I'm not complaining. I love that the food is served family style. If I go anywhere that doesn't serve like that, I tell the waiter that's how we are eating, or else I'm gonna have to stick my fork in everyone's plate. Things we ordered: Coffee and cigarettes to drink - LOVEFried cauliflower - LOVEOctopus - LOVE Drum stick ice cream desert - meh Wish I didn't have to complain, but the dessert wasn't worth it.

15.description: Okay, wow.We went to The Betty to celebrate my new job offer because we didn't want to go very far (we live in Hyde Park). Long story short The Betty is my new go-to. I can guarantee I'm going to be a regular here for multiple reasons.We arrived and came first to a curtained entry way and put our name on the wait list. We were told it would be about 30-40 minutes; It was a Saturday night so we expected it to be packed. The host suggested we run over to The Publican for a drink, which we thought was a fabulous idea, loving The Publican as well. Within 15 minutes, I got a text that they could seat us. We headed over and got to go **behind the curtain.**It was awesome. Totally 1920s speakeasy full of hip but unpretentious people and comfy seats and tables that make it great for dinner, drinks, groups, or dates. It's loud enough to feel private but we could still hear each other talk!!! That is such a rarity and seriously a major plus on our list.We didn't end up eating but I got to start the Maximillion. But when I saw my boyfriends's DIY Gin & Tonic, I knew I had to get that next. They bring you a platter with fancy tonic and gin in a beaker and little bottles with rubber droppers so you can add your own add-ins. Seriously, too much fun.This place was seriously my favorite bar EVER. I can't wait to go back.

57.description: I think we hit them on a off night.  I made a res on Open Table, they didn't have it, asked me "are you sure you shouldn't be at the Publican".  No, sorry, I know where I made the res, and where had planned to be, but maybe things would've gone smoother had we been at the Publican.  I told them I could show them the email confirm...'no, it's ok, happens all the time'.  (I've never had an issue w Open Table res's and have been using them since they started).So they seat us, we order lovely cocktails, and peruse the menu, when a guy brings plates, flatware, and glides away from our table, taking the menu with him (ps can you bring a menu for each of us?  Not just one to share? Thx).  So, next objective, get a menu back so we can order.  Scored menu, ordered food, several plates to share.  We ask the waiter for a wine suggestion, he suggests pairing white w our first two dishes, red with the next two.  Great, so we're thinking they're bringing wine by the glass, and instead they set up for bottle.  Rough week, hard to turn down a nice Sancerre, so we go with the flow and keep the bottle.  Annnddd, turned out we needed it because the gap was so long on our food that we had to nurse the rest of the bottle to make it thru the 2nd plate it was supposed to pair with.By now, we're at 2 hours in, 2 small plates, 2 cocktails, and a bottle of white...and we're only 2 people.  So waiter comes back and asks about the red, we say, what can we do by the glass, no need for a full bottle.  He offers to cork it if we don't finish it.  Forget it, back to cocktails.  2 hours later we finish our 2 remaining plates and cocktail.  The lamb flatbread was so spicy, I swear I drank the whole bottle of water on the table by myself.  Great flavor, but so glad we didn't do wine.So, we were there 4 hours in all.  Nice place, food had great flavor (tho small menu), but I hadn't expected the flow of service we experienced.

20.description: I wanted to love this place after loving the warm atmosphere upon walking in, but that's where my loved stopped. I had made advance reservations for our group of 4, but when we were seated we were seated at the cocktail tables. There were open "dinner" tables, so we inquired if we could switch as it would be more comfortable and those tables would allow room for our food. But the server responded that she would bring a second cocktail table to accommodate the food. Uhhh, ok?We ordered cocktails to start and we loved all of choices. For dinner, we ordered the shishitto peppers, cream cheese spread, waldorf salad, fried cauliflower, and cassoulet to share. The peppers and fried cauliflower were great. I would definitely order both again as they were full of flavor and executed perfectly. However, the rest of our dinner choices were total misses. The cream cheese spread was boring and underwhelming. We gave it a chance because the server described it as "her favorite thing on the menu" so we assumed that the description didn't do it justice. No, the description was accurate--it was really cream cheese and jam which everyone has in their fridge. The waldorf salad didn't have any flavor. The server also recommended the cassoulet, so we gave it a shot. But the black eyed peas were not cooked evenly, so some were hard and others were mushy. We had the drumstick and seasonable cobbler for dessert, but neither lived up to the hype. The highlight of dessert was the whipped cream which came on the side for the cobbler.Because we were seated at  a small cocktail table, it could only fit two dishes at a time. When the first two dishes came, not a problem. But when the next one came in short succession, we had no room, forcing us to send back a dish before we were done to make space. Dinner was not enjoyable because we had to be conscious of eating quickly to make room for the next entree.The atmosphere was lovely and our multiple rounds of cocktails were really good. However, there are much better places on Randolph/Fulton that are better options for dinner.

36.description: Had a great time at The Betty last week.....food, drinks, service were exceptional. Very comfortable atmosphere.

14.description: We decided to stop in for a late night drink last week. Some family friends suggested we give it a try.  The atmosphere was great and the staff was helpful.  They were friendly and knowledgable, we especially thought our server Jay was pleasant and very accommodating. We will go back again.

1.description: This is bar none the place you want to go for a great massage! I really love the intimate atmosphere and the convenient inconspicuous location, as it is merely steps from my office. Reasonable rates for a wonderful therapeutic massage and flexible schedule!

2.description: I was suffering from excruciating shoulder and back pain. My sister recommended Monster Massage located in the West Loop. Tanya was very friendly, professional and did an incredible job. I left feeling like a million bucks! The spa is in a private loft space with beautiful art on the walls, tranquil sounds of water and soothing aromas. Tanya has many years of experience  in massage therapy, sports preparation, pain management and cancer & hospice care massage. Free parking in the lot around back. Highly recommended!

0.description: A completely new twist in massage therapy.  I'd like to call myself a massage pioneer because I'm always perfecting just the"right kind of technique" designed for what your body is communicating back to me. Stretching is a must when booking a massage here.  It is performed at the end of the session.

28.description: My husband and I visited Green Home Chicago after hearing about it from our architect. Our architect thought we should look at another green building/design business other than the one we were working with at the time. We were in the midst of beginning a kitchen expansion and redo. We were very taken with the warm atmosphere at GHC, and found many items we liked. My husband and I were already committed to purchasing our kitchen cabinets from another source, but if we had known about Karen and GHC previously, we would have purchased from her. We decided to purchase 2 countertops from GHC, and carpeting for one of our new rooms. Karen and her staff were great to work with, and very responsive to any questions we had, investigating all options. After our construction project was finished, we purchased furniture from Karen for one of our new rooms! I would definitely work with Karen again - in fact, I need to get downtown to see her!Kim and Joe Decker

1.description: I tried to remodel my kitchen on my own.  It didn't work.  I was so tired of bringing home samples and looking at slabs I thought my brain would explode.So I changed the drill.  I went to Green Home Chicago with photos of my cabinets, back-splash, and counter-top. I told Karen I'd given up on trying to find something to go with my old, tiled back-splash, and she calmly and quickly, like a magician, pulled a few pieces together that she thought would work. They did!  She sent the BEST workers to my condo to install the new pieces. They did beautiful work.My new kitchen looks grand!I recommend Green Home Chicago without reservation.

9.description: I rarely do anything impulsive, but only a little more than a week before a big party in our home we decided to have new carpeting installed. Karen was terrific and brought it all together just in time, even with some last minute changes! She worked with our budget and helped us choose a product and padding that wouldn't exacerbate our allergies and her advice regarding the color pallete was spot on. In addition, she was friendly, accomodating and fun to work with. The installer, Randy, and his assistant did a flawless job - they were timely and efficient, the carpeting was laid beautifully, and they left everything the way they found it. The only unforseen issue was that the new carpet had a lower pile than the old which unfortunately necessitated a last minute touch-up to the paint just hours before 70 people arrived. It was a great party, by the way, and our neighbors will be giving Karen a call!

29.description: Green Home Chicago is now my destination for all home renovation projects.  Karen was my saving grace in completing my kitchen renovation.  Cabinets were already purchased but I was not certain of the countertop.  Granite was a great choice considering cost only.  My visit to GHC and Karen's patience found my perfect match in ECO by Cosentino. The process was absolutely without any grief, an exception to all that came before.  It took less than 2 weeks from order to installation.Can't wait to come in and consult GHC and Karen for my bathroom overhaul.

23.description: Love this place. Karen and her designers are wonderful to work with, and the products they carry are top-notch and thoughtfully selected. On top of that the space is just really cool to be in. We have gone to GHC for upholstery fabrics for refurbishing several vintage chairs, and also sourced a number of materials for a kitchen remodel, including amazing recycled glass composite countertops. Simply put, they carry materials and colors that I've never found anywhere else, and Karen has a great eye and creative imagination for putting things together in compelling ways. None of this is cheap, but I feel the pricetag is well worth it for excellent materials and wonderful, personable service.

5.description: What a terrible experience!  Karen provided pricing then DOUBLED it right before I was to sign a contract.  When I asked why, she refused to share an explanation and was extraordinarily rude in the process.  I was more than shocked. I would not recommend her.

25.description: GHC is outstanding. They offered me great design advice, got everything ordered, made sure it arrived safely and went above and beyond what they charged me. Can't say enough good things about Karen and her business.

12.description: Karen at Green Home is fantastic. We didn't end up using her business for our kitchen renovation project because we decided to DIY, but she was a pleasure to communicate with and their prices are very fair for the quality of work. Definitely worth checking them out as an option... you will have gained another resource for the future. Karen was super responsive and had a wealth of great ideas for our project. If we end up doing anything else in our kitchen that requires nice products, installation (or, if our self-installed breakfast bar falls apart...haha), I will be back at Green Home in a second! ps. Their store is beautiful, stop by just to browse if you're in the market for any sort of earth friendly products. Gorgeous!

21.description: I absolutely love this store! I have purchased several pieces of furniture and they are my favorites. I am rehabbing my kitchen soon and I'm definitely going to use GHC's designers and awesome eco products. Super friendly staff, I highly recommend them for any home projects.

16.description: Green Home Chicago was Everything I hoped for and more. As an environmentally conscience Interior Decorator, the show room was a dream come true. It is My one stop shop for everything, rather than hiking all over the city collecting samples and still not finding what I need, they have it all right there. From cork and bamboo flooring to recycled glass countertops, if you need it they'll most likely have it! Their library is extensive and they are more than happy to help you locate any sustainable material you might need for you or your client's project. Most of all it is a very relaxed atmosphere. Karen and Stefani are fun and friendly, and very knowledgable about the products as well as interior design. They are an invaluable resource to have for both materials and design advice. I look forward to doing much more business with them in the future!

17.description: Karen Kalmek and Green Home Chicago are great resources for anyone interested in exploring a home or apartment remodeling or redecorating project....large or small.I found Karen by googling "cork floors" as I was very interested in finding a non-toxic, green alternative to replace my master bedroom carpeting. She was initially very responsive to my phone calls and I found her to be a wealth of information regarding my flooring options, as well as interior paints. She knows her stuff, most certainly. Don't be fooled by the many well-known brands of paint purporting to be "no-VOC." The toxins are in the pigment, so be cautious if you are truly concerned about introducing toxins into your home.Karen's store is delightful, full of all sorts of tempting furnishings. In the course of my project, I visited twice and am now sitting in a great chair I bought off her showroom floor. Do yourself a favor and visit Karen's place. You will find her completely professional, knowledgeable, and very responsive as you navigate the inevitable challenges of a remodeling project. Ultimately, my project was completed on time and exactly as I expected, with the aid of two incredible contractors recommended by Karen.Highly recommend Green Home Chicago!

10.description: After spending weeks trying to find and agree to the right tile for our bathroom reno & kitchen backsplash with no luck, my husband and I decided we needed an expert's help and creative direction. That's when we found ourselves at Green Home Chicago and we were incredibly pleased with the ideas and advice Karen provided. We brought in samples of our wall colors and granite counter tops, and she then helped us sort through various options. Karen is great at helping you think outside of the box and add some color - to which I can easily be wary of - but I really appreciated her approach. She and her team are a pleasure to work with and we are incredibly happy with all of our decisions! Thank you, Karen!

11.description: Excellent service and very fair pricing.  They have a great selection of products and just stopping in will get your creative juices going.  In my case, I stopped by looking for a small bathroom counter top piece.  I actually thought that my request was going to be too small to be worth their time and effort but Karen never batted an eye. She made a bunch of great suggestions and was ultimately able to get me what I needed.   Sometimes when you go into places that are design oriented and you don't have the budget to afford a lot, the sales/service people figure that out quickly and basically ignore you.  That was definitely not the case with Karen!  Stop in and check this place out.  You will be glad you did.

26.description: I used Green Home Chicago to help me source a few items for a recent home remodel. Their selection is great, their enthusiasm for their business is amazing, they were on top of communication, and both Amanda and Karen couldn't be nicer or easier to work with. Next time I need something they will be the first place to stop.

27.description: Karen is just delightful to chat and work with.  She always keeps a fantastic (but small) selection of home decor products and she is constantly bringing in new, trendy items to consider.  Great deals on designer items...and they are Green!

0.description: Karen recently helped my wife and I with the purchase of a new dining room set. Based on our prior experiences in working with Karen, we knew she would have some options. What we didn't realize is how easy it would be. After talking with Karen for a bit, she came up with a combination of pieces that we couldn't resist.  We continue to get compliments from friends and family on how the pieces work together. I would highly recommend Karen and her team for any interior design efforts.

20.description: Green Home Chicago was Everything I hoped for and more. As an environmentally conscience Interior Decorator, the show room was a dream come true. It is My one stop shop for everything, rather than hiking all over the city collecting samples and still not finding what I need, they have it all right there. From cork and bamboo flooring to recycled glass countertops, if you need it they'll most likely have it! Their library is extensive and they are more than happy to help you locate any sustainable material you might need for you or your client's project. Most of all it is a very relaxed atmosphere. Karen and Stefani are fun and friendly, and very knowledgable about the products as well as interior design. They are an invaluable resource to have for both materials and design advice. I look forward to doing much more business with them in the future!

19.description: I highly recommend Green Home Chicago as a terrific resource for their service in kitchen and bath design and sustainable finishes.  They offer high style in a sustainable package.  Great furnishings and finishes, excellent service.  Thanks Karen and team for helping me achieve my clients design goals.  - Asparagus Interiors Inc./ Elizabeth Marusin ASID - Interior Designer

2.description: My husband and I are so in love with our kitchen designed by Stefani at GHC! We had talked with other designers who constantly pushed us in the direction of a beige kitchen, even when we explicitly stated many times that we love bright colors. When we sat down with Stefani, she was a breath of fresh air; we finally felt like someone was listening to us. On top of the great design work, GHC has amazing eco-friendly products and connections with the best contractors around. It was a true pleasure working with GHC!

18.description: Proprietor, Karen Kalmek is as good as any store owner can get.  Karen spent at least 1-1/2 hours helping us choose the perfect counter top to compliment the tile back splash & Blanco sink samples we showed to her.  With so many styles/colors to choose from, Karen presented the perfect Cambria sample perfectly describing the back splash tile & counter top match as "sophisticated".  Done deal.With a couple of mishaps by Cambria (not Green Home Chicago), Karen worked tirelessly on our behalf to make things right.  Also, Karen displayed numerous beautiful porcelain tile for our radiant-heated floors and helped us choose the perfect product for the back porch area.Karen Kalmek is a knowledgeable and extremely resourceful person.  She  also saved us several hundred dollars by ordering our beautiful Blanco faucet. Throughout our initial visit to Green Home Chicago I found so many beautiful items.  We will definitely be back to the store - perhaps Karen can help us find a 25 ft runner!Thank you for your time and expertise, Karen.  The wine and beer are chilled, and we look forward to your visit so you could see first-hand how beautiful the Green Home Chicago products look in our new kitchen.  We are pleased beyond expectation!

13.description: When we found out we were pregnant in January we knew we had to complete the renovation of our kitchen and two bathrooms before the baby was born. It was also more important than ever that we use sustainable products. Green Home Chicago was the perfect solution for us. Aislinn and Stefani, the designers, came to our home to see the space first hand and take measurements. They were friendly, listened to what we wanted, and came up with creative designs for our space. We were able to stay in regular contact to bounce around ideas and tweak the designs. The showroom is amazing and it was fun to be able to see the products in person and play with different colors, textures and combinations to see what works best. Karen, the owner, was extremely helpful and took the time to really listen to what we wanted. She was able to recommend a contractor who was a perfect fit and could complete the project within our tight timeframe. I would recommend Green Home Chicago to all of my friends and family.

4.description: Sadly my old leather couch had been peeling for some time and it wasn't possible to fix it.  After a lengthy online search I found it was really hard to find an eco-conscious couch, particularly in the Chicagoland area.  Finally I found Green Home Chicago and it's in my neighborhood!Karen and her associate were friendly and welcoming.  She gave us information about the 2 companies she works with and helped narrowed down the style and materials we liked, making sure we knew all options since they're made-to-order.  We browsed through a couple of catalogs and many fabric and wood samples.  Karen was helpful without being at all pushy, and she really went out of her way to make us comfortable.  I also appreciated that she informed us about an upcoming promotion that the manufacturer was running a week later.  We returned to the store at the start of the sale to take a second look and place our order.Our couch was ready a little earlier than promised and Karen was great at communicating with us on the day of delivery (by the way the couch was delivered at the beginning of the 2 hr widow so no waiting around all day!).  She really went out of her way to make sure the couch met our expectations and the delivery went smoothly.  We've had the couch for a few weeks and we're really happy with the appearance and comfort.Overall my husband and I enjoyed working with Karen and we love our couch.  It's great to have a company so close that shares our concern about the environment and fair labor.  We'll definitely use Green Home Chicago again in the future!

24.description: I highly recommend Green Home Chicago as a terrific resource for their service in kitchen and bath design and sustainable finishes.  They offer high style in a sustainable package.  Great furnishings and finishes, excellent service.  Thanks Karen and team for helping me achieve my clients design goals.  - Asparagus Interiors Inc./ Elizabeth Marusin ASID - Interior Designer

6.description: Karen was very knowledgeable. She spent a long time talking with us when we first came in and told her about our project. We were clueless, so it was much appreciated. We ordered Gilasi countertops for our kitchen and get complements on them. We also got a great tip on ordering remnents which saved us money. I wasn't satisfied with the install of the counters and Karen made sure that everything got fixed.

22.description: We first went to see Karen at Green Home Chicago to see what our options were regarding "green" materials for a bathroom remodel.  Karen was so nice to work with and spent time with us and also managed our 2 year old while we looked at materials and discussed options.  The materials we selected were absolutely fabulous and Karen was so helpful through the entire process.  Thanks Karen!Yes I would refer GHC to all of my friends and family!

15.description: I can't recommend Green Home Chicago enough for countertops. They have tons of awesome types of countertops you won't find anywhere else. Most importantly Karen spent a lot of time helping me find the exact countertops for my kitchen space. Couldn't have done it without her help!! Also Walter installed them wonderfully. My kitchen looks 100% better!!

7.description: Karen and team are outstanding. What started with, "we think we might want a single-slab, raw edge table," turned into a trusted partnership as we worked to design the main space of our new home.I appreciate Karen's ability to understand client needs while also inputting her expertise. She partners with quality artisans to custom-build pieces, focusing on local product and local talent. What started as the table turned into a custom-built, locally sourced table, custom chairs, and a gut-renovation and custom stone work/shelving for our fireplace. Our room went from standard to gorgeous in a matter of weeks. It was awesome to see the vision come together -- and I loved having Karen by my side throughout the whole process.   Overall the team provides excellent service at a reasonable rate and only partners with the best to get the job done. I highly recommend.

8.description: My husband and I loved our experience at Green Home Chicago. Karen collaborates with a talented group of artists and contractors who create and install unique functional pieces. We found an amazing custom made counter top there for our new kitchen. Since we were hosting Thanksgiving, we gave Karen an impossible challenge to finish within a very tight timeframe. She kept her word. Everything was completed beautifully and on time.  We're so happy we found Green Home Chicago.

30.description: I have wanted to make a trip to GHC for a while and I did this weekend.  I wanted to buy their eco friendly paint.  I am tackling a big house project so I mentioned a few things on the 'things to purchase' list to Karen, the owner.  She was great at suggesting items and trying to take into account my budget.  She had amazing ideas and pointed out items I didn't even know about.  The show room is great, not huge, but that's to be expected, it's a niche industry, right now.  I haven't painted yet, so hopefully more later.  I was impressed with the wide selection of colors this paint line has, everyone should be able to find a shade they like.  I can't wait to come back!

3.description: I want to say that this company did fantastic job on  renovating our bathrooms . My husband and I are both ecstatic with the workmanship and detail put in and have received lots of positive comments. We love love our contemporary Miami stile bathroom and basement bathroom and floor. Norma and Karen did amazing job.  We will definately recommend this company to family and friends.M & N.

14.description: Superb Service, Sustainable Choices and Competitive Prices!  I am thrilled with the Counter-top and recycled glass back-splash tiles I purchased from Green Home Chicago.  It was a pleasure to conduct research in the beautiful Fulton Market area store that features an extensive selection of sustainable finishes and genuinely friendly people.  I fell in love with the Gilasi product, made in Chicago's Ravenswood neighborhood of  resin and broken oven door glass from Chicago's south side.  How great is that story?!   Walter's expert and timely installation kept our kitchen project right on schedule. Karen was also helpful in finding the specific glass tiles I had seen elsewhere and recommending (but never pushing) complimentary products like flooring and cabinets.  I highly recommend Green Home Chicago for home and office projects.

58.description: Avoid the hot toddy.They forgot the tea, so it was hot lemon water and Bushmills. Good work.This place is as Irish as green Bud Light.

56.description: This is our new favorite spot to get drinks and pub food since moving to the west loop!The spinach artichoke dip is the best I've ever had in my life.  The chips that come with it are fried FRESH in-house.  Unbelievably good.  Also, the fish and chips were very fantastic, and I'm first generation Scottish :) (my opinion on this subject is very important).Other random things I enjoyed:-The bartender remembered us when we came back, which is always nice.  - The $6 Jack Daniels cocktail special.  -The decor in this place is very unique -The place itself is very large so seating isn't an issue-live music from time to time!it's a lovely place :)

29.description: We live in the neighborhood and have eaten here a few times. Food has always been okay - not great, not bad. Service historically not the swiftest, but again tolerable. We went last night because they were advertising Corned Beef and Cabbage on their  Facebook page.  We arrived around 6pm and were the ONLY diners. A few people at the bar. This is not that unusual.  Did not see the special, so asked the waitress, who was the only one working it appeared as she was also tending bar.  She had no clue. After two trips to the kitchen she said the "chef" was new and was not aware, but if we wanted it, it would be at least 20 minutes. Given we were in a bit of a hurry (told that to the waitress), we passed, albeit disappointed. Not sure how an Irish Bar/Pub that advertising Corned Beef and Cabbage a week before St. Patrick's day has no clue. We ordered fish and chips and a chicken salad. This was approximately 6:10pm. At 6:35 and still no food (please remember we were still the only diners in the building) we had to yell across the restaurant asking for an update on our order.  She never came over to the table. At 6:50 the waitress finally came over to our table (only because two diners sat down in the booth next to us) to tell us she was sorry and had no control over the kitchen. She gave us no update when our food would arrive. At that point, utterly disgusted, we left - NEVER TO RETURN AGAIN. How long does it take to drop a couple of pieces of fish in a fryer and make a salad? Wow!

42.description: Went to Paddy's on Superbowl Sunday for the first time.  Very friendly and personable bar staff who offered us in on their squares for the game! Too bad we didn't win :( Loved  the bar,  traditional Irish decor and lots of natural light. Didn't get a chance to eat as we just came from brunch,  but all the food coming out looked great! We were lucky enough to meet th  owners and ended up getting a sweet Paddy's t- shirt! Will definitely be back soon,  maybe for a Hawks game?

23.description: We were in town for my bachelor party and found this place by chance. We had an awesome time here and went twice. The new door guy is hilarious and the servers and bartenders are great. The beers were cheap $2 for a 16oz and mixed drinks were $5 and not light on booze. Just don't give the blonde bartender a hard time about being a Michigan grad lol! Its a low key casual place so leave your skinny jeans or suit at home!

47.description: Paddy's is a great place to grab some great bar food and hang out for a game. Try the Tall Grass burger.. actually a great menu all around. Corned beef and any of the wraps are a good choice too. Sounds crazy but there is something addictive about those fried green beans!Nice beer selection on tap but don't forget to check out the bottles too. Gracious owners Cathy and Patrick are big supporters of police, fire, nurses and our military!!Don't forget to order the hash on the weekend brunch menu and wash it down with a bloody Mary!

8.description: Don't you love when you randomly find a place, and it turns out to be awesome?! My friends and I had been to brunch at Au Cheval, and decided to bar-hop a bit in the area before heading back to our neighborhood. Total bars in our bar-hop? One. Why? Because once we hit this place, we knew anywhere else would just be a disappointment. The bartender (Tess) was fabulous...the owners (Cathy & Patrick) were incredibly welcoming....they have TouchTunes (always worth a star, in my book), and everyone was playing music in the same kind of old-school/chill vibe...and I was introduced to the best Canadian Whisky ever invented (Revel Stoke Roasted Pecan Flavored Whisky). Can't wait to hit this place for a Hawks game!! Cheers!!

31.description: This is just a bar. Nothing too crazy or cool about it. The bar itself is very large & has a ton of room for seating. The place is always kept clean & there are a ton of things to looks at on the walls. We go to watch games here & always sit at the bar. Coleen & Kelly are our usual bartender & are super nice & welcoming.. The barback is nice & takes care of us by providing extra napkins & always keeping the bar clean. The door guys always are friendly & chit-chat with us.Sy is one of the cooks & always makes our burgers & chicken wings with love. After each meal he comes out of the kitchen to ask how we liked the food. I think this is a nice touch & is great customer service. I also think its cool that the Ranch is green. Something that freaked me out at first but now I love. Whenever we are here the place is pretty dead. Maybe 3-4 tables tops. Which is great for us because we can have a nice little date without all the chaos the city has to offer. The prices are also great especially for the area where a couple doors down its a $100 a plate. They also have a rewards card where you spend a certain amount & get $20 for free. VERY COOL.We will continue to be customers here & appreciate the establishment.

34.description: Have been here twice. The second time, went there for lunch and the cook didn't show up to work...so they couldn't serve any food. Waited an hour and there was nothing.This was when they first opened up, though.

16.description: The staff is very accommodating and friendly but the food is terrible. I don't send a dish back more than once every couple of years but did last night. (almost twice). I actually suggested to my friend that we go to Paddy's because the last time I was there... 8 months ago or so, the food was excellent. What happened?!

13.description: A rare gem I discovered by accident.I was very pleased with the hospitality of Pat and Kathy who own and run the establishment.This is the kind of place  where you can go and  feel welcomed and at home. The food is way above what you would expect from a bar and the drinks are very generous.I will recommend this to my friends without hesitation.

11.description: We stopped by a while back after a trip downtown. I was too tired to deal with the menu so I let the waitress give me a couple specials that were completely delicious. My friend ordered what was on tap and I drank wine. The place is really nice and we will be back!

39.description: Great liquor selection. SUPER FRIENDLY STAFF. What more can u ask for from a bar? (other than free drinks). Great place to dress casual and bring friends. Super clean on the inside too

37.description: The regular French fries were great. The chicken tenders were not of even average quality. The service was decent until the end when I gave the waitress $20.00 for my $11.00 bill and she decided to pocket the difference. I politely asked for my money back and she scoffed at the request. I gave this a one because service is what defines a local joint like O' Fegan's.

0.description: Have lived two blocks away for over a year but never went in until last Monday.  The bar was slow (Monday night with below zero temperatures), but the hospitality was fantastic.  Patrick, the owner, is the nicest guy you will ever meet and treated us extremely well.  The bartender (she told me her name but I forget - she said she normally works Mon-Wed) was fantastic.We were having so much fun that a quick beer turned into 3 rounds.My friend and I left a $40 tip on a $40 tab, that's how good a time we had.It isn't gourmet food, but the drinks are strong, the beer list is decent and the service is amazing.  I won't wait another year before going back.

38.description: I booked their fireplace room for a surprise party here and they were super accommodating. Room rental was free, no minimums or requirements like most places, and they were cool with a cash bar for 70 people. They also provided us with dedicated servers and the service was outstanding. They really went above and beyond to make sure everyone was taken care of. Great all around sports bar with a jukebox.

51.description: I would say no stars ... Girl with the nose ring or hoop, what ever you wanna call it ... Lied and said my food was on the counter and should be at the table after waiting like an hour . Not to mention my friend walks in 30 min after I order and he got his burger . 2 hours later she said I thought it was ready . I said bye bye let me pay for the check and left . First and last time I will ever go to this dump . Ruined the hawks game for me .You couldn't pay me to come back here. I never review places but I thought people should think twice before walking into the door of this establishment.warm regards

27.description: Regarding the food specifically...You can ignore most all of the bad food reviews. Now that Nick and Dave have taken over, the difference is notable.  These guys have a true passion for the food they create and wanting to ensure folks actually enjoy it.  Nick's St. Patrick's Day Irish potato soup was incredible.

32.description: decent irish pub, but it lacks something.  maybe just when i have visited, but the atmosphere is always a little dry.  everything about the decor is exactly as you'd expect, green walls with various beer/soccer/liquor signs.  stamped tile ceiling and wood floor.  plenty of smaller & larger tables to accommodate most any party size.  lots of windows to let is daylight, but given location it doesn't get as much sunlight in the afternoon when you really want it.  plenty of hdtvs make this a decent place to catch the game, especially a hawks game.  dark wooden bar top with an angled rail.  brass foot rest and wooden stools with back support.  bar back is very nice with detailed wood trim, shelves, tvs, & mirrors.  service is alright, as is the food.

54.description: Great bar for some BlackHawks.  The bartenders and staff are all super friendly.  Drink special decent. Food pretty good.  Went there for a couple of games, not packed at all, and they have good amount of TVs.  They have chips from ireland... try some.

48.description: Really good food and beer selection.  Had the chili last time was freakin good.  Unfortunately, its not a regular dish here.  The corned beef sandwich is good also.

44.description: Been here a handful of times, and I cannot get enough of the corned beef sandwiches they have. They are to die for! As close to home cooking as it gets. The river shannon soup is by far one of the best soups I have ever had! Who ever came up with the idea of putting corned beef in soup deserves an award. Ever time I have ordered something here, the food was incredible. A HUGE PLUS: Paddy's is easy to get to by train and CTA, and parking is pretty reasonably priced and right across the street. Saw the stanley cup here, and had a blast watching a few games here with friends. Great for food and drinks with family and friends. Outstanding service and even better food. Definitely add it to your list of places to try, you won't regret it :)

24.description: This place is great. I just moved to the city and it didn't take long for the bartenders to remember my name and drink.  But I come for the wings, specifically the ones cooked by Nick in the kitchen.  The guy takes pride in what he sends out and it shows.  I even caught him on a day off one night and he ran back into the kitchen to make sure my order came out the way I liked. Can't beat that.

7.description: This is a good neighborhood bar. If I am in the neighborhood and am looking for a good place to go, then I will return. Otherwise, I don't think I am making a trip back out like I did for burger week (and I don't live too far away).If you are coming out for burger week, bear this in mind. The burger you think you are getting a deal for at $5, costs $5 every day of the year.And it is a good burger, but there is no special for the yelp event (at least that is what our server/bartndress told us). But like I said, it is a good burger. You just get a burger for $5 too. They also have the $10 variety burger if that is your thing and want to spend more money. The $5 doesn't come with any sides, and the sides are pretty big, very shareable.Otherwise the decor is: Support our troops, support the hawks, support the fire.Good Irish bar.

49.description: Nothing exceptional except one of the bartender's makes one of the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had ... but I can't resist a pint of PERFECTLY poured Guinness eitherThe Tots appetizer had Cheese Wiz but the 3 Little Piggies pulled pork sandwiches were very generous with pork and had very good flavorThe vibe is sports, of course, but Irish-Canadian, not Irish-American, though plenty of the American Catholic universities are representedHey, if nothing else you can stop in for one of those 'perfect pints' while you get your kitchen knives sharpened around the corner at Northwestern Cutlery (810 W Lake)I'll go back for the friendly smiles and a great Bloody

40.description: Long overdue review. Came here during a Saturday night during football season with a our friends. We sort of walked into a free event set up by Topman where they were giving out free beanies and coupons. Surprisingly though, it wasn't crowded at all. So lucky for us, we scored a lot of free beanies for the long winter. I like the atmosphere. It's got a local crowd following especially for the Hawks games. Servers are nice. Had a good time because we got plastered off of car bombs and shots of rumple mints. Ended up losing all that later that night and I don't drink rumple mints anymore. Anyhoo, thanks Paddy O"Fegan's for making it a great night of drunkeness. It really is too bad I blacked out, because I'm sure I was having a blast.

53.description: Love this bar! The staff are so nice and friendly. Great drink selection and specials. Awesome Irish food--corned beef sandwich and fish & chips were delicious. Great bar to watch the games, as well.

30.description: I love the great Irish pub feel if this place. I went for lunch and had the buffalo chicken wrap with waffle fries. First let me say that waffle fries should be the only kind of fries. They are so good here crispy fresh and big. The Chicken was great not greasy At all. It as filled with celery carrots ble cheese and a little bit of lettuce. If you are in the area I defiantly recommend this place.

46.description: I have had a few events here at Paddy O'Fegans and this place always has good food, great TVs, and a good time! Great place to watch the Hawks game!I just held a Guest Bartender event here to raise funds for a charity.  Working with the owners, Patrick and Cathy, was so great and the other staff I worked with was so helpful and great to work with.  Food is always great - I Love the Hot Pretzel!! Drinks are good -I mean i did make some of them - staff was friendly.*Also the windows open up for some fresh air! So nice in Chicago's spring, summer and fall!This place is a must do for after work drinks or to catch a game!

1.description: We went here for a casual lunch.  I didn't really have great expectations from this place but the sandwiches were pretty good.  I had the blackend chicken sandwich.  It was just weird that since this place was Irish, they had all sorts of different foods that were non-Irish but who am I to complain.

55.description: Nice no frills bar. The service was great and they had a decent selection of local beer for good prices.

9.description: Fun Irish Pub/Sports bar!! The Smithwicks is ice cold!!! Needs more tv's on the walls.

26.description: My wife and I had just worked up a pretty nice buzz over at The Aviary and were pretty hungry.  We were walking around looking for a place that wasn't too crowded.  This place was about a quarter full and had food.  Looked like as good a place as any.  They have a super nice door man.  Almost too nice.  If he had to kick someone out for being a jackass he'd probably be apologizing as he's roughing them up.  Waitress was cool.  She handed us the "late night" menus.  I was starving.  I went right for the corned beef and Irish Stew and ordered a pint of Green Line too.  Much to my displeasure the waitress came back and said that they don't do soups this late and apologized.  Then why is it on the "late night" menu?  It was only like 10:30.  Food took a bit to come out, and it was okay.  It probably tasted way better to me than it actually was, because I was feeling pretty good.  I did like that this was more of your blue collar place, with what seemed to have a bunch of regulars in it.  Most places down in this area are full of pretentious yuppies.  Not a bad place to pop in for a beer, but I wouldn't make the trek down that way just to go there.

25.description: Great Irish pub with classic Chicago vibe. All the hockey and sporting events on HD flat screens and great music.  The restrooms and bar are the cleanest I've experienced in Chicago! The food is phenomenal, and the selection of drafts paired with the classic and exclusive Irish whiskeys make this a must!  I suggest  their daily drink special and meet Paddy himself for a shot.Love this place!

12.description: Awesome beer selection..sweet staff... great space. The decor is well done, tin ceiling and wooden bar makes it very welcoming. In an area with many popular places, sort of a hidden gem. Check it out. Many tv's for all sports fan.

59.description: OK sports bar. Feels like a warehouse that was converted into a bar;  ceilings are high and there's only 4 walls.  I like the waffle fries that come with the sandwiches.

21.description: Came here with the sole mission of watching an NBA playoffs game and spending as little money as possible before dinner. Mission succeeded with a $5/pint special for Killian's Irish Red. The staff was really friendly and changed the channel on one of the TVs to the game just for us (although we had to keep it on mute), and weren't too pushy about us ordering drinks even though the bar was pretty empty. Plenty of seating inside for big groups! Also, there are electrical outlets on the walls in case you need some emergency charge in your electronic devices.

17.description: Great Irish pub with classic Chicago vibe. All the hockey and sporting events on HD flat screens and great music.  The restrooms and bar are the cleanest I've experienced in Chicago! The food is phenomenal, and the selection of drafts paired with the classic and exclusive Irish whiskeys make this a must!  I suggest  their daily drink special and meet Paddy himself for a shot.Love this place!

10.description: Paddy O'Fegan's is as good as it gets. Great atmosphere, friendly servers and the owners Patrick and Cathy are the nicest people you'll ever meet. Beyond hospitable. They're always helpful and make you feel like a regular even if it's your first time there. I could eat their reuben sandwich every day of my life, too. In fact, I love it so much that we order it on GrubHub regularly. Come for a Hawks game and you will not be disappointed.

5.description: If you are looking for the unpretentious, friendly, come as you are bar, this is it.  Great Poutine, great atmosphere and awesome people. The most welcoming, good time place in the city. LOVED it and will be back!

3.description: This place is so judgmental. We spent a lot of money on drinks at a table and when we were leaving asked to get shots and we're told our "menus smelled like vomit" and yet no one vomited or came anywhere near to vomiting in this place. Felt very ostracized by the staff for playing what we chose to pay for on the jukebox and witnessed them being very rude and mocking us for the music we chose. I have been to this place before and had no problem but the change of staff tonight was embarrassing and I will never go back.

35.description: We were the only people in the entire restaurant. So I'm just confused to why the service was so bad, why the food took so long, and why our orders were brought out at random times (our appetizers were brought out last?).Our waitress consistently forgot our requested items (water would've been nice after we asked for it twice.) Then she awkwardly hovered around us while we were trying to figure out the check. Just an all-around bad experience.Food was decent.

19.description: I want to like this place, as it's local and the staff seems friendly. However, the last several times we've gone, they have been out of multiple beers and food  we've ordered...consistently the same food items from time to time. If you're no longer stocking those items, please remove them from the menu and run them as specials if you do have them. Even better, and a simple fix: tell the wait staff to inform customers of what is not available when they drop off the menus, so customers don't review the menu, only to order something that is not available...repeatedly. It's annoying and frustrating when the first 3 items I order, whether beer or food, are not available.

28.description: Literally the WORST service I have ever had. I was with roughly 10 people and It took 2.5 hours to get 10 or so appetizers. They brought one out every 20 minutes and kept saying "the rest is coming out now". We asked the OWNER for something and she responded with "sorry I'm not the server". Are you kidding me?Where's Bar Rescue when you need them?

45.description: It's a okay place. If you're looking for a quiet place to have lunch, this is it because they're dead around that time. The bartenders are nice and after work during games they're usually busy. But the main reason I'd write a review is to tell people who order chicken dishes to be cautious - they consistently overcook and burn chicken. I hate any burn marks on my chicken and it seems they leave the food on the grill too long. I've mentioned it to a bartender in the past that they overcook the chicken and then went there again and ordered a cobb salad. I didn't see that it also came with chicken and when I got the dish, saw that it was burned again. So if you're going there, and you care about chicken, this one's for you. Everyone else, cheers.

33.description: Went in for dinner and drinks after work, and somehow our server Beth was incapable ofAnswering simple questions. Me-"How large  the mimosas" Beth- "average size" me-"how much is this beer" Beth- " I have no idea" me- "can I have something comparable to the green line, since you are out?" Beth-"No"  Me- "can you split the check please?" Beth- "how am I supposed to do that?" Sadly this is not a joke and very disheartening. This is the first and final time I will ever step into this establishment, yikes.

43.description: I love Paddy's! The food is great, and I highly recommend the burgers! The staff is really nice and always make me feel like home. I've gone a few times during the week to watch a Blackhawks game and had a blast,... Literally. They have the goal horn when the hawks score, which is often! :)I like weekends there as well, and generally like to sit and chat with the bartenders who make really good drinks. The male bartender is my favorite; he always remembers how I like my drinks and knows my name! I would def recommend this place for dinner, drinks, and awesome specials. Best Irish pub around and I love that I can watch any game I want from curling to hockey, or football. I'll definitely be back again, as I'm becoming a regular. Fun crowds and good music! Go hawks!

2.description: The food is off the chain they offer daily specials today chicken ceaser wrap with chips and beef noodle soup for $10.00 not bad service was great .....

18.description: Literally the WORST service I have ever had. I was with roughly 10 people and It took 2.5 hours to get 10 or so appetizers. They brought one out every 20 minutes and kept saying "the rest is coming out now". We asked the OWNER for something and she responded with "sorry I'm not the server". Are you kidding me?Where's Bar Rescue when you need them?

41.description: This is my first time leaving a one-star rating. I have to. I could not believe the service at this place. This wasn't a week night where servers could be a little off sometimes. But this was Saturday evening... where you should be bringing out your "A-Team" servers.It was my friend's bachelorette celebration that evening and we were in a good mood after seeing a show. We came in, sat down... waited and waited some more.The server came by, my friend asked the server about an item in the menu, then my friend  paused for a bit to make a decision. In her annoyed tone, the server proceeded to tell us, "I thought you guys were ready since you've been staring at me for a while"(Oh! so you noticed we were staring!)Another friend quickly quipped, "Well, I'm ready.... I would like the pretzel..."The server leaves (without saying a word), leaving us all confused... what F just happened there?She comes back with different menus "I see that you guys don't have the evening menus"... we don't have the pretzels.(1. You could have excused yourself before you left; 2. you could have told us we didn't have the right menus, yeeesh!)My friend that wanted the pretzel, sees the pretzel on this *new* menu and says "it's on here".  The waitress says "oh I guess we have it"She then goes on, "I'm only here once a week because I'm taking my Master's, so I'm not really sure what's on the menu sometimes"(most of the group have a Master's degree, and didn't see this as an excuse for her incompetency) I ordered a Riesling and she just shook her head at me like I was stupid for ordering wine."it's an Irish bar, we only have beer and whiskey"Stunned that I was just given an attitude, totally forgetting that I have been staring at the menu for 15 minutes while waiting for her to approach our table. I thought to myself, I could not have chosen that out of nowhere!I said "but I saw it on your menu!!!" "Well, I'll have to go check if we have it"She comes back with one glass of water (in a cracked glass at that), while everyone else also ordered water.She says to me, "I guess we do have it"We tell her that the glass is cracked, she comes back with itty bitty plastic cups of water (for all of us this time), while one had a hole on it, spilling water out all over the table.We asked for another cup, she gives us an attitude and says, but I thought I gave all of you guys cups.My entire group was fuming at this point because of her attitude. We did not feel the need to explain this to her since she has already ruined our evening. There are no more politeness left in us.We just could not believe this woman.Paddy O'Fegan's, you guys need to restructure your wait staff.

52.description: Wah Wah. Dislike. Here goes nothing....1. Service. The waitress had absolutely NO knowledge of the products on the menus. She would take it out of our hand to write the name down on her order booklet after we said it. She also said that the drink of the day 'Kettle One Cocktails $4' was going to be more expensive/additional expense to mix the vodka with soda water. WHAT?! I call BS. We had to be her ONLY table of the night. She asked us, in a 5 hour period, if we were okay or if we needed anything, 60 times. For those of you who don't like to do math, that is EVERY FIVE MINUTES!!!! Lay off, chica, let us take a sip/bite. Now it comes to the bill portion of the evening...I ask for the check, she leaves, comes back without the check in hand, and asks if she should just run the card we held the table on. We say no. Can you bring us the check? Then she comes back with it, returns 5 mins later, takes the check booklet, doesn't ask us what we want done (split it, all on one etc), runs by without stopping, then returns 2 mins later asking what we wanted to do. Duh. Why don't you slow down and we would have told you what we wanted to do if you actually STOPPED when you picked up the check with our CCs. She runs the cards, comes back and DOESNT BRING US ANY PENS. Brilliant, I tell you, brilliant. The bussers or owner, or manager or whoever this dude in a polo was, was SUPER aggressive about cleaning off our table. Like the second we took the last beer out of the bucket he ran over and reached in to steal it. We had 1/2 of a plate of food left and he tried to clear it 7 times throughout the evening. Lay off dude, this game is going into OT. Let's move on to the food... (do we have to?) 2. Ew. The menu is odd to begin with. Who offers chicken fingers with Emerald Isle or Blue Cheese Dressing ONLY as the dipping options??? Did I miss something? Did the world run out of ranch, honey mustard and BBQ sauce? Sad day. The Pot o' Gold was anything but the name and description! MAJOR disappointment. I have nothing else to say other than do NOT buy this. I already took one for the team - listen to me when I say do NOT buy this. Cheese! My favorite food. OMG, ew. The cheese served with my giant pretzel (and I mean giant) was just Velveeta melted, and served cold in a little cup. So gross and disgusting. The guys got wraps and sandwiches that were just 'ok' when I asked. There were quite a few fries left on their plates when they were removed. All in all, a bad experience and we will not be returning. Unfortunate since this Claddagh ring on my finger draws me into Irish bars like a magnet. Crossing this one of the list of options for sure. May the luck o' the Irish be with you!

50.description: I stopped in for a couple beers the other day with a friend since we were in the area.  Sunday evening around 5:30pm & the place was almost empty aside from 1 or 2 people at the bar.  We were greeted by a waitress by the bar & chose a booth near the window.  The same server who greeted us came by & asked if she could get us some drinks, I asked what kind of specials they had.  She asked if I wanted the food or drink specials.  I told her I was interested in the drink specials since I didn't plan on eating, so she picks up the menu from the table & starts reading me the food specials anyway, awesome.  We both order a drink while my friend was still looking at the menu.  Drinks took about 10 mins to come out, 1 bud light & a vodka lemonade, tough to make, I know, especially when there's no customers.  My friend ordered their poutine fries & she enjoyed them, but they took a while to come out & looked like it took about 5 minutes to throw together.  We paid cash & didn't need change, but when the server came to take the check, she asked if we were all set, to me, that means "do you need change?"  I said it's all yours, then she came back & put the folder for the check along with our change back on the table.  Kinda odd, but funny looking back on it.  Not really a place I'd go for more than a couple of drinks

4.description: It's a nice little neighborhood bar on the edge of downtown.  I would not describe it as friendly, but the Bulls were knocked out of the play-offs about five minutes after we walked in - so that might explain the sour disposition.One fantastic surprise: a $5 Moscow Mule prepared with Alcoholic ginger beer and served in a pint glass - very big and really good.

6.description: Regarding the food specifically...You can ignore most all of the bad food reviews. Now that Nick and Dave have taken over, the difference is notable.  These guys have a true passion for the food they create and wanting to ensure folks actually enjoy it.  Nick's St. Patrick's Day Irish potato soup was incredible.

22.description: I have to share the experience my colleagues I enjoyed after a day on the convention floor while in Chicago for a trade-show.  As out of towners, we wanted an authentic Irish vibe where we could watch a game.  After Yelping it, we chose Paddy o'Fegans.  What a  great choice!It was a Monday night, so there were smattering of patrons, but that really allowed me to take in the decor- beautiful tilework, an antique looking bar, and  fireplace that made me long for a book.  We ordered Irish nachos, not on the Menu, but these guys did everything to accomodate.  Huge portions, nice mix of traditional irish pub food and some surprising choices- please try the Canadian favorite Poutine,  and their sweet potato fries are just perfect.  Drinks are  generous and very fairly priced.  I am so mad that I didn't take pictures-ugh!Patrick and Cathy with a "C" are my new favorite friends.  They not only hosted a weary group of travelers, but treated us like family.  I am on the plane leaving Chi-town, but now I have somewhere to return.  Sláinte!

15.description: Came here with the sole mission of watching an NBA playoffs game and spending as little money as possible before dinner. Mission succeeded with a $5/pint special for Killian's Irish Red. The staff was really friendly and changed the channel on one of the TVs to the game just for us (although we had to keep it on mute), and weren't too pushy about us ordering drinks even though the bar was pretty empty. Plenty of seating inside for big groups! Also, there are electrical outlets on the walls in case you need some emergency charge in your electronic devices.

57.description: I completely agree with those reviewers that say it's hard to make a decision about the place.  It's an Irish pub yes, but it's more cookie cutter than true to feel "Irish pub", if that makes any sense.  I wish there was something more to it that described it, to each and every patron.  Something that gave it a homely feel, rather than just another stop on the way"  Maybe an entrance greeting or a warm Irish welcome from a bartender or waitress/waiter.  Something that makes you forget about the street and world outside their doors.So this past 2013 St Patty's we happened to stop in.  No St Patty's specials to speak of, other than green beers for something around $3 dollars each.  I wish they would have mentioned a special on Guinness, Irish car bombs or on Irish food favorites, because we would have indeed enjoyed some of those.  It was a business-less, Sunday evening with the bartender playing golden oldies on the (Internet) jukebox which no one wanted to hear.  Speaking of which, they need more recent tracks to be available, I paid a dollar per song and that is shite!

20.description: It's a nice little neighborhood bar on the edge of downtown.  I would not describe it as friendly, but the Bulls were knocked out of the play-offs about five minutes after we walked in - so that might explain the sour disposition.One fantastic surprise: a $5 Moscow Mule prepared with Alcoholic ginger beer and served in a pint glass - very big and really good.

36.description: So this bar/ restaurant is a great place for food, drinks and good times.  But once again I was suprised by how great it is to see world class soccer on many of the several large screen TV ' s throughout the location.It's go time usa!!!!!!
