14.description: Being from the neighborhood we like to support our local vendors but tonight was a real disappointment. My fiancé and I came here to play a game of golden tee, a staff member came up didn't say a word and just unplugged the whole game. He claimed he was trying to turn off the "open" sign but as we walked out the sign was still on.

58.description: This place is AMAZING! The whole market fish is out of this world. Great flavors and they really know how to cook things to the correct done-ness (so important for chicken hearts and sweetbreads). What a great find! The drink are great too.

56.description: I love South American food so I couldn't wait to try this restaurant.  It was a small, cozy restaurant.  Food is definitely to share and is smaller portion and averages 15/dish. We ordered about 3 dishes and 2 drinks and spent $80 including tax.  Food wad really good, wasn't a jaw dropper but good.  I'd definitely go back to snack and have a few drinks.

29.description: Holy smokes this place is everything!!! Delicious food, the empanadas are delicious and the bombo rice is out of this world! Whoa! The service is outstanding they never miss a beat. The drinks are amazing. If I could give 20 stars I would. Go there right now!

42.description: Fantastic Latin-inspired shareable plates.  I'd suggest going on a weeknight when it's a bit quieter, but the restaurant is lively, cozy, dark, and great for two.  The dinner menu is impressive -- the hangar steak with chimichurri was our favorite, and the goat cheese starter was super interesting.  Cocktails are authentic, but we had better luck with the wine menu.  Make sure to save room for dessert - awesome menu with seasonal options.  The staff was very welcoming and attentive -- we will definitely be back!

23.description: I'm still trying to figure out what hype is with this place... The best thing that I could tell you is that the venue and the ambience here are pretty fabulous. That being said I can think of about three or four other places that are similar that have a much better value... And I really do not mind spending money on food and drink but like other "must go to" Chicago spots, this one falls flat.

47.description: We were celebrating a birthday party and the 3 of us at dinner were left dumbfounded - we couldn't decide which was the best dish of the night! The chicken thighs were juicy, the moqueca broth was blissful and the head on prawns melted in my mouth. The service was spot on. Our server surprised us with a birthday desert which was very kind. The host even greeted my mom safe travels when we were leaving since he learnt that night that she was visiting from out of town. Little things like this matter. Thank you for a wonderful birthday celebratory dinner!!  I'll be back soon!

8.description: Very cute place! Dining room is tiny, so we had to sit at the bar without a reservation, but the bartender took great care of us. I started with the oaxacan discoteca, which almost tastes like a traditional Chinese sweet drink (sweet plum juice), loved it! Bf had the pisco sour and peruvian ambassador, the latter of which was one stiff drink. Both were delicious though.We ordered a ceviche, hangar steak and moqueca. While the flavors were excellent, I thought they were a tad stingy with seafood in their ceviche. The moqueca, however, was piled high with delicious shrimps & shellfish. The steak was good but over-salted. Also wished it came with some veggies on the side, especially given the price of the dish (hangar steak is supposed to be budget cut!).I liked the food & drinks enough to go back, but given the prices this is a special occasions place, not for neighborhood weeknight dinners.

31.description: I had the shaved vegetable salad, a potato leek empanada and la bomba rice.   So good.   I will be back.

34.description: SolidFrom start to finish they were good. Service, cocktails and setting were all top notch.  I deduct a star for value, but that may just bee because I'm cheap...ahem.... I mean frugal.

16.description: Came in on a Saturday night for a reservation for 10 people celebrating a birthday dinner at 8:15 pm. We were greeted by friendly hosts in this romantic, chatty atmosphere, dark lit, smaller restaurant in the West Loop on Randolph. We were seated on connecting tables on the beautiful dark wood and comfortable dining chairs and booth. The Good: -Drinks are fantastic. I ordered a daiquiri with the seasonal fresh fruit of green apple. It was not a slush, but it was perfectly strong and sweet. -The chicken was flavored fantastically. The outer crust had a char, and it was tender, over chimichurri sauce. The portion is perfect for one person. I decided to split it but didn't need too. The Bad: SERVICE IS VERY SLOW: I understand the meaning of a busy kichen on a weekend night and how group dinners can be challenging to serve warm all at once, but 20 minutes for the appetizers and 30 minutes for the entrees. It was a bit ridiculous. No apologies for wait time or complimentary appetizers for the wait. OUR WAITER: -We asked our waiter to take a group picture. It was 9 ladies, the birthday girl brought her boyfriend. One of our friends asked our waiter if he can also take a group picture using her phone. He made a sarcastic comment saying 'He will text it to you.' -My friend asked for a 'Kale Salad' and he repeated back 'Pear Salad' but my friend hadn't heard it. He came back with a pear salad but there was no pear salad on the menu. That whole thing was weird. He should have mentioned there is no pear salad on the menu. But he 'covered' the pear salad. -He brought out plates for everyone for the birthday girls surprise birthday dessert when we didn't order any dessert or look at a dessert menu. It ruined her birthday surprise. OVERALL: It's sad that not many restaurants have a Brazilian and south american cuisine and this one does. I feel bad for the Chef, really. But the restaurant does stay busy. If you like a drink- come here, it's perfect to sit at the bar and share a dish but I wouldn't schedule a group dinner or come here on a weekend night. I strive for service, and Randolph street is competitive enough with wonderful restaurants so I would just skip it.

13.description: Today this is my favorite Latin fusion in the city. Well done! The reviewers who rave about their Kale Salad are right, it's fantastic. However I was even more impressed with Moqueca sort of a cross between Thai green curry and Bouillabaisse ( outstanding!!! ) and their Short Ribs were out of this world (i don't recommend sharing) Of course these are just highlights! We shared many items as a group of 4 and there wasn't anything short of simply delicious served! The place is very cozy, has a dark rustic feel with a waitstaff who cares. They have a very interesting wine list. Our amazing waiter who's name escapes me (he was a tall dude in a black shirt with giant glittery wings on the back)  knew his wine and his suggestions were excellent. I loved one of the bottles so much I found it online later and I was pleasantly surprised that $60 bottle is only marked up to $80! If you want fantastic Latin fusion in a laid back trendy atmosphere - make your reservation

11.description: Up front, I've only been here for lunch, but am looking forward to going for dinner one day.With that out of the way... I work in the area and have made this small gem a favorite - especially on a cold day. I am particularly fond of their black bean soup. On a cold day, a bowl of that is the perfect way to warm up and keep yourself going the rest of the day. It does have some heat to it (the type of heat you feel not taste) so if that scares you, you might want to only do a cup or at least ask for extra crema. But if you like beans this soup (and the homemade crackers it comes with) is not to be missed.I've also tried the empanadas, which were great; the cuban and the brazilian beef, which were both tasty but the type of sandwich you need a nap after. Also, I've not tried them yet, but I've heard the Alfajores (a type of cookie) will knock your socks off.The service here has always been attentive and friendly, especially at the bar, and their out door tables are nice for a beer on a hot day.All in all a solid spot that you keep wanting to go back to.

39.description: Came in on a Saturday night for a reservation for 10 people celebrating a birthday dinner at 8:15 pm. We were greeted by friendly hosts in this romantic, chatty atmosphere, dark lit, smaller restaurant in the West Loop on Randolph. We were seated on connecting tables on the beautiful dark wood and comfortable dining chairs and booth. The Good: -Drinks are fantastic. I ordered a daiquiri with the seasonal fresh fruit of green apple. It was not a slush, but it was perfectly strong and sweet. -The chicken was flavored fantastically. The outer crust had a char, and it was tender, over chimichurri sauce. The portion is perfect for one person. I decided to split it but didn't need too. The Bad: SERVICE IS VERY SLOW: I understand the meaning of a busy kichen on a weekend night and how group dinners can be challenging to serve warm all at once, but 20 minutes for the appetizers and 30 minutes for the entrees. It was a bit ridiculous. No apologies for wait time or complimentary appetizers for the wait. OUR WAITER: -We asked our waiter to take a group picture. It was 9 ladies, the birthday girl brought her boyfriend. One of our friends asked our waiter if he can also take a group picture using her phone. He made a sarcastic comment saying 'He will text it to you.' -My friend asked for a 'Kale Salad' and he repeated back 'Pear Salad' but my friend hadn't heard it. He came back with a pear salad but there was no pear salad on the menu. That whole thing was weird. He should have mentioned there is no pear salad on the menu. But he 'covered' the pear salad. -He brought out plates for everyone for the birthday girls surprise birthday dessert when we didn't order any dessert or look at a dessert menu. It ruined her birthday surprise. OVERALL: It's sad that not many restaurants have a Brazilian and south american cuisine and this one does. I feel bad for the Chef, really. But the restaurant does stay busy. If you like a drink- come here, it's perfect to sit at the bar and share a dish but I wouldn't schedule a group dinner or come here on a weekend night. I strive for service, and Randolph street is competitive enough with wonderful restaurants so I would just skip it.

37.description: My husband and I went to La Sirena a couple weeks ago with friends.  It was a great dining experience. The atmosphere was hip, but not over the top; and wait staff was friendly and responsive.  The food was excellent.  We will definitely return.

0.description: Service: The service here is absolutely amazing! We came with a party of 8 for a birthday and the bar gave us some nice shots to toast the birthday boy. When we were seated, the waiter knew everything about the menu and was willing to go line by line explaining what was on the menu to us. He's apparently worked with the chef for many years and understands the ingredients he likes to use and how he likes to prepare food.Ambiance: the place itself is small, it can't seat more than 70 people and I'm being generous. To me, this really speaks to the care involved in preparing the food. It's well seasoned using unique ingredients and was really a special meal. They use real candles for low lighting and it has a rustic type feel to the tables as they're made from refurbished wood. The restaurant is great for groups because their menu is really built for sharing.Parking: No valet but there's street parking you can find for free on both cross streets if you're lucky. You might circle a bit, or take a cab/uber.Food: we ordered basically half the menu and split it for the table. Fried Cauliflower - we ordered one and it was so tasty we had to order a second! A little spicy but barely; the creaminess of the aioli cuts the spice.Kale Salad - very yummy and even those who don't like kale enjoyed it. The creamy dressing was a little heavy for me but I ate it anyway.La Bomba Rice - YUM! Make sure you get some of the crispy leaks on your plate for that crunch.Whole Fried Fish - our waiter let us know that the chef is known for his whole fish preparations. When they bring the fish to the table, they'll let you know how you're supposed to cut your portion. It was light and flaky, some type of fish that's similar to a sea bass. I enjoyed the flavor it was different from any fish I'd had before.Rabbit Coxinha - these croquettes were good especially for my second time trying rabbit. I wasn't sure if I would like it. The meat, spices and cheese are all pureed then fried so if you're weird about texture, you should still be ok eating these. It sits on a bed of the frisee and mustard which was delicious & added a nice sour flavor to the food (but just a touch. It isn't overwhelming)Braised Pork Shank - also, ridiculously good! The meat was falling off the bone, people. I need you to understand that I'm not even a fan of pork shank and I licked all the juice off my fork. If you're a meat eater, try it out.Black Beans & Rice - pretty standard. They were tasty but there's not a lot you can do to make this dish over the top amazing.Empanada - just, wow. SO GOOD. I let out a literal, 'oh my God!' when I bit into this. We got the meat kind and you can't taste the ham, it just has a smokey flavor. Each person ordered their own which I recommend.Overall: I'll be back! Maybe next time I'll try the drinks out since I didn't order a cocktail.

38.description: The rating is based on the overall experience. I loved the food but can't say the same about the service. Everything we ordered was really good. Loved the Kale salad & the goat cheese plate . Our server was a no show for most of our meal time....she explained the menu & took the appetizers order but we couldn't find her after that.

51.description: Arrived a bit early to get a table on the patio to enjoy the nice evening and because inside is very loud and packed in.  Service was great.  We ordered two grit empanadas which were out of this world but arrived very late for an appetizer.  I had the Moqueca, which was incredible.  Exactly as described by another person (cross between Thai green curry and Bouillabaisse).  I also had a glass of wine and found the pour to be extremely stingy.   After the meal, the manager came out and comped the empandas and brought us free dulce de leche cookie sandwhiches.  The cookies really made the difference.  We didn't have the best experience, but overall I would recommend to anyone looking for a new Latin place to try.

27.description: Food - Very GoodService - GreatEverything we had was very good but the empanada's stood out as something special.  Almost worth coming back just for them.  The service was excellent and friendly. Atmosphere was very good also.  I would recommend that you go try it for yourself and see.

32.description: Very cute place! Dining room is tiny, so we had to sit at the bar without a reservation, but the bartender took great care of us. I started with the oaxacan discoteca, which almost tastes like a traditional Chinese sweet drink (sweet plum juice), loved it! Bf had the pisco sour and peruvian ambassador, the latter of which was one stiff drink. Both were delicious though.We ordered a ceviche, hangar steak and moqueca. While the flavors were excellent, I thought they were a tad stingy with seafood in their ceviche. The moqueca, however, was piled high with delicious shrimps & shellfish. The steak was good but over-salted. Also wished it came with some veggies on the side, especially given the price of the dish (hangar steak is supposed to be budget cut!).I liked the food & drinks enough to go back, but given the prices this is a special occasions place, not for neighborhood weeknight dinners.

54.description: Caipirinha -- strong n refreshing Kale Salad very yumCeviche Uniquely yumLunch Sandwiches--tastyEmpanada -- solid Sevice-- friendlyBeautifully decorated with a rustic feel. Enjoyed my experience.

48.description: I was a bit disappointed with my experience because I'd heard such great things.  The food was decent, but nothing impressive.  Everyone at my table had small issues, such as meat being overcooked or dishes being underseasoned.   Service was rushed, the staff seemed frazzled and we had multiple people serving us during the evening, which caused a bit of confusion on their end.  We were not asked if we wanted to order more drinks for nearly 40 minutes, and that really put a damper on our meal.  Where's the party, La Sirena?!The pricing was not unreasonable but everything is ala carte (no sides) and the portions were a bit small, so all in all it seemed more costly than necessary for what I found to be an average meal.  With so many great places to choose from in the city, I won't be returning here.

44.description: We ordered two empanadas (last night they had pork and potato; we did one of each), both were extremely tasty and I like that they are baked and not fried.  We then split the kale salad and the la bomba rice.  Both delicious.  Really big portions, plenty to share.  Did not love their drink menu, mostly sugary type drinks.

24.description: Great food!! Every dish we tried was full of flavor, the exact amount of spices and herbs, not too overwhelming but definitely edgy. The ribeye special was fantastic. Great ambiance inspire of the fact that it's on the smaller side, we never felt like it was too stuffy. Last and not least, the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. Definitely going back :)

7.description: Not one thing to complain about. Great service, great food, great vibe.  Is it a little overpriced, sure.  But they give you what you pay for. My only hope/suggestion for the future is they add a few more choices, particularly in entrees.  Other than that, we will be back

49.description: We stopped in here for cocktails and empanadas one afternoon. The atmosphere is lovely. Service was ok. The empanadas were pricey. The garlic fries were unreal. The cocktails were tasty. I can't see myself going back when there are so many other wonderful sports in the same neighborhood though.

40.description: I was so excited to see Pisco Sour on the menu!  One of my favorite drinks from my recent trip to Peru.  The bartender did a nice job of making mine nice and frothy, my favorite part of the entire drink.  I partnered my Pisco Sour with an appetizer, a baked squash empanada.  It was delicious, fresh and right out of the oven.  I highly recommend sampling these delicious bites.For my entree, even though the menu is small, I had a hard time deciding as everything sounded wonderful.   I opted for the Cuban even though I was nervous that the combination of ham and pork loin would be overwhelming.  I was pleasantly surprised upon its arrival, as the sandwich was a nice balance of each ingredient and absolutely delicious.  The side of home made chips was a nice touch.  In addition to amazing food, the decor was fabulous  A rustic, cozy feel with great art sprinkled on the walls.  Also, the "water" service was amazing, which was greatly appreciated since I was slightly hungover.  The only negative, if it is a negative, was the overly eager staff; but hey I would rather have that then a non existent server

53.description: We walked in a Thursday night around 6:30 and were able to get a table immediately due to a no-show. Otherwise we could have easily grabbed two seats at the bar or patio, which are both first-come-first-served and at that point in the evening were pretty much empty. We ordered the fish special, which was American Red Snapper, the elotes, and the pao de queijo (Brazilian cheesy bread balls) - which were as authentic as I've had outside of Brazil.  The food was good, but not mind-blowing. I would recommend this place to friends who want something a little nicer, not obscenely expensive, and who like good food but would be overwhelmed at the super-foodie places. The food came out very quickly, which was nice. Overall though I feel like the server was good, but didn't give us as much attention as her other tables (and we could tell because we were about 10in from the next table). She didn't explain the menu and it took a really long time to get our check and then take our payment. Still, worth trying out, and they have good cocktails!

30.description: Absolutely fell in love with La Sirena Clandestina the minute I took a bite of the kale salad at the Chicago Food and Wine Festival this summer.I made a promise to myself I would get to the restaurant and try more dishes.I can't believe this gem tucked away on Fulton street never crossed my mind and I'm so glad it is so close by!!Fortunate for them and unfortunate for me that they are across from the new Google building and will always be booked solid for a reservation.I had the kale salad with roasted poblano dressing, cotija, pepitas, jalapeño.  The poblano dressing added the perfect kick.  We also tried the beets and burrata which was good but I would have preferred the beets with goat cheese to add a little bit of a bite.  Of course we couldn't leave without trying the baked empenadas.  I had the roasted squash and a broccoli mac n cheese.  Both were unique and delicious.  Although stuffed, our curiosity got the best of us and we had dessert as well.  I couldn't resist the temptation to try the apple cider donuts with the rum glaze and squash mousse.  The mousse was amazing but the donut was dry and lacked the flavor I was looking for.Overall, this is a wonderful restaurant and I can not wait until they open their second concept this coming year!

46.description: Great service, friendly staff. Amazing food and fantastic wine selection. The room is beautiful.

1.description: I came in to La Sirena Clandestina for dinner yesterday evening (Thursday) with my boyfriend and his parents. We recently returned from a trip to South America and wanted to try Chicago's version. It was pretty darn good, and I love how creative their menu is! La Sirena Clandestina is located on Fulton Market in the West Loop. The restaurant itself is small and intimate with a bar in the front and high ceilings. Atmosphere is rustic chic. Unfortunately they have a metal ceiling, making acoustics a bit poor. Sound control could have been better, and we were speaking loudly for the first half of our meal until the crowd thinned.We each started with a cocktail. Their pisco sour is to die for. I could drink this all night every night. For dinner, we decided to share all our dishes as a table and we started out with the kale salad. It's a basic salad but the dressing is delicious. Portion size was very generous and there was plenty for the four of us. Afterward, we each ordered an empanada. The flavors of the evening were sweat potato and black bean. I loved the sweet potato, while other members of our group preferred the black bean. We also ordered the cheesy bread. These are really just a small bite each (an order came with 4, one-bite size bread balls), but a nice taste nonetheless.For main courses, we tried the tuna steak, hanger steak, pork shoulder, and the moqueca. We also ordered a side of rice and beans. All the entrees were fantastic. I particularly enjoyed the moqueca, which was a rice and seafood stew with head on praws and clams. The seafood was extremely fresh and portion size was again, very generous. The tuna was served tartare and melted in your mouth. Finally, the pork shoulder was extremely tender and served with some delicious potatoes and greens to top it off. If coming with a group, do keep in mind that portions are quite generous, and you don't necessarily need an entree / person.We finished up with alfajores, and these were delicious. A little different than the ones we had in South America in that the cookies were much thinner. Our experience here was great. I appreciate their menu having lots of different choices and items. I would knock a star based on the fact that I think they use a bit more salt than I prefer, and because of the acoustics. I would definitely return, especially for a Pisco Sour!

55.description: I was a little disappointed in my visit here this past weekend.  I had read rave reviews about their empanadas and amazing brunch but I was less than impressed.  I started off with a drink, their setenta y cinco, (not sure why it's named 75....) which turned out to be a pretty strong drink and I wasn't the biggest fan.  My dining companion, K, opted to stick to water since he was still recovering from the night before, what a rookie.  For my entree, I had the plantain chilaquiles and he had the steak and eggs.  We also split one breakfast empanada since I wanted to try their empanadas after hearing such good things.  Our food came out pretty quick since they weren't too busy.  My dish was decent but nothing really stood out.  For whatever reason I imagined the plantains to be the thick cut sweet ones, instead they came out more like plantain chips drenched in salsa verde and topped with an egg.  The flavors were there but texture-wise I didn't particularly like it.  As for the empanada, the crust was very flaky and you could barely taste bacon or anything in the filling.  I would say pass on the breakfast one, maybe the other empanadas they serve at dinner are better.  On the bright side, K enjoyed his steak and eggs but then again he's easier to please than I am (I promise I'm really not that difficult!).  I tried a bit of his flank steak and it was a bit chewy and should have been cooked less.  The service wasn't bad but it wasn't exceptional.  We had multiple people wait on our table throughout the night, one took our drink order, another our entrée order, and then the hostess brought me a takeout box at the end.  It was a bit strange but no complaints here.  What I can say I liked was the rustic décor of the restaurant and the lotion in the washroom as weird as that sounds.

9.description: La Sirena Clandestina was wonderful. It was a last minute decision to go and SeatMe from Yelp made it super easy to make a reservation. We were seated right away and given menus. I had the Moqueca - the seafood stew - and my friend had the Chicken and sausage. Both were excellent. The seafood stew was bursting with flavors and the seafood was very fresh. It was also a very filling dish. I could barely finish it all. We started with the empanadas as an appetizer. The dough was quite delicate and flaky and the fillings were delicious. We had the french onion and the jambalaya. The restaurant is small and cozy. Loved a lot of the upcycle elements used as part of the decor. I've read about La Sirena on TastingTable and am happy I got a chance to try it.

26.description: La Sirena Clandestina was wonderful. It was a last minute decision to go and SeatMe from Yelp made it super easy to make a reservation. We were seated right away and given menus. I had the Moqueca - the seafood stew - and my friend had the Chicken and sausage. Both were excellent. The seafood stew was bursting with flavors and the seafood was very fresh. It was also a very filling dish. I could barely finish it all. We started with the empanadas as an appetizer. The dough was quite delicate and flaky and the fillings were delicious. We had the french onion and the jambalaya. The restaurant is small and cozy. Loved a lot of the upcycle elements used as part of the decor. I've read about La Sirena on TastingTable and am happy I got a chance to try it.

25.description: Our waiter was amazing and explained the menus and helped us choose the best foods to try. We were unsure of how to order because the menus looked really pricy at first but after ordering a few of the items to share we all got something wonderful. It was my birthday and they really took great care of my table and made us feel like we were the most important table in the restaurant.

12.description: Nice ambiance. We got 4 different cocktails between us. 3 were okay 1 was really good the pisco sour.We ordered a bunch of appetizers. They were okay. The rice dish and the alfajores were only things I really enjoyed out of 8 things we got.For the price point I was expecting really good food. Service was great.

59.description: Went there for brunch and it was just ok. Nothing that would blow your mind...The ambiance - okThe food - okThe service - okthe ceviche is not that good especially after having ceviche in Peru and other parts of south america.  The chilaquiles was delicious, you add $6 for shrimp and they give you 2 burnt shrimps, hmmmmm, lets think about that.  If you order this dish, don't add the shrimp or the chicken, it is good enough as it is and considering they give you 2 shrimps for that additional price? No thank you!  Parking was easy in this area.  I think its good to try this place once but im not a repeat customer.

21.description: Great food, service and setting. Have been multiple times and will keep coming back. Great place for dinner for two or a small group.

17.description: The rating is based on the overall experience. I loved the food but can't say the same about the service. Everything we ordered was really good. Loved the Kale salad & the goat cheese plate . Our server was a no show for most of our meal time....she explained the menu & took the appetizers order but we couldn't find her after that.

10.description: My pastry chef-in-training daughter was in from out of town for the holidays. She and I were walk-ins Saturday night early - around 5:25 p.m. The small dining area was almost empty and the bar was entirely so. Paige was our server and she was attentive and gracious at all times. We split three dishes, starting with the kale salad which is huge but not too filling. Since my daughter is a pescatarian and a "spice wimp," they agreed to put the jalapeño peppers on the side of the salad. Its fresh cotija cheese was a tasty counterpoint to the kale. The poblano dressing was not very spicy. Next was the ceviche with toasted pepitas and a kind of creamy green dressing that set it apart nicely from the typical lime juice ceviches you'd get on a warm beach somewhere. It comes with what the menu calls house made saltines that are actually more like large pieces of flat bread papadams. This was a great combo and disappeared quickly. Paige checked with the chef to make sure they could make the grouper entree without the morcillo (which I suspected and we confirmed was blood sausage.) It didn't need it, as it was served over a bed of white beans and maple glazed sweet potato purée. Small portion but delicious, all the same. We couldn't leave without trying one of their famed empanadas - this one with cream of mushroom filling. The crust was flaky but the filling was unremarkable - the only let down if the night. Several times during our meal, Maria (who seemed to be the manager) came over to check on how we were doing. When we told her about my daughter's profession, she spoke with us at length about other places to try in the neighborhood, spots with good deserts and breads and went out of her way to be helpful, supportive and informative. When we were about to pay the bill, Maria sent over two comped deserts: a shortbread cookie with dulce de leche and a flourless chocolate cake with fresh mascarpone and a gooey, delicious ganache. Try to save room for these. You won't regret it. As we were leaving, the place was filling up and getting quite loud, so it could definitely be "conversation-challenged." That said, kudos to everyone at LSC. Thanks for a great night of dining!

5.description: I hosted my 30th birthday at La Sirena this past weekend and the service and food were absolutely as good as it gets. I've been to the restaurant before and had their regular menu. Everything was delicious then but was equally matched with the group menu. They served dinner family style and I was able to choose from many options. Everything we had was wonderful: an assortment of empanadas, head-on prawns, ceviche, kale salad (a favorite of mine), pan-roasted salmon (holy s*it this fish was perfectly cooked and the skin was on point - I almost opted out of the salmon because I eat it often but am so glad I didn't; chef and his team nailed it), chili-rubbed pork loin, garlic frites, fried cauliflower and...my favorite...alfajores. I ate three, no shame. The service was impeccable. My glass was never empty and there was always food on the table. They also split the check evenly between the guests and ran 14 different cards. La Sirena was also so accommodating, inquiring whether anyone in the party had dietary restrictions and letting me know when the market fish had changed last-minute so I could change courses if I wanted. Thank you to Nicole - Director of Marketing and Private Events - she answered my many questions punctually and set the entire dinner up.I will definitely be dinning at La Sirena again!

3.description: In 2016 I want to frequent restaurants within walking distance from my house more often. La Sirena is gonna be one of those restaurants I put at the top of my list while considering diff restaurants for dinner this year. You walk in, it's dimly lit and it's clear, by the smiles on the server/hostess' face that the folks who work here are passionate about making sure you have a delightful night. La Sirena has never failed. I first wanted to check this place out because I heard it was designed by local Chicago artist, Brian Willette. As a big fan of his work, I was hoping the food would be as good as Brian's art. And boyyy it sure is.  I've had some truly terrific and innovative dishes here at La Sirena. Some of my faves include the sword fish ceviche, braised rabbit empanada and duck heart confit. Truly all of which had stand-out flavors and an interesting rather unique twist on Latin cuisine. Yes La Sirena yes!I suggest bringing some cash so you can valet because it definitely is hard to park in the ever-growing Fulton Market District. Please don't be alarmed if there's a wait for dinner, it's very worth it!

35.description: I don't even know where to start.  This place is AMAZING.  The staff is awesome along with the food.  The 4 of us got the whole fish, empanadas, shaved vegetable salad and the special of the day Ribeye Steak....ALL so GOOD!  Hats off to the chef and bartender...mixologist I should say who didn't only have an awesome beard but REALLY knew his craft and whiskeys.  BEST old fashioned I have ever had.  Our waitress was great and accommodating.  The staff was not only attentive but funny and personable.  We WILL be back!

19.description: SolidFrom start to finish they were good. Service, cocktails and setting were all top notch.  I deduct a star for value, but that may just bee because I'm cheap...ahem.... I mean frugal.

28.description: Sunday night double date last week. My friends were in town visiting from Michigan, and we wanted to treat them to a nice meal out. All in all it was a lovely experience. I definitele would consider it better for a smaller group, as it was nice to eat family style. Our server was wonderful, friendly and available while still leaving us space to enjoy the meal.  Shared the ceviche, empanadas, tempura fried cauliflower, garlic frites, moqueca, and the off menu meat plate. The ceviche sauce was to die for, I wanted to lick the bowl clean. The empanadas were on the smaller side, but spot on flavor wise (my bf and I shared the "Cubano sandwhich" one). I like that the entrees are really built to share, and that the meat plate offered us a taste of all the meat dishes we were hankering to try anyway (hanger, sweetbreads, blood sausage, and a couple others). The fries serving was huge, which was fine by us with how tasty they were, but a little strange given it was a side item. Cocktails were lovely and I thought their wine selection went well with the food. Ended the night with table cookies they brought out and the flourless chocolate cake with espresso fudge and quince. Perfect end to a great meal. Definitely plan on going back and will recommend.

45.description: What an awesome place!  The food was amazing and our waiter was the best.  He helped make our night outstanding.   The empanadas are some of the best I have ever had..

33.description: I made a reservation for dinner for my husband's birthday.  I actually called and asked if they would be willing to put chicken hearts on the menu for one day because it's my husband's favorite food (he's from Sao Paulo, Brazil).  Joe was extremely helpful and accommodating and told me he would ask the chef but couldn't promise anything.  To my delight, Chef agreed to run a chicken heart special!  I  don't think I've ever seen my husband happier about a plate of food. The atmosphere of the restaurant is warm and romantic.  The waitstaff was very friendly and attentive.  All of the food we ordered was outstanding!  We got Pao de Queijo which was wonderful.  My husband, was raving about it; he said it's the best he's had ever, aside from his own mother's recipe.  The empanadas were delicious.  My husband had two orders of chicken hearts with farofa, and I had the hangar steak with chimichurri.  We shared garlic frites and topped it all off with caipirinhas and alfajores.  We will definitely be making La Sirena a regular stop for us.

43.description: Drinks, food, service, ambiance, and noise level are all amazing!.....This is my second time here and it was still a wonderful dining experience.

2.description: Wow. Came here for Valentines night dinner and was very very impressed. Food was a little saltier than expected, but didn't take away from the delicious flavors. Was very impressed with the steak and chimmichurri dish - SUPERB. Asked for a medium steak and got something a little more on the rare side, but the flavors and quality made up for this entirely. I LOVED this meal.  The chicken dish was equally great in its own way, still salty, but chicken cooked to perfection. Atmosphere: 5 starsBathrooms: 5+ stars Food: 5 stars

18.description: Sunday night double date last week. My friends were in town visiting from Michigan, and we wanted to treat them to a nice meal out. All in all it was a lovely experience. I definitele would consider it better for a smaller group, as it was nice to eat family style. Our server was wonderful, friendly and available while still leaving us space to enjoy the meal.  Shared the ceviche, empanadas, tempura fried cauliflower, garlic frites, moqueca, and the off menu meat plate. The ceviche sauce was to die for, I wanted to lick the bowl clean. The empanadas were on the smaller side, but spot on flavor wise (my bf and I shared the "Cubano sandwhich" one). I like that the entrees are really built to share, and that the meat plate offered us a taste of all the meat dishes we were hankering to try anyway (hanger, sweetbreads, blood sausage, and a couple others). The fries serving was huge, which was fine by us with how tasty they were, but a little strange given it was a side item. Cocktails were lovely and I thought their wine selection went well with the food. Ended the night with table cookies they brought out and the flourless chocolate cake with espresso fudge and quince. Perfect end to a great meal. Definitely plan on going back and will recommend.

41.description: Food was delicious but the service was disappointing and server was overly pretentious. This is not a Michelin star restaurant, but serves very good food. The server had taken over the evening instead of the food on the plate.

52.description: Today this is my favorite Latin fusion in the city. Well done! The reviewers who rave about their Kale Salad are right, it's fantastic. However I was even more impressed with Moqueca sort of a cross between Thai green curry and Bouillabaisse ( outstanding!!! ) and their Short Ribs were out of this world (i don't recommend sharing) Of course these are just highlights! We shared many items as a group of 4 and there wasn't anything short of simply delicious served! The place is very cozy, has a dark rustic feel with a waitstaff who cares. They have a very interesting wine list. Our amazing waiter who's name escapes me (he was a tall dude in a black shirt with giant glittery wings on the back)  knew his wine and his suggestions were excellent. I loved one of the bottles so much I found it online later and I was pleasantly surprised that $60 bottle is only marked up to $80! If you want fantastic Latin fusion in a laid back trendy atmosphere - make your reservation

50.description: I have eaten @ LSC four times and been in for drinks another few. The vibe is fantastic every time I've been here and it manages to feel intimate and special even when full (which is almost always). The menu items rotate, but every meal has been spot on from appetizer to dessert and I have never tried anything that I didn't want more of the next day. Wine list is a weak spot for me as I like west coast cabs, but the beer list is decent and the mixed drinks are very well prepared. My litmus test is an old fashioned and they make a very balanced one.  A great spot to that I never hesitate to recommend. Check it out before google opens next door and over runs the place.

4.description: Food was nothing special. Server was a hipster who needed to adjust the attitude and learn the menu. Wines weren't exciting but it's probably not a wine place. Had a few good beers. Cocktails looked ok. Issue is, with this many new restaurants coming, and already existing, this place is nothing special. Service is definitely an issue. Attitude and slow will get you nowhere.

6.description: Absolutely fell in love with La Sirena Clandestina the minute I took a bite of the kale salad at the Chicago Food and Wine Festival this summer.I made a promise to myself I would get to the restaurant and try more dishes.I can't believe this gem tucked away on Fulton street never crossed my mind and I'm so glad it is so close by!!Fortunate for them and unfortunate for me that they are across from the new Google building and will always be booked solid for a reservation.I had the kale salad with roasted poblano dressing, cotija, pepitas, jalapeño.  The poblano dressing added the perfect kick.  We also tried the beets and burrata which was good but I would have preferred the beets with goat cheese to add a little bit of a bite.  Of course we couldn't leave without trying the baked empenadas.  I had the roasted squash and a broccoli mac n cheese.  Both were unique and delicious.  Although stuffed, our curiosity got the best of us and we had dessert as well.  I couldn't resist the temptation to try the apple cider donuts with the rum glaze and squash mousse.  The mousse was amazing but the donut was dry and lacked the flavor I was looking for.Overall, this is a wonderful restaurant and I can not wait until they open their second concept this coming year!

22.description: My pastry chef-in-training daughter was in from out of town for the holidays. She and I were walk-ins Saturday night early - around 5:25 p.m. The small dining area was almost empty and the bar was entirely so. Paige was our server and she was attentive and gracious at all times. We split three dishes, starting with the kale salad which is huge but not too filling. Since my daughter is a pescatarian and a "spice wimp," they agreed to put the jalapeño peppers on the side of the salad. Its fresh cotija cheese was a tasty counterpoint to the kale. The poblano dressing was not very spicy. Next was the ceviche with toasted pepitas and a kind of creamy green dressing that set it apart nicely from the typical lime juice ceviches you'd get on a warm beach somewhere. It comes with what the menu calls house made saltines that are actually more like large pieces of flat bread papadams. This was a great combo and disappeared quickly. Paige checked with the chef to make sure they could make the grouper entree without the morcillo (which I suspected and we confirmed was blood sausage.) It didn't need it, as it was served over a bed of white beans and maple glazed sweet potato purée. Small portion but delicious, all the same. We couldn't leave without trying one of their famed empanadas - this one with cream of mushroom filling. The crust was flaky but the filling was unremarkable - the only let down if the night. Several times during our meal, Maria (who seemed to be the manager) came over to check on how we were doing. When we told her about my daughter's profession, she spoke with us at length about other places to try in the neighborhood, spots with good deserts and breads and went out of her way to be helpful, supportive and informative. When we were about to pay the bill, Maria sent over two comped deserts: a shortbread cookie with dulce de leche and a flourless chocolate cake with fresh mascarpone and a gooey, delicious ganache. Try to save room for these. You won't regret it. As we were leaving, the place was filling up and getting quite loud, so it could definitely be "conversation-challenged." That said, kudos to everyone at LSC. Thanks for a great night of dining!

15.description: Easy reservation on a Monday evening - plus. $60 dinner with essentially 4 appetizers and no drinks - minus. Biggest disappointment was the spring lamb. Although the preparation was perfect (especially the terrine part), we expected a lamb entree and pretty much got an appetizer. There must have been 5-6 small cubes of lamb, which for $20 makes sense, but either raise the price and offer a satisfying portion or specify that it is a small dish. Delicious lamb curry empanada, great flavor on the elotes (served on the cob).Loved the ceviche, but you can't really tell the difference between the squid, shrimp, and mahi. We'll give it another try in the winter, when the heavier dishes will be more enticing.

57.description: Somewhat randomly, my husband and I chose La Sirena Clandestina to celebrate our anniversary. Not knowing too much of what to expect, I must say we were very pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is vibrant without being overpowering, the food exciting without being too unfamiliar, and the service incredible. Paige was helping us that evening and she really helped make the experience 5 stars. She was attentive, considerate, and thoughtful. Overall a wonderful night made better through the personal touch.

20.description: Our experience was just wonderful.  Had the empanadas, they are my new addiction.  Also, the whole fried fish and shared the steak.  All were cooked to perfection, and incredibly flavorful.  Service was on point, from making and changing our reservation, to our wonderful server.  Friendly and very knowledgeable staff, beautiful and fun atmosphere, another new fave of mine!!

36.description: The food, service and decor are perfect - I had a great experience here by myself on the late side of a weeknight.

14.description: I'm still trying to figure out what hype is with this place... The best thing that I could tell you is that the venue and the ambience here are pretty fabulous. That being said I can think of about three or four other places that are similar that have a much better value... And I really do not mind spending money on food and drink but like other "must go to" Chicago spots, this one falls flat.

28.description: Five 'scissors' for Studio I-90! :)I've been a faithful customer here for several years and they always do a great job. Veronica and her staff are extremely nice and friendly. They are always accommodating when it comes to booking an appointment and my haircuts always look GREAT! I have referred many friends here (both guys and girls) and they are now regular customers as well. Studio I-90 is reasonably priced and they offer a great straight razor neck shave. They will even provide you with your own complimentary personal razor which they label and store for you. Now that's exceptional service! As an added bonus, there is easy non-metered street parking in front of the salon! I highly recommend this place!

1.description: Veronica and the team at STUDIO I*90 team SAVED MY HAIR after it was destroyed by an overpriced, "brand name" salon that was big on pushing product and short on expertise. When I left, the owner still didn't know my name. And I was going bald!! ( I needed help!)Despite its  amazing Bucktown location, Studio I90 is the antithesis of the trendy, hipster hair salons that open and close every six months. STUDIO Owner Veronica really knows ( and cares) about hair; the art, the craft and the science of it.. She's known as a "fixer," and has successfully been running her shop at this location for more than 10 years, building a loyal clientele for more 20 years. 10 stars to this establishment!

9.description: It was one of these days when I decided to get a haircut last minute. I arrived 30 minutes before closing time and they took me in right away (it was a Tuesday). There was a new girl who said she would cut my hair (I didn't catch her name). I went with a layered mid-length bob (from pretty long hair) and I could tell she hesitated a bit. But Angela and Veronika (I believe she is the owner) came to the rescue and instructed her and also fixed a few things. Overall they took time and spent over 45 minutes getting it right (all three of them!), tweaking details and getting it exactly to how I wanted it. At the end it was perfect and it cost me $20! On my way out Veronika stopped me, said that she loved the haircut and the way it looked on me but she wanted to style it to show me how it needs to look like. So she spent an extra 20 minutes after closing, styling it at no extra charge (they usually charge for styling), with her husband waiting in the waiting area. You could tell that she really loved her job; was passionate about it and wanted to make her customers happy. I love this place and I will keep going back there (this was my third haircut there and I never had a bad one yet)!

29.description: I went in for a walk-in trim.  I told the stylist I wanted a trim, but after drying my hair I see it is at least 1.5 inches to 2 inches shorter.  She said she was taking off a half-inch.I had previous layers I wanted trimmed up but I feel she trimmed them too coarsely; I didn't want that chunky look. I think she spent probably 10 minutes cutting my hair total.  It's not a terrible haircut, don't get me wrong, but it's about the quality of a Great Clips.  For $18 at the last minute though, I guess that is what you get. A men's cut here is probably fine, but I won't be going back.

23.description: Love this place.So i have been here twice, first time was for a hair cut second cut and color. I am from a small town and this salon reminds me of one back home i really like that. Both experiences have been great, had the same lady both times tho I have forgotten her name.I the second time she did high light and low lights she also deep conditioned my hair for free, it really need it was dried out from the summer. Now looking good and i didn't have to give up an arm and a leg to get these services!!The specials they have here are great! Monday-Tuesday free hair cut with the purchase of color or high lights and Wednesday $15 cuts.Free parking!

5.description: RUTH IS AMAZEING best hairstylist her hair cut was very good and she is well trained when my hair grew out it remained it's shape really well

31.description: This is my new salon.  The people were very friendly and did a great job.  The owner did my hair and introduced me to her staff which I thought was a nice touch.  She didn't hesitate to tell me about the bargains like the free hair cut with any color service on Mondays and Tuesdays.  If you are looking for a good cut under $20 then you should try them.

25.description: Down to earth people and decor.  Wonderful haircuts.  Very reasonable prices. Used to live in the neighborhood - that's how I discovered them.  Moved to Wrigleyville, but keep coming back for the haircuts.  Every once in awhile I try a more expensive salon, but I'm never as happy.  Studio I-90 is the best!

12.description: I am originally from NJ and have been looking for a haircut place that is decently priced in chicago.   I read some reviews on yelp and decieded to go here.  I first called and decieded to book my apointment with Angela, she picked up and was strange on the phone when i told her i wanted to book my appointment with her. I proceded to tell her it was my first time and she told me to bring cash, she didnt even take down my name so I told her my name.  I called at 4:40 and she said 5:00 is good for today, i said I would be late bc there was no way of getting there on time.  I am pretty laid back person, so my rating has nothing to do with that initial experience.  However, with my hair cut that I get once a year bc I've been growing it out, it was a horrible experience.  First she washed my hair asked what i would like to do, i told her i might go short bc i dyed my ends and i want it to be healthy so i might get a long bob.  She dismissed what i was saying and i needed a inch cut off, mean while i know i had atleasted dyed my hair 3-4 inches, why i was willing to get a long bob instead of a trim.  Next she proceded to cut my hair and "trim " it, i told her my hair is extremely thick and i need it razored or weight lifted from the ends.  After she cut my hair she still had not thinned my ends, and i asked her to do it again.  She did not know what she was doing.  Next, i wanted to see the results and wanted her to blow dry it straight, she said " ohhhh that would take sooo long" , getting a cut once a year, i said ok but doesnt the haircut come with the blow drying, she said no, i asked how much and she said rubbed her hands thru my hair and said ummmm $20 extra dollars. it sounded like she made up a number bc she didnt want to cut it. I could see my hair looked boxy and straight at the end even without it straightened.  I payed her $20 for the haircut and left in the cold without my hair done and dryed it at home. It now looks like a box in the back and the layers look like a line going thru the back, not blended in at all.  I would not recommend this place to any female!!! please just go to paul mitchell or aveeda institute, new trainnees would do better than this place!

21.description: one of the best haircuts I ever had. Veronica and  all the girls at Studio I-90 are very professional and always accomplish exactly what I am looking for in every and any style Highly recommend pleasant fast experience everytime-And they take appointments so it fits my schedule perfect

16.description: I would love to give this place a terrible review, b/c I don't want it to get too popular and then I can't get an appointment and they jack up the price. However, Jeanette has given me the best cut of my life (running on 8 months now). I now look like a jewish Bradley Cooper, and I'm not even Jewish!! My cut only costs $18 ($25 w/ tip) and I almost proposed to her during my first straight razor neck shave. Don't let the looks of this place fool you. They don't need all of the fancy decor. Their work speaks for itself.

17.description: Isabella left! I almost panicked but found out she's now at Spotlight by brickyard. Totally worth the extra drive! It's hard to find a hair stylist to trust, but she's great lifting dark color while keeping the health of your hair. I've recommended her to all of my friends and get compliments on my hair all the time. So if you're looking for her or just a great stylist in general-- she's at Spotlight.

10.description: I made an appointment the day before. I arrived a 5 mins early and sat down to wait for a stylist. This seems to be a popular hair place for men. It was a Thursday and I don't remember what the deal for that day was. They do have deals on Monday and Tuesdays ($45 color and free hair cut) and Wednesdays ($15 hair cuts). I paid $18 + tip. The space is not a fancy spa....it is a basic hair salon with one hair sink. Frequent phone calls to the salon interrupt the time the stylist spends with you, but they return right away.I really like my hair cut and I think they did a great job. You need to remember two things:1.  Bring cash (they do not accept credit cards, but there is a bank just across the street)2. This is a what you see is what you get kind of place. No frills, so get over it.It is well worth the money and right in my neighborhood.

11.description: I wish I can give this place more stars but they only deserve these two because they're nice and cheap. First, the haircut I got is just awful.. She gave me bangs like I asked and layered them but there's a few pieces that are just long and hanging in the middle of my face. And lastly, the owner was taking shots with other clients and there's underage children there getting their haircut. How can you let someone drinking tequila shots and then cut your hair? Ridiculous.

26.description: I always wanted to be a 'regular' at a hair salon/barbershop, and I've finally done that with Studio I-90. I've been coming for more than 2 years now, always for Jeanette, and have always been satisfied with my haircut.It's a happy place--they greet you smiling, they have their regulars coming in and out--and the price makes it a near unbeatable value.

27.description: Isabella is fantastic. I have long hair with layers. Before Studio I-90, just about every time I would get my hair cut, the layers would be uneven. But Isabella does a great job with layers and with my bangs. She's also great at making sure she knows EXACTLY what you want for that particular cut. You can't beat the service or the price. Studio I-90 is definitely a great choice!

0.description: I don't really like to spend too much money on haircuts nor do I ever know what I'm doing to make appointments so I usually go to Great Clips or something, but this was by my work so I thought I'd give it a try.I have long hair and I like to have short layers so it looks voluminous and most of the cheap places I go to don't understand how to cut that look -These gals here knew exactly what I was talking about and I absolutely LOVE my haircut. I'm writing this about a month later and it still looks amazing!!I didn't need an appointment, it was fast and easy.. the woman who cut my hair had such confidence and communicated so well with me that I felt totally at ease.Make sure you have cash though because they don't take credit cards!Definitely going here for my haircuts from now on.

20.description: I think down to earth says it all about this place, fantastic place to get a haircut in Bucktown.  Nice family establishment with friendly people.

19.description: Five 'scissors' for Studio I-90! :)I've been a faithful customer here for several years and they always do a great job. Veronica and her staff are extremely nice and friendly. They are always accommodating when it comes to booking an appointment and my haircuts always look GREAT! I have referred many friends here (both guys and girls) and they are now regular customers as well. Studio I-90 is reasonably priced and they offer a great straight razor neck shave. They will even provide you with your own complimentary personal razor which they label and store for you. Now that's exceptional service! As an added bonus, there is easy non-metered street parking in front of the salon! I highly recommend this place!

2.description: great cut, great price! really good with last minute appointments and walk ins!

18.description: I always wanted to be a 'regular' at a hair salon/barbershop, and I've finally done that with Studio I-90. I've been coming for more than 2 years now, always for Jeanette, and have always been satisfied with my haircut.It's a happy place--they greet you smiling, they have their regulars coming in and out--and the price makes it a near unbeatable value.

13.description: Love this place.So i have been here twice, first time was for a hair cut second cut and color. I am from a small town and this salon reminds me of one back home i really like that. Both experiences have been great, had the same lady both times tho I have forgotten her name.I the second time she did high light and low lights she also deep conditioned my hair for free, it really need it was dried out from the summer. Now looking good and i didn't have to give up an arm and a leg to get these services!!The specials they have here are great! Monday-Tuesday free hair cut with the purchase of color or high lights and Wednesday $15 cuts.Free parking!

4.description: A damn good cut and a damn fine neck shave with your own damn name on the blade. The price is damn fine, especially on Wednesdays. Go pay a reasonable price for a good pro cutter. Don't you go payin' $125 for a damn cut.

24.description: Ohhh my goodness I just love love love this place!  I have only been a few times now, but this is where I plan to get my haircut from now on.I took a gamble and chose a new place (I don't usually go to the same place/person as many do, however, I'm not too high maintenance about haircuts...), but I decided to get bangs!, which is kind of a gamble to take in the first place, not to mention randomly going to a place you've never heard of.Anyway, supppper cheap, really friendly haircutters, so quaint and informal, I just love it!  I showed my hairdresser the picture of the bangs look I was going for, and she made them look great!  And bang trims are only $5.  I will DEFINITELY be back and will encourage my friends as well.

6.description: I have lived near this place for many years and finally went in for a last minute cut today and I'm very happy I did!  The owners daughter was super nice, friendly and gave me a really great cut for only 20 dollars!  Mon and Tues they have free cut with color too.  I will defiantly be back!

22.description: Jeanette is awesome! I felt comfortable from the second I walked in. She listened to me and gave me exactly what I asked for, and was SO friendly... and it was only $18! There was no sales pressure to buy products and she made a point of telling me the days I could go in to get even better deals. It really doesn't get any better than this. I've found my new hair salon after searching for years and I couldn't be happier.

15.description: Great local place.  It's always easy to get an appointment and they do a nice job cutting hair (though I must admit, cutting my hair is not a difficult task).  More than that, the price is unbeatable.  With tip, my haircut comes to a whopping $15.  Not sure where else in Chicago you can get that kind of deal!  The best part, however, is the straight blade shave on the back of the neck at the end of each hair cut.  Make it in for 3 hair cuts, and you get a blade of your own.  Rock on!

7.description: I love it here bc today I'm getting my hair colored red velvet like cat from Sam and cat and victorious the show and I thought it was pretty cool ^_^

8.description: Got my hair cut by Angela (I believe) at this place.  Its a small place with only one shampoo chair and 3 haircut chairs.  As you sit down, they ask what you are looking for.  They asked all the pertinent questions (what number for the sides and back, round or square in the back, side burns or not, etc) for my haircut. Obviously will be different for girls. After the cut, they do straight razor cut of the neck, being a straight razor virgin I was nervous.  It turns out to be nothing more a regular shave with a cool looking razor.  As an incentive to return, after 3 haircuts you get your own personal razor blade.  They have a cabinet full of blades with people's names on them. You don't need an appointment but bring cash (one guy didn't and had to leave to go to the ATM I hope he returned and paid for his cut).  I went at like 4:30pm and only waited about 10 minutes or so.  There was plenty of free street parking at that time.  Go on Wednesdays because the haircut is only $15.  As an added bonus for you creepy dudes, one of the stylist is pretty cute I think her name was Jessica.  All in all, it was a good haircut that was nearby and only cost $15 + tip.  Stylist did ask if I wanted a shampoo or styling product after the cut, I declined (never understood that because a shower is a must post haircut, so why style for the ride home). I will return and hopefully get my own straight razor.

30.description: Looking for professional service, excellent prices and easy access (thus i-90 I guess), Studio I-90 is awesome. Armitage and just east of Damen in Bucktown.I've been going to Veronica and her staff for years and always get great cuts and service. My wife who had been going to the trendy higher priced Bucktown and Lincoln Park salons now goes here and agrees the services equals or exceeds those other higher priced salons for a lot less.Guys...just because it says salon doesn't mean its NOT for guys. Walks in are ok too (or call)Easy, friendly and reasonable prices (esp Mondays and Tuesdays-I think it was $18 dollars for a cut and a shave!)Bucktowns best!

3.description: I visited Studio I-90 this week, looking for a new salon in the city (where it doesn't cost $200 to cut and highlight my hair). I've found my new go-to salon! Jesse did my highlights and cut, and did a fantastic job. She and Veronica (the studio owner) were very nice and personable. Both the service and prices were fantastic. I'll be back, for sure!

14.description: I just went in for a trim.  I'm trying to grow my hair long and another salon cut it to look trendy and razor-y; the opposite of what I asked for. I tried Studio I-90 to fix my hair after seeing their good reviews. Jessica listened to what I said and I love my hair! They were super nice. I was in and out in 15 minutes.  And it was only $18! I'm so glad I went there! They are cash only, but there's a PNC bank across the street.  They let me run over after the cut.

3.description: Sometimes when you order flowers for a special occasion you don't know what you're going to get. There's a lot of trust involved.  I've sent flowers in place of attending certain events and with those I just crossed my fingers and hoped that they turned out alright. because I never actually saw them. I will never have that fear again. We hired Oliver Dogwood Floral Company to provide the centerpiece for a large dinner party we were having. They nailed it! I never felt so good about buying a flower arrangement. The flowers were the focal point of the table and became a real talking piece for the party. I asked the owner to have some fun with it and to use her best judgement and I couldn't be happier.  The arrangement oozed with creativity and beauty. I only wish that I had known about this company when my wife and I were planning our wedding.

1.description: I was referred to Oliver Dogwood by a colleague and used them for a going away arrangement for someone in our office. The flowers were so magnificent!! Tiffany was fabulous to work with and really listened to what we were looking for. Can not wait to order flowers from here again!!

2.description: I can't say enough good things about Tiffany and Oliver Dogwood! Her arrangements are spectacular and always exceed expectations. She did the flowers for my friends wedding and we still talk about how beautiful they were a year later!Such a wonderful person and amazing business. I would support Oliver Dogwood over any of the big chains in a heartbeat. The time and detail to their arrangements is hard to find anywhere else these days!

5.description: My brother is, sometimes, a good son.  For Mother's Day, he got my mom a beautiful flower arrangement from here -- and not your average flowers.com overpriced bouquet.  I am always on the lookout for a new floral company (you never know when that comes in handy) and this place seems to be the ticket.  It's close to work and parking is usually pretty easy around there.But more than anything, if I can sing its praises based on flowers I have seen, but not bought from there (yet), I'm sold.  Now I just need a reason to buy some flowers...

0.description: Tiffany is absolutely brilliant. Her arrangements are creative, thoughtful and unique. She is a spectacular florist, woman and human being.I don't hesitate to call her when it's time to make someone feel extra special with flowers.

4.description: I have worked with Tiffany and her team on floral for a number of corporate and social events.  The designs are always unique and stunning and the service  always exceptional. Guests always, always want to know what florist we used.I also frequently send small arrangements as client "thank you's" and these are always met with appreciation and rave reviews!

3.description: This place is the best - I cannot imagine going anywhere else. Amazing selection of poultry and eggs. Everything is fresh - no processing. I thought the prices were reasonable considering what you were getting for your money. I look forward to ordering my Thanksgiving turkey here next year!

1.description: This was an educational experience into the world of Chicago Live Poultry slaughter.  We raise chickens in Indiana and called in advance to schedule a time for our medium size flock of chickens to be butchered.  I was quoted a price of 3$ a bird over the phone, told that birds would be bagged, and could be weighed if time permitted, and was given a window during which to bring the birds.  When we arrived, my husband checked in, identified us and was told a different price of 4$/bird.  I called immediately after leaving and was told, "things changed from last week".   I asked them to elaborate about what details contributed to higher cost and asked to speak to the owner/manager.  He came back after a brief wait and said they would honor the original price.  When I returned, the birds were not fully processed.  I requested that heads and feet be removed and that the birds be individually bagged.  They agreed.  I stepped out to gather an additional container and when I returned, they tossed the last couple birds into the bins.    I asked if I received all of my chickens and asked about some that were set aside near where chickens were staged.  He quickly said, "no, no, no" and  escorted me out the back door.   After careful examination of the job, I realized that they had only given me 24 of my 30 chickens and that they had quickly thrown as many not fully processed chickens into my large container and covered them up with other birds when I had stepped out.  Extremely unhappy with my experience and with this grimly unethical place and staff.

2.description: Decent spot for live poultry. I was in and out quickly. Got a medium sized live chicken for about $13. The guy at the counter was very polite. No complaints here. I will def be back when my tummy is hurting and I need to make the ever so healing sopa de pollo :)

0.description: Where else can you get fresher chicken? A previous reviewer said it best - "they must be doing something right!" I mean, they must be here for AT MINIMUM 35 years. I remember coming here as a young boy in the early 1980s with my mom when she came here to buy fresh chicken and eggs. I'll never forget hating the stinky smell of the inside. But it's true, you do get used to it.   Back in the '80s, I remember a kindly older, short woman who worked the counter all the time -- can't remember her name for the life of me. But she looked like she was about 75 or 80 years old. And there used to be a gumball machine in there, which distracted me from the sounds of the chopping.  I have many memories of this little shop. There used to be a neon sign outside but I guess it was too expensive to maintain. There was even a competing poultry stand on Belmont near Long Ave, but  it vanished by the late 1980s. John's is definitely your place for fresh chicken and eggs! A Chicago tradition!

4.description: The true grim reality of eating meat. If your one for fresh chicken or fresh rabbit then this place is all you. You walk in, covering your nose,  and just look around and pick out the chicken or rabbit you want. Then just let them know what you want to keep and what to throw away. This definitely not my thing so that's why I give it only one star. But this place has been open for as long as it has because it does something right.

3.description: Shelby did hair for a few family members, my maid of honor, and myself for my wedding day, and we were all very happy with her work! She's super sweet, and very personable. I chose her based on the portfolio on her website - I really liked the braiding she had in a few photos. When I went in for my trial, she took the time to talk through different options and looks with me. Since my hair is a little slippery (I'm Asian), braiding was a little tricky, but she was patient and determined. She even took extra time to try an additional look for me that she thought I might like better than the previous ones. I ended up getting a combination of our test looks, and every time I look at pictures of my wedding day hair, I still love it!! And, another testament to Shelby's skills: we were talking that morning about how one of my husband's nieces can never keep a curl in her hair for longer than a couple of hours, no matter how much product - Shelby worked some magic so that this niece rocked a full head of gorgeous curls all day and night! They never fell out!! Shelby is a hair genius, and I highly recommend her for bridal styling.

1.description: So here is my second review for my favorite hair dresser. Woman, stop moving around as I frantically look all over the city for you!! But honestly the new place that she's at is pretty awesome. Totally unpretentious and close to public transportation and its like her chair is perfectly positioned so that the light from the windows seem to give you a halo over your dream hair. Please refer to my other review of her and then add now that after a hair color disaster that happened in Asia, she fixed my fried and frazzled color with now a glossy summer touched shade of perfection. i'm totally devoted. She's worth every penny.

2.description: I have been getting my hair done with Shelby for about a year now. I have loved every haircut she has given me. I used to go to Mops and I heard she wasn't there anymore so I looked her up. I'm glad I found her, I dye my hair red and its an asymmetrical cut. I know it takes a lot of time and talent to fix my hair, and Shelby makes it look perfect every time. I've gotten several different cuts and color services and I've loved every single one. I trust Shelby, she always does a great job.

0.description: Thanks for the haircut! Shelby is so patient to cut and dry my thick wavy hair. She also gives out great tips for styling my unruly hair. I can't wait to go back.Edit - Adding one more star for a 5 star review.I love my haircut. My hair keeps looking better each day. Has been a long time since I've loved my hair.

58.description: I was staying nearby next to the Publican, but didn't have the time to enjoy a sit down meal there. Enter Publican Quality Meats. When you enter the front door, you'll see a deli with a variety of specialty smoked or cured meats, and on the left, you'll see a small cafe with some communal tables and chairs. It's a fairly interesting offering they have, from soups, breakfast plates, to day-old cookies that they sell at a discount ($1).The two times I visited on my trip were mainly for sausages and takeout sandwiches. I tried their "Da Grinder", which was a medley of salamis and cheese, on a French baguette. The meats were salty, toned down by the mildness of the cheese, all accented by the crustiness of the bread. Not too shabby. The sandwich came with a bag of Deep River chips and a pickle spear. I also recommend getting the duck prosciutto and the green chile sausage. I wasn't exactly sure how to prepare them, but the cashier/host gave some good recommendations, and it turned out great. One thing I will have to say is that you should avoid the chicken salad. The chicken was a a bit on the dry side, and while they do use quality ingredients (radishes, homemade buttermilk dressing, and black chickpeas), the portion is also pretty small for $15. Overall, the place is great for some specialty meats, or a high quality sandwich. I'll definitely be back to try some of the charcuterie or other toasted sandwiches they have to offer.

56.description: Great sandwiches!!! The Parm #2 is especially good and unique. It melts in your mouth! The gyro was good but nothing too exciting compared to a normal gyro. The endless ice tea was great and they really did keep filling it up! Each sandwich comes with one of their sides but you have to ask to find out which one. The service was good and it's fun to look around in the shop inside. Parking was hard to find though!

29.description: Being that this was my first decent meal in Chicago I was pleasantly surprised. It's a meat market with an amazing menu selection and literally "quality meats."The Return of the Gyro (I could eat five of these in one sitting.)- pork belly heaven in a crisp wrap with coleslaw and a pickle. They also sell Mexican Coke which is always a nice treat. I'd want to try the Wagu Sandwich next. Like right-now-next.

42.description: Amazing sandwich and soup , went for Friday lunch with friends great ambience for a beer with meat filled sandwich.Great place for meat lovers.

23.description: This place is great, I've been here a couple times for lunch. Tried the Return of the Gyro, a sausage on a lobster roll, and a few others. Least favorite tried was the cauliflower sandwich, while easily the best was the roast beef sandwich - it was just incredible and now that I've tried it, it's hard to imagine ordering anything here not roast pork or beef.

47.description: Brunch = AMAZING. I live only a 10-minute walk from this place and have just now gotten around to trying it for their famous brunch. We arrived on a Saturday morning around 11AM and there was plenty of space for us. Inside, they are a meat and bread shop that also offers some tables and wait staff for dining in. Outside, they very nice sidewalk seating, which is what we opted for. Their brunch menu is small and simple, about 4 or 5 offerings, some sweet and some savory. After contemplating, my boyfriend and I both opted for the Farmers Breakfast, which includes two Sunnyside up eggs, two pieces of bacon, house made breakfast sausage, homemade fresh bread, and amazing breakfast potatoes. This breakfast blew me away. It was simple, but all incredibly fresh and homemade. The house made sausage was a huge highlight, as were the breakfast potatoes that come with a spicy aoili. We really enjoyed the fresh bread served with the eggs as well. I was definitely impressed with the quality of the ingredients here, and I'm excited to come back and use them as a meat and bread shop as well for cooking at home. Very fun to have this place in the neighborhood and I look forward to adding it as one of my go-to's!

8.description: As the manager of Xoco, I live with a dark secret: my addiction for PQM chicken parm!  Take it from someone who eats at least one awesome torta a day: the PQM chicken parm is a must have sandwich. As in, I must have one just writing this. I need one a week, at least.I love that it comes with Deep River chips. They're made in Connecticut (where I'm from) and I can't stop eating them. The pickle is also top notch.  Get the chicken parm.  Everything else is amazing too, it's just...  Chicken Parm Is The Thing You Cannot Not Get.
