31.description: After having a great lunch at Au Cheval, the bf and I wanted to try charcuterie plate at Publican Quality Meats. Since we were stuffed, we want to just have a quick snack. The shop is super adorable, with a huge selection of deli meats in the front, small shop with specialty goods, and a small sit down area in the back.The Bf and I ordered the 3 item charcuterie plate, chef's choice. I believe he gave us a shredded duck piece with cranberry jam, head cheese, and another item i cant remember. The meats are served with a grainy mustard, sweet pickle, and a few pieces of toasted baguette.I would definitely recommended this place for a quick bite or lunch. I saw some awesome sandwiches that other patrons ordered. A very chill place, nothing fancy smancy, great meat shop with lots of other specialty items to purchase. The staff are all very friendly. a 3 meat plate was around $20.

34.description: Porchetta sandwich is amazing. Had the pork belly gyro and it was good, but after the porchetta  it paled in comparison. The texture, the mix of salty, sweet, tangy, and a touch of heat with the savory of the pork of the porcetta was unbeatable. Good service. Good Bloody Mary. Fair prices.

16.description: Paul Kahan, purveyor of such fine establishments like Big Star, Avec, and The Publican, can do no wrong in my book. Thus, I was already destined to enjoy Publican Quality Meats (PQM, for short), Kahan's salumi-slash-sandwich shop and Publican spin-off.The closest proxy to PQM is Cochon Butcher in New Orleans, an ungodly good salumi-slash-sandwich shop that specializes in all things cured between two delicious slices of carb. Cochon Butcher is better than PQM, but I can't hardly think of another place I've liked better than the Butcher. In other words, putting PQM in a second-tier isn't an indictment.My one issue with PQM is what appears to be a lack of communication between the two halves. PQM's sandwiches don't seem to take full advantage of the delightful charcuterie available to them. In fact, PQM's most well-known sandwich, the "Return of the Gyro," stuffs its pita with braised pork belly, something more associated with Publican proper rather than PQM. Again, I'm not hating. This wrap is damn good, ranking amongst the best "sandwiches" I've had in Chicago.The remainder of its menu is highly rotational, and maybe I just keep coming at the wrong times, but I'd love to see a muffaletta, a pastrami on rye, an Italian grinder, anything that's just simple meat, cheese, bread, and a couple condiments. Sure, a chicken parm sounds darn good, but that's not why I'm drooling puddles staring at your meat case, PQM.OK, mini-rant over. Everything else about PQM is fantastic. It's a little jarring first walking in, inundated with meat cases with hefty price tags. Here's the tips. If you're getting a sandwich or prepared foods to go, go to the middle cashier directly. If you're picking out sliced meats, head left. If you plan to sit and dine, head right (or to the far end, depending on the door you've entered). Once that moment of zen has passed, you'll feel more relaxed.For salumi orderers, there's plenty to choose from, but try to pick the stuff (labeled with PQM) smoked in-house. PQM has variants of just about everything under the sun, and I've never been disappointed by anything I've taken home. For restaurant-goers, somebody should get the Return of the Gyro, but from there I leave it to you. Like I said, my preference would be to get something with meat available at the butcher, but that's just me. Whatever you get, it will not suck.

13.description: I have been to the Publican thrice for brunch now and I thought it was the best thing since sliced bread... Until last Friday when my friends and I ended up at PQM after being quoted an hour and a half wait time at Little Goat. I say "ended up" but I really mean we're soooo lucky to walk in, sit down, and immediately begin stuffing our faces with some of the finest charcuterie I've had in Chicago aside from Hopleaf and Gather. It had big heaping portions so all three of us felt like we had plenty to taste. I started with the Pok Pok Gose cocktail which was a super refreshing summery gin drink. My boyfriend got the Bloody Mary which was similar to the one across the road at the Publican, with a Miller High Life beer back instead of a draft (champagne of beers--way classier). The guys got the pork belly gyros and they must have been amazing because I didn't even get offered a bite, and I'm usually able to steal one! I was able to taste the slaw that came with the gyro and it was amazing--light and vinegar based and crunchy. I ordered the smoked salmon plate which had ridiculously good salmon. The only weird thing was the charcuterie actually took longer than our main dishes to come out so we were awkwardly eating everything at once. But geez louise was it good!! Perfect way to start off a nice long day drinking session, and I will definitely be back asap... And probably bring everyone who visits me in Chicago here as well!

11.description: First stop in Chicago, and I was immediately impressed! I originally wanted to go to The Publican, but accidentally ended up at this location without knowing until I had sat down. Since I was already looking at the menu, I decided to stay here and see what Publican Quality Meats had to offer!! Because it is a meat shop, we decided to order the three types of charcuterie for an appetizer. We got the coppa di testa, duck rilette, and pate, and the dish came with different types of mustards, pickles, peppers, and bread. The rilette was surprisingly fantastic, and the bread was toasted and drizzled with olive oil. Preparation and care into their food is obviously seen, and this was the perfect start to our meal.For my entree, I got the Butcher's breakfast which includes sausage, bacon, bread, two sunny side up eggs, and chorizo? hash. Everything was a little on the greasy side which is expected as it is bacon and a bunch of meats, but it was amazing. The sausage was so flavorful, and the chorizo hash had soft potatoes and crunchy bits with a hint of meat in the taste. So good. The plate was overall very well structured, and I surprisingly finished everything on there. I also tried my friend's chickpea soup which was good, but nothing extraordinary.This location really does serve quality meats, and it surpassed my expectations! They had a ton of options to buy meat and spices at the front, and if I was a Chicago local, I would totally buy their meats to take home. If I do end up coming back to Chicago, Publican is next!

39.description: Their pâté game is on point! Wide variety of meat and cheese, specially sodas, beer, and sauces/spices. Picked up a board for office lunch and it was easily the best way to spend lunch at work. Highly recommend!

37.description: I got the chicken parm ordered through delivery here twice and both times it was just OK. Nothing special for the price and all of the talk. I probably wouldn't go here again.

0.description: This was quite the fun stop on the way out of the neighborhood, after having breakfast at the publican across the street.Upon entering you are greeted by some very knowledgeable folks behind the counter, and some cases filled with absolute delicacies as far as me to go. They had a lot of porcine options, including a ton of different ways to serve sausage. The guys really knew their stuff, and it was fun to listen to the different types of sausage and how each one was made.The cuts of beef looked excellent and there were also some lamb options.The back wall contained tons of cooking supplies, spices, books, and plenty of other kitchen pleasantries that would make for great stocking stuffers. Absolutely worth checking out if you're in the area.

38.description: This was my second time here and boy was it delicious. We ordered the charcuterie platter which came with chef's choice of 3/5/7 different meats. It came with head cheese, salami, thinly sliced pork belly?, shredded duck with some sort of comport and this delicious chorizo and garlic block. They gave us toasted bread on the side and when we requested more, we got two more additional plates! The service and the platter were awesome. I sampled my friend's hot apple cider and man was it good. I regretted not getting a cup of my won. For my own entree I ordered the return of the gyro which was a pork belly gyro served with coleslaw. The pork belly was delightful and probably deep fried. The coleslaw was cold and cut through the fattiness nicely. Definitely coming back.

51.description: Really good food. Amazing atmosphere, and did I mention good food? I had a turkey sandwich that came with a pickle and kale salad. It was amazing and not too expensive. My only complaint was that there is not much room during the lunch hour and the tables are all cafeteria style, long and shared. Overall very very good!

27.description: Girlfriend took me here for Saturday brunch to show me her workplace for the summer :) We sat outside in the small patio area along the side of the shop, it was a beautiful day to soak up some sun. We ordered a couple dishes to share: the porchetta sandwich, a hot charceuterie plate, and also a side of fried eggs cause we really wanted eggs :P I had a Kyle's go juice to go with my meal (coffee drink). The go juice is made with coffee, espresso, honey, and angostura bitters. The porchetta sandwich was absolutely phenomenal; it's served only on Saturdays after 12. We saw the butcher bring out the entire roast on a large cutting board. The meat is juicy, succulent, and tender. The sandwich is served red onion, pickles, aioli, mustard on a ciabatta bun. The porchetta portion was huge! We had difficulty keeping the sandwich together while eating it. The onions and pickles gave it some acidity to help balance out the fatty delicious meat. Comes served with a side of chips. The charceuterie plate was comprised of 3 types of house-made sausages served on a bed of red peas, pickled cabbage and mustard. They were all delicious; but my favorite was probably the cajun blanc sausage followed closely by the cajun boudin. I forgot what the other one we had was called :/ It all ate quite well with the peas and pickled cabbage and our fried eggs :)I would absolutely recommend PQM to anyone looking for a casual, delicious meal. Their meat and cheese selection from their shop is excellent and they also sell baked goods as well. They have a small grocery section that sells some nice preserved goods and even select wines and beers. Would love to come back and try more of their delectable offerings.

32.description: Publican. Since I moved form Chicago this is one of the places I miss the most. Their lunch is so creative and delicious. Even when there is a wait I love looking around their little store at all the awesome cooking specialities they have! It is great on a  cold rainy day to grab a seat inside, get the caramel creme tea and soup!

54.description: This was my second visit to quality meats and after giving it a second try, I have to voice my disappointment. On this visit I had the PIRI-PIRI PAVO smoked turkey for $12 (!!!, really??) and found it to be a small upgrade to what would be the experience of a what if Trader Joes had a "to go" sandwich business. The flavors were uneventful, and the sandwich size represented two smaller sized pieces of bread only a few notches away from being the heel. I gave it two stars since I was eating with some of my closest friends that I never get to see, and I was able to finish my sandwich. I really don't get it, I love Publican's original restaurant venture, but Quality Meats is more like Publican't.

48.description: My wife works near Publican and her company has catered their food. She is a Vegetarian. She had good intentions when she brought me back a Gyros Sandwich (description taken from receipt). The sandwich was beyond disappointing. It was expensive and tasted like vomit. Sorry that is the closest flavor it resembled. Plus the menu says the sandwich is served on a flat bread, which appears to be the case in many of the pictures I see, but mine came on a stale flour tortilla.

44.description: Great butcher shop, though a little more than I typically like to spend, but you get what you pay for.   Fantastic sandwiches and a helpful staff make this place perfect for me. One of their more popular sandwiches and one of my absolute favorites is the chicken parm sandwich. Heaven on earth,  nice patio in the summer.

24.description: Great little deli in the Fulton market neighborhood. Their sandwiches are delicious, and the menu changes often. To go foods are great as well! Highly recommended.

7.description: After having a great lunch at Au Cheval, the bf and I wanted to try charcuterie plate at Publican Quality Meats. Since we were stuffed, we want to just have a quick snack. The shop is super adorable, with a huge selection of deli meats in the front, small shop with specialty goods, and a small sit down area in the back.The Bf and I ordered the 3 item charcuterie plate, chef's choice. I believe he gave us a shredded duck piece with cranberry jam, head cheese, and another item i cant remember. The meats are served with a grainy mustard, sweet pickle, and a few pieces of toasted baguette.I would definitely recommended this place for a quick bite or lunch. I saw some awesome sandwiches that other patrons ordered. A very chill place, nothing fancy smancy, great meat shop with lots of other specialty items to purchase. The staff are all very friendly. a 3 meat plate was around $20.

49.description: As the manager of Xoco, I live with a dark secret: my addiction for PQM chicken parm!  Take it from someone who eats at least one awesome torta a day: the PQM chicken parm is a must have sandwich. As in, I must have one just writing this. I need one a week, at least.I love that it comes with Deep River chips. They're made in Connecticut (where I'm from) and I can't stop eating them. The pickle is also top notch.  Get the chicken parm.  Everything else is amazing too, it's just...  Chicken Parm Is The Thing You Cannot Not Get.

40.description: I don't know what shit I was on before but this is my go to for all my meat and a regular lunch spot. Excellent customer service. I was dumb they are great. I'm so sorry my friends at PQM!!!

53.description: This place is wonderful, the food's wonderful, the staff makes the place hum with their constant work and attention.ADA note: the restrooms are DOWN a set of stairs, and the elevator is not easily visible -- apparently it's kind of behind one of the checkouts, i.e., not near the stairs (I didn't realize they had an elevator at the time, would have been good to know).

30.description: PQM is the ultimate carnivore's paradise. Cases full of whole dry-aged ribeyes, racks of venison, legs of lamb, slabs of porchetta and guanciale, oddities like beef bacon and duck prosciutto, the best damn smoked turkey and roast beef in the world, and every kind of sausage under the sun. If your mouth isn't watering yet, you don't belong in here!As far as sandwiches go, I've had the roast beef (kneel to zhoug), turkey (piri piri pavo) and the seriously kickass chicken parm. All excellent, to the point where I try my best to recreate those roast beef and turkey sandwiches at home. You can't go wrong with any of their meats or charcuterie, and the guys working the counter are really friendly and happy to accommodate whatever odd weights of meat you want. Side note: they also sell Avec dates and piquillo pepper sauce here ($1.50 apiece!) Definitely check out their fresh baked cookie selection as well...the $1 day old cookies are a steal. Pricey stuff, yes, but you really get what you pay for. This ain't no Boar's Head.

46.description: Solid choice for a simple and interesting lunch sandwich, with interesting combinations of meat or cheese, bread and condiments. While not the point of the place, the passage to the basement restrooms is really cool.

1.description: The food is great. Nothing you can take away on that front. It's so good for brunch too, as well as dinner. My issue is purely that the beverage program is seriously wine deficient. Like its missing a huge component. Beer is so-so, but for me I wanted more wine options. Better ones too. Wine program needs serious work. It's really lame, tame, and not anything exciting. With a place that has that much amazing pork, you need to have wine. Good wine. Not just stuff that everyone else has, or score hunting stuff from Spectator.

55.description: Okay guys, let's talk about PQM here. I've put off going for a long while, for too long I realized last week when I went there for the first time. Well hot dog, get that roast beef sandwich. I mean really: it has roast beast (beef), crunchy shallots and a mayo that is literally to die for piled on top of fab bread. I wanted to eat a second one immediately after I devoured the first. I am a PQM-aholic. I vow to go back this weekend to bring my husband and toddler there to experience the greatness. The first step is admitting to having a problem... I saw cookies that I have to try, an amazing selection of wine, beer and condiments. AND 12 other sandwiches on the menu that I could not quite fit into my mouth. This is a winner, my friends.

9.description: Ordered PCM for the second time for a client meeting today and once again food arrived hot, on time, and with no issues. Jessica, the Catering Manager, is great and so accommodating.  Clients loved the food both times and were very satisfied.  Thanks PCM!

26.description: Really wonderful trout roe from the butcher section, if you can get it.  They have it from time to time and you can ask for it.

25.description: Placed an order for 60 chicken parm sandwiches and 20 chorizo dates to go. Was overcharged $382, and the best the manager could come up with is "my hands are tied"???? Would've cancelled the order but the food was already promised. Is this any way to do business ?? Never been RIPPED OFF!!!!  like this before. Also picked up 90 steak sliders from gibsons, who chose not to charge a premium.  Won't be doing business with publican again. For anyone looking to do a large order with publican, buyer beware!!!!!

12.description: Great food, simple dishes, and not much of a wait time make PQM a great place to eat.Came here for lunch w/ some friends on a Friday and we were able to get seated right away. I got:-Pok pok gose: letherbee gin, pok pok thai basil, rhubarb, off color troublesome. This was a very refreshing drink that was tasty, too-Return of the gyro: braised pork belly, raita, escalivada, pea shoots and calabrian chili vinaigrette. HOLY HELL THIS WAS AMAZING. I love pork belly and I love gyros, so when I read that PQM had married these 2 together, I knew I had to come here to try it and it definitely did not disappoint. The pork belly was amazingly flavorful and tender (they also didn't skimp on the portions, either!), and the vinaigrette tied it together very well. Definitely a must-get if you dine here-Cold charcuterie plate: we all split this and we all loved it. There were about 5 different types of meat, and they all were phenomenal. Another must-get IMO.Will definitely be coming back to try other items on the menu. They were out of the Roast Beef when we arrived, so hopefully the next time I'm back I'll be able to try that.

59.description: I've only been here once but my lunch was sooo good.  I popped in randomly one day, having never been before, and I'm so glad I did.  This review is strictly for one sandwich - the Cauliflower.  Sounds odd, right?  It was so stinkin' good though.  I wasn't convinced when I placed my order but my first bite immediately changed my mind.  While the sandwich was huge (and came with a pickle and bag of potato chips), it was expensive (~$12.00).  The bread alone makes my mouth watering thinking back on it.  I definitely recommend checking this place out.  They have some interesting meat and cheese selections (snail sausage for example).

21.description: I had lunch with my two friends here and it was amazing! From the fresh meat to the overall interior , this place is awesome. In fact it was so good, I have been looking for similar places in the San Francisco Bay Area :) Must haves include the charcuterie plate , the Big E and the Butcher's Breakfast . Each of the meats and cheeses were absolutely delicious. I could hardly pick a favorite

17.description: I went here for lunch and breakfast on 2 different occasions.  First, the breakfast was phenomenal.  I wish I still worked nearby for that breakfast burrito with bacon and eggs.  I was truly in bliss when eating that sandwich amongst the noisy crowd in my office.  And for lunch, I had the gyro.  The first thing I noticed about this establishment was that all their baked goods were excellent.  The chewy texture was just out of this world.  I want to marry the baker and live forever eating carbs and being fat.

10.description: I was staying nearby next to the Publican, but didn't have the time to enjoy a sit down meal there. Enter Publican Quality Meats. When you enter the front door, you'll see a deli with a variety of specialty smoked or cured meats, and on the left, you'll see a small cafe with some communal tables and chairs. It's a fairly interesting offering they have, from soups, breakfast plates, to day-old cookies that they sell at a discount ($1).The two times I visited on my trip were mainly for sausages and takeout sandwiches. I tried their "Da Grinder", which was a medley of salamis and cheese, on a French baguette. The meats were salty, toned down by the mildness of the cheese, all accented by the crustiness of the bread. Not too shabby. The sandwich came with a bag of Deep River chips and a pickle spear. I also recommend getting the duck prosciutto and the green chile sausage. I wasn't exactly sure how to prepare them, but the cashier/host gave some good recommendations, and it turned out great. One thing I will have to say is that you should avoid the chicken salad. The chicken was a a bit on the dry side, and while they do use quality ingredients (radishes, homemade buttermilk dressing, and black chickpeas), the portion is also pretty small for $15. Overall, the place is great for some specialty meats, or a high quality sandwich. I'll definitely be back to try some of the charcuterie or other toasted sandwiches they have to offer.

5.description: I had one of my greatest meals here while in Chicago. This restaurant wasn't on the planned list of places we wanted to try, but sometimes the greatest meals aren't always somewhere you plan. My friends and I ordered the Butcher's Cold Charcuterie Plate with 5 different meats. It was absolutely delicious and how great that it comes from a butcher shop. I ordered the spinach and potato soup because it was raining the day we came here. The soup was good, but came in a small bowl. If you come here, you MUST order the "Return of the Gyro." I had never tasted anything like it. The sauce with the pork belly was something I still dream about even a year later. If I happen to ever be in Chicago again, I will be sure to stop by here.

3.description: Excellent portion, quality and food preparation with a decent price.HOT CHARCUTERIE OR SAUSAGE PLATE ($18) -- I'm not a sausage person, but the 3 different selections compliment each other.  Addictive.  Perfection to dijonnaise drizzle.  Taste great when freshly served, it still taste the same when reheated.  Serves 2+.APPLE PIE ($5) -- the best apple pie in Chicago.  The crunch on top is addictive.  $5 is hefty but worth it.CHAI LATTE ($4) -- housemade Chai.  Woo hoo!  Balanced spice with milk.SERVICE -- Jessica was knowledgeable with a just right timing on follow-up.  You go to the baristas and they will be glad to tell you the magnificence of what they do.VENUE -- communal tables.  Plenty of employed guys eat here.  LOL

35.description: Excellent breakfast and quaint ambiance.  The smells from the deli are just awesome. Great bloody Mary's.

19.description: Like the main restaurant, outstanding.Cheese board is a bargain.  Chicken parmesan in a lobster roll is delicioso.

28.description: I may have found my favorite place in the world. I wish I lived in Chicago now just so I can eat here every day and get insanely fat. Cute little meat and cheese deli with a restaurant in the back. Really brightly lit, and the staff are all very lively and friendly. They have meats in display like a usual butcher/deli, and sell them in bulk. Near the back is a fridge with refrigerated goods (frozen raw meat cuts, cold broth in soup takeout containers, and ice cream/yogurt/cold dairy products.Little restaurant in the back is adorable - it looks like it came out of someone's pinterest. The menu is mouthwatering delicious and made me sad I couldn't eat everything. I ended up getting the 3 piece charcuterie set, which comes with three heaping portions of preselected meats, as well as pickles, picked red bell pepper, whole grain mustard, and olive oil coated bread slices. One complaint is that there wasn't really enough bread, but there is never enough bread so I guess I can't fault them for that.I was too busy already eating to pay attention to when the server was describing the meats (shame on me). What I got though was a mild, thick sliced saucisson of some type, pork rillettes with fig jam, and some kind of spicy pate pressed with dried apricots, all in heaping portions. The sausage and rillettes were absolutely amazing. If I had to rank them the pate would probably come last, but that didn't stop me from eating it all and scraping the last bit off the board.Would absolutely recommend.

45.description: Ate off the brunch menu on our way out of town. Three words "smoked cheddar gravy". Game changer.  I am a breakfast lover, biscuits and gravy being a real favorite, an indicator of how well an establishment can do breakfast.Nailed it.  Their own smoked ham under a layer of the aforementioned smoked cheddar gravy, with a fried egg. Great biscuits, something unique about them, slathered in pan drippings and gravy, the fact they held up so well and were not hard, pretty solid.The meat and butcher options were quite enticing. Had kids not been on verge of meltdown, would have stocked up.Only issue is lack of parking. There are a lot of lots marked No Parking.  Forced to valet.

33.description: First stop in Chicago, and I was immediately impressed! I originally wanted to go to The Publican, but accidentally ended up at this location without knowing until I had sat down. Since I was already looking at the menu, I decided to stay here and see what Publican Quality Meats had to offer!! Because it is a meat shop, we decided to order the three types of charcuterie for an appetizer. We got the coppa di testa, duck rilette, and pate, and the dish came with different types of mustards, pickles, peppers, and bread. The rilette was surprisingly fantastic, and the bread was toasted and drizzled with olive oil. Preparation and care into their food is obviously seen, and this was the perfect start to our meal.For my entree, I got the Butcher's breakfast which includes sausage, bacon, bread, two sunny side up eggs, and chorizo? hash. Everything was a little on the greasy side which is expected as it is bacon and a bunch of meats, but it was amazing. The sausage was so flavorful, and the chorizo hash had soft potatoes and crunchy bits with a hint of meat in the taste. So good. The plate was overall very well structured, and I surprisingly finished everything on there. I also tried my friend's chickpea soup which was good, but nothing extraordinary.This location really does serve quality meats, and it surpassed my expectations! They had a ton of options to buy meat and spices at the front, and if I was a Chicago local, I would totally buy their meats to take home. If I do end up coming back to Chicago, Publican is next!

43.description: I've sampled most of the sandwich menu over the past few months but keep coming back for the roast beef and the chicken parm. The turkey sandwich they had on the menu a while back was nearly a religious experience on bread...alas is rotated off. While $12-$14 may seem like a lot to some people you get chips and the great spicy pickle along with it. The quality and consistancy is well worth the price plus I've always has great customer service expereinces here.Looking forward to coming for brunch or burgers one day.

2.description: Let me just say first off, that the food was very good and the atmosphere was enjoyable. I am glad I gave this place a try!I am a bit confused as a first time customer, however. When I came in with my children (who eat nearly everything), we looked at the deli meats and knew that we wanted roast beef sandwiches, mine without bread. When we talked to the girl at the counter, she seemed a bit confused and mentioned that we could sit in the dining area and order.When we ordered in the dining area, I asked for roast beef only with horseradish sauce. She didn't seem very sure about it but then said she could bring a plate of it, no problem. When my daughter ordered a roast beef sandwich that was not on the menu, it seemed to cause some confusion. My daughter, the ever loving negotiator, simply asked that if she went to the deli and ordered a roast beef sandwich, if they could make it and asked why they wouldn't be able to make it for the dining area. Ugh. Eventually all was figured out and she had a plate of roast beef, cheddar wheeze, lettuce, salami, and sourdough bread for a DIY sandwich plate, but it was strange to not be able to order simple things that were clearly in the deli, in the dining area.At this point, my son decided he wasn't going to eat...All of that aside, I would definitely go back for the deli meats and some of the goodies in the refrigerator. Maybe we'll take it home. ;)

18.description: I wish we had a place like this in MN!! It might be time for me to move...this place was that good!The little restaurant is super cute, with a modern homey feel. There's community style seating which I loath. Half the time the people I'm next to are talking so loud it starts to sound like pigs squealing it's that annoying. However, I won't let that take away from the whole experience, it was that good. My boyfriend and I decided to split Gerry's Adobo Sausage, and the Cold Charcuterie plate. I will never forgot how f'ing delicious my first bites were of everything we ordered. The adobo sausage came on a lobster bun, some pickled cauliflower on the side. The sausage wasn't overpowering, it was a perfect balance with the bun and toppings. Intense flavors, but none were competing. Of the charcuterie, all 5 were phenomenal, but the lamb roulette, and pate were to die for. I could have eaten it all without a bread vehicle, just meat all in my mouth. I wish I remembered what our servers name was because she was amazing. She was friendly, quick, and helpful with the menu. Our waters were always topped off by the busboys. Everyone working there seemed to really enjoy it, that's always great to see. I also have to mention the bathrooms were in the basement, that usually creeps me out. These were not at all creepy. Bright, modern, and clean. Bonus, you see the kitchen at work downstairs, super cool.Whenever I make a trip to Chicago again I will always make a stop here.

41.description: Lunch with a work colleague. Green chile sausage sandwich with a side of pickled cauliflower. I can't believe it has taken me so much time to visit this fine establishment. Loved it! Absolutely delicious.  Service was excellent. a bit pricy but worth it!

52.description: Their butcher's breakfast is to die for. Don't get me started on their potatoes.I highly recommend. One of my favorite places to brunch!

50.description: Horribly overpriced for a sandwich with too much bread and maybe five small pieces of meat. We arrived half and hour before close and were not allowed to sit down to eat this $15 gyro. Save your time and money and go to any of the wonderful restaurants nearby instead.

4.description: Girlfriend took me here for Saturday brunch to show me her workplace for the summer :) We sat outside in the small patio area along the side of the shop, it was a beautiful day to soak up some sun. We ordered a couple dishes to share: the porchetta sandwich, a hot charceuterie plate, and also a side of fried eggs cause we really wanted eggs :P I had a Kyle's go juice to go with my meal (coffee drink). The go juice is made with coffee, espresso, honey, and angostura bitters. The porchetta sandwich was absolutely phenomenal; it's served only on Saturdays after 12. We saw the butcher bring out the entire roast on a large cutting board. The meat is juicy, succulent, and tender. The sandwich is served red onion, pickles, aioli, mustard on a ciabatta bun. The porchetta portion was huge! We had difficulty keeping the sandwich together while eating it. The onions and pickles gave it some acidity to help balance out the fatty delicious meat. Comes served with a side of chips. The charceuterie plate was comprised of 3 types of house-made sausages served on a bed of red peas, pickled cabbage and mustard. They were all delicious; but my favorite was probably the cajun blanc sausage followed closely by the cajun boudin. I forgot what the other one we had was called :/ It all ate quite well with the peas and pickled cabbage and our fried eggs :)I would absolutely recommend PQM to anyone looking for a casual, delicious meal. Their meat and cheese selection from their shop is excellent and they also sell baked goods as well. They have a small grocery section that sells some nice preserved goods and even select wines and beers. Would love to come back and try more of their delectable offerings.

6.description: I may have found my favorite place in the world. I wish I lived in Chicago now just so I can eat here every day and get insanely fat. Cute little meat and cheese deli with a restaurant in the back. Really brightly lit, and the staff are all very lively and friendly. They have meats in display like a usual butcher/deli, and sell them in bulk. Near the back is a fridge with refrigerated goods (frozen raw meat cuts, cold broth in soup takeout containers, and ice cream/yogurt/cold dairy products.Little restaurant in the back is adorable - it looks like it came out of someone's pinterest. The menu is mouthwatering delicious and made me sad I couldn't eat everything. I ended up getting the 3 piece charcuterie set, which comes with three heaping portions of preselected meats, as well as pickles, picked red bell pepper, whole grain mustard, and olive oil coated bread slices. One complaint is that there wasn't really enough bread, but there is never enough bread so I guess I can't fault them for that.I was too busy already eating to pay attention to when the server was describing the meats (shame on me). What I got though was a mild, thick sliced saucisson of some type, pork rillettes with fig jam, and some kind of spicy pate pressed with dried apricots, all in heaping portions. The sausage and rillettes were absolutely amazing. If I had to rank them the pate would probably come last, but that didn't stop me from eating it all and scraping the last bit off the board.Would absolutely recommend.

22.description: There are two things on this earth that have left me feeling overwhelmed and insignificant in the same moment.  Those are the Grand Canyon and the deli case at Publican Quality Meats.

15.description: PQM is the ultimate carnivore's paradise. Cases full of whole dry-aged ribeyes, racks of venison, legs of lamb, slabs of porchetta and guanciale, oddities like beef bacon and duck prosciutto, the best damn smoked turkey and roast beef in the world, and every kind of sausage under the sun. If your mouth isn't watering yet, you don't belong in here!As far as sandwiches go, I've had the roast beef (kneel to zhoug), turkey (piri piri pavo) and the seriously kickass chicken parm. All excellent, to the point where I try my best to recreate those roast beef and turkey sandwiches at home. You can't go wrong with any of their meats or charcuterie, and the guys working the counter are really friendly and happy to accommodate whatever odd weights of meat you want. Side note: they also sell Avec dates and piquillo pepper sauce here ($1.50 apiece!) Definitely check out their fresh baked cookie selection as well...the $1 day old cookies are a steal. Pricey stuff, yes, but you really get what you pay for. This ain't no Boar's Head.

57.description: Really good lunch spot with unique salads, sandwiches, etc. It can get a bit crowded, but we were able to sit right down for lunch on a Monday. Got the cauliflower sandwich and the roast beef sandwich, both of which were really good. I'll have to go back and try a few others. Good options for a casual meal any time.

20.description: The Big E.  Say no more.  It's a sandwich to dream about.

36.description: I went here for lunch and breakfast on 2 different occasions.  First, the breakfast was phenomenal.  I wish I still worked nearby for that breakfast burrito with bacon and eggs.  I was truly in bliss when eating that sandwich amongst the noisy crowd in my office.  And for lunch, I had the gyro.  The first thing I noticed about this establishment was that all their baked goods were excellent.  The chewy texture was just out of this world.  I want to marry the baker and live forever eating carbs and being fat.

14.description: Being that this was my first decent meal in Chicago I was pleasantly surprised. It's a meat market with an amazing menu selection and literally "quality meats."The Return of the Gyro (I could eat five of these in one sitting.)- pork belly heaven in a crisp wrap with coleslaw and a pickle. They also sell Mexican Coke which is always a nice treat. I'd want to try the Wagu Sandwich next. Like right-now-next.

58.description: I went here regularly for about a year before I moved out of the neighborhood, and each time I had a good experience, both with my acrylic nails and pedicures.  It does get really busy after work and on the weekends, so you might want to consider making an appointment.  Otherwise, solid nail salon in the area and worth a visit.

56.description: I moved to the West Loop neighborhood and was looking for a go-to nail salon. I found this salon based on yelp reviews and made an appt for my mom, sister and myself on a Friday afternoon. We ended up showing up an hour early and they were still able to accommodate us. They have an immense selection of no-chip colors! I would definitely return. They did a great job on our nails and didn't rush it either. We paid $35 for a no-chip gel manicure.

29.description: My niece and I got mani/pedis here and the service was exceptional and our nails look amazing. The manicurists were meticulous and warm and I'm so thrilled with the result. Thank you!

42.description: Called ahead to make an appointment for a no chip/pedi. They started on my no chip as they were finishing on my pedi which I always like because it gets me out of there faster. Pedi was great, no complaints there. The woman doing my no chip spoke little to no English at all, although she was very nice and did a good job. The only area where my complaint comes in is with the tip. They DO NOT, and they made this very clear, accept anything but cash tips. I had no cash on me and they would absolutely not up charge my credit card, so being that I only live about 10 min away I went home to get a check. Meanwhile, the woman next to me getting her nails done was also complaining that she had no cash and they wouldn't help her either. The woman doing my nails assured me they would accept checks for tips, so I walked all the way home and came back to ask if I made it out to the appropriate place and she could not understand what I was asking. I went to ask the other woman who spoke English and she told me they do not accept checks. At that point I was fed up and walked out without tipping the lady. Sorry, but that's their own fault. Within about 5 minutes of each other they had two people complaining that they only take cash for tips, don't you think that'd be a sign to make a change?!

23.description: I've been coming here to get my nails done for years and love it. Very professional, clean, trendy and best of all, come out with perfect looking nails that actually last. I've recommended a number of my friends and they all love it also. Thanks!!

47.description: First time visitor, and I would go back. I could tell there were a lot of regulars (which is a good sign). The crew was friendly. It was busy but no one rushed. I would definitely recommend an appointment. They have a very large assortment of colors included fluorescents and other unusual colors.

8.description: I had been here once before and the lady did a great job. I was in and out in an hour for a no chip manicure and loved the results.I went in again yesterday and the experience was awful. I was the only customer in there but they had my nails wrapped to take off the no chip for 25 minutes. The man doing the manicure was awful. I kept telling him he was hurting me and he just ignored me. I have had many, many manicures and never been in this much pain. My fingers are raw, hunks of skin missing, and I was there for almost 2 hours. He cut me several times. I will never go back!

31.description: Love this place for a regular manicure. They always last a full week unlike most places. They are super friendly and have a great selection of colors (regular & no chip).

34.description: I was in today for a no chip removal and basic mani. *Twon* peeled himself away from his daydream to get me going, and shortly afterward, 4 or 5 clients came in and nail techs magically appeared to work. This is the second time I've come on a weekday and the place seems virtually empty. There is usually just Twon and the woman watching Netflix on her phone. Anyway, though I took the emptiness as a good sign (I can be in and out on my lunch break), I now see things differently. The first time I came, a tall and warm male tech came from the back to do my no chip mani. He was so warm his hands were sweaty and he held my fingers too tightly during my entire mani. Aside from one bubble in my thumb nail (which he denied even existed, even while I pointed it out to him), he did a good job. I just felt dirty at the end. Anyway. Today. Twon. Rough. Acts like he wasn't in the mood to do nails. Ever. Unnecessarily rough scraping of shellac. Filed. Buffed. Refused to cut or acknowledge the broken nails I pointed out and ASKED TO BE CUT OFF. Roughly pushed back cuticles. Then dropped oil on. Rubbed lotion and did hand massage. IN THAT ORDER. Confusing. Now, I wish I hadn't asked, but I did: "Are you going to cut my cuticles?" (With those possibly unsanitary cuticle cutters you've kept concealed under the dirty towel you're doing my nails on?) I wanted them cut. I love how my short nail beds look after I get a mani because the removal of my cuticles just makes my hands look better. He acted annoyed that I asked, as if he planned to do it all along. By this time, he had also clasped my hands together while wrapping them in a steaming hot towel, sprayed my nails with alcohol, and buffed again. I was confused about this process. Everything got real clear though when working on my SECOND cuticle, HE CUT ME! I guess he was trying to cut a hang nail (that I didn't know I had; there certainly wasn't one bothering me), and when I squealed in pain, he grabbed a tiny bottle of turquoise stuff and squeezed a glob on me while answering my query with, "it's antiseptic." I just about screamed in pain then, while jumping up to rinse the BLOOD OFF MY FINGER. I went to the sink and washed and rinsed for a while, but it still bled. I told Twon I was done, asked how much I owed, and told him he shouldn't have been cutting so roughly. He said he was just cutting my hang nail and that it was a tough one to cut. What? That sounds like victim blaming, so take this $5 and I'll be sure not to return. My fcking finger is still sore.

16.description: I visited West Loop Nail & Spa last week for a mani/pedi.  The nail salon supposedly does not close until 8pm, but when I showed up at 7:30pm I was turned away.  First the nail tech told me that everyone that was in a pedicure chair just so happened to also be getting no-chip manicures, so there would be no time for me to receive ANY services.  Then she suddenly flipped the script and told me that I could be serviced, but I would have to pick either a mani or a pedi.  This was not acceptable.  Why would I drive 30 minutes in heavy traffic plus pay for parking to receive half of my desired services?  I explained this to her and pointed out the fact that they were still open for at least a half hour, not counting the time that would need to be spent cleaning and closing the salon.  The nail tech unapologetically told me that I still could not be seen.    I have patronized this nail salon on other occasions, and the service is already nothing to write home about, but I continued to visit them. This was the last straw and after this incident I will do my best to not patronize them again or recommend them to any friends.  If a business advertises certain business hours online and in their window, they should honor them--even if I had to sit there and wait a few extra minutes for an available tech.  If the nail salon was unable to take on more patrons, the open sign should also not be in the window when I drive past, because you are clearly not open for business.  I have never experienced a service oriented business turning away customers before their business was closed.  Beware of visiting this nail salon if you plan to arrive anytime in the last hour before they close.

13.description: I am adding one more Star with this update! I have been going here for some time now, and I have consistently gotten greats service.  Last time, my no chip started to change color (they did warn me about this when I initially got it that this may occur with this particular color/brand). However, it was much more than normal shade change. I called Vanessa (the owner), and she was very nice about this and had me come back to fix my nails. She fixed my nails.  Things can always go wrong, but I respect the business that handle it well. They did just that!  I also wanted to mention that while I was at the salon there was a very rude customer and Vanessa did a great job of handing her with out getting worked up over the customer's unreasonable requests which can ruin the mood of other in the salon.  If you are in Chicago, this is the best place to get a no chip!

11.description: Tina is awesome! A little to be desired in terms of service as english is not their first language so communication is limited. They had the Kardashians playing on TV (that's what they think american girls like) and a crazy collection of no chip colors. I paid $50 for my fills with no chip add on - pricy but when you fold in uber to and from other locations it all evens out!

39.description: I have been a regular patron of West Loop Nail & Spa for several years.  As mentioned, they only accept cash tips.  This is a little frustrating, but the service and charm of West Loop Nail & Spa make up for it!  The staff is friendly and welcoming.  Vanessa or Tuan warmly greets you when you walk in the door.  They remember customer names and provide outstanding customer service.  Tina does a fantastic job with gel nails and no-chip manicures and is so sweet!  They have a great $55 special on pedicures and no-chip manicures Monday - Thursday.  They are frequently busy, but can accommodate same-day appointments and provide accurate wait times.  Highly recommended!

37.description: The no chip manicure and pedicure I got were both okay and lasted 2 weeks but all of the nail technicians I came in contact with were extremely rude.  Their attitudes were enough for me not to return.

0.description: Great Place in the City.  Not a nail mill.  They do good work! Priced right!  Customers were divers and like a community of professional on downtime relaxing and engaging. Fun experience and will go back again.

38.description: Love getting my mani & pedi here. Go before 4 Monday thru Thursday for the discounted rate if you need to save some money.

51.description: I have tried several nail salons and I always go back to WLNS.  I love no-chip manis but you can't just get one at any old place.  If a salon does not use a good product or if they do not know how to take off a no-chip, they can really ruin your nails. (I know from experience!) At West Loop, they have never harmed my natural nails and the no-chips last over 2 weeks! Twan (sp?) is my personal fave because he is a perfectionist.  I definitely would recommend trying this place out.

27.description: I live across the street from this salon but never tried it because it was a little pricier then a couple other salons nearby. I wasn't thrilled with the other salons so finally decided to try this salon out, and so glad I did. The saying "you pay for what you get" is so true! Their prices are just a tad higher then the other salons I was going to, but definitely worth it... I got a regular manicure (not a no chip) that lasted almost two weeks!!! They take there time and are very friendly. This is my new nail salon moving forward!

32.description: This is the place to go for a no chip manicure. I have had much better luck having them last here than many places. The price is also better here for no chip than most. There is a tall, slim male who works here who I have seen be very aloof and almost rude to customers. I had him once and he was fine, but I was worried. This is NOT the place to come get a pedicure. They are chintzy on the massage and my polish (they only gave me one coat) chipped within a day. Normally a pedi can last like a month on my feet.If you want a no frills, super good, lasting no chip, this is your place. Anything else, you might want to look somewhere else.

54.description: It smells pissy in here.  Why am I still here? So far the service is good. The place seems clean enough but wtf is that smell? Lots of colors to choose from. Too many buttons on the massage chair. What's that smell? I'm overwhelmed.

48.description: I arrived an hour early for a meeting and in true CG fashion was determined to push my time limitations to the brink of late-ness by scheduling a no-chip manicure with under 40 minutes to spare. Normally this wouldn't work out in my favor but these Bs up in here got to work on my digits and pumped out a KILLER no-chip mani in under 40 minutes... Which is basically unheard of. Like the Usain Bolt of manicures. The color selection was unreal- by far the best I'd ever seen anywhere and I get my nails done A LOT.  I probably could've spent 40 minutes just fingering the options Inside was as relaxing as a could be on a major mani time crunch and I got the added bonus of getting to watch Bridesmaids on the flat screen overhead while the whole thing went down. I left $35 lighter but actually got our in time to make my next meeting early and with a killer nail job. Priceless.

44.description: Loved this place! I've been trying to search for a nail place with consistent reviews and walk in availability. After lunch with the boyfriend, I decided to call around some spots in the area to see where I could get in. They said they were pretty empty and had no problem taking a walk in. The deluxe pedicure is exactly what my toesies needed seeing as it's July and I haven't had my summer pedi yet. They don't skip on the massage part either! I'll be back!!!

24.description: Very nice nail salon! This was my first time here...the salon was very clean (and I am super OCD about the cleanliness and esthetics of nail salons!) $40 for a basic mani and pedi, not bad! Very good service, would definitely recommend! You may want to ask for a longer foot and leg massage, but other than that, no complaints!

7.description: Buffed Manicure only lasted 2 days.  Hang nails are there.  Dull cuticle nipper as there was a lot of pull.  Plentiful of skin peeling around my nails that never happened before.CASH ONLY TIPS*BEWARE* LYSOL WITH BLEACH -- it's alarming that Lysol Bleach is used to clean the whirlpool foot spas after each client.  With warm foot soak, bleach absorbs easily into skin.  There is a HEALTH ALERT to weekly passive bleach exposure.VENUE -- hot and humid just like in Vietnam.  It was uncomfortable.  Isn't there a regulation where circulating air is ON at all times in a public space?

49.description: Tried this place for this first time and was pleasantly surprised!  I was greeted right when I walked in and asked to select a color.  After selecting a color, I was prompted to sit down and starting my manicure.  The manicurist was very meticulous and my nails turned out wonderfully!  Cannot wait to go back again!

40.description: Called and made an appointment for two pedicures and two no chip manicures. He repeated it back to me to confirm what the appointment was for but when I arrived they only had time for the manicures. Left and went to one closer to home that took us right in. The place is tiny and jam packed with chairs and tables. Very uncomfortable.

53.description: I have been going to this nail place for six months and I LOVE it! Tina does my acrylic french tip gel sets and is timely with appointments. The pedicures are great as well, they have a wide variety of colors and chairs to choose from. I have never seen it super packed, or had to wait for a service. I typically call ahead to make sure that Tina is working that day so she can do my nails. She is the only person in the salon who does the acrylic french tip gel sets. I recommend this salon to anyone who lives in the west loop/river west area, its the best one around! Don't waste your money going anywhere else!

30.description: I enjoy coming to get my mani/pedi here. Staff is friendly and very attentive. They take walk ins, and I've never had to wait too long. They take their time and get the job done right. Best of all they are not overpriced considering the location. I definitely recommend it.

46.description: After moving to Chicago I needed to find a salon. West Loop Nail & Spa didn't disappoint! I went in for the no-chip mani and pedi on a Thursday and it was wonderful. The staff was great, the salon was CLEAN and the nail polishes were arranged by color (seems simple but not many salons do it). Also, my no-chip manicure has lasted three weeks without lifting or chipping. I will absolutely be going back every three weeks for a mani pedi.

1.description: Found my new nail spot in West loop! Wish I remembered my techs name. I messed up my nail at the end of my mani pedi and she repaired it really well. Great deal of 35 for mon to thurs during off times (before 4pm I believe).

55.description: This is one of the BEST nail salon/spa in Chicago! They have a huge variety of different colors for no-chip manicure/pedicures! Everything is very organized and clean. The entire staff is very friendly and will answer ANY questions you may have about their services. Their prices are very reasonable, they are able to get you in-and-out under an hour for a no-chip manicure and they look amazing and last a very long time! I highly highly recommend this place. Walk-ins welcome too!

9.description: Love this place. Very nice interior, tons of no chip colors, and it's very clean. All tools are sanitized and sealed prior to individual use. The ladies that work here are all very sweet and do a great job, so make sure you bring cash to tip because they don't accept tips on cards - pretty standard for nail salons. Also, Monday through Thursday they have happy hour nails specials - no chip mani and a pedi for $55! Awesome deal!

26.description: By far the worst customer service in Chicago, have never been treated so poorly by staff. I will never again consider a service at this nail salon, and I would never recommend this spot to anyone. After walking in at 10:30 on a weekday, and not enough staff to cover the handful of people inside, I was told to sit and wait 20 minutes for a no-chip manicure. As I waited, I very politely asked to see the no-chip colors available, as was told to sit down and the manager would show me later. He then told me that I cannot walk in unless I have an appointment (despite the sign on the door stating walk-ins are welcome) and make demands. After sitting down, he forcefully grabbed my hand to begin filing, and proceeded to lecture me about asking to see colors or wanting service without an appointment. Within minutes, I stood up and left the building immediately. There are far too many nail salons in the West Loop area to be forced to receive such poor service and attitude from a salon. If possible, I would give this salon a negative star rating and am writing this review to warn others of the problems with this salon.

25.description: Buffed Manicure only lasted 2 days.  Hang nails are there.  Dull cuticle nipper as there was a lot of pull.  Plentiful of skin peeling around my nails that never happened before.CASH ONLY TIPS*BEWARE* LYSOL WITH BLEACH -- it's alarming that Lysol Bleach is used to clean the whirlpool foot spas after each client.  With warm foot soak, bleach absorbs easily into skin.  There is a HEALTH ALERT to weekly passive bleach exposure.VENUE -- hot and humid just like in Vietnam.  It was uncomfortable.  Isn't there a regulation where circulating air is ON at all times in a public space?

12.description: I arrived an hour early for a meeting and in true CG fashion was determined to push my time limitations to the brink of late-ness by scheduling a no-chip manicure with under 40 minutes to spare. Normally this wouldn't work out in my favor but these Bs up in here got to work on my digits and pumped out a KILLER no-chip mani in under 40 minutes... Which is basically unheard of. Like the Usain Bolt of manicures. The color selection was unreal- by far the best I'd ever seen anywhere and I get my nails done A LOT.  I probably could've spent 40 minutes just fingering the options Inside was as relaxing as a could be on a major mani time crunch and I got the added bonus of getting to watch Bridesmaids on the flat screen overhead while the whole thing went down. I left $35 lighter but actually got our in time to make my next meeting early and with a killer nail job. Priceless.

59.description: Whenever my local spa is booked I go here for a no chip. I've never had any problems with the service, but once 2yrs. ago I had a problem with a double-booking of my bridal party! That's how I found my local fave. Other than that I've gotten many mani/pedis & no-chips here with no complaints.

21.description: I have been here twice for fill ins when I have been in the area. My most recent gel fill in here was really good. Vanessa paid careful attention to detail when completing my nail service and was also gentle with the nail tools. I also got a repaint of my toes which also came out very well.  I am a little confused about their pricing here though. When I made an appointment over the phone I was told a gel fill in was $26 (average). Since I added the repaint on last minute, I figured it would be around $40 with both services, but it was $48, so maybe the toe repaint was $22? (kinda pricey). Despite my price confusion, this is still a good salon with quality services.

17.description: I have had my no chip down at least 4-5 times and I am not very impressed. Twice i have had to go back and ask them to fix my no chip within days after getting it done. My no chip should last two weeks not a couple days. The third time i went they didn't cut my cuticles properly. I will say that the pedicures are always nice, but I don't think the no chips are done very well. Also, this may be a matter of preference but I am very tired of having to leave a tip in cash. I like to get my no chip done every two weeks and I don't always have cash on me. They need to get a square machine or start incorporating the option for tip when i pay with my credit card.

10.description: First time here and everyone was very nice. They were super quick. In and out. And my mani was perfect.

5.description: Had a great experience here. Gorgeous interior. Quick service. The best part: Something they applied to my manicure made it instantly dry! They felt like glass! Brilliant! And the manicure was a decent price at $15.I will say, my massage was really about 15 seconds long. So that was a bummer. But the rest of the service was good. Would stop by again!

3.description: After being a devout customer to Allure Nails in the West Loop for over a year now, I decided I needed a change after the quality had went drastically downhill. It's hard to find a place that does acrylics anymore, much less good acrylics for a good price but I took the plunge after hearing many good things about West Loop Nail. $32 for a full set, $22 for a fill fit well in my budget and they did a great job! My nails are shaped well, painted nicely, and the customer service is just wonderful. They had E! on the entire time which made the service fly by and the whole salon is very clean. I've gotten endless compliments on them in just the last few days and this will definitely be my go-to nail place in the West Loop from now on.

35.description: As good as any other nail bar overall.  Price on window for Mani no chip/pedi already has yelp coupon applied :-/ you lose a star for that. Need to update chairs. My massage chair did not work. Nice people. Service good.

19.description: Just got back from this place.  Love it.  I have been getting my nails done for years and paying about the same amount and this place offered a lot more service for less money.  I was surprised with how long they spent on my nails.Current special is Monday through Thursday 10:00am-4:00pm, $35 for a regular mani and pedi and $55 for a no-chip mani and pedi.I also had my eyebrows waxed.They did a great job and I am happy!  I will be back.

28.description: I visited West Loop Nail & Spa last week for a mani/pedi.  The nail salon supposedly does not close until 8pm, but when I showed up at 7:30pm I was turned away.  First the nail tech told me that everyone that was in a pedicure chair just so happened to also be getting no-chip manicures, so there would be no time for me to receive ANY services.  Then she suddenly flipped the script and told me that I could be serviced, but I would have to pick either a mani or a pedi.  This was not acceptable.  Why would I drive 30 minutes in heavy traffic plus pay for parking to receive half of my desired services?  I explained this to her and pointed out the fact that they were still open for at least a half hour, not counting the time that would need to be spent cleaning and closing the salon.  The nail tech unapologetically told me that I still could not be seen.    I have patronized this nail salon on other occasions, and the service is already nothing to write home about, but I continued to visit them. This was the last straw and after this incident I will do my best to not patronize them again or recommend them to any friends.  If a business advertises certain business hours online and in their window, they should honor them--even if I had to sit there and wait a few extra minutes for an available tech.  If the nail salon was unable to take on more patrons, the open sign should also not be in the window when I drive past, because you are clearly not open for business.  I have never experienced a service oriented business turning away customers before their business was closed.  Beware of visiting this nail salon if you plan to arrive anytime in the last hour before they close.

45.description: No chip service was awesome ... Best in the city. Every time I go any place else it's just never as good.

33.description: My first visit to West Loop Nail was this weekend.  There were 3 of us and we did not have an appointment.  It was busy but they got us in right away for pedicures.  Since it is December in Chicago I had to put socks and shoes on after drying for an extra long time.  One of my toes got smudged really bad, so I went back the next morning.  They got me in right away and fixed the smudge with no problems.  If you are in the area, West Loop Nails is a good, inexpensive place for a pedicure!

43.description: Great spa pedi for $35.  The staff was nice and the place was clean. Great location for west loopers.

2.description: I can't even begin to tell you how much I loved this place. I went there every two weeks to get my nails done. I knew the staff by name. I was a loyal customer. I now will never go back. I went in one day and was assigned a new employee to do my no chip. It took her two hours to do my nails. My hands were in pain by the end of the process. I had the nail polish all over my skin, chunks of skin missing  and there were parts of the nail that had no polish on it at all. Worst of all I had a wedding the next day. My child could had done a better job. I politely explained I was not happy with the end result. They gave me the option of getting it redone right then and there but with the amount of pain my fingers were in I literally couldn't, my hands were on fire from being over exposed to the LED lights. They demanded I pay for the services and if I wanted a refund I would have to come back the next day when there manager was in store. I was leaving out of town the next morning. I thought this was ridiculous. Even the two of the other nail techs had seen my nails and agreed that what had been done to me was wrong. But still the make shift manager whom they had called yelled at me over the phone saying I am paying no matter what. All in all the customer service there is terrible. They lost a great customer. I always tipped well and had even referred friends to that salon. What a shame.  Your loss guys. Get better management.

18.description: *cash tip only*Vanessa did a great job on removing my no chip without hurting and then doing a no chip mani for me. She was meticulous, which was really necessary since I had my hands filmed for some videos today.I had a pedicure here two months ago and it was good too. I have to say it's nice having the people here speak English, and also know their clients.This may be my new usual spot for nails - happy to have found it in my new area!Took a star off for no tip on credit card.

41.description: *cash tip only*Vanessa did a great job on removing my no chip without hurting and then doing a no chip mani for me. She was meticulous, which was really necessary since I had my hands filmed for some videos today.I had a pedicure here two months ago and it was good too. I have to say it's nice having the people here speak English, and also know their clients.This may be my new usual spot for nails - happy to have found it in my new area!Took a star off for no tip on credit card.

52.description: For me the 2 most important things when getting my nails done is that 1) it's a relaxing experience and 2) the finished product looks good / lasts. This place hits both notes for me :)Love coming here for my pedicures and staple no-chip French manicures. Twan and Vanessa are the best and Their colors always get compliments when I'm out and about. prices are super reasonable and the atmosphere isn't loud or stressful which I appreciate. I have had some of the other technicians with whom I wasn't AS pleased but overall I can't say I've had a bad experience here. Love bringing my 11 year old baby sis too!

50.description: Zero Stars. Not relaxing at all. Came in at 2:30 to relax and get a pedi only to be given a rushed pedicure with a 30 second massage. I looked over only to notice that lady next to me was offered water and given a longer massage that wasn't rushed. Will not return again! I just moved to Chicago from the suburb and I'm used to pedicures Lasting 1 hour, not 20 minutes!! I will never return and also will not reccomend any friends to come. On top of all this, the lady poked me with a pen to get my attention for signing my receipt, how rude is that, could she not just say excuse me!!

4.description: I really like this place. I've been getting a no-chip for the last 4 years...and this is by far my favorite place to go. Vanessa and her staff are always consistent and do a fantastic job on my nails (see pics attached). A must try!

6.description: Mai laid down a sick set of gel nails for me!! I am really particular about the process: completely dry nail bed, bond aid or similar PH balancer, cleaning up any polish on the skin before putting them under the light etc. Mai did not cut a single corner with my manicure. She even appropriately capped off my nails with polish on the tip to prevent chipping. Seriously the best manicure I have had in two years. As a walk in (on a Monday early afternoon) I was seen and seated right away. Sex and the City played in the background and the salon was quiet and serene. It feels very upscale but the soak off and gel manicure was only $35 which feels incredibly reasonable for this level of work.

22.description: I've been using Vanessa's services for no chip manicures and regular pedicures. She is excellent, a perfectionist, and a wonderful person as well.

15.description: This is my go to place for nails. They always look amazing leaving this place. The employees are friendly and very professional. I always make an appointment so it cuts down on the waiting time. If you pay cash they also give you a discount so that's a bonus.

57.description: I recommend not go this place. They use really dirty hot towels and pumices, especially the waxing room is  so dirty. It is better to go pinky because they are much cleaner.

20.description: It was ok. Prices ok. But I wish the girl had scrubbed my feet better. I think she was more in a hurry than wanting to provide a good service. I'll probably go back only if it's something I would need quickly because they are so close to home. Otherwise, I will probably go somewhere else.

36.description: Everyone is very nice, but I came in for a no-chip manicure and a pedicure for my wedding a week and a half ago, and am not thrilled with the results. Unlike the no-chip manicure that I received here previously that lasted for three weeks, this one is already peeling.  I noticed this time during the manicure, that I was directed to only do one process under the lamp as opposed to the two that I had the time before, so I am assuming this was a contributing factor, but I figured that I was only told to do one this time as it was a lighter color....My pedicure also chipped within the week, which is unusual for me...I am sure I will return, as it is close to home, but I don't think it will be a regular place for me, unfortunately.

14.description: I have been here twice for fill ins when I have been in the area. My most recent gel fill in here was really good. Vanessa paid careful attention to detail when completing my nail service and was also gentle with the nail tools. I also got a repaint of my toes which also came out very well.  I am a little confused about their pricing here though. When I made an appointment over the phone I was told a gel fill in was $26 (average). Since I added the repaint on last minute, I figured it would be around $40 with both services, but it was $48, so maybe the toe repaint was $22? (kinda pricey). Despite my price confusion, this is still a good salon with quality services.

58.description: I come here extremely frequently. They have really tasty mini-burgers that are on special on Tuesday evenings. They also have an awesome beer list that includes (not exhaustive by any means) Allagash, Stone, Laguintas, Victory, and Two Brothers. Their Bloody Mary's are also delicious and spicy. The space is really roomy so you never feel cramped. It would, however, be a little pricey if you plan to do serious drinking because craft beers don't come cheap.

56.description: How many bartenders do YOU know that recognize you AND will call you out when you're not at the bar, promptly at 9am, to watch Liverpool get annihilated?Yup, that's what I thought.  Matt the bartender is the man.Even if you're not rolling through Wicker Park, there's hope - you can still catch all of the important Premier League games on HD TV, drink craft beer, and snack on tots at Small Bar's Fullerton location.Three Floyds, Half Acre, and Goose Island on tap are something I don't come across too often on the East Coast.  The hedonist that I am, I'm going to make sure I get my fix (and then some) at Small Bar.  Combined with the amazing sandwiches, burgers, tots, or brunch fare and some footie, and we're golden.Although Small Bar was technically not supposed to open until noon on New Years Day, management opened early for the Liverpool league to watch the game (and we kind of tagged along later on).  That's real dedication to your clientele, right there.You definitely need to follow them on Twitter: @SmallBarFull and take advantage of the Foursquare check-in special.

29.description: I'm not sure how one messes up a bacon cheeseburger. This is one of the simplest items to make, but, nonetheless, Small Bar refused to make it appetizing at all. The patty was crumbly and lukewarm, the cheese was melted on top then solidified from sitting under the warmer for an extended period of time, and the bun was as hard as the crust on a French baguette. And burnt, crunchy fries? This is not something I should have paid $10 for.In addition, the server seemed to give exactly zero shits about my party. We sat for 20 minutes waiting for him to take our order while tables mere feet from us who had come later were being helped. We finally got his attention and he took our order, then waited another hour for our food to arrive. And this wasn't complicated stuff, just lunch food -- sandwiches and burgers.I think the only thing this place has going for it is its large beer selection. Avoid Small Bar if you actually want to eat good food in a timely manner.

42.description: Was our favorite bar in the city - great food, excellent service, and healthy beer selection. Unfortunately, small bar is going through an identity crisis and has forgotten it's a bar. The staff and beer selection are still great, but the food is now awful. All our favorites have been replaced by poorly conceived and executed dishes. No hot wings, pizza, or hummus. 5 burgers have been replaced by one. Tots have been replaced with bland potatoes. The three dishes we ordered in our two visits since the menu change were not flavorful or enjoyable. Cold, visibly fatty, and unsatisfying sums it up.I'm afraid that if you want our bar business, you are failing. If you want our fine dining business, you are failing.SB, please become the great place you used to be. Until then, I'm afraid  we wont be there often ....

23.description: After hearing multiple friends singing this establishment's praises, I decided to check this place out with some pals (after being told the wait at Kuma's was TWO HOURS!) and we were glad we did. Even though the menu is small, the food was stellar! My BBQ Pulled Pork sandwich was perfect; not overly saucy and the pieces were large and juicy. And the grilled corn with ancho chili butter... I think that was one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten in my life. My pals were impressed with their selections as well.I know that this place is all about the beer, but that's not really my thing. But if you do go here for a brew with some friends be sure to get some grub as well. You won't regret it. It's fantastic.

47.description: I had dollar sliders and a beer my first time here. It was a late and night during the week and there was still a sizeable crowd. I also ordered a side of fries that were huge but kind of burned. The beer selection is amazing but they did not have Blue Moon and that was kind of a downer but the server suggested something that was very good. I will go back, it's right down the street.

8.description: Weekday drinker, checking in.Lincoln Park....I can never get away from you. I usually come here to grab a bite with drinks. The food is pretty good but quite pricey. They have several booths, tables, and even an upstairs section. It should be called "not so small smallbar". They run several drink special throughout the week. this bar also has several craft beers for a craft beer junkie to get lost in. The bar is pretty intimate and dimly lit.I usually come here to blow some steam...as i needed it today. cheers small bar!

31.description: With a killer tap selection and now a great new menu, there's a lot to like about Small Bar Fullerton. They have a great staff and overall have good prices on the beers; they haven't bought into that "every beer needs to be $9 mentality." If you're paying for a great craft beer why should your only option be a burger or nachos when you're at a bar. Small Bar is hitting that perfect price point for a solid night out; right in line with what we see Fountainhead doing. I've been in a few times since they switched to the new menu and everything I've had has been pretty tasty. A few of my favorites were the Tomato Jam & Cheese, White Fish Sandwich, and the Patty melt. I do miss their tater tots from the old menu but the wedges are a pretty good substitute. I've had some really great nights at Small Bar Fullerton. I'd agree with Sarah H., "Small Bar is doing it up right."

34.description: Probably my favorite bar in the city. What was an awesome place to grab a pint, eat some good grub, and catch some Soccer games, has turned into a full on Gastropub with a new inventive menu.Love the new touches, and all of the fresh, not processed ingredients. Had the new Sliders and blew the old sliders out of the water, and the Carmelized Onion Aioli with the potatoes, I would drink it with a straw it was so good. Really excited to try out the new brunch before a Fire game, or for an early EPL game when the season starts back up. Keep up the good work guys.

16.description: Went here a while back with fellow yelpstress, Melissa Q! Whoohoo to Melissa Q!Anyway...the name of this place threw me. I pictured cozier...european-er. Maybe since I heard it was a soccer bar, I imagined lots of Europeans. That would be nice......But no, it's very very big, very uncozy, and well, cold. I found the stools to be much too large. This place should be called "Large Bar."Oh well. My salad was really good, and so were the steaming tater tots. The bartender started out snobby, because I openly admitted I don't like expensive beer. But as the night went on, he got better :)  Oh, and the food is slightly overpriced.
