13.description: It's a funny thing about siblings.  Even though they all spring from the same source, they can be vastly different.  Nowhere is this more true than my family and the Small Bar family.  Like my family, the first two children settled in the Hipsterville (or as I have started calling it, All-Star City) sub-neighborhoods of Logan Square and Ukrainian Village(ish).  The youngest of my parent's children still lives in Michigan but, were he to move to Chicago (with my family history, probably an inevitability), he would almost certainly call Lincoln Park home - just like the youngest Small Bar.Each Small Bar, like the peeps in my family, definitely reflect the neighborhood around them.  And I have to say that my fraternity-belonging, libertarian tax revolting, glad handing, brother would be right at home at Small Bar Fullerton.  I still like it though, honestly (just like my own little brother).  This establishment has used the beautiful place it built in very well.  With high ceilings, an ornate bar, a large, segregated, upstairs private party area, and a lot of tables it is a joy to behold visually.  Plus, since it's still a Small Bar, it shows soccer, has a fantastic brunch menu, has delicious $5 veggie chili bowls, serves yummy tots (which, when dipped in wasabi mayo, made my taste buds ecstatic), and has hired a friendly, knowledgeable (of both beer and soccer), hip, and quick staff.  As far as the evening patrons go, however, they might as well have wandered over from Faith & Whiskey next door (and many of them probably have).  Can't blame a bar for its clientele, though, unless the bar dictates them.  But Small Bar Fullerton does.  The music (fake hip-hop, son!), the lighting level (they keep this place drunken amateur-hour hookup dark), and the prices (*cough* trust fund? *cough*) all fit in with other bars in the surrounding area.  Plus they often have Coors Light on special?  Come on!  Ordering that beer at Small Bar Division Street would definitely get you dirty looks (at least).Not that this special choice reflects the general beer selection.  Just like the two other Small Bars, Fullerton has carefully crafted their beer menu so packed with imports and craft beers that it has taken me multiple visits just to try every stout on their menu (I believe I counted five, but I may have missed one or two).  My favorite is the Lion Stout from Japan which is served in an adorably small can and pours like motor oil.  However, it kicks like a mule, and tastes like liquid heaven.  Fullerton also, like the other two Small Bars, have beer tastings and roll out events.  One of these was Stone Brewing event last weekend with all three Small Bars participating.  Taking this supplied free trolley to the other two locations, I was reminded why I like them better.  They're more intimate, less douchey, and a little rougher around the edges (in a good way).Again, it's not that I dislike SB3 (I actually frequent it the most), it's just different than the other two.  And by different I, sadly, mean kind of the same as a million other bars.

11.description: The bar may be small, but there's certainly nothing small about the stock of beer behind the bar. And that's what beckons me here -- beautiful beers made for sipping and not slamming.Which brings me to this -- not sure why, but there's something about this stretch of Fullerton that I don't care for. It's a bit cold and almost industrial. Anyway, guess I'm used to the cozy, warm confines of the Small Bar on Albany Ave. Sure, this location is prettied-up and glossy, but it's missing some heart. Know what I mean?I did enjoy my time at the bar (yummy hummus platter and two Belgians), but felt a little claustrophobic upstairs. Maybe it was the seating 'arrangement'? Yes, it felt a bit like an arrangement with its long tables perfectly-spaced apart. But once we got everyone moving and mingling it was a brand-new party!I'd definitely come back for some quality time with a friend at the bar and a brew or two. Maybe it's just not the best venue for a larger group, unless you're able to land one of the huge booths downstairs. Oh, and the burger menu is very tempting!

39.description: Stopped in here with a friend last Thursday after having lunch at Pequods. There's a small section of outdoor seating (which would be nice if the weather would cooperate for more than 2 days in a row). It was pretty much empty inside, but seeing as how it was only around 3:30 I can't say I was shocked. I've never been here before so I was pleasantly surprised at their beer selection! Plenty of bottles and a surprisingly good amount on tap as well. Drafts are relatively cheap, starting at $5. Went with an Allagash White and some sort of German stout(forgot the name). Both were good though. Can't comment on the food or how it is at night, but definitely served its purpose for a few beers and good conversation with a friend. It's probably more of a 3 star place, but the bartender was extremely friendly and charged my phone for me so the extra star is deserved.  Oh, it's also apparently a USMNT official bar, so would probably be a lot of fun to check out a Gold Cup or World Cup game.

37.description: Smallbar is definitely one of my favorite bars in the city.  The staff is knowledgable and friendly.  The beer selection on draft and in bottles is stellar.  The food has gone from good to great!  How can you be mad at an establishment changing up it's menu to be seasonal, local and sustainable?  Don't get me wrong I loved the old menu and will miss some of the items but I'm definitely embracing and excited with the current changes and what's to come.  You can get nachos, wings and burgers anywhere.  Keep it tasty and different.

0.description: This place has had a positive impact on my life in the following ways:-Chopped pork, bacon, jalapenos, giardiniera, delicious bun.  -Tempura battered cheese curds, some kind of Sriracha laced dipping sauce.  -Brussell sprouts, bacon.-A book of beers.

38.description: Been going to Small Bar since March of last year, mostly for soccer matches. Love the new menu. We did the beef hotlinks as an app. Then I picked the Whitefish Sandwich w/ the side salad & garlic dressing. Insanely good. My girlfriend had two sliders and the potato waffle chips. Fantastic. I like this new menu way better. Though I'll miss the GCB the menu is now something beyond bar food. They support the Chicago Fire Soccer Club and show all their matches too!

51.description: GREAT beer and good food!  There is much to be desired about Small Bar.  First, it's a pretty chill place...I'll even go as so far as saying, yea, you could have a date here....low noise level, you can easily grab a booth or sit at the bar on most nights.Second, the beer selection is one of the best in Chicago....they are always adding/dropping new items; the menu includes a large draft selection as well as numerous bottles.  The staff is "beer knowledgeable" as well...which is key. Third, the food is good...pay attention to the menu -- the items that they recommend have a marking...look for that.  Other's seem to be hit and miss...so if you're a first timer...stick with their recommendations from the menu.They have a good chicken sandwich...but again (if you read my reviews) tops for Chicken Sandwich (especially buffalo) goes to Stanleys.  They have a good chili and the salads (southwest chicken salad) are pretty good.  Burgers are excellent and huge.. Feel free to ask for sweet potato fries instead of regular fries. Also, the pizza's are popular...and may be their #1...it seems every time I'm in there folks are ordering pizza, but I have yet to do so. The fried cheese curds are good/ok...my peeve is so many places fry this stuff....where can I just get curds!?  I was not happy with the calamari...but otherwise, the fare is good....just stick to the popular bar items that are marked on the menu and this place is a great choice for food along with your favorite brew.

27.description: Here is a perfect example of it's not broke, don't fix it. Still a great beer selection. I used to love the food, and they made everything "organic". If I wanted fancy organic food, I'd go to Sprout next door. PUT THE OLD MENU BACK!!!

32.description: I LOVE the new menu.... such interesting flavors and variety. High quality food in a comfortable atmosphere.  Especially love the decor at Fullerton.... stained glass and all.Beer selection is always tops, service is super friendly.... and the owner has popped over to say hi on more then a couple of my visits.Big fan.... I often bring coworkers there for some relaxing report.

54.description: This month's special, Small Ball derriere, I mean Small Bar pale ale (two brothers), daisy cutter, and carlsberg on special for $4. Your very own personal HDTV for the table! Helluva spacious booths for all the clammering, hollering you can muster in a sports bar.Scrumptious Phoenix skillet with chorizo layered into baked eggs on hash browns with salsa on top.The place is pretty cavernous for a small bar, with a whole upstairs full of thumping Barcelonians catching a soccer match, and a packed first floor watching the Bears beat the pants off the Seachickens.Not to mention 4 stalls for the women, cause this  place KNOWS who counts when choosing where to catch some Sunday football.

48.description: Weekday drinker, checking in.Lincoln Park....I can never get away from you. I usually come here to grab a bite with drinks. The food is pretty good but quite pricey. They have several booths, tables, and even an upstairs section. It should be called "not so small smallbar". They run several drink special throughout the week. this bar also has several craft beers for a craft beer junkie to get lost in. The bar is pretty intimate and dimly lit.I usually come here to blow some steam...as i needed it today. cheers small bar!

44.description: I'm NOT happy. I used to love this place, and would order food from here atleast twice a week.. (same story for all of my co-workers..). It was easily the best bar food I'd had in quite some time. And then, everything changed. Literally. They completely changed their menu, and have taken off every good thing that they used to have! It's been tweaked to appear more like their neighbor Sprout. For example, they used to serve tater tots, fries, etc. as side dishes... now, you can choose from fava beans, pumpkin seeds and the like. I'm uber disappointed, and I'm hoping that they bring back some of the stuff that kept us coming back weekly! Until then, we're on the prowl for a new place nearby that has awesome quesadillas like Small Bar used to!!

24.description: (3.5)Stopped in for a late lunch the other day. There was one guy (with a broken arm!) working for all the tables. This was a recipe for SLOW service. He was really nice though and got everything right!The table ordered the pimento cheese. I love that pimento cheese. The char on the bread and the pesto...so good. We also ordered the farmers cheese with charred bread and tomato jam. That is also tremendously good. I'd eat that tomato jam on just about anything. Since we'd barely eaten all day we also got an order of the pickled veggies. They were just pickled red onion slices, asparagus spears and a couple small carrots. They were ok, but definitely my least favorite of the three.I ordered the fish sandwich with the green salad on the side. The salad was ok, though the dressing wasn't my favorite. The fish was crispy and had a nice batter. Overall the food was ok, but next time I might stick with apps and beers on the patio. Nice little patio area out front and a great beer list. I'm not often in this area but I might be back.

7.description: As my homie Jason Z said this place is not small (The location on Division is).  Its actually quite a nice size. They have an upstairs area which seems to be for private parties maybe...The service was great and they have a nice beer list. The buffalo spring rolls were very flavorless...I expected more from them. All in all, I wouldn't mind coming back for another go round at this joint

49.description: I love Small Bar more than most bars in the city. There are 3 important things a great bar must have: 1.) A Great Beer List 2.) Great Food 3.) Awesome Music.The Beer: They have an amazing beer list and they have Allegash White on Tap!The Food: The Chili was by far the best thing I ate there. It had huge chunks of beef in it and it was just incredible. My burger was really good but Kuma's is still king.The Music: So that night they were playing The Beatles White Album in it's entirety while the Chicago Fire were playing on the tube! I never wanted to leave, but we did.I will be back and I am going to drink a lot more than I did last Friday night.

40.description: We should have left when we sat down and the host announced that they were redoing their menu, never a good sign.  Then, on a Saturday night they tell as, as we are ordering, that they are out of wings.  In the meantime we kept seeing people coming in and getting food for another bar down the street, Faith & Whiskey.  After at least 40 minutes we still didn't have our food and the Faith & Whiskey people had complained that all of their food was done incorrectly.  Finally we got our food, it was cold, the thin cut fries that promised cheese on them had no cheese to be seen.  The waitress had told us the burgers came with lettuce and tomato, we didn't get them with our burgers.  I had asked how the Kale was prepared, sauteed?  She assured me it was sauteed, and then the bowl of fried and greasy Kale was set in front of me.  Even though the manager comped the entire meal, I wouldn't go back, at least not if I was hungry!!!

53.description: Solid bar through and though.  Great beer selection, currently Half Acre Daisy Cutter is on special for $4, decent food and cute hipster waiters.  The sweet potato fries are battered which is unique but quite tasty.  There is an upstairs/ mezzanine section for overflow and plenty of TVs. The menu is pretty extensive, even offering poutine, you can't find that anywhere in the states, I'll definitely be back for that!

30.description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere of this place. The bar in general is nice, with new updates (no 'this place is grimy' feeling). The whitefish sandwich was amazing; crispy exterior and moist delicious interior. I enjoyed some Two Brothers brew, and also Franziskaner (my fave)! The waitress was very knowledgeable, and happy to make suggestions on food and drinks. The only downfall was that the bartender was kind of rude... we asked him if they had any "specials or happy hour" drinks, and he went into a rant about the city of Chicago not having happy hour. Ok dude, just give us the beer special then. So silly. I don't know why he was so intent on correcting us. Anyway, would definitely recommend this place to any of my friends.

46.description: Just visited for my first time tonight. Great atmosphere and spectacular service to go along with it. There was a business event going on upstairs and it wasn't loud or overcrowded, we hardly even noticed the event was taking place. Me and my friend both got burgers, and they were cooked perfectly, down to the fried egg on top. I was there during the early evening hours and the the ambiance of the space is very comfortable-not too many people and not too loud. The service was great, the waitress didn't annoy us, but came often enough to meet our needs.Cute bar in Lincoln Park, I definitely will be returning!

1.description: Good salad, great beer list, mediocre chili and the service?  Still virtually non existent.We could see the food sitting out ready to be served, even mentioned it to the bartender and still it sat.  Really?

55.description: My only complaint is that they don't serve dessert!  Yes, I know, its just a bar but c'mon people gimme a brownie or something!I've been here twice for bear's games and each time it was good,  the service can be slower than average if there is one guy waiting on 15 tables but it's fine.  I know how it is to work in a restaurant.This last time I went, we snagged a booth that had its own TV, sweet!!  I had their burgers and pizza, both solid choices.  I'd be happy to come back to watch more games.  On a side note: it can get a little cold in here, turn up the heat please!

9.description: Small Bar was just fine.Great selection of beers on tap and decent food options.I appreciate that it must have been difficult to wait on our group for Beer Appreciation Society, especially with a cash bar, but it took forever to get a drink. The set-up on the upstairs level made it less than easy to mix and mingle, plus it was hotter than a mofo up there. Seriously, I was schvitzing.By 11:00 I was in need of some grease to stave off certain drunkenness, so I ordered some tots. And I waited. And then I waited some more. After about 30 minutes, I finally tracked down the waitress and inquired about my food. She was surprised that I hadn't gotten them and even asked me if I was sure that I hadn't already. I'm pretty sure I would have remembered eating them, so I asked her if she'd bring me another order. After about 15 minutes she came back with them and said that someone else claimed the original order.They were some pretty darn tasty tots, but by then I'd have eaten the ones that were ground up and smashed on the floor by other Yelpers.***To whoever snatched my original order of tots, please note that as a redhead, I have a built in feistiness, which is only amplified when food is involved. I will be on high alert at the next Beer Appreciation Society event for signs of food pilfering. Consider yourself warned.***

26.description: This is the only decent sit-down lunch option near my office, so we end up here fairly regularly. Yes, the old menu was great for greasy and hearty (the tater tots in particular are sorely missed), but I really dig the new menu. The salads are big and unique and there's poutine! Homemade waffle chips are good, too. My coworkers are still on the fence, though.I've only been here once or twice in the evening, but every time we go for lunch, the servers are super friendly and cool. That said, it's terrifically slow for lunch, which makes no sense considering that we're usually one of three groups in there, tops.

25.description: Used to go here several times a month, but not anymore. Love the beer selection, but the new menu is awful. Thats fine if you want to add some fancy selections, but dont get rid of the things you did so well (southwestern salad, chicken wings, buffalo chicken rolls). Please bring back some normal bar food.

12.description: Visited Small Bar Fullerton to watch some NCAA action with the up and coming "Mayor", Michael G. (Go Spartans!) As a big fan of Small Bar Division, I was super excited to see what they did to this old pool hall that was made famous in the Color of Money.The church lights and stained glass are great decorating touches. The two booths look like huge church pews, and they have their own private flat screens, nice! Church Win! In addition, there are two GIGANTIC flat screens in the bar and two smaller ones, so seeing the game from anywhere is not a problem.Small Bar was smart and they are borrowing tattooed employees from SB Avondale to help wait tables here. The waitress that made sure we got our first beer was easy on the eyes, and super sweet! Our waiter was cool and service was spot on all night.The beer list is of course, HUGE! I did an around-the-world thing and came back to something called Avery Daisy Cutter that honestly tasted like freshly mowed grass! Hopperific! The cup of beef chili was just spicy enough, and their tots were good.The Lincoln Park element did start to filter in around 10pm, but I would have no problem whatsoever coming back for football (soccer to you and me), an afternoon Pint, or the NCAA final game. Hopefully I get the Confessional with its own personal flat screen! Bless Me, Small Bar, for I have sinned!

59.description: Went here on a whim with a friend of mine after a concert. We went back the night after. Then again later that week. Now I've started to drag other friends there. Some of the door guys have started to recognize us. It's crazy good. Probably my favorite overall bar in Chicago.The ambiance is great. Feels classy, but still like a pub. Not a bad place for a date, also not a bad place to order some chips and salsa and watch a game. Seems to get less crowded after 10:30 or so, even on the weekends, which is SUPER refreshing. Good place to have a conversation on a Friday or Saturday night, unlike most other bars in Lincoln Park.The bartenders and waitstaff are quirky, friendly, and always down to suggest a good beer. If it's not busy and you feel like talking, they'll definitely chat. Maybe about tattoos, maybe about when they were bartending at this place downtown and chilling with the Cool Kids, maybe about characters in the Chicago metal scene. Waitresses are friendly and attentive, even when it's busy. Also, the music they play there is eclectic but entertaining and appropriate. It's nice to not have to listen to "Like a G6" all night.The food isn't bad. I've never been for dinner. Chips and salsa weren't bad. Neither was the poutine, which I wouldn't expect to see outside Montreal. Not much else to say here. Unremarkable, but solid.What really makes Small Bar stand out is the beer. Their beer list is long, varied, and has a bunch of unique stuff on it (and also hilarious). They have a barley wine, a flemish sour, and a smoked helles. All on tap. They've got local-ish breweries like Three Floyds and Bell's, as well as Rochefort (Belgium) and Hitachino (Japan, but actually good.) And they have two kinds of Lindemans. For your girlfriend.Combination of the service, the ambiance, and the beer makes this place the tops.

21.description: In Michael Pollan's book "The Omnivore's Dilemma," he talks about having The Perfect Meal.  It doesn't necessarily mean that its the best tasting, the most artfully crafted, or beautiful plate of food.  His description is that it was a meal that had all the necessary ingredients for success come together at the exact moment you had the meal.I believe I had The Perfect Meal at Small Bar the other night.  A perfect combination of service, food, and drinks led to an extremely enjoyable experience.  The lady and I were going to see a friend's play down the street and had a Drink Deck card for Small Bar - Fullerton.  We stopped in and it wasn't overly busy and were promptly seated and served water.  The drink menu is robust without being overwhelming and they even had Ephémère on tap!  We split a wonderfully smoky side of poutine, which has convinced me to put together a bar crawl of all the places that serve this delightful Canadian delicacy.  Crispy bacon was a nice addition.  We also split the Smoked Chicken Club and was blown away by the flavors interacting in it.  Our meal was topped off by a great beer cocktail that had fresh mint in it.  It was a great meal and while I'm not typically in that area much I'd be more than happy to stop in again.  Again, The Perfect Meal.

17.description: Sooooo happy these folks opened up a location off the redline. I still love the one out on division along the blue line, but its just a pain for me to get there.... so thats why I have been coming here more often in the past few months.They have a great covered patio out front.... it was pouring out and we sat out there...great to listen to the rain and eat some super yummy food. I had a buffalo chicken sandwich. The sauce was exactly what I like.... hot and tasty. My roomate got a mush-swiss burger and couldnt shutup about how awesome it was (so it HAS to be good since hes a burger fiend).... they have a great beer menu with all kinds of different specials. I got a londons pride, it is a soccer bar afterall haha. I came here for a sunday English Premiere League bunch (go Chelsea!!) and wow I was surprised with the food. I figured it would just be some simple breakfast food... no... some of the best biscuits and gravy I have ever had!! One of my friends got french toast that looked amazing.So thats the best part about this bar.... most bars have your typical pub food that is ok/good but all the same. This place really has some unique foods and some really good twists to normal boring pub food. oh, and again its a SOCCER bar.on the inside there is an upstairs area for additional seating, and some comfortable booths on the main floor. I also noticed they have some Das Boots hanging around the bar... I forget how much it was for one, but yeah awesome.

10.description: I didn't NOT like Small Bar... I just wasn't anywhere close to thinking it's awesome.  Despite the well above-average beer list (yay for Allagash White on tap), something  left me kind of cold.  Was it the looooong wait for the waitress to distribute beers to our party?  Perhaps the fact that the staff was not willing to let our large party that took over the upstairs loft move the tables to the side so we could, you know, actually mingle rather than sit in rows like we were at a wedding.  Maybe the perfectly nice, yet totally sterile décor.I don't know... I just wasn't falling all overmyself with glee over Small Bar.  It's alright.  I would definitely go back.  I just won't be running to get there.

5.description: First went to Small Bar with a friend who lives in Chicago to catch the World Cup.  This is one of the best soccer bars I have been to.  There is usually a good mix of fans there.  The food is excellent.  I have never had a bad meal there.  For the world cup, my usual meal would be one of their breakfast skillets.  I believe it is the Phoenix, but it has Chorizo in it!!! I am a huge fan of Chorizo especially with eggs, potatoes and hot sauce.  It is great in the morning with a nice brew as well.The beer selection at Small Bar is stellar.  There is a huge variety of local micro-brews in bottle and on tap.  I have never been disappointed with the selection.  The only issue is their drinks can get expensive after about 3 or 4 rounds.Like I said before this is a soccer bar.  Anytime the US Men's National Team plays, there is no place I would rather be if I cannot make it to the game.  The Chicago Fire support group, Section 8, also realize how awesome of a soccer bar this is and have a beer bus that will take you from either Small Bar location to the stadium for $10.

3.description: Everything was just ok. Our waitress seemed attentive at the beginning, but we slowly lost her as the meal went on. They have a great beer selection which is a plus, and their menu seems great (seems being the key word), but the execution just wasn't there. Had their chili, which was more like a stew, and the chicken sandwich which was kind of hard to chew.On a high note, our table shared their cheese curds for an appetizer which were pretty outstanding. We also had their fries that come with bacon gravy and were REALLY salty, but I guess that's to be expected. One member of our party received her food 10 minutes before everyone else which is a pet peeve of mine. Nothing is more awkward than telling someone they can eat while everyone is starting at their food. Decent meal, not worth the $30 I paid, there are plenty of other places that I'd rather try before going back.

35.description: Everyone seems to rave about their beer list. While it is good (not great), it seems that no one that works there actually knows the first thing about what they serve. I can't speak to the food there as I have only gone there at night for the beer and atmosphere.One thing I will say after three times being there, the bartenders/servers are complete douche bags - ironic because the original small bar was known for its friendly attitude and talkative staff.The location on fullerton actually stuns me with how jerky the bartenders are. I am literally shocked at how rude they were to my friends (I personally didn't have a run in), but witnessed several instances of utter bitchiness, including (1) giving one person shit for ordering a water (he was the DD), (2) mocking another for ordering bud light (when "clearly" they only serve Miller or whatever), (3) getting all huffy when we returned two stouts when the order was for two Allagash Whites, (4) telling that we had better move because he was 85% likely to spill water on us...the list goes on, sadly.If you can deal with total and utter lack of customer service and an attitude intended to make you feel like a homeless person in a Ritz lobby, go for it.

19.description: In Michael Pollan's book "The Omnivore's Dilemma," he talks about having The Perfect Meal.  It doesn't necessarily mean that its the best tasting, the most artfully crafted, or beautiful plate of food.  His description is that it was a meal that had all the necessary ingredients for success come together at the exact moment you had the meal.I believe I had The Perfect Meal at Small Bar the other night.  A perfect combination of service, food, and drinks led to an extremely enjoyable experience.  The lady and I were going to see a friend's play down the street and had a Drink Deck card for Small Bar - Fullerton.  We stopped in and it wasn't overly busy and were promptly seated and served water.  The drink menu is robust without being overwhelming and they even had Ephémère on tap!  We split a wonderfully smoky side of poutine, which has convinced me to put together a bar crawl of all the places that serve this delightful Canadian delicacy.  Crispy bacon was a nice addition.  We also split the Smoked Chicken Club and was blown away by the flavors interacting in it.  Our meal was topped off by a great beer cocktail that had fresh mint in it.  It was a great meal and while I'm not typically in that area much I'd be more than happy to stop in again.  Again, The Perfect Meal.

28.description: Small Bar is a neighborhood bar for me so I've been there quite a few times. They have an extensive beer selection and a better-than-bar-food menu.  Gumballhead and a chopped salad make a perfect lunch!

45.description: Small bar gets 3 stars for its AMAZING food, and great beer selection.However, it is not worth 5 stars for 2 reasons. One, because I had my birthday there, and I was promised a table for all of my guests, and threatened with a $200 charge if all my party did not arrive within 90 minutes. Despite all of this I was not give a table but rather three separate tables which made it pretty obvious that they really did noting to accommodate me.Also, the service was sub-par. The wait staff was somewhat rude, and knew very little about the beer and food, also they forgot to put in our appetizer. All in all, its a great place and I do plan to come back

33.description: I am surprised to read any negative comments about the new menu. Really people, the complaint is that you miss tater tots and nachos? Don't we have enough places that serve typical bar food in Chicago?  I thoroughly commend Small Bar for taking the initiative to bring a higher quality of delicious food (ie: not processed) to the bar scene. It's about time. The tomato jam & cheese is amazing (tastes like bacon!), the beef hot links, and the Smoked Chicken Club is out of this world. Paired with one of their many craft beers, or specialty cocktails, who could ask for more!  Can't wait to go back for another visit.

43.description: Been patronizing this place since they opened. Staff always top notch. Remember your name and poison. Always nice selection of craft beers and their new cocktail is pretty cool. Where they lost me is the new chef (used loosely) Yes they needed to make a change there and freshen up the menu a little. Instead they have some pretentious menu that is poorly executed and 180 from where it was. I ordered three things from the menu . None of then hit the mark or for that point the target. There was only 3 or 4 people total and it was the middle of the afternoon. They were hardly "in the weeds"First I was told the Bacon Fried Almonds that I ordered were not available. Then they were. Soggy, sticky and without crunch in a half filled ramekin that looked like an old ash tray. They also came out with rest of order after 20 minutes. I expected them to be warm and toasty not cloying and mushyNachos as simple and mundane as they are can be a great bar snack when done right. The old pulled pork nachos did that well. The smoked brisket nachos were cold lumps of fat. The cheese wasn't even melted through and the chips were soggy from grease. Who wants creme fraiche on on flavorless cold budget cut of meatSorry you had to refire them after they came out wrong the first time.  letting the patrons see you throw your hands in the air in disgust after putting them up in the service window which were worse the the second time just shows lack of professionalism and emotional controlThe sliders were the best of what we had. Not saying much.The onion straws were nice, The bacon was cold and congealed  The burgers were over cooked and room temp by the time the nachos came up. Which took over twenty minutes. I know this because of the huge clock they hung over kitchen window (restaurant 101, never remind people how long they been waiting, No clocks in casinos or bars much either) I hope they get it sorted and fast otherwise I think.they may have jumped the shark.  I frequented SB with a bunch a different friends before as it was a great bar in the neighborhood with above average staff and food. I can get a beer anywhere which I think may now be the case

2.description: Came here for the CSSC's opening party, so I may be swayed by the free drinks or that fact that we lucked out and got one of the huge booths !The food was really good, I had the chicken taco salad which was really good, could have done with more romaine lettuce and less giant white chunks of regular lettuce, but still good. My friend had the buffalo wings, the looked really good, very meaty, she said they were pretty spicy but in a good way. We also had a burger and sweet potato fries at our table, the fries were seasoned well and the burger was gone in about 1 minutes so I'm gonna say it was good too !Good service, cool all wood bar and overhead lanterns that look like they are from an old church, good food, a little loud for my liking but thats pretty much everywhere in this city !! I can't wait to go back !!

18.description: I've been here a couple of times now, and became an instant fan. I love basically everything about it--the ambiance, decor, and even its logo is awesome (yea, I'm a nerd). It's a great spot for a casual date or a hangout with a group.The staff is super friendly, which is always a plus. The food is pretty good too, generous portions and fast service. I've tried a couple of beers off their extensive drink list, and a cocktail, which was really tasty and strong!I've also heard good things about their brunch, so maybe I'll come back to catch a Bears game and try that out. Fortunately, I just moved a couple of blocks from here, so needless to say I will definitely be back more often!

41.description: 3.5 stars. I don't know if there's anything in particular that sets this bar apart from any other besides for the fact that it's a great place to watch soccer games. I went here with some friends on the weekend to watch a game and everyone at the bar was there to watch the game. It was a fun atmosphere so I would definitely go back to watch soccer.I was kind of hungover from the night before so I only drank a bloody mary. It was good but not great. It seemed like they had a good beer selection though.

52.description: I really enjoy the small bar. It's one of my favorite spaces. They touted themselves as a soccer bar on my first visit. The inside is very nice and the bartenders have all been pretty cool and very knowledgeable about the beer. They have a patio, and I have sat out there a few times (when the weather permitted.) If you don't have cushion on your backside, I'd recommend staying inside because the wooden seats outside are not that comfy. I have had their breakfast: it was French toast, I think . . .the bread was really thick and I believe they put bananas on it- YUCK to the bananas- the bread was o.k. Iv'e also had their bar food, and that was better. I recommend the sliders. You get six of them and the meat is seasoned very well. I also recommend pairing them with the sweat potato fries. They have a good beer selection and it was here that I was introduced to Lindeman's Framboise and Founders Cerise (a cherry wheat beer) and they were excellent!!!Here's the NITTY GRITTYoMbIoUns= pretty COOL They have a nice bar, high tables and chairs and booths. sTaFf= they have all been NICE to me. I likes. They have all been very knowledgeable about the beer and given that I am a novice beer drinker, they have been extremely helpful.pRiCe= REASONABLEfOOd= it's not the best, but taste good with the BEER***Side notes- parking can be a challenge.

50.description: I went here during awkward hour on a Saturday. Our group made up over half the patrons in the bar, but the service was still pretty bad- slow and inaccurate.  They have an insane beer selection so this is a great place to try some weird ones.  Unfortunately, one of our group was asked to leave for really no reason which leaves a bad taste in my mouth about this place.  It's really cozy and I love the exposed brick.

4.description: With a killer tap selection and now a great new menu, there's a lot to like about Small Bar Fullerton. They have a great staff and overall have good prices on the beers; they haven't bought into that "every beer needs to be $9 mentality." If you're paying for a great craft beer why should your only option be a burger or nachos when you're at a bar. Small Bar is hitting that perfect price point for a solid night out; right in line with what we see Fountainhead doing. I've been in a few times since they switched to the new menu and everything I've had has been pretty tasty. A few of my favorites were the Tomato Jam & Cheese, White Fish Sandwich, and the Patty melt. I do miss their tater tots from the old menu but the wedges are a pretty good substitute. I've had some really great nights at Small Bar Fullerton. I'd agree with Sarah H., "Small Bar is doing it up right."

6.description: Small Bar was my favorite bar that came outta my trip to Chicago. Out of all the places I visited this was a tap line up that really impressed me. This review is based on the beer selection only as I didn't eat here. They have a great selection of taps and bottles and I learned alot of cool stuff about Midwest brews from the very friendly bartender. Big selection paired with friend staff and good conversation is a win every time. They saw it was my birthday and hooked me up with a free beer....you cant beat that can you??? If your around in the area and looking for some good good beers...and are sick of drinking the 312's stop in here you wont regret it. CHEERS!!!!!

22.description: Not top not notch and there is a much better selection of good sports bars in the area. Really slow service and kind of a boring atmosphere. We tried the Tomato and Goat Cheese Jam and Sausage apps and both were hugely lacking in flavor. We came for a friends birthday, and someone at the table told us the manager was raving and really pumped about their new menu, which was weird since everything we tried was sub par. There is nothing necessarily wrong about Small Bar, I just feel there are much better options in the area if you are looking for a night out,

15.description: For no good reason I wanted to get out of the house last night for some new, cheap food. @SmallBarFull fit the bill. I had no idea the Small Bar franchise was soccer centric, but it was a welcomed change especially with World Cup fever in the air. Also, when they say "Small" Bar, they mean it. It's not a big space but it doesn't need to be. There is a nice long bar on one side, a few large bench tables on the other side and table-tops in between. The menu fits with the setting serving pizza, sandwiches and bar food starters. Additionally, the beer list is as good as I've seen in a while with many craft brews on tap. While the food wasn't bad, I'd make a return trip focusing on drinking and not eating. As for the food, we started with a bowl of their "fabled" veggie chili. I love chili so I was a little disappointed when the bowl resembled a bean salad more than chili. I love beans, but chili to me is still tomato based with onions, spice and cheese. It also came with a mound of sour cream (to each their own I respect), which kind of defeats the purpose of a vegetarian healthy dish. I enjoyed the beans, flavors and cheese, it just wasn't what I would call veggie chili. We were craving pizza so we browsed the very appealing pizza list and went with the BBQ chicken. The pizza's are 14'', so they serve more than two people, and cost $14. I was impressed with the pizza, but not blown away. Very good for bar food, especially something other than pepperoni or plain. I forgot that BBQ pizza is hard to eat a lot of, and we should have ordered something simpler for our own tastes. I would be curious to try their other pies, especially vegetarian focused options. The beer was great, the service attentive and friendly, and the food above average for bar standards. I think the value is only mediocre. I'm also very surprised that there are no daily food specials, something that cash strapped Chicago bar goers seek. Since I don't live down the street I might not make the trek, but the beer menu is fantastic and the next time I want to watch Euro soccer or a World Cup match, I'll head to my local Small Bar.

57.description: What is there not to like about Small Bar on Fullerton? You've got two giant HD TVs to watch your favorite sports games, the staff is very knowledgeable about soccer and friendly and the food is great. Let's say you are a raging alcoholic, you're even going to find a deep beer menu that will leave your taste buds dazzled.I first went to Small Bar Fullerton to hop on the Section 8 Chicago Fire fan bus that drives you to the Chicago Fire game. Before people load up on the bus, they get loaded at the bar and all meet up there. Small Bar is a very good soccer bar since they will open up early to let us addicted soccer fans come watch soccer early in the morning. 6:45am beer is not usually everyone's first choice, so they have plenty of coffee ready!With two 65" TVs mounted on the wall, it's hard to miss any details of the big game should you choose to watch it there. But let's say you're hungry, well then it's time to dig into brunch! I've always rocked the Countrymen's skillet and like it well done because it's loaded up with egg, taters, veggies and will do the trick so early in the morning. Not in the mood for eggs and potato so early in the morning? They'll even let you bite into the rest of the menu. As for me, I've taken a shot at the Bacon and Egger, which is a fierce burger ready to knock your socks off. Oh, so now you are looking for a drink in this venue? I'd have to say my favorite beer in here's the Half Acre Daisy Cutter on tap, but I've also had some wicked Spaten Octoberfest in liter steins enough to knock your socks off. The beer is deep, but if you want to go for true value, hit up the PBR and Bullit Whiskey for $6 or $7 and double down!Sometimes people have special occasions and Smallbar is up to the challenge. With a large second floor available for private events, Smallbar regularly hosts Man-B-Que events and I've had the pleasure of throwing a party at Smallbar and loading it up with a few dozen of my best friends. The service is good and the venue is great for all events large and small. Small Bar, you're quickly becoming a Chicago classic.

20.description: This Small Bar location is just fine and was a welcome addition to a lackluster stretch on Fullerton. That said, I prefer the Division Small Bar by a MILE after having been there again just the other night. The vibes are just really different, possibly because of this one's proximity to DePaul. It gets a little more...fussy at night.

36.description: SmallBar Fullerton was once a solid bar with excellent brews, an endless supply of televised soccer, and a gnarly plate of pulled pork nachos.  Now, SmallBar Fullerton is an awesome gastropub, comparable to Hopleaf and Paramount Room.  Yes, lifelong fans will be bummed that the old menu is lost and gone forever.  Tough love for them; the new menu completely blows the old menu away.  I'll gladly take the Whitefish sandwich over the fish & chips, or the corned beef and hash over the phoenix any day.  And definitely go for the bar snacks as you're pondering the menu for a full order. Every time I go back I order something different; haven't had a bad meal yet.As far as the drinks go, the beers still rock. Sad to see Carlsberg go, but they've adequately filled those pints with the likes of Lagunitas Pils and Metropolitan Krankshaft.  And the craft cocktails? Amazing - especially the cucumber gimlet and bulliet smash.Best thing is: even though they've changed their menu, soccer still reigns supreme. Just be prepared to get in VERY early for a seat during a big game. Your legs/back will thank you.

14.description: FYI: This is not a small bar. They are lying.Anyway, they have tons of Stone's Brewery on tap. Many of them are bitter and really hoppy...not my bag. My husband inquired about where Stone's was from - figuring it had to be local. Surprisingly it's from San Diego. That was a bit of a let down since we love supporting local breweries.... apparently they don't. Boo. Hiss.+1 star for Schlitz on tap.

28.description: I had to write an update because I seen the review by dia. First of all she must be mistaken, Dr. Breadon doesn't holler at you and she always has an assistant in the room with you. (90% of the time) She is very professional and knowledgeable. Right now, I am getting the laser hair removal treatments. I have had the so called laser light surgery before at a "medical spa". So when I was asked if I wanted to try the treatment, I was skeptical. I had paid mega bucks at this medical spa and went there for about a year. After all that I STILL had to shave every other day. Let me tell you this, I am an African American women. I have VERY coarse hair.  (Especially under my chin!) I have had 2 (ONLY 2!!!) hair removal treatments under my chin and PRESTO , no more hair! UNBELIEVABLE! I have been hairy all my life. My eyebrows are thick and hair grows on my cheeks. So I have some very stubborn hair. But I'm here to tell you, underneath my chin is oh so smooth and silky. The few hairs (and I mean VERY few) that grow, I can pull the out with my fingertips and no pain. Also I had very bad acne (as mention in the previous review) and uneven skin tone. My face has done a total 360 since she has been treating me.  I have gotten so many compliments on my face since I have been going to Dr. Breadon. I definitely recommend this office.

1.description: I gave Dr. Breadon another chance here but yet again she is always late for her appointments. I talked to her office staff about timing and mentioned that like most individuals I am extremely busy and would like to choose a time that I should have the best chance of getting in ASAP, I was told a time and I booked it.  Once again, the Dr. was over 15 minutes late.  This frustrates me as she gives off the impression that her time is more valuable then mine and her patients.On top of all this her office staff was extremely rude on the phone to me and did not offer to help me in any way when I called with questions.  Overall I will not be returning here as there are plenty of other dermatologists in the area who I believe can do much better.

9.description: I am not sure why there are so many negative comments on here. I saw Dr. Breadon to get treated for a small black keloid on my chest. She gave me a shot and it was flattened in about a week and a half. She gave me some lightening cream to lighten it up and it is working very well. I will be returning next month for a chemical peel. :)

29.description: I called the office and they refused to quote me prices of laser hair removal over the phone. They also refused to tell me how much an appointment was. So my only choice was to book an appointment and treatment and take a chance when I got there.I get there on time for my appointment and they told me I had to be there 30 minutes before my appointment to fill out paperwork. Nobody had told me that over the phone, in fact I was transferred twice just to make an appointment. How hard is it to set an appointment?? And how does it take 30 minutes to fill out paperwork? Anyways, I asked them if I could fill out paperwork after my appointment, and of course they said no because they had to have my information on file before a doctor saw me. The best part was they would only be able to see me an hour and a half later, and of course I had no time to wait around for that long.I also didn't get a very good impression of the office itself. First of all, it's in a really strange area for a dermatology office...it's on Fulton Market street, where dozens of trucks are unloading tons of food merchandise. So it's hard to even get there without wondering whether you are going to have the good fortune of being smashed by a truck. I could go on and describe the office itself, but I think you get the idea. Going back to pricing, full arm is $250 for both arms, which is a reasonable price, but of course the first appointment is $150 and you have to have an appointment if you want to get treatment there. That's where they rip your money. SO not worth it, especially after the whole paperwork crap.Read some of the other reviews and you'll see they don't have great customer service. Take a chance at your own will.

23.description: I saw Dr. Breadon for a troubling dermatology problem. I was impressed at my first visit. The office is nice, the staff is attentive and she seemed positive and able to help me in my problem. When I returned 4 weeks later, not much had changed for my skin. She decided to do a skin biopsy to see what was going on. Up until I returned for the biopsy results I would have given the office a solid 4 stars. Then things turned ugly. I went back and the doctor's assistant came to remove the sutures and told me, well it's hives and so there's not much more you can do. To this I responded, I'll wait to speak to the doctor. He then told me for suture removals you don't get to see the doctor. I told him that was not ok, and I would wait until she was available. When she finally came to the room, she look at the biopsy results and said yep, its hives. Keep doing what you are doing (which was not working) and come back in 6 mo. I made a follow up appointment with an allergist-- to assess the hives-- and called on a Monday for my biopsy results for my Thursday appointment. No response. Called on Tuesday. No response. Called on Wednesday and finally spoke to someone who argued with me about when I did and did not call. After some arguing I finally got a hold of my results. And I've since had two doctors me the results are not what Dr. Breadon said they were. This place seems geared for aesthetic problems, and if you have an actual dermatological problem I would go elsewhere.

5.description: I went today as an emergency as I am coming from out of town. I found through Zoc doc, the staff was extremely friendly and the office is very cutely decorated and most important clean! I have had a lot of bad doctor experience in the past but this was not one of them. Based off my experience I was treated with a steroid immediately, given three prescription options and a bag full of samples and coupons to try to rectify my skin sensitivity from flaring up again. I see some complaint on here about billing which I have not experienced billing yet since I just went today but based off of my experience the I was very pleased. If I loved in Chicago I would go again.

31.description: Dr. Breadon is extremely knowledgeable and professional, her staff is friendly (and sometimes funky, in a good way), and the facility is spotless.

25.description: Just called to find out Veronica no longer works there...bummer

12.description: I saw Dr. Breadon for a troubling dermatology problem. I was impressed at my first visit. The office is nice, the staff is attentive and she seemed positive and able to help me in my problem. When I returned 4 weeks later, not much had changed for my skin. She decided to do a skin biopsy to see what was going on. Up until I returned for the biopsy results I would have given the office a solid 4 stars. Then things turned ugly. I went back and the doctor's assistant came to remove the sutures and told me, well it's hives and so there's not much more you can do. To this I responded, I'll wait to speak to the doctor. He then told me for suture removals you don't get to see the doctor. I told him that was not ok, and I would wait until she was available. When she finally came to the room, she look at the biopsy results and said yep, its hives. Keep doing what you are doing (which was not working) and come back in 6 mo. I made a follow up appointment with an allergist-- to assess the hives-- and called on a Monday for my biopsy results for my Thursday appointment. No response. Called on Tuesday. No response. Called on Wednesday and finally spoke to someone who argued with me about when I did and did not call. After some arguing I finally got a hold of my results. And I've since had two doctors me the results are not what Dr. Breadon said they were. This place seems geared for aesthetic problems, and if you have an actual dermatological problem I would go elsewhere.

21.description: So I generally don't write reviews however, I must say that I was very impressed with Dr. Breadon and her clinic. Although the clinic may be slightly busy with occasional long hold times, I would not trade the clinical treatment and patient-physician relationship. When I initial presented to Dr. Breadon she worked with me to determine my needs and my concern for price because of insurance. She altered the treatment for effective but less pricey alternatives. I have now seen her four times and she listens to my concerns and works with me.  Additionally, she tried treatment for my acne that was different from other Derms I had been to with great results.  As a future physician, I recognigze the value of bedside manner and patient rapport and I believe that Dr. Breadon is a model example. As far as price. I think it depends on your insurance. Dermatologist visits are pricey the nature of the beast. However it was about the same price as my mothers visit with her primary doctor.

16.description: I had to write an update because I seen the review by dia. First of all she must be mistaken, Dr. Breadon doesn't holler at you and she always has an assistant in the room with you. (90% of the time) She is very professional and knowledgeable. Right now, I am getting the laser hair removal treatments. I have had the so called laser light surgery before at a "medical spa". So when I was asked if I wanted to try the treatment, I was skeptical. I had paid mega bucks at this medical spa and went there for about a year. After all that I STILL had to shave every other day. Let me tell you this, I am an African American women. I have VERY coarse hair.  (Especially under my chin!) I have had 2 (ONLY 2!!!) hair removal treatments under my chin and PRESTO , no more hair! UNBELIEVABLE! I have been hairy all my life. My eyebrows are thick and hair grows on my cheeks. So I have some very stubborn hair. But I'm here to tell you, underneath my chin is oh so smooth and silky. The few hairs (and I mean VERY few) that grow, I can pull the out with my fingertips and no pain. Also I had very bad acne (as mention in the previous review) and uneven skin tone. My face has done a total 360 since she has been treating me.  I have gotten so many compliments on my face since I have been going to Dr. Breadon. I definitely recommend this office.

17.description: Dr. Breadon is very nice and I've always been satisfied with the service and prices here. Maybe my skin problem is relatively simple and so that's why all has gone smooth at my four or five appointments. On the other hand, the receptionist has a bad habit of putting you on hold multiple times, especially just prior to the last word in the conversation.

10.description: I love Dr. Breadon. It's her staff that makes me not want to return, the office manager and receptionists are very rude. I really liked this doctor. Unfortunately,  I won't be returning because of the horrible staff.

11.description: Before I left the office, they told me that my prescription would be ready in just a couple hours, and the results from my blood test would be back in no more than 48 hours.TWO WEEKS LATER, I still hadn't heard back from their office and Walgreens didn't have my prescription ready yet, so I decided to call the office and see what the holdup was. I called Breaden's office at 10:00 in the morning. The following day I got a call from Juan from Breaden's office saying the reason they hadn't called the prescription in or called me back with test results yet was because their fax machine was broken. (???)Juan also told me they knew the results of my blood tests, but the only person who could tell me is the doctor, and she would be out of the country for another two weeks. In the meantime he said I needed to come in and get more blood tests done. I decided at that point I need to see a physician about my condition, so I asked to get a copy of my medical records so I could take my test results to my doctor.He transferred me to Kim, the office manager. She said there's a $100 fee for getting my medical records, OR to have them sent to another physician. She kept saying $100 was industry standard. For a one-time visit with probably 2 pieces of paper in my medical file, that seems a little like highway robbery. EDIT: After a visit with my doctor, he asked Dr. Breaden for my medical files and was able to get them without the $100 fee.

26.description: After reading a few of the derogatory comments, I must say that I am truly surprised as well as in disbelief of these negative comments. I have found Dr Breadon and her staff to be quite professional, efficient and most certainly competent. Some of the responses are ridiculous, who doesn't have to fill out paperwork to see a new physician? Who doesn't ever have to wait sometimes at a Dr's office? Things happen! I truly feel that Dr Breadon and her staff are true professionals and appreciate that they actually care and look out for my well being.

27.description: Dr Breadon is a genuine Dr who really wants to help, but there are definitely pros and cons:Cons: - Definitely isn't enough documentation throughout your visits.  I've received contradictory information on more than one occasion.  She once told me I had the beginning signs of rosacea and proceeded to plot out a plan of attack giving me literature and everything.  This stressed me out immensely but I was willing to do what I needed to.  A few months later I went in and asked her if it looked like there was progress in my skin and the rosacea issue, and she told me, "what are you talking about, who would have told you that you have that, you don't seem to have anything of the kind."  - You wait in the waiting room and in the patient rooms for longer than it takes for your actual appointment.  The time spent waiting seems extreme.- They're product-pushy and beware, you may end up buying products that you don't really need.- I have small veins and it took them a few times of drawing blood where I ended up with severe bruises before the finally wrote me a script/referral to Quest to get my blood drawn.Pros:During my accutane visits they were very supportive with all the side effects and consistent in the follow-up.Dr Breadon and her staff are very sincere and nice, regardless of whether they actually know what they're talking about all the time.The half off days rock, I mean the laser prices and facial service prices during those days are great.

0.description: Excellent dermatologist! My whole family sees Dr. Breadon for various skin issues. I understand now why she has patients from all over, travel into the city and see her.

20.description: DON'T GO HERE.I'm seriously in shock right now. I went in back in January (it's now May) because I had dry skin patches- they said they would take a culture make sure it wasn't anything and would call me if I needed to come back. She was very convinced it was just dry skin and even gave me a lotion for it -that's fine.I just received a call today... 5 months later... saying the cultures came back positive and it was something more and to come back to them. I asked if it really took them 5 months to get the results back - he said it was my job to follow-up with them...Tell me any doctors office where they don't call you once they receive test results back that you need further visits?! It was the most unprofessional phone call that made me feel attacked by the office.Yes- I will never be going back. Thanks Ron-Carlo for your abrasive phone call 5 months later.

19.description: Skin problems are almost gone! Great staff! Knowledgeable, sensitive to needs, friendly! 10 STARS! Thank you!

2.description: The treatment is top notch. The billing situation, scum lord status. I have some of the best insurance money can buy. If my insurance doesn't cover it, it must be lipo. I went in for 4-5 sessions on a scar, instead of contacting me that my insurance was having issues (6-8 months since my last visit, when my insurance covered every treatment but I guess one?) they sent my bill straight to collections. Now not only will I have to talk it out with my insurance, their billing dept, and this collection agency....I have a big beautiful collection notice on my credit report that could have been resolved if they actually got in contact with their patients. Beware their billing...While Dr Breadon was great, I would not wish this billing nightmare on anyone else. There are too many great practices in Chicago to waste your time on a place that does this to their patients.

32.description: This place is horrible. The last two times I have been here I have been charged for services never received. The appointments are a joke - I have always had a significant wait time (even though the place is always empty). The last time I waited over an hour and a half before even being seen. The last straw was being refused a prescription refill without a follow up visit. Despite the fact that I had just been there!! Come on people. We're talking about skin cream for pimples. You're really going to bilk your customers for every last cent by making them come in for a follow up visit every time they need to get it refilled? No thanks. I'll take my business somewhere else.

18.description: After being placed on hold two times I waited five minutes to finally ask to make an appt. only to be put on hold again.  Then told I'd have to put a $50 deposit down to make an appointment.

13.description: Dr. B has been my dermatologist for years. Her new office is beautiful and inviting.  She is really knowledgeable and her staff is efficient and attentive. You feel like she is really listening to you (which is not always the case these days now that many doctors stare at computer screens instead of their patients). In my opinion she works to find the right combo of cremes to treat your skin with great results!

4.description: Dr Breadon herself deserves five stars. My teenage son and I both saw her and we were very pleased with the care we received.  Unfortunately, due to total incompetence from the office staff, neither he nor I were able to see her during our last two appointments:(1)  My son had an appointment on February 2nd in the evening. Apparently they closed the office that day. He was not even given the courtesy of the call (no missed calls, no voice mail), so he went  all the way there in the freezing cold for nothing. If he had no call,no showed, they would have charged him $50. I suggested it would be fair if they treated him to to the same, but they "do not do that."(2) At my last appointment, it was 45 minutes past my appointment time, and I was still in the downstairs waiting room and there was no communication at all whatsoever. Other people who arrived after me were called up but still nothing was said to be about the wait.   I finally went up to the front desk to ask how much longer it would be, and I was told they did not know. I went upstairs, and the very nice PA said there were still two people ahead of me- I did not have unlimited time to wait that day so I left. I understand a doctor may fall behind, but then the front desk should have told me when I came in that they were so behind, and give me the option to wait  or reschedule.  Instead, my time was wasted.I called about my son's appointment three times. I did not receive a call back for over a week- instead I had to keep calling.  I finally spoke with Kim about it, and she is very sorry and has lots of excuses about  employees being sick. I asked to speak to the doctor herself, but was informed that the doctor does not deal with these types of issues. Please message me any recommendations for good dermatologists with functional offices.

24.description: I have yet to be disappointed! Very professional staff!

6.description: I came here several years ago when I had a slight discoloration on my abdomen.  I attributed it to sun exposure.The Dr that I saw, after 2 different visits-insisted on doing a biopsy of the area.  I write this review years later because I am still bothered by the scar of an unnecessary biopsy.  Her theory was that I had an autoimmune skin disorder called Vitiligo where the skin starts to lose its pigmentation. After the biopsy she recommended I come in for light therapy 2 times a week for "as long as it takes." A second opinion determined it was NOT a serious skin disease and the white spot went away on its own in a few months.  However, I now have a lovely scar the size of a pea on my abdomen, for no necessary reason.  While I don't discount the possibility that this practice can be capable, I personally felt that my "recommendations" were exploitative and I assumed it was so they could bill my insurance for many expensive services.  Her diagnosis was wrong and the procedure was invasive.  I never went back and it was absolutely my worst skin care experience ever.I since have been VERY please at the Nima Skin Institute on 1460 N Halsted.

22.description: After being placed on hold two times I waited five minutes to finally ask to make an appt. only to be put on hold again.  Then told I'd have to put a $50 deposit down to make an appointment.

15.description: I still think Dr. B. is great...... My daughter has chronic skin problems.  She is allergic to everything.  This time it was ingrown hairs in her scalp which had become infected.  After not being satisfied with the diagnosis at urgent care on Saturday night, we called Dr. Breadon's office on Monday morning at 10:30 and asked for an emergency appt.  They told us to be there by 11:45 which was great.  We waited about 15 minutes even though we expected to wait longer.  Dr. Breadons staff is great.  Her nurse came and asked very thorough questions and by the time Dr. B and her PA arrived the appt went pretty quick.  She did cultures, she talked to my daughter about her routine, what she had already been using and prescribed.  All to provide a proper diagnosis.  She also explained the causes so that we can prevent it from happening again.  These are all the questions I expected urgent care to ask but they didn't bother.  They just handed us a prescription and sent us on our way.  We walked out of Dr. B's  feeling much better with samples and discount coupons to help with the cost of the prescriptions.  Her PA also noticed that I picked up some pamphlets regarding dermal fillers and even took the time to make suggestions and explain the different options even though I myself did not have an appt.We recently switched to an HMO so Dr. B is no longer in my network but my daughter still insisted on going to her and paying out of pocket to ensure she receive proper treatment.Everyone's experience is different but my daughter and I have nothing but great things to say about Dr. B.  She has always come thru for us.

7.description: I have to return and downgrade my review even further for Aesthetic Dermatology. I've have been fighting with the office and their billing department for over 4 months regarding a payment that was made and cashed. The contact at More Than Billing, Shuntae has been unresponsive and unhelpful. Each time I attempt to contact the office to rectify the matter, I am given the run around with promises that someone will contact me but it never happens. Instead they continue to hide behind incorrect billing statements. Even after my last review, I gave them a second chance and went back only to be bombarded with issues month after month. This place isn't worth the hassle. There are plenty of other great dermatologists in the city and I'll be sure to notify my network, my sorority and my business relationships not to utilize their services.

8.description: I am really shocked at the bad reviews.  I have been a patient of Dr. Breadon for over 20 years and now have taken my sons to see her.  I have nothing but the utmost respect for her. She helped me with many dermatological issues over the years and my skins looks great.    I deal with Juan when I go for other non-medical dermatological issues and he is just a doll. He takes really good care of me.  Over the years, different staff has come and gone and some are better than others but that's with all small businesses.  What's consistent is the care and treatment be good.  I have experience nothing but the best in both.

30.description: I went to Jonith over 3 years ago and stopped going because her staff were all idiots and rude. Plus, I always waited an hour for a 15 minute appointment. The last straw is when they couldn't keep their messages straight and 2 separate times I had cancelled an appointment way before the 24 hours notice they charged me a late fee. I thought they had waived it because it was their mistake and now 3 YEARS LATER I get a call from a collections agency for 50 bucks. Are you kidding me? I have made 4 calls into the office manager and have had no luck in talking to her. They must be needing money if they are trying to collect 3 years later.

3.description: Dr. Breadon has been around for a long time in her practice . I have notice how the customer service is absolutely horrible!!!! I use take my daughter to her when she  suffered from eczema and would pay cash for our bill and I notice how she old charge me whatever figure she could come up with . I had to debate with them regarding my bill they tried to charge us a bill for her seeing my daughter and giving her a shot and some cream 400.00 I thought I was being punked.  Never did I pay her assistant changed the cost knowingly that was outrageous by all means. The front desk is not helpful at all !! $

14.description: DON'T GO HERE.I'm seriously in shock right now. I went in back in January (it's now May) because I had dry skin patches- they said they would take a culture make sure it wasn't anything and would call me if I needed to come back. She was very convinced it was just dry skin and even gave me a lotion for it -that's fine.I just received a call today... 5 months later... saying the cultures came back positive and it was something more and to come back to them. I asked if it really took them 5 months to get the results back - he said it was my job to follow-up with them...Tell me any doctors office where they don't call you once they receive test results back that you need further visits?! It was the most unprofessional phone call that made me feel attacked by the office.Yes- I will never be going back. Thanks Ron-Carlo for your abrasive phone call 5 months later.

28.description: Five Stars for Vision Boutique! I had an excellent visit with the doctor after admitting to not seeing one for years. The technology is up to date.  The staff is very knowledgeable and also express true meaning for style. This boutique has an extensive collection of sunglasses.. I love seeing all the brand new styles and having a chance to try them on. This is a great store, I recommend it for everyone!Thanks, MDemos

1.description: The doctor was very nice and thorough. He talked through my eye history to make sure he understood my needs. They have a machine that takes a picture of your eye which was pretty cool.Josh helped me select glasses that fit my face shape. I've never had this type of service before and I'm really glad they take the time to fit your needs and budget. I even popped into the storefront unannounced a few hours before my actual appointment to scope out the frame choices and was helped right away. I spent more than I wanted (about $400 for a pair of Oliver People's and glasses eye exam after using VSP insurance) but I do feel like I received a quality eye exam and a great pair of glasses that will last me a few years. I've never bought designer frames before only cheap no name ones, but these new ones are much more comfortable than the cheap ones.They also mailed me a hand written thank you note saying that I can come in anytime for free adjustments. A nice touch.

9.description: My first eye exam was a bit daunting, I've been having trouble seeing while driving at night& since I work nights, this is not good!!! I put off a trip to the eye doc, but finally bit the bullet& made an appt at Vision Boutique. You can do so online, which is easy and since I was a new patient the staff, followed up with a friendly phone call. The staff and doctor put me at ease right away. All were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. My vision insurance was accepted, glasses ready in about 10 days and all of my questions were answered. Couldn't have asked for a better experience! I've already recommended them to family and friends!!

29.description: I came here to buy sunglasses.  I ended up finding a pair of Raybans that I liked, and the salespeople were fine and friendly and helpful.  The retail price at the store was $239.When I took my glasses home, I looked them up at Rayban.com for more information, and it said on the site that the price of the sunglasses was $169.  That also was the price at the Sunglass Hut website, and other sites were even cheaper than that.  I thought maybe that the price quote in the store was a mistake, so I called them up.  They acknowledged on the phone that it wasn't a mistake, and that their prices are higher than what you would pay at Rayban.com, at the Sunglass Hut, or online, etc.  So, if you don't mind shopping at a store that is unapologetic about their higher prices, this store is for you.Disclosure- I got a $150 gift card for $45 from youswoop for my purchase, so overall I made out ok.  But obviously I'm not inclined to go back.

23.description: Got my last 2 pairs of glasses from here and I've been happy with their service. They are friendly and knowledgeable with their frames. I would like to see more mid-priced range of frame selections.

5.description: Not very friendly nor helpful.

31.description: Went to this store as they were on my insurance (VSP) website. Customer service was great, the girl at the desk was attentive and responsive. They had flexible appointment times. Doctor was great, did a good job of explaining everything. Cons: they don't have anywhere to sit while you wait and it was a bit pricey even with my insurance, so I got my glasses there, but chose to buy my contacts on the visiondirect website, the girl at the desk said they were cheaper than their own employee discount. Probably will try to look for a more price friendly place for next time, (that's why I gave it 2 stars) but if money is not an issues, then this might be the place for you.

25.description: I have been getting glasses since I was in the fourth grade and this is  my favorite eyecare facility.  Karina and Tiffany are very helpful and very honest about what pair looks good on you.  They are neither pushy nor snobbish, as some other places in the area may be.  They have a great selection of frames at multple price points.   Also, both optometrists are very informed and are able to explain to you exactly what they are doing.

12.description: Great glasses shop on Madison in West Loop area.  Their optometrists are super knowledgeable and efficient-  a major plus for me!They also have a large selection of current glasses and sunglasses.  Tiffany, one of their retail associates has great taste and has already helped me pick out 2 pairs of glasses and a pair of sunglasses.  Highly recommend.

21.description: I have been seeing Dr. Helen for over 2 years now.  She is very kind, and understands the condition of my eyes.  Their selection of glasses is awesome!!  I always have a hard time deciding which frames I want.  The staff is very helpful and always friendly.

16.description: I'm very pleased with m experience! Thanks to the woman working the front desk, I was able to find the glasses that I wanted.  I can't remember the name of the doctor who performed my eye exam, but she was also great! Very informative, professional, and polite. I also liked that they call and email you reminders for your appointment. I had to reschedule several times because of my work schedule, but they were very accommodating. The only downside for me was it was a bit expensive (I'm a broke college student and had to pay for everything).  But thankfully my insurance saved me a ton of money.

17.description: I'm not pleased with this place at allPros:- people are smileyCons:- very unresponsive; I had to call a few times each time I needed something before I actually received it. I had to call a three times to have my prescription emailed to me, and three times to have my boxes of contact lenses exchanged out- doctor misdiagnosed prescription. The doctor prescribed .50 stronger than what I have always gotten. Thus, I ended up having to exchange my un-opened boxes for a prescription that I have always gotten because the ones that were prescribed gave me headaches and hurt my eyes from making everything so much more sharp than what I could handle. See above - had to call three times to make this happen and a wait of a couple of weeks- when I was looking to order glasses and they didn't have anything in stock that I'd be interested in, the girl kept pressuring me to come back to only them to order glasses because they can always get them for me off-line. That's great, but I'd like to try them on before I purchase them because aesthetics are pretty important when buying such a thing.Completely ridiculous! Terrible service.More so, I do not appreciate private details of my visit being disclosed in the note provided as a response by the business to this review!! If you want to discuss the issue at hand, please do call.
