10.description: Their website advertises them as "eye doctors, first and foremost".  I disagree, I do not recommend Vision Boutique for an eye exam- explanation below.  This really is more of a boutique,  a place to go if you have a lot of money to blow on designer frames.  This was the quickest eye exam of my life, it was not thorough.  All past eye doctors I had ever been to had specific machines to do a glaucoma test and others (the puff of air test, etc.), but not here.  I'm also used to a retinal imaging scan, or if unavailable then a pupil dilation.  Vision Boutique never dilated my pupils and when I realized that after my exam I called them to ask why.  I was told the doctor would be doing that part when I came back to pick up my glasses a week later  (that seems strange..).  Never happened then either so safe to say they either just don't do this or they forgot- neither of which are OK in my book.  They saved some stars because the staff was really nice and friendly, but again I could not recommend them for an eye exam.

11.description: Extremely helpful and nice. They opened the store 30 mins early for me on a Saturday before I left on a trip. I've been to my fair share of bad optometrists over the years and the doctor was very patient with me even though sometimes there isn't any difference between 1 and 2 or 3 and 4. They knew what my insurance benefits were and did a very good job of explaining all my options and the breakdown of costs. I'll be back once my current Rx expires.

26.description: I'm sad that i coudlnt' give a higher review. 1. the staff is pretty awesome- very nice and accommodating.2. Dr. Margaret is really nice, and i love that she explains what she's going to do before doing it. eye touching= freaky. 3. what really knocked it down to 3 stars is because we ordered contacts for a full year supply, and 3 days after receiving the supply, i realized that the contacts are NOT for me! acuve hydraclear plus- ruined every 1-2 days b/c of my eyeliner. (It is the same brand i used in my previous contacts.)what's terrible, is that now i can't return the full year supply, and i've been back multiple times to figure out a brand that actually works for my eyes. Granted, Dr. Margaret is really nice about it, and has been ordering samples for me; but i REALLY wish she didnt let me order a full year before figuring out that these contacts dont work for me. and its annoying to keep coming back!

27.description: Great customer service at Vision Boutique - staff is super friendly and attentive. Dr. Helen was also friendly, informative and thorough. She explained everything as she did the eye exam and helped me understand how my prescription would work.I also received helpful advice from all staff members on which frames to purchase - they all weighed in on which pair they liked best. After my vist, I promptly received a follow up call, thank you and itemized bill (which I requested for insurance purposes). I would definitely go back to VB and recommend to anyone. Love my Prada glasses!

0.description: I had my first visit to Vision Boutique this morning, and it was the best experience I have ever had when having my eyes checked.  From the initial consultation to picking out my glasses, Dr.  Kiwacz and her staff were exceptional!  Personal, professional, patient, and so knowledgeable, this office goes beyond to make your appointment easy.  Dr. Kiwacz is so passionate about helping her patients and answering questions.  I kept telling her "this is the best appointment I have ever had!".  I do not even have bad vision, but I learned more about the process and the health of my eyes in this appointment than I ever have.  I am excited to go back and pick up my glasses.  There is no question that I would recommend Vision Boutique to friends and all.  Thank you Vision Boutique!

20.description: My experience here could not have been better. The doctor was more thorough than any I've ever been to, and I've been wearing glasses/contacts for 19 years. I loved the opticians, especially Karina! Her level of customer service and general caring/interest far surpassed anyone in a service-oriented profession that I've met in a long time.Great experience and staff!

19.description: I thought they were really nice until I  requested a copy of my prescription (and I  actually found out that by law they were supposed to give me a copy on the day I got the exam). They do the best they can to not give you a copy of your prescription, and that includes ignoring emails and hanging up on you after saying wait a minute (very disrespectful). Even after they say they are going to email it to you, it takes a while. Once, I had to call them again to make them send it to me. Don't go here unless you are planning on sticking with them forever. (then I am sure they will be super nice to you like they did to me when I went there to spend $500)

33.description: Great Optometrists and staff. They usually have a great selection so eyewear and my husband and I love the eyewear that we have purchased there.   4 years ago I gave them a horrible review but they have changed management over the past couple of years and we are very satisfied customers.

2.description: I received awesome service and the staff was friendly, personable and very professional. My exam was thorough and comprehensive. I am enjoying my new Tom Ford eye and sunglasses. Just one of many designers offered.

34.description: Great selection of eyewear and accesssories.  the staff is extremely knowledgeable and friendly and i like how this store is out of the way of downtown so doesn't get as crowded as some of the stores on michigan

32.description: I bought my last pair from store down the street before I discovered Vision Boutique when I was walking in the neighborhood. The Staff was very helpful and friendly. They also have a wide variety of designer frames.

18.description: I came here to buy sunglasses.  I ended up finding a pair of Raybans that I liked, and the salespeople were fine and friendly and helpful.  The retail price at the store was $239.When I took my glasses home, I looked them up at Rayban.com for more information, and it said on the site that the price of the sunglasses was $169.  That also was the price at the Sunglass Hut website, and other sites were even cheaper than that.  I thought maybe that the price quote in the store was a mistake, so I called them up.  They acknowledged on the phone that it wasn't a mistake, and that their prices are higher than what you would pay at Rayban.com, at the Sunglass Hut, or online, etc.  So, if you don't mind shopping at a store that is unapologetic about their higher prices, this store is for you.Disclosure- I got a $150 gift card for $45 from youswoop for my purchase, so overall I made out ok.  But obviously I'm not inclined to go back.

13.description: I went in to Vision Boutique just for an exam. I was greeted very warmly by all three of the ladies there including the doctor. All of the women working there were very friendly which is important to me. The doctor worked very efficiently for having been the only doctor there juggling 2 or 3 patients. Even considering that I was not the only patient needing the doctor's time, I was in and out in no time and well taken care of! I definitely recommend the Vision Boutique to anyone needing an exam or new eyewear - their selection was great as well.

4.description: These guys are on top of their game. I can confidently say that this place has the best customer service that I've experienced from any optical shop. I'm 34 years old and I've been wearing glasses since the 4th grade so that is saying a lot. The frames there are really unique and in addition they stock the classics. I ordered a prescription pair of Ray-bans Wayfarers and I really like them. They also carry a brand called 'IC Berlin' that is worth a look. They are expensive but the technology is super cool. They don't have hinges! Also, I had an old broken pair of designer sunglasses and they were able to fix them on site. I'm a fan!

24.description: They sent me a hand written thank you card - that pretty much sums up my experience at Vision Boutique.

6.description: I went to Dr. Margaret for an eye exam to check in on my glasses and RX prescriptions, and it was a wonderful experience!  Dr. Margaret is extremely knowledgable, and one of the loveliest doctors I've ever had.  You can tell she really cares about her patients and loves her job.  Her office was full of top-of-the-line technology which made the exam so easy - no puffs of air or dialation necessary!On top of that, the man who pre-checked me and filed my insurance paperwork (sorry I forgot your name!) was also very diligent and helpful.  He knew way more about my insurance than I did - which really helped me out in the end.All around a great experience and I would absolutely recommend them to anyone looking for a comfortable, easy, and pleasant optometrist experience.

22.description: I switched eyecare providers primarily because my previous eyecare provider was more old school and I wanted something more contemporary. I was seen by Dr Kiwacz who was extremely soft spoken, professional, gentle, and friendly. My husband and I had questions about the very big difference on the contact lens prescription she gave me versus the one prescribed to me by my previous eyecare provider. She very patiently explained how we always want to achieve 20/20 vision with the least prescription especially when we are still at the young age because our eyes will naturally compensate for it. Over prescribing would make our eyes over dependent for higher and higher corrective measures throughout the years. She also let me compare the lens with the new lower prescription and my previous higher prescription given by my previous optician, and clearly my eyes preferred the new prescription in terms of clarity and comfort. To reassure me, she even offered to let me take home a trial pair for each different prescription so I could test them out and compare.Karina the optometrist helped me out in picking out new glasses as I was also looking to get a new pair of frames. I tried on several pairs and finally found the perfect pair, at least I think it's perfect. Now I'm spotting the new pair of black chic yet classic looking glasses! I asked about their current Yelp promotion (20% off glasses) and Karina helped me figure out my insurance coverage and told me that I would get a better deal out of my insurance discount compared to their current Yelp promo.Vision Boutique is clean, contemporary, and professional-- the way I like it.

15.description: My experience here could not have been better. The doctor was more thorough than any I've ever been to, and I've been wearing glasses/contacts for 19 years. I loved the opticians, especially Karina! Her level of customer service and general caring/interest far surpassed anyone in a service-oriented profession that I've met in a long time.Great experience and staff!

7.description: I lost my glasses last weekend, which I needed for driving to Detroit this weekend. My original prescription written by my doctor on the northside had expired. I didn't have time to go schedule an appointment, drive to northside, wait for exam, wait for eyes dialating, and drive back to city. So I called Vision Boutique where I have gotten glasses on other occasions. They were able to schedule me the next day. The doctor gave me a thorough exam and we decided to forgo the dialation this year because of my low risk for eye problems. (Next year we dialate for sure.) The team called their lab to be sure the glasses I picked out were in stock. The frames were, but only one lens was. The doctor took me back into the exam room and looked at my left eye to see if an alternate, but very close lens, would work. Her alternate recommendation was in stock! New glasses will be ready for me Friday evening, in time for my trip to Detroit! All around great experience! Everyone at Vision Boutique worked together to solve my problem. They understood my goal and made me feel like their first priority while I was there.

8.description: I'm sad that i coudlnt' give a higher review. 1. the staff is pretty awesome- very nice and accommodating.2. Dr. Margaret is really nice, and i love that she explains what she's going to do before doing it. eye touching= freaky. 3. what really knocked it down to 3 stars is because we ordered contacts for a full year supply, and 3 days after receiving the supply, i realized that the contacts are NOT for me! acuve hydraclear plus- ruined every 1-2 days b/c of my eyeliner. (It is the same brand i used in my previous contacts.)what's terrible, is that now i can't return the full year supply, and i've been back multiple times to figure out a brand that actually works for my eyes. Granted, Dr. Margaret is really nice about it, and has been ordering samples for me; but i REALLY wish she didnt let me order a full year before figuring out that these contacts dont work for me. and its annoying to keep coming back!

30.description: My wife and I have bought a combined 6 pairs of eyeglasses from Vision Boutique over the past couple of years and we have yet to have a bad experience there.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the selection is above average.  The store is also very conveniently located for us.Every time I've gotten a checkup at Vision Boutique I have felt that the Optician took the time to do a thorough exam and completely explain the condition of my eyes.  The only thing that keeps Vision Boutique from getting 5 stars from me is that the selections available for people with bigger heads like mine was a little bit thin.  The staff was very helpful doing special orders of the my last 2 pairs since I wanted to get styles with longer temples.  For most people the selection will be more than adequate, though.   The store also accepts many forms of insurance, which makes shopping they convenient for those with a vision plan.

3.description: Great place! Picked up some prescription Raybans for a much better price than I found at Lens Crafter. Customer service is top notch! Even on a busy Saturday I received personalized service. My first time here but many of the customers in the store seemed to be regulars which is a good sign. Looking forward to returning for some contacts.

14.description: I switched eyecare providers primarily because my previous eyecare provider was more old school and I wanted something more contemporary. I was seen by Dr Kiwacz who was extremely soft spoken, professional, gentle, and friendly. My husband and I had questions about the very big difference on the contact lens prescription she gave me versus the one prescribed to me by my previous eyecare provider. She very patiently explained how we always want to achieve 20/20 vision with the least prescription especially when we are still at the young age because our eyes will naturally compensate for it. Over prescribing would make our eyes over dependent for higher and higher corrective measures throughout the years. She also let me compare the lens with the new lower prescription and my previous higher prescription given by my previous optician, and clearly my eyes preferred the new prescription in terms of clarity and comfort. To reassure me, she even offered to let me take home a trial pair for each different prescription so I could test them out and compare.Karina the optometrist helped me out in picking out new glasses as I was also looking to get a new pair of frames. I tried on several pairs and finally found the perfect pair, at least I think it's perfect. Now I'm spotting the new pair of black chic yet classic looking glasses! I asked about their current Yelp promotion (20% off glasses) and Karina helped me figure out my insurance coverage and told me that I would get a better deal out of my insurance discount compared to their current Yelp promo.Vision Boutique is clean, contemporary, and professional-- the way I like it.

58.description: Everything about this place is great.  The staff are very nice without being all over you.  The merchandise is top quality.  I got a  coupon.   Ive had my knives sharpened here too and that went great too.

56.description: Great deal on knife sharpening, done while I waited. Picked up a couple of other kitchen supplies I've been wanting. Great find!

29.description: Got my santoku sharpened while shopping.  Very happy with the work done, it was fast and only cost $3.5.  Also got a Wusthof knife block for $10 which is an extremely good deal.  Love walking around the store and looking at all the kitchen tools.  One day when I'm not renting apartments anymore, I'll stock my kitchen with everything!

42.description: I always feel like an impostor when entering since I just cook at home, but the staff is always super friendly and very helpful. They do a great job, super fast, and can't beat the prices.  I never leave this place without buying some random kitchen stuff while waiting for my knives to get sharpened.  And they have parking!  It's heaven.

23.description: OMG! If you're searching for a cutlery place, where the staff is way knowledgeable, experts, trustworthy, and reliable advisors - you just found it! I drove from Oak Park and loved this place the minute we walked in. Knives are only $3.50 each to sharpen - for real??!! I was in awe. And what totally did it for me was I brought in my expensive Wüsthof knife which had a large crack in the wood handle. We've lived with it thinking it couldn't be repaired, and didn't want to have to spend more to replace it. The minute I asked if they could do anything before sharpening, they told me they'd do one step better. Wüsthof's policy was to replace it, sooooo, I'd be walking home with a new one! At that point they hit rock star status! I can't stress this point any further - you need to be here. In fact, stop searching for more reviews to validate them, just go NOW.

47.description: I would give this place ten stars if I could.  I don't know how people here gave them as low as four stars.Everybody else already told you about the great prices, knowledgeable and helpful staff, the knife-sharpening service, the student discounts, etc., etc. You know they have EVERYTHING you could possibly need in a kitchen, home or professional. But here's something else that brightened my day today.So years ago, when I first started cooking, I bought a Wusthof Santoku here and it's always been one of my favorite knives. The blade got worn down past the divots (this is not the right word for them, but I don't know what they're called, whatevah), the handle somehow cracked and pieces of it fell out. I really thought nothing of it because this knife can still cut juliennes like you wouldn't believe. Today, I took this old, beat-to-hell knife along with another chef's knife to get sharpened, expecting only that. So dude looks at the handle, looks at the worn-out blade, sees that it's a Wusthof, and he looks at me and says, "I'm going to replace this for you."WHAAAAAAAT?!?!?!No need to prove that I bought it there, no need to produce a ten-year-old receipt, I didn't even ask them for anything but to sharpen it, and walked out with a brand new knife!Beat customer service like that! You can't, can you.Get all your kitchen stuff here. Get all your knives sharpened here. There is no reason to go anywhere else.

8.description: I have known Marty and his staff for as long as I have been here in the West Loop,,27 years I own Prairie Production we are a photo studio and production stage doing private and social events so my needs coincide with Northwestern on many points I have always been more than satisfied with the service and selection of what they provide. being a business owner I appreciate the consistent way that I have been serviced and treated over the long haul .

31.description: I've been here. They sharpen my knives. Knives are dull? You go here and make them sharp. They also have some other fun things, like spoons. You want spoons? They have a few. Me? I'm going to make some sausage or meat. They've got a curing agent for that. That makes me fairly content. It is close, and it is good, and they sharpen enough knives to know what they're doing. Go there to make your bad knives good, or to make your good knives better.

34.description: I love kitchen gadgets, so naturally, this place blew my mind. The service was great and they sharpened my knives before I even had a chance to have a thorough look around!

16.description: This place is the truth! Great prices on knife sharpening  as well as all kitchen needs. Definitely recommend if you are in the industry

13.description: This is a great place wonderful people find what you need for cookware customer service excellent I invite everyone to come and experience a store like no other

11.description: This is an amazing place with experienced and patient sharpeners. The young man and the girl I dealt with were exceptional with taking care of honing my $320 Dovo straight razor. This place honed it right!I bought mine from Art of shaving and even after they had it honed and then by Merz Apothecary, it was still dull and caused me go through hours of painful shaving with no result. I almost regretted dumping my Gillette but thankfully found this place on google.

39.description: Excellent.  These guys truly are the best.  20 minutes to sharpen all my knives, never too busy to answer questions.  Been going here for the last year and a half and I am always amazed at how helpful they are.

37.description: It's all true.  Great prices (Amazon-competitive), great selection (ditto), and knife sharpening.  Parking to boot. Go to Isaacson and Stein (and Publican Market) and make a day of it.

0.description: It really is a candy store for chefs like their cheesy radio ads claim! I used to come for small things that I keep losing, or pants if I forget mine, and everything is very reasonably priced. One time, I found myself closer to Sur La Table in LP, and I went there instead - and everything I bought cost 2x more than here. Not sure about literally everything in the store, but most things are really affordable.The only thing they didn't have was a giant like 4ft whisk, which is what I first went in to look for :(They also do really speedy knife sharpening if your knives, but not by hand, though if your knives aren't super expensive it's worth the $3 and convenience. If you insist on hand sharpening, you have to leave the knives with them for a few days to a week. Prices vary but I ended up paying $30 for 3 knives so it wasn't bad. Also, there's a parking lot!

38.description: So I took a knife skills class this week and as a result, it was determined that I needed (wanted) some new and fantastic knives.  After consulting with my father in law and the internets, it was determined that we should come to Northwestern Cutlery Supply.  As the name indicates, they have several glass cases of beautiful high end knives - Wusthof, Global, shun and others.  They also have some lower end knives and sets, as well as all the accessories you may want.  If you're generally into cooking, they have a nice selection of cast iron, Le Creuset, Calphalon, and a fairly decent array of implements for cooking and baking.  Shoes and jackets for chefs, too - and while I am not one, I do like to play one on TV so I really like this.  A lot.In addition to knife sales, they also do sharpening.  We waited about 15 minutes for this to be done on 6 knives, which I think is completely reasonable.  They used an electric sharpener so maybe that was why it was so quick.It's a small place and on a Saturday morning, it was pretty crowded.  There were only a few people working and it took some time to get someone to be able to take some knives out of the case for me to handle.  Once we had them out, though, the fact that the woman helping us had to go help someone else was actually a good thing as it gave me time to work my way through the selections so that I came away with what I think will work the best in my kitchen (an 8" Shun chef's knife and an 8 cm Global paring/ peeling knife).  On thing that I also really like is that while there is ample street parking, they have their own parking lot.  I hate trying to park on the street in the city with a passion so this is a very good thing for me.After check-out, we got a coupon for knife sharpening and if I had checked in here before we had checked out our purchases, I would have also seen that there was a 10% off coupon.  No worries, though, as I think this is going to be my go-to place for cooking supplies, and most certainly for knife sharpening in the future.  Excellent resource!

51.description: I'm not a chef, but I do like to shop like one. Prices are good and customer service is phenomenal. Why go to Target or large chain retail stores for your cooking needs when this place is around?!?!

27.description: BEST place to get your knives sharpened.  Go in drop off your knives look around for a few mins.  Pick up a few gadgets ( I can never resist) and before you know it, your knives are nice and sharp by the nicest guys!!! I love it and it's CHEAP!!! $3.50 a knife and they do scissors too!! =)

32.description: This place is a gem. You can get your knives sharpened quickly and they have their own parking lot for customers. Lots of other kitchen doo-dads and cutlery very reasonably priced. I'm a fan.

54.description: The people who work here are friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable about all their unique products.  Knife sharpening is a huge bonus for only $3.50 per knife!!

48.description: I love this place and I can not believe I've never written a review for it. (Opps...I just saw I reviewed this place in Feb 2010...okay its time for a re-review...you would think with only 650 reviews I could remember this!)Recently I stopped in to get a tortilla press. I hit a few stores in the Little Village but they were over priced and looked like they would break the first time I used them. I went to Northwestern's website and found exactly what I was looking for plus the product seemed like it was strong and wouldn't break at all.  It was also $5 cheaper then the stuff I was finding at other stores. While there I met Jerry, who helped me find the tortilla press on the shelf and we had a great conversation about food.  We even started exchanging restaurant recommendations. Funny us talking about food in a place that sells the tools to make amazing food.  Ironic!!!This place is a one of a kind store and it is located in the heart of the wholesale district near Randolph Street.  One of the reasons we come here all of the time is that they will sharpen your knives for you while you wait (for a fee). I have no idea any other place in the city that sharpens knives.  As I'm waiting I always see a constant steam of chefs and future chefs bringing in there knives and getting them sharpened. It is also fun to walk around and see all of the gadgets.  It is hard not to buy everything in here.  One day I'm buying those mini cast iron skillets there only $12.95 and so cute but I'm gonna need 4 to 6 to use them to serve to company.  I saw a restaurant use these in Milwaukee. They also have a parking lot next door which makes parking easy.  I also was able to get 10% off recently with my check in on Yelp!  Yeah Yelp check in offer!!!I love this place and I hope it never goes anywhere because it would be a loss to the Chicago Food Industry including my kitchen needs!!!

44.description: if you like cooking, this place makes you feel like a kid in a candy store. I usually go there to get my chef knives sharpened and there are so many things that i wanna buy and use lol. their prices are not bad either and their service is friendly and fast

24.description: Things here are quite pricey.  I think a lot of people in the food industry come here.  For a home cook like me, this place is too much.

7.description: This is an excellent resource for pots, pans, cutlery, kitchen paraphernalia of all sorts!In addition, the absolute best place in Chicago to have your good knives and scissors sharpened at a terrifically economical price.Service can't be beaten!Everything is not shown on their website, this is a place you must visit to believe.Stuffed to the rafters and beyond with everything anyone who works in a kitchen, professional or home, could possibly want.I highly recommend Northwestern Cutlery!

49.description: So far so good!  Good service, great prices on knife sharpening and very quick turn around.  I would definitely recommend to a friend.  Also, I took advantage of the yelp deal so that was a bonus as well:). Free parking lot too.....love not having to worry about finding parking!

40.description: Get my cheap Chinese knives sharpened here every six month and it's  like i have new wusthofs! Love this place for the knowledgeable staff and reasonable prices for professionals and home cooks alike.

53.description: They were very friendly & did a great job on all 15 knives I took in. All kinds of wonderful cooking & baking supplies plus the largest selection of knives I have ever seen. I would go back & recommend them.A little more than I expected but worth it.

30.description: They did a great job not only for my kitchen knives, but also the hair shears of my spouse.  I can't say enough good things about them - and love wandering through their store.  I look forward to the day when I can afford to have them replace all my knives.

46.description: Get your knives sharpened before the holidays are upon us and you find you can't cut the turkey (or your tofurkey) because your utensils have become duller than the Kardashian sisters. Peruse the wide selection of cooking paraphernalia while you wait. Pick up bizarre but useful items you didn't even know you needed. (A $1.00 strawberry huller became a good friend of mine this summer. ) Take advantage of the staff's knowledge and expertise. Service with a smile. Love it!

1.description: I found myself in need of some cream whipper recharge cartridges, and didn't want to wait for Amazon.  Found this place online, and was concerned (like always) about parking.  Turns out they have their own private lot.  Already a plus.This store obviously caters not just to the public, but to the trade as well.  Huge selection of chef knives and other pro equipment.  Most everything looked well-made and I love kitchen gadgets.  This was kitchen-gadget heaven.Great experienced staff and it looked like on-site knife sharpening.I'll be back!

55.description: Got my knives sharpened here on a weekday afternoon.  It took about 10 minutes and they even straightened the bent tip of my slicer without me asking!  During that time, I shopped for a few kitchen toys to spend the rest of the Yelp deal I purchased.  Love this place!

9.description: Quick and affordable.  Can't say anything bad about these guys.  The store is pretty fun to poke around in too.

26.description: This place is so cool!  I guess I don't know of another place to get knives sharpened so is it the "best" place?  Who knows.  I do know that it's always full of actual chefs as customers, so I would guess that this is the place.  It's really fun to look around at the kitchen gadgets, AND they have a parking lot.  Love.

25.description: pornkitchen porni came, i drooled, i bought knives (my first for chefdom) and other kitchen porn.  i want to be rich and buy more stuff from here.  saleswoman was helpful

12.description: It's nice to find someplace that doesn't rip you off on basics for a change.I'd been meaning to go here for some time, mostly for knife sharpening. I was also in the market for a honing knife.They do have hundreds of honing knives, but I found something better: the best baking sheet in the market. And unlike Amazon, it's nice to know as I'm holding it that I've actually found the right one., because it's the only baking sheet they sell. :-)They also had a wire rack that perfectly fits this baking sheet. Crispy baked chicken cutlets, here I come!All this for roughly $20, tax included? Bargain basement prices. It helps that they these wares to nearby restaurants, who are likely go through cookie sheets (even 13-gauge ones) pretty frequently.I'll be coming back for another one sometime later this summer, and maybe I'll even be able to pick up my honing knife then too.

59.description: Small place, yet a very good selection of tools for pro chefs and serious amateurs.

21.description: Great service and quality products. They will sharpen your knives while you wait! Lots of pro grade kitchen tools too!

17.description: Early last week, I ended up placing a special order for a pair of Mozo shoes because my size was out of stock. As promised by the person who helped me, early today I received a phone to let me know that my shoes had arrived this morning. They arrived a little over a week due to the long 4 of July weekend, though I am very glad because my first day to wear my full uniform at The French Pastry School will be this coming Monday. (Phew...)Thanks Northwest Cutlery!

10.description: I live in the neighborhood, and only 5 years later saying that I'm going to stop in I finally made it. I must have hit the right time of day because I was helped immediately and got my knives sharpened without having to wait after anyone else. In fact, 10 people must have come in after me. It was early afternoon, and I think it was done in 20 minutes so I had the opportunity to browse the shop while my knives were getting a new cut. The products are a little pricier than some of the chain kitchen stores, but it's a part of convenience and location in the city. The have a little area in the back for chef coats and aprons and hats to try on. There's a whole bakeware section with plenty of cookie cutter shapes to choose from, and of course knives of all shapes, sizes, and brands on the back wall near the register. There's also a small Le Creuset section as well. I believe it's $3.50 per knife to get sharpened. I'm not sure where else I could go for a price comparison on this, but I already cut myself after using them for the first time. So, I can assuredly say that they are definitely sharp and to handle with care.

5.description: Last week I brought them 8 knives that I had inherited from my grandmother.  They were heavily worn. A few had small chips and most no longer had a point.  Some folks might suggest hand sharpening for these (mostly vintage Wustof) knives, but given the heavy wear and my very limited budget I opted for machine sharpening. I'm really pleased with the result.    The knives came back sharp as a razor and they all have points again.  Additionally, they all came back with little plastic sleeves on them too!  If you look closely, you can tell from the finish that it was a machine job, but these are tools for cutting, not display pieces.  I also had them sharpen my wife's 2 year old Victorinox Fibrox chef's knife that had a couple of chips. The chips are gone and she was shocked at how sharp it is.One little mystery. One of the old paring knives (an Ekco vanadium) had an extremely battered handle that I had crudely repaired with epoxy.  It looks like they put a replacement handle on it!  The handle is clearly not new, and maybe I (or they) accidentally switched the knife, but think they just went above and beyond on a whim.  Thanks!Lastly, that they have a parking lot is really wonderful. It can be a real pain to find parking down there and being able to get in and out when you have kids along is a real selling point.   Though I've only been there once, their friendly staff, great service and affordable prices will definitely have me coming back.

3.description: I can't even begin to describe how much I love this place. They advertise themselves as the "candy store for chefs", which is the perfect description. It's so hard walking in without walking out with a whole bunch of new kitchen toys.The staff is experienced and knowledgeable. I don't know of any other store that has near the range of knives and other kitchen equipment that they do. I bought a chef's knive and cleaver from here and couldn't be happier. When I lived in Chicago, I used to bring my knives here to get sharped. Only quip is that their hours are a bit odd (e.g. they close at 2pm on Saturday). I've traveled to the shop more than a fair share of times only to find it closed, so be sure to check the hours before you head out!

35.description: great spot if you need a specialty tool. this is like the hardware store for your kitchen.

19.description: Want one of those metal circular things to make perfect eggs or ceviche tower? A great littlle shop to find all your little kitchen doodads for reasonable prices. It looks like the Kendall students get an extra student discount.What impressed me here was the intricate knife sharpening stations. Serious stuff.

28.description: Perfect place for knife sharpening--and there is always something else to pick up for the kitchen while waiting.  Price to sharpen knives is great--only a few dollars a knife.  If you don't want to wait while they sharpen your knives--Randolph Street is only a block away with lots of outdoor dining--dogs welcome!

45.description: If you're looking for actual cooking gear, try this place before the boutique stores and the grocery store aisle. Let's start with what they don't carry. No plates, glassware, appliances or linens. Obviously their speciality is cutlery and they carry some of my favorite brands: specifically Victorinox, Wusthof, Shun and Global. They also sell professional cases and guards for knife transport and storage. Also pocket knives. Knife sharpening is $3.50 and my chef's knife is now scary sharp.Two aisles of cookware and tools doesn't seem like a lot but they pack in a lot of quality gear into a small space. Check their website to get a good idea of what they carry. If it's on the site, chances are it's on the shelves. I came away with a piping bag with tips, donut cutter, tiny offset spatula, tapered rolling pin, parchment sheets, bench scraper, rubber spatula, metal funnel, two sizes of squeeze dishers and gel food coloring. If you need cheffy coats or pants, they have those too. Specialty gear can be found here as well like cookie cutters and molecular gastronomy ingredients. Ever try to find fish bone tweezers? They have 6 types. It's weird/awesome.Staff is courteous and knowledgable. One complaint is that the pots and pans selection is not great. They have Vollrath, Lodge and Le Cruset but more variety would be welcome.

33.description: Want one of those metal circular things to make perfect eggs or ceviche tower? A great littlle shop to find all your little kitchen doodads for reasonable prices. It looks like the Kendall students get an extra student discount.What impressed me here was the intricate knife sharpening stations. Serious stuff.

43.description: Very fast, while you wait knife sharpening. Only place I ever go to.

2.description: I would give 4.5 if I could. Took my straight razor in to be sharpened and when I got I back it was sharper than when I bought it. Everyone was very nice and they called me when it was ready to let me know. The only reason I say 4.5 stars is the sharpening was $20. Not a lot of money, but there is a sign that says sharpening starts at $10 so I assumed a blade that small would be $10. Maybe I should've asked for a price when I dropped it off?  In hindsight the shave is probably worth $20, just a little sticker shock when I went to pick it up.

18.description: Northwestern is great for kitchen knives, but they've shined at helping me with my fabric scissors, woodworking chisels and hand planer blades, and leather working knives. They also helped me pick some reasonably priced water stones so I can put a mirror finish on the new edges they set me up with. No nonsense prompt and friendly service at good prices. I couldn't recommend these guys more.

41.description: great prices on knife sharpening, and good selection of chef's tools and cutlery as well.

52.description: Awesome store. Friendly staff. Industry/student discount on top of already low to reasonable prices. Just a few blocks from Peoria Packing, win win win win win situation overall.

50.description: Excellent service and selection-the place to go for pros and everyday cooks.

4.description: These people rock. My knife had a broken handle and they offered to fix it for me at no cost.  I had taken my knives in to get them sharpened. One guy gave me a hard time because I guess I was being too loud when I was taking out cooking pans and racks to see which ones fit which. Im not sure how I was supposed to do this making no or little noise but maybe he was just hormonal. Either way he offered to fix my knife and I thought that was pretty great!

6.description: I can't brag on NCS enough.  I took my knives down (thankfully they are down the street from me) to get sharpened.  I expected to have to return later but within 15 minutes and $17 later I walked out with my entire knife set sharper than sharp!  Of course that wasn't the total bill...I had some shopping to do!I was happy for the wait time so I could check out all of the awesome cooking/baking supplies!  I was like a kid in a candy store as an avid hobby-chef.  Everyone on staff is friendly and knowledgeable and I highly recommend NCS to everyone!!!

22.description: Great selection, one of the few options a home cook has for some specifics. Great staff, and bring knives to be sharpened.

15.description: I love this place and I can not believe I've never written a review for it. (Opps...I just saw I reviewed this place in Feb 2010...okay its time for a re-review...you would think with only 650 reviews I could remember this!)Recently I stopped in to get a tortilla press. I hit a few stores in the Little Village but they were over priced and looked like they would break the first time I used them. I went to Northwestern's website and found exactly what I was looking for plus the product seemed like it was strong and wouldn't break at all.  It was also $5 cheaper then the stuff I was finding at other stores. While there I met Jerry, who helped me find the tortilla press on the shelf and we had a great conversation about food.  We even started exchanging restaurant recommendations. Funny us talking about food in a place that sells the tools to make amazing food.  Ironic!!!This place is a one of a kind store and it is located in the heart of the wholesale district near Randolph Street.  One of the reasons we come here all of the time is that they will sharpen your knives for you while you wait (for a fee). I have no idea any other place in the city that sharpens knives.  As I'm waiting I always see a constant steam of chefs and future chefs bringing in there knives and getting them sharpened. It is also fun to walk around and see all of the gadgets.  It is hard not to buy everything in here.  One day I'm buying those mini cast iron skillets there only $12.95 and so cute but I'm gonna need 4 to 6 to use them to serve to company.  I saw a restaurant use these in Milwaukee. They also have a parking lot next door which makes parking easy.  I also was able to get 10% off recently with my check in on Yelp!  Yeah Yelp check in offer!!!I love this place and I hope it never goes anywhere because it would be a loss to the Chicago Food Industry including my kitchen needs!!!

57.description: Amazing service. Experience. Decent prices.Free parking.Wide selection in a small space.Great staff!

20.description: Northwestern is great for kitchen knives, but they've shined at helping me with my fabric scissors, woodworking chisels and hand planer blades, and leather working knives. They also helped me pick some reasonably priced water stones so I can put a mirror finish on the new edges they set me up with. No nonsense prompt and friendly service at good prices. I couldn't recommend these guys more.

14.description: They were so helpful! Fixed my badly chipped knife perfectly. They also helped me find a great machete for coconut chopping! Thanks!

3.description: Stopped in this morning looking for yogurt. No go but they suggested I try the Chia Seed Pudding. It was delicious and I hope they have it every day!

1.description: Yuk! That's what I said when I first tried Harvest. However, although the jucies are made up of things I wouldn't mix myself they were pretty good. It's kind of hard to choose juice when there's a corned beef place right across the street. (See review for "The Corned beef factory.") Harvest  help me do great things for my body and weight. I totally lost like 6 pounds in 4 days with the drinks and I was not trying. They have a buy 10 get one free punch card. The Green juice gave me lots of energy to get through the day.

2.description: Ahhhhh so thankful this place is here. After living on the west coast where juice and healthy options to be thin are everywhere... It was hard finding options in Chicago. The juice and bowls and smoothies rock!!

9.description: I haven't been to this location yet, but I picked up some cold-pressed juice made by them at another shop and I'm in LOVE! I love cold-pressed juice and it's so much better for you. No, they can't make it in front of you they have to be premade. I will be checking out this place soon and stocking up on some juices for when I'm too busy to juice myself.

10.description: This place is the REAL deal. We ran into the owner while we were there and she is so personable and knowledgeable about what she does. It really shows that she has a culinary background - so much thought and detail have gone into each juice and smoothie combination. We tried the Nutty Oat smoothie and Carrot juice and loved them both.Yes, it's a little pricey, but cold-pressed juice is the BEST form of juice you can get in terms of nutrients, so naturally you pay a premium for the laborious process that goes on behind the scenes to make a superior product. I'd rather pay $8 for a really good-for-me juice than $15 for a nutrient-devoid martini... or $4 for your typical overprocessed juice at the local grocery store. But hey, it's whatever works for you. The interior is the icing on the cake (or the froth on the smoothie?). The modern, airy, semi-earthy vibe feel makes me want to go over and just hang out for a while... maybe I'll do that...

4.description: I have 2 juice bars I frequent in the city.  This is one of them.  I like how there are a lot of green juice choices at this place.  I prefer my green juices to not be so sweet and this place has a couple of good geeen options.  I also throw in a shot of ginger juice in my green juices.  The grapefruit juice is also very good. Also important is that the store is very clean, bright, and airy.  They also have started using punch cards.  The staff seems knowledgeable, but I haven't personally asked any questions.

6.description: Good stuff......health benefits have yet to see them, Ask for a frequency card as a small reward for purchasing 3lbs of vegetables in a cup can get expensive. Also, brace yourself when you take the ginger shot, it can be "wasabi" spicy and make you feel all kinds of good!

12.description: I live right around the corner from this place. Although I want to really like it, I find it hardly worth it. I've only been in a few times, but it seems the employees are always more interested in their conversation than talking to me. I am also very surprised/disappointed after taking the time to look at their large menu of juices, and carefully select the perfect juice...that it comes already pre-made in a bottle. Maybe it's the fact that this juice is a whopping 10 bucks after tax +tip (they actually have a tip jar), but I'd expect to see it made. I'm definitely not impressed by this place and would sooner make my own, or go to one of the many other spots where the juice is fresh and half the price

5.description: My fav juice bar! Delicious juices in beautiful bottles.

13.description: I love veggie juice so much and I'm a bit of a juice snob. I've tried almost every juice bar in chicago and Harvest juices are hands down the best. You can taste every ingredient in the juice and the green juices are REAL green juices... Not just fruit or root vegetable juice with a twist of lemon and some greens for colouring. I love that they use glass bottles and save on plastic and toxins. The citrus juice is amazing... Perfect balance of fennel and citrus. The nut milk is such a silky treat... It makes me feel like a million bucks. I did a 3 day juice cleanse and it was the same price as some of the 5 to 7 day cleanses I've done at other places. This one was so much more thought out and the juices weren't just fillers. This will be my go-to cleanse from now on. Totally worth the money. And to the reviewer who wanted to see them make the juice... They cold press the juice so it's more of a process than using an ordinary juicer and is more efficiently done in batches... That's why they can't do it in front of you. The cold presses are massive too. The quality of the juice is still going to be way better than juices you see made in front of you, much more nutrients are preserved. But they do make delicious smoothies at the bar!

11.description: Quick and easy. They have premade green drinks, a fennel drink, ginger shots, melon juices and nut milk. My favorite is pear infused with ginger. Also available are made to order wheat grass, juice and smoothies.

8.description: I really want to love this place. It's cute, local, and they make fresh veggie juices in glass bottles. Well, the juices are good and incredibly fresh. I enjoy the variety of them. However, if I'm going to spend $8 per juice, I would like some level of friendly and/or helpful service. The first time I went, the lady was incredibly unhelpful. I asked which juice she would recommend and she was less than helpful in distinguishing between the juices. I had to pry it out of her. Then when I went to pay, she was really awkward about it and then had issues with the machine. It took 5 minutes to pay and no real reason why. Today I went back and she was similarly awkward and unhelpful. So, bottom line-- juices are good, but don't expect good service.

0.description: This is a healing oasis in a dark, toxic world. As a raw vegan I found the keepers of this organic unpasteurized kingdom to be extremely knowledgeable, patient, and dedicated to the highest level of quality in their products and services.I have bought their juices from one single bottle up to their three day cleanse and been ecstatic with every encounter. They may "seem" expensive until you count up the cost of the huge bulk of organic vegetables and fruits that they juice down into one small bottle. Bottom line: they're cheap, not expensive.As an added bonus, this place is easy to get to: right off the Morgan stop on the CTA Greenline which is only one stop away from Ogilvie (Clinton).I give this fine establishment my highest recommendation!

7.description: This is one of the few places in Chicago where you can find (hipster) cold pressed juice.

58.description: I've lived in Chicago for 4 years now and still have not chosen and optometrist.  Well, that is until now....  Based on the rave reviews from Yelp, i made my first appointment with Dr. Brian Ortiz. My appointment was on a Saturday morning - the entire staff that was in that Saturday was very helpful and happy to make sure my needs were met. I have a very standard vision insurance.  With the insurance I have, I was quite pleased with the cost of everything.  The selection of frames they offer is very updated and trendy, not to mention very diverse.  I ordered some frames that needed to be special ordered from the manufacturer and they still had the lenses set and ready for pick up within a week.I feel very safe saying that I've now got an optometrist in Chicago.

56.description: Great overall experience.  Unfortunately, I got a bit lost trying to locate the shop (which for some reason I thought had a ground floor storefront) and was a bit late.  The staff at Eye Appeal was able to work their schedules and fit me in anyways.  Saved me the trouble of making a second trip.I had an appointment with Dr. Asano.  She was fantastic although she probably would have been even better if I had arrived on time.  As it was she was polite and nice, but mostly business.  She offered to dilate my eyes at the end of the day so I could go back to work as well.Prices are pretty reasonable.  Staff is nice.  Selection of frames is outstanding for a small shop.  Thanks to Yelp for pointing me towards Eye Appeal.

44.description: First, let me say that my rating is based on my experience with the office staff, not with the doctors themselves.  I went to Eye Appeal based on the Yelp reviews, and you guys were right - Dr. Ortiz is pretty good.  A good listener, took his time, etc.  That part was fine.My trouble started when I was buying my new contact lenses.  I purchased them online after cajoling my prescription out of the office staff.  I told them how much I was going to pay and asked if they could match or come close.  They couldn't - online is much cheaper.  They tried to tell me that the state of IL doesn't allow people to purchase contacts from the site I used (a huge company!) and that my order would be rejected.  It wasn't, and the contacts have been great.  (I've used almost all of them at this point.)Then I filed my claim with my insurance to cover the cost of the contacts.  I got a letter back saying my claim was rejected because I had already used the reimbursement allocation.  So I called and had them mail me the claim filed by Eye Appeal for my visit.  They CHARGED IN CONTACTS I NEVER BOUGHT FROM THEM!  I don't understand how such a mistake can be made when I even discussed it with them in person.  I figured it wouldn't be a big deal to fix... I called my insurance and explained the mistake.  They called Eye Appeal for me (a bonus), then called me back and said Eye Appeal was refiling the corrected claim and once it went through (about 10 business days) I would receive my reimbursement check.  Two months went by, so I called my insurance again.  They hadn't received anything from Eye Appeal!  I let my insurance try calling them again, but once again nothing happened.  So the third time I called Eye Appeal myself.  The staff said they HADN'T REFILED THE CLAIM YET!  No explanation.  I asked them firmly to file it immediately.  It took 5 months, but I finally got reimbursed for my contacts.  Even though the doctors are great, I won't be going back.  It took way too much time on my part to correct a mistake THEY made and have still not apologized for.  Besides the fact that they tried to pull one over on me to have me pay more than twice the price for contacts from them than from a competitor.  (Good thing I try to be an informed consumer!)

29.description: I went here because of the reviews on Yelp.  Dr Ortiz was great, but in hindsight, I found it odd that I walked out with both bifocals and reading glasses, and I've never worn glasses in my life.  Who knows, perhaps the years were catching up to me.  I probably could have gotten by with just reading glasses for eye strain and saved the $ from the bifocals.

42.description: Dr Ortiz is the greatest!  I had an emergency on a Saturday and he was able to see me right away!  He examined my swollen eye, gave me drops and a few hours later, I was good as new.   He has such a kind, professional demeanor, too.  I highly recommend him.

23.description: I was way overdue for an eye exam. I hesitated to go to my previous optical because my experience has always been subpar. Also, every year there was a different optometrist on staff. So my search began for a new optometrist. I turn to Yelp and decided to give Eye Appeal Optical a try. I had my first appointment yesterday and was not disappointed. My appointment was on time and the staff was very friendly. Dr. Asano was great! She was thorough and made great suggestions.They also fixed my severly crooked glasses. It turns out that I was wearing the wrong prescription on my eyeglasses. No wonder I could not wear them for long periods of time. I'm glad I finally found an optometrist I can build a longterm relationship with.

47.description: For the last year, I have been struggling with some sort of mystery problem with my eyes. It all started last April, when my contact lens Rx expired, and it was discovered by a different optometrist that there was something irritating my eyes. Since then, I've been to 5 different optometrists and ophthamologists, none of whom could tell me why I seemed to be becoming increasingly less tolerant of my contacts, and all of whom acted like it was my fault for over wearing them or not cleaning them enough, even though that was not the case. After a year of being lectured for things I was not doing by doctors who refused to listen to me or take the time to try to find out what was wrong, I have found Eye Appeal.Dr. Ortiz and Dr. Asano are two of the best listeners I have ever met, and it seems as though it didn't even occur to them to lecture me. At the first visit, Dr. Ortiz listened carefully to my tale of woe, updated my prescription, and gave me samples of an eye drop that he thought would help (apparently, the most common eye drop for this type of problem, even though NONE of the other doctors had even suggested it). Within a week, my eyes are all better, and we now know that I am allergic to silicone- duh. They are ordering an older model of contacts for me that are not made out of silicone, which is something that none of the other doctors would consider because they don't get the kick-backs from less mainstream companies. I HIGHLY recommend Eye Appeal to EVERYONE. If you don't have insurance, they are very conscious of keeping your costs as low as possible and work hard to find discounts and samples. The office staff are some of the most personable people I have ever met, and everyone I have come into contact with has been incredibly friendly and helpful. Look no further for a trustworthy optometrist in Chicago- Eye Appeal is the place to go!!!!

31.description: I signed up the yelp account just to write up this review. I have VSP insurance and went to Eye Appeal Optical for an eye exam, a new pair of glasses, and got a contact lenses prescription. I specifically told the doctor that I only want to get my glasses from them, and I will save my VSP benefit to get my contact lenses from Costco since they are a little cheaper. It took a lot of trouble to get the doctor singed contact lenses prescription (first time, they gave the wrong prescription, 2nd time, they sent the prescription through email without any signature which is not accepted by Costco, 3rd time they gave the wrong prescription again. Finally the 4th time, I got my contact lenses prescription). And when I went to Costco, they said they can not process my VSP, it seems like my benefit was already used and they suggested I call my VSP insurance. I called the next day, and they said Eye Appeal Optical already ordered and put a hold on my contact lenses and used my benefit, but nobody from Eye Appeal Optical called me about it and I didn't get my contact lenses from them either. So my insurance called them and later told me that Eye Appeal Optical wanted to hold my money for further purchases at their place, so they processed my benefit without my permission! The insurance guy said he will write something up for this company. I was so pissed off! Everyone considers to go there should watch out for them!

34.description: Incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, punctual, and they don't try to upsell you. Essentially, the opposite of the eye care chains.

16.description: I was way overdue for an eye exam. I hesitated to go to my previous optical because my experience has always been subpar. Also, every year there was a different optometrist on staff. So my search began for a new optometrist. I turn to Yelp and decided to give Eye Appeal Optical a try. I had my first appointment yesterday and was not disappointed. My appointment was on time and the staff was very friendly. Dr. Asano was great! She was thorough and made great suggestions.They also fixed my severly crooked glasses. It turns out that I was wearing the wrong prescription on my eyeglasses. No wonder I could not wear them for long periods of time. I'm glad I finally found an optometrist I can build a longterm relationship with.

8.description: I've been wearing glasses since I was 12 years old and it's only recently that I realized how important it was to attend check ups on the same. For some reason, I felt that my eyes were straining and the fear of being told I may be going blind kept me away from the optometrist. But, it got to a point where I had to suck it up and do the necessary.I looked up the Eye Optical Appeal on Yelp and was impressed by the rave reviews I found. I got an appointment for the following day which I think was awesome and arrived there on time. I was seen right on time as well. No waiting even though it was made at short notice.I met Dr. Asano who was very accommodating, friendly and reassuring. Apparently, I had been given the wrong prescription for lens and that problem was identified almost immediately and solved. Great service and reasonable fees as well.

11.description: Take my review with a giant grain of salt because I'm not actually a patient here.  I'm an ophthalmologist who used to work a few floors above this office.  Since I no longer work in the same building (I changed practices), I feel I can now write a review.I can honestly tell you I referred patients to Eye Appeal because I've heard nothing but good feedback when my patients returned to me.  I'd be very comfortable sending my own close friends or family members here if they needed glasses or contact lenses.

26.description: After being WELL overdue for an eye doctor appointment after moving to Chicago just over two years ago, I finally broke down and made an effort to track a new one down. Must consternation on Yelp over where to go began and took a few weeks to resolve...Based on other reviews, I landed on Eye Appeal and was happy with the visit yesterday. I had a 9 a.m. appointment and, figuring arriving 10 minutes early as a new patient would be a good idea, ended up waiting in the hallway for 10 minutes before they opened. A little annoying, but my fault!Upon opening, I was quickly led in, processed and in the exam room in no time. Measurements, etc. all done efficiently and Dr. Assano offered up more information and understanding than I remember from previous eye doctors.There was a slight initial upsell on glasses at the beginning but nothing difficult to shake off. All-in-all, great little practice for a bit of a hole-in-the-wall find!

39.description: I selected Eye Appeal based on stellar Yelp reviews, and everyone was right. Like many other people named Brian, Dr. Ortiz is an outstanding professional! After a period of primarily wearing glasses, I decided to try contacts again, and he was very patient in getting the prescription strength just right and experimenting with two different types of lenses. My exam was more thorough than I've had elsewhere, especially given the oddities of my vision -- my eyes don't work well in unison. He explained everything expertly, and with none of that hokey doctor small talk.

37.description: Though he certainly has plenty of positive reviews, I feel compelled to add my own remarks about my wonderful eye doctor, Brian Ortiz, at Eye Appeal.  The office has a convenient downtown location (I like getting appointments during my lunch break) and a friendly no-frills atmosphere.  Dr Ortiz is kind and thorough, and provides very reasonable recommendations for eyewear and care.  I once had a scratched cornea and he squeezed me in for an appointment and gave me some antibiotic drops - all for no charge.  He called back a few days later to make sure I was feeling better.  He knows how to keep his patients coming back!

0.description: I've been coming to Dr. Ortiz since 2007.  Tried an optical place closer to home one year and as sorely disappointed - and came right back.   They are no-nonsense here and get it all done efficiently.   The best thing is they continue to replace the lenses on a special pair of 10-year old frames that's on it's last legs.  Like them so much I brought our kids here to get their eyes done for school.  Kudos to Dr. Asano who as imminently patient with our uncooperative 5-year old.  Thanks.

38.description: Convenient downtown office, professional staff. Small office, no wait. Dr. Asano and Ortiz are both knowledgable, friendly, thorough and quick. No puff in the eye either. I got my first pair of graduated lenses (I feel old) and they're great. Chose a stylish pair of frames I like, from a decent selection.  And they take my insurance! They did a great job. Not the cheapest glasses I've ever gotten, but I care about seeing well.

51.description: I've switched my eye doctor so many times, I should be called an eye whore. Wait, did that make sense? Anyway, the point is... Eye Appeal Optical is awesome.Dr. Asano and Dr. Ortiz are the most professional people ever! I'm so happy to have found this place. They make you feel comfortable and don't yell at you accidentally sleeping with contacts on. These doctors actually CARE about their patients and will do whatever it takes to make things right. I got my frames and contacts from them and couldn't be happier! The eye exams are so painless and fast. Even though I have to walk further, it's totally worth going here. Plus the address is so easy to remember, 111 N. Wabash Suite 1111.I recently came in for an eye exam because my left eyes were bloodshot. Both Dr. Asano and Dr. Ortiz took care of me; in and out within 15 minutes. Again, painless! Why can't dentists be like them?I switched from America's Best (all they want is for you to take unnecessary eye exams so they can make extra $$$). Not cool in my book. Never going back to America's Best because I found the perfect place. Thanks Yelp! The reviews don't lie.

22.description: Your search for an optometrist ends here! I arrived super early but Dr. Asano was able to take me in early, too. She is not only friendly, but thorough and answered every one of my myriad questions. Since I'll be moving to Asia this summer, I had her print out my Rx to take with me. I have heard that some optometrists are hesitant because of so many people taking the Rx and buying glasses online, but she did so without hesitation or asking why I'd need it. The staff were awesome, too! My insurance (VSP) only covers $120 for glasses and lenses, and I just can't afford to spend much. Their glasses all have color-coded stickers, indicating the price of the frames. They ranged from $180 upwards of $350. I told them about my insurance and not having extra funds. While I was in my appointment with Dr. Asano, they gathered around 30 glasses in the style that I prefer and lined them up in 4 lines based on price ($120, $130, $140, and $150). The selection was great and I ended up asking for advice between two pairs. I was called a week after my appointment to pick up my glasses. Ultimately, I walked out of Eye Appeal after having had a wonderful experience, with a gorgeous pair of glasses and high-quality lenses, for only $26 out of pocket. When I saw the price list next to the colored stickers, my hope deflated. I just couldn't afford even their least expansive pair. But Eye Appeal made it happen and I'm one HAPPY patient and customer. If I wasn't moving out of the country, I'd be a patient for life.

32.description: The doctors here are great and I would probably come back again if it weren't for the absolutely terrible staff at the reception. I ordered a pair of glasses and some contacts from them and specifically told them to call me once both of them had arrived so that I could just make 1 trip in to collect them. Nope, rather they called me claiming that both my lenses and glasses were in, only to realize once I was already in their office that my contacts still had not arrived. Fine, not a huge deal. I pay up and collect my contacts several days later.Then, a year later they claim that I owe them money for my contact lenses and start sending me several invoices at a time. Now, I have the old receipt that says outstanding balance: $0. You can't invoice me a year later and expect me to pay up without any questions asked. I ask them to send me the original invoice for the contacts that I supposedly should have paid last year (which should have been dated Jan 2011)... and it's dated Dec 2011. So basically, it seems like they just decided to bill me $75 out of the blues and don't actually have an original invoice for lenses that I already paid for..

54.description: I've seen both doctors here, and both were excellent.  They both have a very nice manner, come across as knowledgeable, and were very helpful.  Additionally, the administrative staff is very friendly and helpful, something which I think is too-often undervalued in a doctor's office.

48.description: Wonderful place!  Always a pleasant experience.  Dr. Ortiz is professional, patient, engaged - truly focused on solving your problem, explaining what he is doing, helping you to understand the options. I have no hesitation in recommending this office and would to anyone looking for eye care in a good downtown location with really wonderful people and service.  Keep up the good work!

13.description: I meant to write a review long ago, but I figure better late than never, right? I've had shockingly poor eyesight my entire life (got contacts when I was 8), so have spent a good deal of time in eye dr.'s offices. But I didn't find out about Eye Appeal and Dr. Ortiz until last year, when the optometrist who worked with my ophthalmologist left and I needed somewhere to get glasses. I really wish I'd known about him years ago - it would have saved me so much frustration and aggravation, not to mention money! Dr. Ortiz is truly wonderful. He is patient, good-humored and, perhaps most importantly, (and something I'd never experienced from any eye dr.) he explains everything thoroughly. Vision & the inner workings of the eye are extremely complex and something I've never fully understood. Dr. Ortiz told me things about my vision that I'd never known, and spent a great deal of time discussing the best options for me with regard to new contact lenses, as well as new glasses. I also discovered that there was no reason for me to continue to see both an ophthalmologist and an optometrist unless a problem arises (like retinas begin to detach). The difference in power between my left and right lens in the monotype vision lenses was too severe for me to see well, so Dr. Ortiz sent them back for 're-tooling.' I also had to return a couple more times so that he could re-fit them (did you know that  contacts change the shape of your eyes and this needs to be taken into account after you've worn new ones for a few days?). His goal is not to assembly-line his patients, but rather to provide them with the best vision possible.I adore Dr. Ortiz, but I would be remiss if I did not mention the wonderful staff. The guys who worked to find me the best glasses in my price range, make sure they fit properly, and figure out what my insurance would pay for, as well as the girls at the front desk, who seem to love their jobs and are always laughing and schmoozing with customers - I've never encountered such a friendly staff in a Dr.'s office! They are a welcoming, very competent bunch of people, and as far as I'm concerned I've found my eye dr. for life!

24.description: I brought in a pair of glasses in need of repair at lunch today. The front desk staff and the technician were highly professional, knowledgeable and cheerful! In and out in minutes with my faith restored in customer service. Bravo!

7.description: This is a terrific find and I agree with previous review that the eye exam was amazing. Dr. Ganz has a great disposition and is quite observant which I very much appreciated. She determined without my having to say anything that my contact lens prescription was too strong in one of my eyes. I had complained about this to last two Optometrists I saw and they pretty much said I was imagining it. The tool she used to calculate eye pressure  is also a big selling point. It is and handheld tool -- quick and without that shocking burst of air in the eyes. The other staff was great too. Highly recommend!

27.description: Wow! I'm a relatively new customer at Eye Appeal Optical -- just had my first eye exam a few months ago and I'm on a trial pair of contacts right now. Well, my eye became scratched/irritated last week and it wasn't healing. So I called Eye Appeal today first thing in the morning and spoke to Dr. Ortiz. He got me on his schedule as soon as he possibly could.When I arrived, it was clear that Dr. Ortiz was super busy. BUT -- he still took me at 10:30am on the dot. Right on time. And he didn't rush through the appointment. He was extremely thorough and took time to explain everything very clearly, while also providing me with all the products necessary to remedy the problem -- going so far as to recommend a better regimen to avoid this type of thing in the future. Bottom line, I am just blown away at how thoughtful and thorough Dr. Ortiz was despite it being a last-minute appointment on a very busy Monday morning. THANK YOU, DR. ORTIZ!

49.description: Based on Yelp's reviews, I made an appointment with Dr Ortiz for an eye exam for contacts.  Dr Ortiz was fast and professional with his exam.  He gave me some trial contact lenses to try out to see which one works for me.  After several weeks of trying various contacts out, I still have some issues and questions about contacts.  I came in and talked to Dr Asano.  She's great too.  Really put me at ease with some of the quesions and issues I have with wearing contacts.  The staff is great.  They were looking for rebates and such on the contacts that I'm ordering.Highly recommended!

53.description: Great place for eye care.  Dr. Asano was very professional and the facilities seemed to be top notch.  They take VSP and seem to provide good value and honest advice (unlike For Eyes who sold me inferior contacts at inflated prices).  I believe I have finally chosen an optometrist in Chicago and would recommend them to anyone looking for a new eye doctor.

30.description: One of the best experiences throughout - from the doctor to the staff. And the main thing that impressed me was how they dealt with issues I had with the frame. They replaced the frame with a new one (without me asking for it), since they discovered a small scratch on it. Service is what differentiates an optical business from the other chains..

46.description: I love Dr. Ortiz. He's prompt and thorough, and the office staffers are friendly and helpful.

1.description: Terrible optometrist who doesn't care about his patients, only about upselling them.  After my eye exam, I asked the doctor for my prescription which he refused to give me on the basis that I needed to first try the contacts at the new prescription level he suggested to make sure it was fine (keep in mind I was still using the exact same contacts, so it was only the prescription level that had changed).  He said that after I tried them and felt they were fine, I should come in again to talk to them about options for glasses / contacts and to get my prescription at that point.Well, I tried the contacts for 10 days and felt the prescription level still didn't allow me to see clearly so I called back to see if I could come in again and check whether the new prescription was still off.  To my surprise, the doctor refused to see me and said that if the new prescription wasn't working maybe I should just go back to my old prescription.Clearly the "trial" wasn't so much in the interest of seeing whether the new prescription worked so much as a tactic to get me back into their store and getting me to spend hundreds more on their contacts and glasses.  Thanks for charging me $125 for my eye exam and making me jump through hoops just to tell me to "go back to my old prescription".

9.description: So, I'm old and stuff and I fell asleep with my glasses on my stomach, then rolled over on them in my sleep.  Destroyed.  This place had nearly 5 Yelp stars and was near my hotel, so naturally I checked it out.  I really didn't think the glasses could be salvaged and was just looking to get something new and quick.To my surprise they were actually able to  repair them!  They could have easily taken me for a new pair of glasses and i was able to enjoy the day without waiting for new lenses.Awesome place!

40.description: Great service, got me in and out on a Friday afternoon no less. They explained how to keep my eyes healthy by avoiding eye strain. I am happy . They are on the 11th floor and the building is in between staples and McDonald's just past Washington on Wabash. Go through the gold doors for the "Garland building." I chose this place for two reasons, excellent yelp reviews, and they took my insurance. I got what I expected and I am very happy, thank you Yelpers!

25.description: I've had a number of Eye doctors over the years, but Dr. Ortiz is the first one to really address my concerns. After having a number of eye appts, Dr. Ortiz called me to check up with me. And when I thought I was having an eye emergency he immediately made time for me to come in.

12.description: Thanks to Yelp, I found Eye Appeal and the awesome Dr. Ortiz about 6 years ago, and have been coming here ever since. The hype is real! Dr. Ortiz is thorough and knowledgeable and I know I'm getting top notch eye care.  He's also friendly and easy to tell your eye-woes too.  Appointment are quick and efficient so there's no reason not to take care of your eyes. :)

59.description: Great service, really friendly technicians.Will come back here when my eyesight worsens :( but for now it was a good experience.

21.description: Came in to repair my sunglasses.The guy was super nice, told me right away the risks of trying to fix them and that he would do the best job he could without breaking them (they were in very bad shape and I could not wear them). He went to the back less than 2 minutes later he was back, my sunglasses looked good as new.This amazing service was also free!!!!Def recommend this place for sunglass repair and their selection for of sunglasses for sale was also pretty good.

17.description: Great service, got me in and out on a Friday afternoon no less. They explained how to keep my eyes healthy by avoiding eye strain. I am happy . They are on the 11th floor and the building is in between staples and McDonald's just past Washington on Wabash. Go through the gold doors for the "Garland building." I chose this place for two reasons, excellent yelp reviews, and they took my insurance. I got what I expected and I am very happy, thank you Yelpers!

10.description: Amazing customer service and staff! I came here after having a horrible experience at Spex, and needed glasses ASAP! The staff at Eye Appeal were super sympathetic. They went above and beyond to make sure I got what I needed. I walked in with my prescription and picked out frames with the perfect amount of interaction with the staff. The staff quickly got my order together.
