When they found out the jerks at Spex had already authorized my insurance without my permission, the Eye Appeal staff vowed to make sure my order when through and that I didn't have to place a call. They assured me that everything would be fine and got my order ready to send when they fixed the issue. On Monday, when they were able to fix the problem, they called me to follow up and go over my entire order once again before placing. The staff's amazing work made what was a nightmare into a dream.All in all--Staff: Friendly, efficient and understanding Selection: Wide! Everything is clearly marked for price so you don't need to ask or guess. Service: Outstanding. Love these guys!

5.description: First, and last visit. I accidently scratched my eye and knew it would need some attention. Not my first rodeo so I knew I probably needed drops. Being a new resident in the area, I needed to find a new optometrist. I chose this practice since it was conveniently down the street from my apartment and had stellar reviews. First off, the receptionist was probably not the right fit for the job. I guess its my job to initiate the conversation. No greeting, half fake-smile, blank stare, sorry to say- seemed a little stuck up like she was too good for the job. She wasn't rude, just unapproachable. All around received bad vibes from her. I told her that I was checking in. I did the whole process of being a new patient, paid, and waited. BTW, just to test her, I was extremely nice and smiled (plenty) hoping I'd get a better attitude or even a genuine smile out of her. Maybe she was having a bad day? Still not an excuse. Don't remember the optometrist I had. He was an older gentlemen. He confirmed I had a corneal abrasion and would prescribe eye drops. Quick and easy. However, the part I was confused about was him needing me to come in 1-3 more times so he can check my eye to make sure it doesn't get worse ... uh .. never, in the past did I ever had to do that even with a more severe eye abrasions ( I usually RECEIVE a call from an optician checking on me) and drops usually does the job. I am a busy person and I would like to avoid additionally visits if it wasn't necessary. Whatever, 1-3 days seemed major for a  scratch so maybe it was something he noticed that I never experienced. Although it didn't seem to be getting worse, I went in for a second appointment anyway. Same receptionist, same attitude. I paid my $35 co-pay and saw the dr. However, I didn't even go to the back room .. the Dr. took one look- said it was healing. Gave me a sales pitch on glasses over contacts. Which I declined since I already had glasses. I was with him for maybe 1 minute. He then told me to make another appointment to come back for another check up! Are you serious, dude? So I can pay another $35 and see you less than a minute. No, thanks! He didn't even need to use his special equipment to examine my eye. I don't think another appointment was necessary. It is a BIG waste of my time and money! I told the receptionist I would just call and give them an update on the progress. But she insist that I should make an appointment. I get why they hired her on .. she doesn't take no for an answer. Told her I'd call in to make an appointment because I didn't know my schedule. I didn't. I also never received a call from them about the healing of my eye. If my family eye practice needed me to physically come in-and I didn't, I would have at least gotten a phone call. If I have the option, I'd give them .5 a star. At least he had the right diagnosis and prescribed me the right drops. fyi. this review was for my visit in 2013. I wasn't a yelper then. But this experience sucked, and had I had to yelp it.

35.description: I was very disappointed considering all the stellar reviews.   This was why I chose this place and it was a big mistake.  As I entered the office, I felt I was being rushed in and out.   The eye doctor was very knowledgeable and gave me the wrong prescription.  In addition the staff there appear to be fallacious in their greetings!    They are super slow and I was waiting for an hour to get everything completed.   Perhaps I went on day where everyone was having a bad day!

19.description: Excellent experience.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  Dr. Asano was extremely down to earth and very thorough.   She was also mindful of my time.   Thank you so much!

28.description: I will say Dr. Ortiz himself is a good eye doctor.  Unfortunately, the rest of the experience at Eye Appeal was not good.  Service was terrible, I waited 30+ minutes before anyone would help me pick out frames.  Several people were helped ahead of me - even though they arrived after I did.I am very underwhelmed with the knowledge of the staff relative to other Opticians I have been to.  As someone who has a very strong prescription, picking the right frame and lens shape is critical to getting a finished product that looks good.  Sadly, the staff seemed much more interested in trying to upsell me than in helping me find the right frame. The lenses I received from Eye Appeal are incredibly thick and look terrible relative to lenses I have gotten elsewhere - despite the fact that Eye Appeal actually reduced the strength of my prescription.     If you are looking for more than a good eye doctor and are looking for knowledgable staff that can help provide you a good looking pair of glasses - I would strongly recommend going elsewhere.

3.description: The Dr. has a no-nonsense approach and knows his trade well.  The optician working with me (named Jean) was just fantastic and knew exactly what worked for my face.  This will be my go-to lens center.

33.description: I went to Eye Appeal because of the reviews on Yelp and I was not disappointed. Dr. Assano is wonderful. She takes so much time and care to explain the services and to explain the procedures. She also informed me that I am nearsighted and I have an astigmatism in my left eye. Who knew?All the other doctors I have ever gone to never took the time to communicate any of that information to me. Plus she is quick and I was in and out of there in 45 minutes. I also complained of dry eyes and she gave me a free sample of a rather expensive bottle of eye drops. Such a nice experience and for only 80 bucks. My status as a student leaves me without insurance so I had to pay out of pocket but Dr. Assano, the visit, the care, and the facilities was well worth it.

43.description: Just like everyone said, Dr. Ortiz is great!  Pros:  zero wait time, friendly doctor that takes time to explain things to you, they don't push you to buy stuff right away (i.e. contact/glasses), flexibility, etc.Cons:  NONE

2.description: This is the second time I've been here. The optometrist, Dr. Asano was great. She's very personable and easy to talk to.  Her service alone would be rated 5 stars.The reason I took 2 stars off was for the service afterwards.  The gentleman helping me select glasses was rude and seemed impatient (I had a 9a appointment and was the only patient seen at the time so it had nothing to do with the volume of patients being seen).  He quickly went over the pricing and policies and left me to wander.  I ended up choosing to use my insurance allocation for contacts only because I bought my last pair of glasses through Warby Parker and felt they were a much better deal.  When I told him I wanted contacts he became even more rude, almost as if I was wasting his time.  Just terrible customer service overall.  If this guy works on commission, he really needs to step it up.  If I wasn't so lazy, I would order my contacts through 1800contacts since it's basically the same price.  Overall, come for the checkup- the optometrists are great.  Use your insurance money for contacts (I love my dailies and I tend to have dry eyes).  Save your time and money and avoid ordering glasses from here.  Opt instead for Warby Parker glasses.  For $200 total you'll get frames, lenses and that special coating preventing glare- seriously.  I would have spent at least $250 for frames and lenses here.

45.description: Fastest, easiest and most no nonsense exam I have ever had. You would think rude and incompetent right? Wrong! Friendliest and most thorough. This is the -est vision business I have been to. Thanks Yelp! Again you steered me in the right direction. Dr. Ortiz was thorough and professional and didn't admonish me for sleeping in my contacts or using them waaaaay past the 2 week date.

18.description: The staff is so friendly and get you in as soon as you possibly need to be seen. Danny the front desk guys awesome. And both dr Ortiz and dr Asano (I've seen both) are the most personable and down to earth people- as well as awesome optometrists. Go get your eyes checked now...

41.description: Went here for the first time on Saturday.  Great experience!- zero wait time- the doc was great- excellent selection of frames- great price!Woohoo!

52.description: I, too, tried Eye Appeal based on Yelp reviews. I guess you have to start somewhere. I'm not giving them five stars because they didn't live up to my gold standard, which is Urban Eyes in SFO. But they do get four, which is high praise considering that they made a mistake in my first pair, which meant my glasses took two weeks to complete. Why? Because of one very crucial thing: Danny's opinion on how I looked in the sample frames. I was pretty sure I wanted something different, but Danny said, "No, I think those other ones look better." I deferred, which is rare for me, because I know he spends a lot more time looking at people in glasses than I do. And I am not disappointed. Typically opticians are reluctant to offer opinions, leaving you squinting into mirrors and desperately trying to figure out if the frames  you're trying make you look like David Byrne or Indira Ghandi. Like it or not, it's a sad truth that how you look in your glasses makes a big difference in how people treat you. Everyone who wore glasses as a kid in the 80s knows that to be true. Thanks, Danny!

50.description: Based on the great Yelp reviews, I made an appointment with Dr Ortiz. Wow, Dr Ortiz and Danny are not only very professional but they offer stellar customer service. Really, really nice people. I ordered new glasses and cannot wait to receive them.

4.description: I saw Dr. Ganz for a contact lens exam (10/5/2015).  The most amazing exam (as much as an eye exam can be amazing) ever!  First, the office does not use the air puffer machine to test eye pressure.  It was some other high tech machine that is much more pleasant.  Second, she listened to my eye issues and explained that allergy eye drops must be administered before you put in your contacts.  Who knew!  They were conveniently located and very reasonable.  The front desk was also very helpful in emailing me my eyeglass script.

6.description: This place is perfection. Everyone's nice, the place is nice, they explain things well. I don't see how it could be any better. It makes me want to go in to get my eyes checked.Bonus: their address is 111 and their suite is 1111 and before I submitted this there were 111 reviews.

55.description: when i was in the market for an eye doctor in chicago, i tried eye appeal solely based on the yelp reviews.it's amazing how small the staff appears to be when i'm in there. the doctors seem to do a lot of the work of an administrative assistant, which is interesting. i'm not complaining because this doesn't affect the customer service in the least bit. the doctor and receptionist i met with were both very attentive. my doctor is dr. asano. she's really friendly and offers lots of alternatives and advice.there's nothing too special about the office... just your standard eye doctor but i would recommend it and dr. asano to anyone in need of an optometrist.

15.description: Your search for an optometrist ends here! I arrived super early but Dr. Asano was able to take me in early, too. She is not only friendly, but thorough and answered every one of my myriad questions. Since I'll be moving to Asia this summer, I had her print out my Rx to take with me. I have heard that some optometrists are hesitant because of so many people taking the Rx and buying glasses online, but she did so without hesitation or asking why I'd need it. The staff were awesome, too! My insurance (VSP) only covers $120 for glasses and lenses, and I just can't afford to spend much. Their glasses all have color-coded stickers, indicating the price of the frames. They ranged from $180 upwards of $350. I told them about my insurance and not having extra funds. While I was in my appointment with Dr. Asano, they gathered around 30 glasses in the style that I prefer and lined them up in 4 lines based on price ($120, $130, $140, and $150). The selection was great and I ended up asking for advice between two pairs. I was called a week after my appointment to pick up my glasses. Ultimately, I walked out of Eye Appeal after having had a wonderful experience, with a gorgeous pair of glasses and high-quality lenses, for only $26 out of pocket. When I saw the price list next to the colored stickers, my hope deflated. I just couldn't afford even their least expansive pair. But Eye Appeal made it happen and I'm one HAPPY patient and customer. If I wasn't moving out of the country, I'd be a patient for life.

57.description: Dont go there on a Saturday else you wil meet the assistants ..not really friendly ...they made glasses for me and i  wanted them to rush the delivery it took them two weeks ...first time around they messed up the axis for my astigmatism and then instead of 2 days it took them 2weeks andnow i have to travel withou my glasses.....i never met Dr Oritz at  this place because on saturdays the assistants are working....

20.description: The reviews are true! I just got back from my appointment an hour ago and everything was easy and stress-free. The receptionists were friendly and attentive. My appointment started right on time, the optometrist was laid back, loaded me up with contact samples and if I decide to buy from Eye Appeal I just have to phone-in and order. My eye exam for contacts was $100 flat with no pressure to purchase, with holding my Rx, or any of the funny business some places try to pull on you. Eye Appeal was the first place I tried after breaking up with my last optometrist, and I plan on staying with Dr. Asano as long as I'm in Chicago.

36.description: Phenomenal service and the staff is so friendly. My last optometrist experience in Chicago was terrible and I'm so glad I found Eye Appeal. I saw Dr. Asano, who was super friendly, informative and generous with her time while I asked a million questions. Because I had seen another optometrist, she suggested I get the Rx from them so I wouldn't have to pay twice and even mentioned I didn't have to get my frames there if I didn't find anything I liked, but I found a really cute pair of Kate Spade frames. I've recommended to 3 of my colleagues so far. Exams are a bit pricier at $100, but they carry a variety of frames at different price points.

14.description: All my life I've had horrific experiences with optometrists in the city. Although I often say it's the last time I'm going to see one, I always end up needing a pair of glasses. Fortunately, a good friend of mine told me about Eye Appeal and I decided to give it a try. As soon as I stepped in, I was taken to the exam room where Dr. Ortiz gladly answered to my wide range of questions and offered some advice on how to maintain a healthy sight. Thanks to his calm and care I realized that not all optometrists are the same. At Eye Apple no one tried to sell me the most expensive product in the store. In fact, the doctor actually said that he preferred a $160 pair over a $200 one. The service is one of the best in Chicago and the only regret I have is that I didn't find this place earlier.

0.description: Attended the soft opening, where Meg personally greeted each guest.  This gallery is very inviting where art is presented in natural light and showcased in a way that invites the enthusiast as well as the curious.Meg is a gracious host, fabulous artist and inspiring teacher.I will definitely visit again.

28.description: These guys are the best framers I've ever worked with.  I've had multiple pieces framed here.  They've been perfect with both 2-D & 3-D items. And their suggestions for matting & framing exceed my own eye. Very reasonable prices too. Highly recommended!

1.description: I have a slight addiction in collecting concert poster art. I know my stuff when it comes to archival framing.  Everything I've brought here has surpassed my expectations. I will probably have some prints re framed that the big box stores jacked up. These guys do this for a living and it shows in the final project.

39.description: Highly recommend CMM Framing to anyone!!! The employee I dealt with, Chris, was very personable and was truly engaged in the piece I had framed. Also the space not all drab like other frame companies. It has a good environment inside, relaxed but professional, charming decorating AND did a terrific job on my piece.

9.description: Love these guys. They are super chill and really creative. They will help you find the right frame setup for anything you have. I love all the pieces I've had made there and can't wait to have them help me with more!

29.description: I chose this place based on the reviews I saw here on Yelp. I had no clue as to what style of frames I need get. Chris, the owner, did an amazing job in explaining me about the wide variety of frames ( they have a huge collection!) that would go well with my posters. And he also gave me a discount being a new customer. I would definitely recommend this place to someone who is looking for high quality work for their buck.

23.description: Chris was so great to work with! He quickly responds to emails and is very thorough. I wanted a jersey framed for my husband and Chris helped me decide on the frame and matting. I dropped off the jersey Sunday afternoon and it was complete Tuesday morning (they are closed Mondays).  Very affordable, honors Yelp specials, and super easy to work with. They even drove me home since I live in the neighborhood! I would highly recommend CMM!

5.description: WOOOOOOWWWWW, is probably the best response that i can give for my experience with Chris over at CMM Framing. Excellent experience i took him 7 jerseys to be frame he was very reasonable in cause as well as fast turnaroud on my jerseys. I even brought him another jersey while he was framing my other 7 and he was able to get them all done on the same time line and when i came to pick them up i end up paying less than i was quote. And the quality of his work was amazing, i wish i could post a picture of the work... An amazing experience Thanks Chris and team... Thanks,Kevin

31.description: They did a terrific job with my item that I brought it.  They took the time to discuss what I wanted and made suggestions for me.  When I declined some of their suggestions they did not attempt to push me in any direction.  I was very happy with the finished product and it did not take as long as I anticipated it would.  I will be back again.

25.description: Chris is extremely attentive to quality and craftsmanship. You can tell he really enjoys what he does and making his customers happy. He handled a huge order for me (60 prints in total) and did a phenomenal job. I recommend his shop!

12.description: Chris was so great to work with! He quickly responds to emails and is very thorough. I wanted a jersey framed for my husband and Chris helped me decide on the frame and matting. I dropped off the jersey Sunday afternoon and it was complete Tuesday morning (they are closed Mondays).  Very affordable, honors Yelp specials, and super easy to work with. They even drove me home since I live in the neighborhood! I would highly recommend CMM!

37.description: Chris (the owner) did a great job, and I would recommend his shop to anyone.  I initially went to CMM after buying a coupon, but I liked it so much that I ended up having 5 pieces done by Chris.He took lots of time with me picking out matting, the frame, etc.  He also worked within my budget.  His store location is easily accessible and has lots of his work displayed, so you can see the many different things he can do.  I'll definitely go back!

21.description: Loved my experience with CMM Framing, especially Chris! I was researching options to have my bf's jersey box framed for Xmas (including the cost to do it myself) and reached out to CMM Framing for a ballpark estimate via email. Chris responded right away! Given the cost and convenience (and difficult fabric with which I was working with) I decided to drop the jersey off with Chris. He took a look at the jersey and gave me a few options for the matte and frame which I'm so glad he did, because the finished product turned out WAY better than my simple black on black suggestion would have.  He broke down my pricing options in detail e.g., folding or not folding the jersey, the platinum color frame or the black frame and kept in touch via email throughout the entire process. Although I told him I had tons of time before I needed the finished jersey (dropped it off the last week of October!), he got back to me within 2 weeks saying it was ready to go! I'm more than confident he could have turned around my project that same week if needed.  Lastly, he agreed to keep the finished project at the shop (about 2 weeks later) until I was back from out of town and had the perfect window of time to grab the jersey, get home, get it wrapped and hidden away for Xmas before my bf got home. The only meh piece is it wasn't easy to park and run into the shop after work as there's no parking from 4-6 pm.  Luckily, I threw on my hazards and Chris carried the completed frame out to my car; service above and beyond.I definitely recommend CMM Framing!

16.description: These guys are fantastic! I would highly recommend them to anyone.I initially found them when I googled for a place in the west loop and to avoid the madhouse of larger shops I previously went to. I worked with Chris to find a frame for a signed print from a well known European street artist.  Chris was patient and took the time to help me find the right frame and provided good suggestions. His focus was all about what would compliment the art and not trying to up sell me into getting some elaborate or expensive matting or frame, When it came time to pay, he was upfront about having a coupon on yelp which at the time I wasn't aware of and provided me with the discount anyway. I was told it would take 2-3 weeks. I then called a day later to see if I can get the piece earlier for my housewarming and they were able to make it happen and it was ready within days. The framed print looked amazing and  even better was that the result and cost spent was minimal and so much better compared to the larger shops like the AF without all the craziness. I returned a couple weeks later after I received a piece of art from Washington state and went in with pictures to see what type of hooks and anchors I would need to hang it, since it wasn't a normal picture that needed hanging. Chris made a drawing, showed me where and what hooks & anchors were needed, and then ended up providing me with all the pieces which he provided at no cost even after I offered to pay as an appreciation of my patronage.I have never written a yelp review before, and I was not asked to do so nor am I being paid or have anything to gain.  It's only because I believe that Chris and his shop are not only so deserving as their work speaks for itself,  but it's small businesses like this one that exemplify a true customer orientation, integrity, and sincere respect for the customers that walk through their door which is rare to find.I would never use another shop again.

17.description: I am so glad I discovered CMM Framing through Groupon, I have tried other Framing places, they always cost me hundreds of dollars even after using Groupon.  The first time I went to CMM, I was surprised that the Groupon covered everything, and I did not need to pay any extra money.  They also did a very nice job, no complaint.  After that, CMM is my go to place for framing, you cannot beat their price, and the quality is there.  Chris is also very nice to work with.  Good price, good quality, and good service, what more can you ask for?

10.description: CMM framing is clean and inviting. The owner is very welcoming and he truly enjoys making quality and creative frames for his patrons.  I went to CMM to get a piece of art framed that has been in my family since the 80's.  If there's no parking on Halsted, definitely look on Green st. (one block west of Halsted) I always find parking there!

11.description: I will never get professional framing done anywhere else. The proprietor is super friendly and has a wonderful artistic eye which brings out the best in the framed pieces. I wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone looking to have something professionally framed. He is an artisan and it is wonderful seeing this craft carried on because nothing can compare to a crafted frame for a beloved poster, artwork or photograph.

26.description: We had an old wrinkled map of Paris framed and it turned out beyond wonderful! Chris helped us decide the frame and matting that would highlight the piece. It is now in the living room and it's hard not to just stare at it all day. Worth every penny for the amazing craftsmanship. We will be back.

27.description: I couldn't recommend CMM highly enough. Chris knows his sh*t. He's super prompt and covers his bases. We had to get a few large prints framed for our company and he did an amazing job; we did everything remotely at first, so he picked frames out based on our price point, decor style, and the look of the prints without even having them physically yet. He even sent back samples of the frames to make sure it's what we wanted, and of course I ordered incorrectly. It was a mistake that was quickly rectified because he anticipates stuff like that, which is the sign of an excellent businessperson. And his prices were extremely reasonable for what we had done -- he offered a very generous discount since it was a company order. I'm getting all of my framing done here from now on! Thanks Chris, you're the best!

35.description: Chris took such good care of us.  I really appreciated that he presented us with multiple options but didn't try to up-sell or talk us into the more expensive choice.  My husband and I are hardly art connoisseurs ... we had an idea of what we wanted when we walked into CMM Framing, but Chris really took the time to bring our pieces to life.  Best of all, he finished the work in the amount of time he quoted us.  We will definitely take our business here in the future.

8.description: I've had plenty of items framed. By the big box stores with crazy discounts that you still end up paying an arm and a leg for, through the mom and pop stores that try to charge you 50X the piece of the art to frame it. All in all none of them great experiences.I first shopped at CMM for a big very last minute art project and they were amazing. Completely understood the budget and timing and delivered miracles. Next I recently stopped by for some stuff I had held onto forever but hadn't managed to frame it. Again, great service, done in a very timely manner, and completely reasonable prices.Thanks guys!

0.description: Amazing quality framing!  Chris picked out a gorgeous frame for our family heirloom antique architectural print. The frame and matte accentuate the print beautifully and the craftsmanship is top notch.  He also framed a set of prints in a single frame, which I think looks stunning.  I wouldn't have thought to put both prints in one frame, but I love the way it looks.This is truly museum quality framing, and I know because I work in a museum.

38.description: CMM Framing is by far the best framing place we have been to!  Chris was awesome from the start.  He took his time with us and helped us decide which frame and matting would compliment our piece the best.  He has an artistic eye which helps with the process of choosing what works best.  His shop is very organized and has a wide variety of example framework.  The selection is broad but not overwhelming.  We could not be happier with the end result of our piece.  If your looking for professional framework, with fair pricing, great selection and expert to take care of your work, go see Chris!

20.description: Awesome job!!  They where on time.  Price was very good.  Could not have been happier with how the piece turn out.  If you need to get something framed this is the place to go.  We live in the burbs and he had no problem coming out and doing the work.

19.description: Awesome job!!  They where on time.  Price was very good.  Could not have been happier with how the piece turn out.  If you need to get something framed this is the place to go.  We live in the burbs and he had no problem coming out and doing the work.

33.description: I trusted Chris, the owner, with a series of large rolled canvas-printed photographs to be stretched and couldn't be happier with the results. He was very consultative throughout the process and quoted me what I felt was an extremely fair price on the job. We ran into a small hiccup during the job related to the quality of my canvases and without going into too much detail I will simply say that Chris went above and beyond what anyone should ever expect a small business owner to do in order to keep a customer satisfied. The finished products look excellent and the quality is on par with what you'd expect at some of the more well-known framing shops around town. It's clear he takes pride in his craftsmanship and it shows. I'll be back to have him complete more work for me in the future.

2.description: Excellent job! I came in with a signed throwback Rizzo jersey to frame, not knowing any colors I wanted for the frame or background. Chris worked with me to look at different frame, background and glass styles to come up with a great end product.All the guys in the shop were very professional and incredibly helpful. i'll be back for sure.

34.description: Great store + great service. Chris is a serious and proactive professional. He has a great eye and can provide fantastic recommendations for your work. And once you receive the end results, you'll be pleased.His store is neat too - he gets so much work from both regular customers and artists, his store is like a modern art museum of sorts. Highly recommend. Would go there again.

32.description: I first found this place through Groupon, and brought in a couple pieces. Chris, the owner, is one of the nicest and most accommodating people you'll ever meet, not to mention extremely adept and creative with his craft. He does work with colors and mattes unlike anything I've seen at other places, and he put his flair to work on a beautiful striped shadow box frame for me. Each and every time he's done work for me (4 pieces and counting) I come away completely satisfied, if not blown away. Maybe the most incredible thing about Chris is his pricing-framing can be a very expensive service, and because of this I sought cheap alternatives, like Target frames, for my art. But even if you don't have a Groupon or Gilt City voucher for CMM, Chris will work with you on the price until it is a manageable number that you're happy with. What's more, he always gets the work done in the timeframe he quotes, and the one instance he was behind by a couple days, he called to apologize and explain. As far as I can tell Chris does all the work himself, and he is accountable and dependable. I can't recommend Chris at CMM Framing highly enough. If you want to have your art framed but don't want to pay the prices that Michael's or another place is charging, please give Chris a try and I promise you won't regret it. You will also probably be inspired by one of the many quirky and creative pieces on display in his shop.

18.description: Just walked out of CMM Framing after waiting over half an hour to be assisted, while the couple in front of me discussed every detail of their not one, not two, but three pieces they were having framed. Not to mention two employees working but only the one could possibly assist with framing for whatever reason. The logical thing to do knowing that there was going to be a wait would be to ask me to leave a number and call back, instead of wasting my time as I was given a wooden chair to sit in and wait.. Looks like they do good work here but I will never know because I will not be returning due to this horrible customer service.

41.description: Chris is such a great designer. All of the frames from this shop look amazing and the customer service is very laid back, The sales people are very knowledgeable about framing and art. Its a great overall experience, and the designs are amazing! check out the website, i don't see why you would go anywhere else!

13.description: Loved my experience with CMM Framing, especially Chris! I was researching options to have my bf's jersey box framed for Xmas (including the cost to do it myself) and reached out to CMM Framing for a ballpark estimate via email. Chris responded right away! Given the cost and convenience (and difficult fabric with which I was working with) I decided to drop the jersey off with Chris. He took a look at the jersey and gave me a few options for the matte and frame which I'm so glad he did, because the finished product turned out WAY better than my simple black on black suggestion would have.  He broke down my pricing options in detail e.g., folding or not folding the jersey, the platinum color frame or the black frame and kept in touch via email throughout the entire process. Although I told him I had tons of time before I needed the finished jersey (dropped it off the last week of October!), he got back to me within 2 weeks saying it was ready to go! I'm more than confident he could have turned around my project that same week if needed.  Lastly, he agreed to keep the finished project at the shop (about 2 weeks later) until I was back from out of town and had the perfect window of time to grab the jersey, get home, get it wrapped and hidden away for Xmas before my bf got home. The only meh piece is it wasn't easy to park and run into the shop after work as there's no parking from 4-6 pm.  Luckily, I threw on my hazards and Chris carried the completed frame out to my car; service above and beyond.I definitely recommend CMM Framing!

4.description: Absolutely amazing service and great finished products... I had movie posters that I wanted framed and they made them look RICH! I'll be back *Arnold Voice*

24.description: Awesome amazing amazing!! Just picked up my 2 pieces from Chris at CMM (my first time having something professionally framed) and I couldn't be happier! Chris took the time, about and hour, helping my choose the perfect frames for my 2 large canvases. Today I picked them up and fell in love with them all over again. Chris is Wonderful. Very pleasant and he really knows his stuff!! I highly recommend CMM  for everyone's framing needs - large or small. Can't wait to have something framed! Thanks Chris!

6.description: We all have framed photos that are really important to us. My favorite is a vintage family photo in an antique glass frame that belonged to my late grandmother. I spent hours on google trying to find a replacement for the cardboard easil backing, which had fallen apart. No luck. So I took it into my favorite framer, CMM, not sure if they'd even accept such a little job. Five days later, I picked up my frame with a new easil backing that fits perectly. Chris is truly awesome!

22.description: Was just thinking the other day about how happy I was with Chris and my frame I wanted to post on yelp to show my appreciation. Thank you Chris.

15.description: The service is so great there, and the people that work there are so nice. I was devastated when my mirror fell off the wall and the frame broke, but they fixed it in no time! Such a great place!

40.description: I strongly recommend this place, especially with the Yelp deal for $60. The owner was very kind and personable and he did a terrific job with my canvas painting. I appreciated the customer service, prices, business hours (til 7pm) and beautiful work.

7.description: We had Chris frame a very special piece of art.  My husband and I disagreed on the style of frame, but Chris was able to help us find a frame, style and matting that worked for us both.  He was careful and detail orientated.  My husband hurt is back and so Chris delivered and hung the piece for us too so we could have it for a big party.  When we received it, we noticed it had a slight imperfection and Chris noticed it too, so he took it back to the shop, fixed it and came back to hang it again. The frame was complex, had three panes of museum glass and it looks incredible!  His recommendation on the sizing and proportion ended up being perfect!Chris was nice, honest and a really good guy to work with.  We highly recommend his store!

36.description: We had an extremely positive experience at CMM, and ended up getting two pieces done there, a painting that is very precious to us as well as our wedding photograph. Chris (the owner) handles customers personally, and has both a fine artistic eye and a great sense for when and how to give helpful guidance when customers are trying to choose a frame that will complement the piece they would like framed. We really appreciated his ability to articulate what aspects of a photo were highlighted by a particular frame/mat, and to respect our budget. I should mention that we came in with a Groupon and that didn't change the quality of attention we received at all. Additionally, his workmanship is of superb quality and we are proudly displaying our newly framed pieces.

30.description: As soon as I walked into Chris' store it was perfect.  He asked me the right questions, we looked at various frames, he provided his opinion, gave me pricing options, etc.  It was the first time I ever got something professionally framed and I would never go anywhere else after this experience.  Chris is an amazing person and helped me choose the right frame for my artwork.  Highly recommend!  Thanks, Chris!

3.description: highly recommend this place. Best customer service I've ever had. you write and email/call and you have an answer in less than a day and trust me when I tell you I am a pain in the butt to deal with.  I had a frame that broke and had to be repaired. they did such an amazing job, and delivered the finished piece, pictures attached. added museum quality glass, if you have something very special or unique to get done and need someone to trust, this is the place.

14.description: Swinging by CMM Framing today to get a couple small jobs done. Big or small, they always do an excellent job!

1.description: Well...instacart,  you could be so great.  But you're not.  You're kind of the worst in fact.  My order is never right.  My hands clench up when I start getting my first round of texts from my shopper. "They're out of....blah blah...everything...never ever do I have an order that actually has exactly what I want.  I get weird substitutions,  plus subs that are double the price. I get produce that's on its way out.  Meat that expires that day.  If I'm spending a $20 fee, which is usually what it ends up being,  I want what I order. I don't want a $25 chicken or $16 worth of organic milk.  Two days ago,  I received two gallons of conventional milk,  but was charged for 4 half gallons of organic milk for $16. It's still not resolved. Dear Instacart. I'm out. I just deleted your app.

9.description: Ok I've been using this company awhile now and wanted to update my review because it's been a life saver and such a convenience over the last few months.  The ease of the app is what's really great- I can place my order and schedule my delivery all on my commute to work, it's genius. The shoppers are always quick and seem to really try to accommodate/ find what you're looking for and I appreciate that.  Overall I'm a very happy customer and appreciate the convenience and flexibility this service offers. They even go to Petco now which is awesome if you need to grab food for your dog too.

23.description: Just tried InstaCart today after having tried PeaPod a couple of weeks ago (yelp.com/biz/peapod-skok… ).I really like the fact that the InstaCart minimum is $35.  Since I'm only buying for me, it helps.  I spent a lot more than that, because their site is pretty well designed and when one has a potato chip addiction, let's just say that a page full of chips is a rabbit hole I'd not care to discuss in detail :-)They had a lot of variety and I liked the fact that I could search for an item and the results indicated that the item was available in a different store.I ordered from two different stores and both ladies that delivered were great!  The first was a little early, so thankfully I was here to get the stuff.  I will have to keep that in mind for next time.Great selection, great service, overall great experience!

5.description: I'm working my way towards becoming a hermit and Instacart is really helpful in that pursuit.  Living in the loop without a car makes grocery shopping a bit of a hassle.  I love being able to do my grocery shopping online from home or work or really anywhere.  In my area I can get Instacart deliveries from Whole Foods, Mariano's, Jewel, Petco, Costco, and a couple other places.  There is a mark up for some of the stores but not for Whole Foods, which is my usual choice anyway.  One huge plus for me with Instacart is being able to get groceries delivered within 2 hours (most of the time).  I can decide what I want for dinner while I'm at work and place the order to be delivered when I'm walking home from work.  It's soooo convenient.  The price for delivery isn't too bad either, especially compared to Peapod.  I chose the "unlimited" delivery for a year for $99, which is a really great deal for someone like me who wants fresh food a couple times a week (some weeks). My only issue with Instacart is that a few times the deliveries have not been within the time window I picked.  But!  They gave me a credit towards future purchases.  Aside from that I'm really happy I've found Instacart.  Pretty soon I'll be able to be a full blown hermit, and I have Instacart to thank for that.

25.description: The idea: great.The cost: pricey if your order is less than $35The execution: poor.When I choose a delivery time it's usually for good reason- I'm not available during other times.  They have twice delivered my groceries before my desired delivery time.  Unfortunately I wasn't available.  Instead of apologizing for their error, the delivery person said "well I'm not going to wait around for you to get here, I guess I can take it back to whole foods- they'll have to re deliver later tonight".  He made it seem like I was putting HIM out.I've also had strawberries with mold and the wrong item delivered.

12.description: First I'm a fan.  I use Instacart all the time and for the most part its great for living in the loop.  I do wish they would shop at the store that I shop at, so that I could consistently rely on specific products and brands. But, that is another story.I'm writing this because Instacart Chicago has stopped tipping the drivers from the tip we leave at check out.  So, if I give a 20 dollar bill to cover the shopper and the driver the shopper is getting the whole tip.  I verified this with the driver and Instacart.  I'm expecting the deliveries to start going down hill.  The delivery drivers for Instacart are using their own cars and paying insurance for using their cars for business.  I can't say I know what the delivery drivers are paid, but they cant be so much that tips don't matter.  This has become an inconvenience for me having to be home for a delivery and to have cash on hand to tip the driver.  Plus, its a pain when you have two shoppers.  Even more so, when you have a driver who also shopped for an order. I hope that this message gets out, so that Instacart users know there has been a change in the tipping process.

21.description: Great service for if you don't want to go to the store, but after using them loyally/consistently...the delivery man I think accidentally left the receipt in my bag. If you look at prices IN the stores, most them Instacart contracts with will charge 15-20% less. I just found this out. Even though this is stated on their website in small print, it is a bit deceiving. So 15-20% more on groceries with instacart, a 3.99-7.99 delivery fee depending on when you want delivery or if it is during busy time, and then on top of that your 10-20% tip. Pretty ridiculous, and I feel cheated after all the times ive ordered. They won't refund money either. Also, they will tend to forget things here and there. So, if you need that important ingredient, and they forget it...you're either screwed, or have to wait to get it as they will send someone back to the store for you. It can be an inconvenience. But, right now...just pissed due to how I feel a bit cheated with the cost of this service.  And, when I feel cheated...that's 1 star for them.

16.description: Who else will deliver 5 cases of Ice Mountain water,4-24 roll packs of toilet paper, 5 cases of beer, some kale, an organic apple and a years worth supply of Cinnamon Toast Crunch to your River North 30th floor highrise door for $5 (YES delivery is only $5!)?I was just surprised that just because I gave the driver the wrong address and once he found me just loaded the bulk cargo on a cart, told me his time in the loading zone was up and he can't afford to get ticketed or towed, wheeled the cart through the main entrance and took off.The nerve!

17.description: I found the ordering process very confusing. The interface wanted to charge me 2 delivery charges, when I was only ordering from one store. Further, some of the prices were incorrect, so I would either not get the item or be charged more than I expected. Overall, the process was cumbersome and the administrative end was handled poorly.

10.description: The ordering process went smoothly enough, or so I thought. When the time came for the food to be picked up, I realized there was a problem: somehow the order had been scheduled for pick-up instead of delivery. I realized this when the store called to talk about substitutions and said the order was ready for us to pick up. I'm still confused about this, which was made even more confusing by the text message updates I was receiving saying the order had been picked up and then that the order was being delivered, even though I was on the phone with the store right then and already knew that wasn't the case. An hour later, the store called back and said that someone from Instacart was going to their store to pick up my order. There were two things that were substituted, and one thing that they didn't have which I'd asked not to be substituted, but everything else had been there. The order total originally was $46.49, but when I looked at the charge on my bank account, it said $56.44. An hour and a half later, the Instacart employee arrived at my apartment to deliver the groceries.I mentioned the overcharge to her, and she said I would have to email Instacart to get it fixed.Once I got my groceries, I immediately knew something was wrong because I had ordered two 12 packs of soda cans, and the bags weren't nearly heavy enough. Before the employee left, I told her that there were things missing. I then checked my order and saw that the 12-packs were marked as "found," which meant they should be there. However, she didn't have them and even admitted that she hadn't checked the order to see if everything was there before leaving the store with it. She said she would go back to the store and pick up the missing items, so we'll see if that actually happens. Lastly, I checked over the two substituted items and made sure everything else was in the bag. Everything else seemed to be there, although I was pretty confused at some of the portion sizes for items. For example, I'd ordered a box of crackers, and the picture displayed a 12 pack, yet I received a 6-pack. Also, the bananas were $.30 each, which was definitely pricey. The two items I received as substitutes weren't really anything close to the original item I'd chosen, so that was disappointing. Overall, I would not recommend this experience to anyone. I've ordered several times from Prime Now and had zero issues. If there comes a time when Prime Now has everything I need, I will definitely just order from them instead.

11.description: I have been using Instacart for about a year now and thought it was getting somewhat better. Today I mistakenly put the wrong delivery address so I was trying to correct that. The 2 phone calls I made were so rude and couldn't talk to me or get me to a supervisor because they were all busy. I was just trying to get them the correct delivery information that finally on the 3rd call I fixed. Postmates and Amazon now both deliver groceries so I think this will be my last order. Beyond rude and stupid. If you let someone explain their situation then maybe you wouldn't be in this situation Instacart!

26.description: I guess the most appropriate place to start is with a comparison to Instacart's main competition: Peapod.Pros of Instacart over Peapod: delivery is significantly cheaper (in most cases) and almost always faster. Instacart allows you to choose from five or six stores, including one for your pets. Instacart lets you select replacements for items that might be out of stock, and you can request that they call you to discuss replacements. And the biggest pro, for me anyway, is Instacart lets you add the tip up front and put it on your card. With Peapod, better have cash. That can be a nuisance. The shoppers have always been extremely pleasant with both services.Areas where Instacart falls a little short: prices and sales. Peapod has an extensive list of specials and sale items. Instacart has nothing of the sort. No sales, no specials, and it can occasionally be a touch more expensive than in-store prices. And that's really the only shortfall that I've found with Instacart. Everything else is aces.Overall, I love Instacart and will continue to be a regular user of their service.

22.description: We have used Instacart several times simply because we were too lazy to go to the store, but after several attempts, we've determined they cause us more hassle than the chore of getting up and going to the store. Here's why:1. We have had several deliveries where the driver drops the bags and leaves and as we unpack we find we are missing MULTIPLE items. Like to the tune of $60 on a $150 order is missing. 2. When you call the rep to explain the items are missing they tell you it's not their fault, but the store's fault (in this case Mariano's) and that they will get your items. 3. Sometimes we get the items delivered later, sometimes we get an email saying 'here's money back.'  4. If the rep can't find your item, they will substitute, but they are not choosy with substitutions so you may end up paying significantly more. Overall, Instacart isn't worth the hassle. Nice idea. Poor execution.

0.description: Instacart enticed me some promotional offers, and there was nothing to lose so I gave it a try.  I'm not sure if my experience would have been as good if I was ordering more complicated things, but I was just restocking non-perishable essentials like coffee, tea, granola bars, chips, etc.  My shopper started picking my order within a few minutes, and I received notification about a substitution (1 out of 12 items), which was pretty close/acceptable to me.  A text was sent when the driver was on his way with an ETA (10 min. ahead of 2 hour time frame).  Some of the stores have marked up prices, but the available stores that offer the same prices as in-store are displayed, which is fair.  Delivery cost is $5.99 for orders over $25 or  $9.99 for orders $10+ plus tip.  After reading a few articles, it's unclear whether the tip goes to the shopper or driver, and Instacart is vague citing that it varies by region.  I hope that covered "my shopping team."  This definitely a time-saving and convenient experience for people who are pressed for time or don't have cars.  Another plus is that it provides more shopping options than your regular Jewel or Mariano's.  Although Plum Market is not far from where I requested delivery, it was off-route so I normally wouldn't make the trip, but they a nice selection of local, natural and organic items that Whole Foods doesn't carry that I had to order online in the past.  Since I have a car, and there are grocery stores than open very late or even 24 hours, I'm not sure if I'm the customer for this, but I would keep it in mind when in a time crunch and/or I don't want to leave the house.

20.description: Instacart- have more pride in your brand. This is an opportunity for you to out do anyone in this category. Your representatives have no pride in working for you. It shows. They incessantly call about your items (defeats the purpose) or they bring 2 slices of deli meat when you ordered 2lbs.  Who orders 2 slices of deli meat??

19.description: BEWARE of Instacart.  I have used Instacart for quite some time, and, largely, have been pleased.  Recently, I received an order that contained several incorrect items.  Attempts to complain to Instacart went unanswered, so I file a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.  While that resulted in the refund that I sought, Instacart retaliated by suspending my account.I am disabled and I am unable to go to the grocery store for large items, so I have depended on Instacart--PeaPod's prices and delivery charges are too high.  I am angry at their move and have complained to my Alderman about their corrupt business practices.  My best advice is that, if you can, AVOID this business at all costs.  If you depend on them, just never complain about their service as they will shut you out too.

2.description: I was taught that when you are wrong you own up to it. If you are factually incorrect (heaven forbid!) you fix that error immediately. If you hurt another's feelings, you apologize and make darn sure you change your actions so it does not happen again. So, here goes-I was wrong and incorrect in my initial appraisal of the advantages of using Instacart.I have changed my ways, purchased a year long pass for delivery, and am a devoted customer.What changed?Instacart offers more stores from which to choose in my area. The addition of stores has caused pricing to become a bit more competitive. Additionally, if I am not finding the prices I want, I have options for my order. I now have stores that sell groceries with no markup. Pretty fantastic! I have found that some stores, that do markup, have items at less than shelf price. For example, I can purchase a certain produce item for at least $.50 less through Instacart than if I were to go to the store. I also have adjusted my expectations. I place exact substitutes for every item. I expect NO ONE to be a mind reader or guess what I would choose. I don't leave it up to chance. If they don't have what I want, don't purchase anything. Thanks!I will admit, the system is a bit buggy and I find it irritating that the only *help* is an email option. HEY, HEY! They fixed this with updates!!! You can now chat OR call!!  How awesome!! I'm pretty happy with my service and shoppers. I love not having to lug groceries in and out of a car -something that is pretty difficult in my world. Instacart makes my life easier :)

18.description: Instacart is a handy service for those times that you just cannot make it to the grocery store, but just make sure to check your order before you part ways with your delivery representative. Once they are gone, it is difficult to get in touch with anyone from the company to remedy any errors. They will contact you, but when time is of the essence (as it most likely is, if you are using this service), they still have a lot of work to do.

13.description: My delivery was somehow diverted and I didn't receive it. There is no phone number you can call for assistance, I received texts from the "shopper" accusing me of fraud and it was twelve hours before I received an email reply from Instacart. There solution was we'll redeliver or refund your money and give you a ten dollar credit. I had been depending on that delivery for guests. I had to add shopping to the list of things I needed to accomplish before my guests arrived. Instacart was a convenience I was willing to pay for so that I could receive my guest well and enjoy their visit. It became a nightmare I won't soon forget. I do not recommend them. The extra cost is not insignificant and when they accuse you of fraud it really is adding insult to injury. Let the buyer be aware!

4.description: I used Instacart for a year and I can honestly say not "once" was my order ever correct. My sister lives in San Fran and tells me how great it is; they bring her tons of samples and mistakes are rare. I had to wonder if we were talking about the same service! I've had orders late, I've been called by my shopper to tell me WF is out of turkey (yes, turkey) at which point I asked him to put the person at the deli on the phone who quickly cleared that up. I could go on and on with my nightmare experiences but the bottom line is....I should have gone to the store myself and saved a lot of time, headache and aggregation. Whatever San Fran is doing, Chicago needs the use them as a model bc everyone I know has given up on this awful service.

24.description: I love having things done for me and I don't have a car. So schlepping my grocery's around is low on the list of things I'd rather be doing. Ergo I love instacart. The user interface is super easy to navigate. Love the option of several stores and the fact that I'm doing it all online away from in-store temptations means I'm usually making healthier choices. There are tons of coupon codes out there for your first order. And after that, the delivery costs aren't really that bad. Especially if you think of it in terms of time spent shopping and costs of an uber or public transit both ways.Not sure what constitutes an acceptable tip percentage, however. So I'm not sure if that brief flash of disgust on the delivery lady's face was because of my unkempt apartment or my miserly tip amount? The world may never know...

6.description: Holiday shopping time and work is chaotic so I decided to give this service a try so I could save a little time which in the end I didn't at all. Ordered 19 items, one of which was a special request since it wasn't listed on their website and the shopper said they couldn't find it? I even went on Target's website to verify the item (a pharmacy staple) was in stock before placing my order, which said they had ten, and to get it's full description for the shopper?They delivered a couple of the wrong items, right brand but the wrong style when I didn't ask for any substitutions for any of the items I ordered. I thought they were suppose to text me to verify replacements but I never received any updates other than my special request item not being found. So I ended up going back to the same store the following day and found the right items that were incorrect and my special request item which was supposedly unavailable?The online ordering process was simple enough, I even removed a few items before my delivery with no problem. Delivery was on time too but the shopper just dropped off items at my front door and walked away, didn't say hello or anything which I found a bit rude. I understand it's the holidays and I am sure they are busy but a simple hello would have been nice.In summary the company was fine they refunded the items which were substituted incorrectly, they also offered to redeliver the correct items but since I had to go back to the store anyways to get my special request item I chose the refund. The shopper however didn't seem to care much about their work performance which left me sour on ever using this service again.

15.description: The idea: great.The cost: pricey if your order is less than $35The execution: poor.When I choose a delivery time it's usually for good reason- I'm not available during other times.  They have twice delivered my groceries before my desired delivery time.  Unfortunately I wasn't available.  Instead of apologizing for their error, the delivery person said "well I'm not going to wait around for you to get here, I guess I can take it back to whole foods- they'll have to re deliver later tonight".  He made it seem like I was putting HIM out.I've also had strawberries with mold and the wrong item delivered.

7.description: What a terrible service. Set up my account and ordered 34 items. Very easy to order, nice interface. OK, lost my half complete order for no reason but hey. In the process was told that  one - only one - item was noted as often unavailable. Came to check out and found that 90% - literally - of my order was either out or needed to be substituted. How does a grocery delivery service via a major grocery store have NO chicken broth? NO lemons - just bags of organic ones. NO red bell peppers. NO half-and-half except low fat?Why do they offer products that they don't have? Complete waste of time. Never again.

8.description: I guess the most appropriate place to start is with a comparison to Instacart's main competition: Peapod.Pros of Instacart over Peapod: delivery is significantly cheaper (in most cases) and almost always faster. Instacart allows you to choose from five or six stores, including one for your pets. Instacart lets you select replacements for items that might be out of stock, and you can request that they call you to discuss replacements. And the biggest pro, for me anyway, is Instacart lets you add the tip up front and put it on your card. With Peapod, better have cash. That can be a nuisance. The shoppers have always been extremely pleasant with both services.Areas where Instacart falls a little short: prices and sales. Peapod has an extensive list of specials and sale items. Instacart has nothing of the sort. No sales, no specials, and it can occasionally be a touch more expensive than in-store prices. And that's really the only shortfall that I've found with Instacart. Everything else is aces.Overall, I love Instacart and will continue to be a regular user of their service.

3.description: Don't waste your time signing up for this service.  I spent 45 minutes logging in my items; paid for them; and then expected the delivery.  I did not receive the items I ordered, instead they sent an email saying the account was fraudulent! WTH?!!! NO phone call, NO request as to why they made this claim, just cancelled. Instacart cancelled the order about the time it was due to be delivered to my home.    If you call customer service and inquire as to why the account was listed as fraudulent with no explanation, they will tell you they can't help you until some from another department gets it and reviews in it 24 hours.  This is insanity at its best.  A complete waste of time.   I will happily continue my Peapod account.

14.description: I love having things done for me and I don't have a car. So schlepping my grocery's around is low on the list of things I'd rather be doing. Ergo I love instacart. The user interface is super easy to navigate. Love the option of several stores and the fact that I'm doing it all online away from in-store temptations means I'm usually making healthier choices. There are tons of coupon codes out there for your first order. And after that, the delivery costs aren't really that bad. Especially if you think of it in terms of time spent shopping and costs of an uber or public transit both ways.Not sure what constitutes an acceptable tip percentage, however. So I'm not sure if that brief flash of disgust on the delivery lady's face was because of my unkempt apartment or my miserly tip amount? The world may never know...

1.description: I hate writing this review because everyone at the salon was very friendly and it was evident that they were going out of their way to make you feel welcome, however my experience was subpar - and frankly just strange.I got a no chip mani + pedi.My pedi was great, no complains there. However, my no chip mani was done by a nice lady who seemed to have little experience doing nails. She did a wonderful job filing and buffing, and was kind enough to ask if the shape was fine and if there was anything I'd like her to fix. But when it came to the painting, things started to fall apart. First off, she did just the pinky and ring finger to start -- so this meant 1 layer on the left pinky + ring finger, then UV lamp, then 1 layer on the right pinky + ring finger, then UV lamp, 2nd layer on the left then UV lamp, 2nd layer on right then UV lamp, etc. Only after 3 layers did she move on to the middle and index finger for each hand -- rinse and repeat the process described earlier. And then finally moved on to the thumbs. So as you can imagine, this meant  18 rounds of the UV lamp since it was for 3 layers, two nails a time. (If she had done all fingers together, it would've simply been 6 rounds of UV for 3 layers.)Moving on, when all nails were colored, she did the top coat in one go (thank God), only to take on the color again to GO OVER the top coat with another layer of color to fill in any spots she missed. She then proceed to layer on another top coat. All in all, I had my hands under the UV lamp at least 24 times. Not to mention she then did the edges, which asked for another round of UV. That makes 26. At least she was thorough.If you've been counting, that's SIX coats of thick no chip, and of course, my nails came out looking like marshmallows. Not to mention this took me 1.5 hours. They didn't have a drying station and so I was asked to wait another 30 minutes for my toes to dry naturally. In sum, it was 2 hours for a no chip mani + pedi.*Not to mention the strange booking policy. I had a Gilt City voucher and this was the third time I had tried to make an appointment at least a week in advance. The first two times they were fully booked. Instead of booking a time and date that work for you, they ask you for a range of times/dates and call you back a day later to let you know what slot you get.

9.description: Found the salon on PrettyQuick.com.Made a Mother's Day appointment for a Mani & Pedi.My Mama LOVED the experience. We brought our own vino which was chilled in a wine fridge. Had the place to ourselves. I plan on returning for blowouts!!!

12.description: Such a great experience! Absolutely welcoming and inviting environment the moment you walk in the door!  The absolutely most perfect place to go for your after work mani-pedi.  A glass of wine and a perfect no chip mani and pedi... Need I say more?! So glad to give Eleventh Hour a try.  I will be back bi-weekly!!

21.description: Complete & Total relaxation is what's on the menu at the Eleventh Hour Salon. The entire staff was super friendly & laid back. I went in for a massage & facial but ended adding a waxing session. Rosalyn had me so relaxed with the steam, low lights & soothing music I think I fell asleep for awhile. I am definitely going back.

16.description: I got a Hair cut at this salon, I found it at Yelp and based on reviews I selected this place. It was Sunday and I had no appointment I just called and asked if they can give me an appointment and they said this is fine. I asked for basic hair cut which was 60 $ which 15% tip included too. The girl who gave me a hair cut was Cortny which was super nice and kind. She did a great job.I will come back to this place for sure.

17.description: My first experience at Eleventh Hour Salon was amazing! I needed a hair trim before an interview in the West Loop area so i scoped out some places nearby. Initially, I was hesitant because the salon seemed fairly new and there were not many reviews on yelp. They had some people outside promoting the salon so i deiced to try it out.First of all, the customer service was great! They have iPads at the styling stations, free snacks and water, music with head phones you can use, and comfortable shampoo bowls they wash your hair in. If you have your smart phone or computer, you can connect to their free wifi while you wait. My stylist, Shantale, was very professional and great to talk to. I gave her a vague idea of how I wanted my hair cut, and the result was exactly what I wanted. The salon has a very professional, yet positive vibe; if you are having a particularly stressful day, it would be a great place to relax and get a spa treatment. After my haircut, they mentioned some promos they were having. They were polite, but not pushy about the deals they had. If I move to or start working in the area I would definitely hit them up on these offers. I was extremely happy with my experience at eleventh hour salon. The next day, the receptionist at my interview even complimented me on my hair! This is definitely an up and coming place and I would not hesitate to book an appointment if you are in the area. They have very flexible hours (11-11), the customer service is great, and they have a professional, yet relaxing vibe.

10.description: This salon is lively (I mean that in the best way) and professional at the same time. I had my first sew in with Courtney who did an AMAZING job!! You will not have a stylist snapping their gum, on their cellphone while trying to do your hair-but hey if that's your thing, go for it! You really can't go wrong here, while I was getting my hair done, a couple women came in for no chip manicures and they left happy and excited to return. He even was patient enough while a client looked on Pinterest for a design. I noticed another client who came in wanting a Keratin treatment. Everything done here is dealt with laughter, a good mimosa, and professionalism. I searched for a hot minute for a good salon around my area and decided to just bite the bullet and look in Chicago and it is well worth the drive for others that are considering this salon. Hell, make a day of it and go shopping at the Watertower Place! Lol

5.description: The best.Nothing more to say.People are fantastic Quality great.

11.description: Loved the salon the second I walked in. Lovely staff, awesome ambience and decor. Was given wine as soon as I sat down and was offered a bunch of services and offers right away. Loved my haircut (trim on long hair, layering, wispy side bangs) and will definitely be returning. I've been looking for a salon to go to for a while now I think I've  finally found one :) I would definitely recommend this place.

22.description: My first experience at Eleventh Hour Salon was amazing! I needed a hair trim before an interview in the West Loop area so i scoped out some places nearby. Initially, I was hesitant because the salon seemed fairly new and there were not many reviews on yelp. They had some people outside promoting the salon so i deiced to try it out.First of all, the customer service was great! They have iPads at the styling stations, free snacks and water, music with head phones you can use, and comfortable shampoo bowls they wash your hair in. If you have your smart phone or computer, you can connect to their free wifi while you wait. My stylist, Shantale, was very professional and great to talk to. I gave her a vague idea of how I wanted my hair cut, and the result was exactly what I wanted. The salon has a very professional, yet positive vibe; if you are having a particularly stressful day, it would be a great place to relax and get a spa treatment. After my haircut, they mentioned some promos they were having. They were polite, but not pushy about the deals they had. If I move to or start working in the area I would definitely hit them up on these offers. I was extremely happy with my experience at eleventh hour salon. The next day, the receptionist at my interview even complimented me on my hair! This is definitely an up and coming place and I would not hesitate to book an appointment if you are in the area. They have very flexible hours (11-11), the customer service is great, and they have a professional, yet relaxing vibe.

0.description: I purchased a Gilt City voucher for a mani-pedi here- so glad I did.I went in on a Saturday (Nov. 14th) for the service.  I was greeted warmly & up-beat (by who I think is the owner).  She took my coat and offered my a glass of wine.  I arrived a bit early because it takes me forever to pick out colors.  She was super helpful and patient with me as I analyzed every shade they have :)  When I finally settled on colors- I was escorted to the massaging chair (nice touch).  A guy did my pedicure & it was excellent, from the foot & leg massages to the polish, awesome.  The same woman who helped me pick the colors did my manicure.  Excellent no-chip...nothing chipped or peeled the entire time I had it on.  I had a dark color and my nails grow quickly so I ended up getting it taken off a week and a half later but it definitely would have stayed on the full two+ weeks.  Also- they let you know during the appointment that they guarantee the no-chip mani and to come back at anytime within the two-weeks if anything chips or peels and they will fix it free of charge.I tried to get back in to get another no-chip manicure but they couldn't get me in so I went somewhere else in the neighborhood...wish I would have just waited to go back to Eleventh Hour...as my no- chip experience at the other salon was not good.

20.description: Loved the salon the second I walked in. Lovely staff, awesome ambience and decor. Was given wine as soon as I sat down and was offered a bunch of services and offers right away. Loved my haircut (trim on long hair, layering, wispy side bangs) and will definitely be returning. I've been looking for a salon to go to for a while now I think I've  finally found one :) I would definitely recommend this place.

19.description: I'm totally digging this new boutique-style full service salon. The girls are so welcoming and I was having a bad night and they definitely helped! Amazing wax and custom spray tan!! The vibe is awesome, fun and chill. Def recommend this place to anyone!

2.description: I found this hidden gem of a salon on Gilt City.  I would highly recommend this salon to anyone.  I was traveling from out of town and needed a mani/pedi before an event and the staff made special arrangments to fit me into their schedule to accommodate me.  My nails looked amazing and the service was some of the best I've experienced at any salon anywhere and I travel often.  My nails looked amazing, the staff and the service was amazing and I received a quick ride back to the hotel in a 1929 Model A Roadster with a 350 under the hood!  You can't have a bad day when you start it off like I just described.  I will return to this salon every time I travel to Chicago.  Thank you thank you thank you!!!Please support this salon!  They do a great job and provide exceptional service.Your newfound loyal customer,Kellie Smith from Washington State

18.description: Found this salon through reviews and decided to give it a try- I was able to book a facial and a hair cut back to back, which was very convenient.  From the minute I walked in I was greeted so warmly and treated like a friend by everyone at the salon.  My facial was so comprehensive; Lydia took her time and made a recommendation to do microdermabrasion based on my skin.  My skin looks amazing.  My hair cut was great and the styling was beautiful- Sarah did an amazing job and was so fun to talk to.  I had such a blast and felt very relaxed!  Will be back again!

13.description: I just got a dermaplaning facial with the oxygen add on...it was amazing!!! Lydia is awesome! Everyone there was so kind and welcoming. They got me checked in early and actually let my boyfriend buy me this facial as a birthday gift, even though they don't sell gift cards for money value. They treated me like they were happy to see me again, even though this was my first visit. Love it!!!

4.description: All the services a girl needs PLUS wine  This shop is a win and you can get your whole life at the same time.

6.description: Such a great salon! I went there on a Friday (an hour and a half before my actual appt) and they were easily able to accommodate the change. I had my eyebrows waxed and a no chip mani. I have super sensitive skin and the wax was super gentle. I love my no chip manicure and appreciated the care the nail tech provided. I've scheduled an appt for a blowout in a couple weeks. If you live or work in the area, I highly recommend checking out this salon!

15.description: Wow.My sister was in town this week for a visit, and we were looking for a salon that was open on Monday for facials.  I found Eleventh Hour Salon via Amazon Local.  I've had some bad experiences using discounts for beauty services, but my inner cheapskate won out, and we purchased a $125 oxygenating facial for about $80.  Additionally, I was able to schedule the appointments online, which was a huge bonus at ten on a Sunday night.We arrived a bit before our appointments Monday morning at 11.  Immediately, we were offered a vast array of drinks, including mimosas.  Umm, yes please!  The lovely receptionist, Animah, opened a fresh bottle and the morning was off to a pleasant start.  The staff kept talking to us like we were long lost cousins or something, and we settled into the couches.The gent that did our facials, Ian, was running a bit late.  We saw him walk in at eleven, (for an eleven appointment,) and by the time the room was ready and we got started, it was 11:20.  Although I was initially a bit irked, Ian immediately apologized profusely.  It happens, so no biggie.  He was so gosh darn adorable I couldn't stay mad for long.Now the facial itself?  Mmmmm.  I got a little freaked out by the *tiny* robe provided, but it made sense later.  For starters, Ian has the gentlest hands.  Ever.  Secondly, every other facial I've had, some cream or the steamer is started, and away goes the practitioner.  Ian stayed in the room every second of the hour and fifteen minutes, and whenever he wasn't working on my face, there was a lovely shoulder massage.  Lovely.  It was basically a facial and massage all in one, and was just about the most relaxing thing I've done in ages.  Ages, people!Animah kept the mimosas flowing while I was waiting for my sister.  And then she dropped a bomb on me.  She asked me to get my parking meter ticket so they could reimburse my parking.  Let me repeat that in case you are in disbelief like I was.  They *reimbursed* my parking.  In Chicago.  I tried arguing, because really, I'm prepared to pay for that.  But she insisted, and I was floored.  I'm still pretty psyched about it.Four days later, and my face is smoother than a baby's patootie.  And my super, super sensitive skin has nary a blemish nor spot.  I'm in love!  I will most definitely be not only going back regularly, but purchasing one of their nifty packages of 11 facials, and trying a few other services as well.  Heck, I might even try and schedule one at 10 on a Sunday night.  (Oh, did I mention the insane hours they are open???
