I think that's where the 'Eleventh Hour' part comes from...)  These people have a great thing going.  Can't wait to go back!

7.description: Love it here. The girls are friendly, its also a nice environment. I get braidless sew ins, which is hard to find in the city. My hair is done right, and i end up looking fabulous. Go see sara.

8.description: I have been all over the city and this was the first time I actually walked away feeling good about myself and bit more educated about haircare.  Sarah was a trip, super fun and knowledgable and no bulls*.  She didn't look at me and say "You need fixed!" like other salons.  Rather, "How can you walk away feeling your best?!"  I will definitely come back. And the woman that helped me with my appointment and information was lovely as well. Thanks again! ;)

3.description: Only one star b/c they refunded all my money.Where to start.. This salon might have friendly staff but can't cut hair at all. I went for a haircut on my birthday it should've been a red flag when a simple haircut took 2 1/2 hours. The next day I washed my hair blowdried it and realized my left side was longer than my right side by 2 inches. The layers and bangs all uneven.     Courtney had curled my hair so I had not noticed the crappy haircut until my hair was straight.   I call the next day I left a message about what happened. Salon called... Apparently they do not cut hair 7 days a week (voicemail needs to be updated) I had to wait 5 days to get an appointment.  They assured me a senior style Sarah will fix my hair.  Whole weekend I was upset didn't enjoy my birthday Bc all I can think of was my hair. (Very petty to cry over hair I know) Day of my 2nd appointment salon text me (8am) saying if I can come a hour later because a client move an appointment to accommodate her.  Of Course I said No. Are you serious!!  My appointment is priority, I am an upset client! How can you even think of texting me to move my time.  I didn't yell or swear, Very polite.. All I wanted was someone to even the hair.  I get there for my second appointment supposedly with a senior stylist Sarah. It was going fine, hair still looked uneven at the bottom but she tired to fix it, until the end she thought she grab finishing scissors and chopped my bangs in 1/2... I just put my head down and told her not stop. (I really wanted to scream and yell just make a scene, but didn't.  I just told them to stop) Sarah didn't even give an sincerely apology she left/ran to her client that was waiting for her.  Didn't even say bye or sorry while I left. Unprofessional on her part. The front desk girl was very nice she refunded all my money including the additional gratuity I gave Courtney.  Her apologize was very sincere.  I had very long hair, down to my hip.. 10 inches gone! I run 5 days a week and now I have 2 inch width of hair keep falling out!  Sarah said she cut a small bit nope it's very noticeable when I put my hair behind my ears or up. I did not want to post a bad review for Salon because they were very nice.  However, my hair says it all!  Not a happy client! Please do not go there for a haircut. Advice to the owner- definitely needs to hire new hairstylist if you want to survive in the West Loop! For 5 days I was telling people I was so upset with my hair and where I went.  Many people warned me not to go back and go somewhere else.   I learned my lesson!!!

14.description: The staff is awesome!!!! As soon as you walk in, you're greeted by everyone. I went in to get my hair styled-loose curls- and make up. They did a great job, my curls lasted for a couple days, which is soo great! I will definitely be returning!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

58.description: I bought Colossal Shrimp which were very well chilled (or maybe mostly thawed). They were slightly pinkish in a massive pile. Thus I asked if they were cooked and was told no as that's the color they have. I didn't take the ones of the top of that huge pile as I had dug through a few to get the biggest and most in tack. Upon taking them home in minutes, into the fridge and back out after about an hour they had a strong scent. But when cooking, it was the scent of ammonia. Bad shrimp was disappointing as it was a hefty price tag. I didn't take the half cooked shrimp back to them as I had to get on an airplane the next day. I'm not sure they would have wanted it back either.

56.description: This is a great fish market.  They are my go to fish monger.  The fish is fresh (you can tell by the salt water smell and clear eyes w/ whole fish) and the price is right.  Come early on the weekends as the parking is difficult.  You come in to the place and grab some plastic gloves and go at it!  Also, if you get a whole fish, you can take it to the back to get it cleaned, scaled, etc.

29.description: I've been going to Isaacson's for three years now and have always left impressed. Their prices are reasonable and the selection is fantastic. This place trumps Whole Foods any day.Fair warninng: this shop is beyond real, as in the place smells like dead fish and has everything on ice + living things on ice real. You walk in, instantly smell death, accept it, put on your plastic gloves, get your basket, and put your fish in plastic bags, just like you would do with produce at the grocery store. There is no one there to do it for you. They will clean whole fish for you after you buy it, but for the most part, you're on your own, kid. This place is not for the sheltered!

42.description: I don't buy fish anywhere else.  Their prices are great and they have an extensive selection from fillets, to whole fish, to shellfish, to squid, cuttlefish, and octopus.  They will gut and clean any fish you buy, which is great.

23.description: The fish was fresh and reasonably priced. Lots of great exotic things, and the origins of the fish is posted. They also will clean your fish after you buy it~

47.description: This market was one of the first places me and my dad would check in for fresh and inexpensive seafood. After +20yrs, the place hasn't changed much and remains to be a true find.Giant walk in fridge where you can REALLY get your hands on some of the largest and freshest scallops/clams along with a good variety of delicious sea creatures. Heads, tails or all - giving you all the omega fats, vitamins and minerals one could ever need. Great prices, free parking out front (yep, this is incredibly rare), is one of my primary grocery stops should I have a weekday off.

8.description: Went here for our NY eve dinner prep.WHOA, its busy...like really, really busy.They have a HUGE selection of seafood.  Be prepared to reek of fish..duh.They have plastic gloves to be able to scoop up whatever you want.Two separate lines...one to weigh and one to pay.Have to spend over $100 for credit card...however, its pretty easy to do here.Parking...plan on getting lucky and getting one of the 5 spots in front...OR slap on your hazards in the street like every other Chicagoan.

31.description: Selection and price are the selling points here. There is a wide and excellent selection of fish, whole or cleaned.   There is  an extensive frozen section with more unusual fishes and fish cuts. There are guys who will quickly clean your whole fish for you, and it's customary to tip them a buck, or more if they're doing several fish IMHO. You put on gloves and pick your fish. It's like being behind the counter of a fish monger.  This place is not for the dainty, nor for the Whole Foods crowd.  Parking is very challenging on Saturday.The customer service runs the range from friendly to indifferent, to irritable.  I was in there a few weeks ago when the place was more packed than I'd ever seen it before.  I accidentally bumped into some worker with a cast.  He looked at me like he wanted to kick my ass right on the spot.  I was all apologetic but he wasn't having it. And then there is a guy who weighed my fish and he's chatting about how he cooks monkfish and all, nice guy.  And then there's the guy who takes your money and he never says anything but the price you owe and doesn't even look at you.  it's about the selection and price.

34.description: Seafood heaven! Three rows of fresh fish that you pick yourself (don't worry they provide gloves) and they are ready to clean and prep your fish. Why get grocery store fish when your fish could be this fresh?

16.description: Great selection of fresh seafood and fish.  I will definitely be  going back. Got the Chilean Sea Bass and Colossal Shrimp, can't wait to cook them up today.

13.description: Love this place.  I go in here and want to BUY ALL THE FISH!!!!  I don't but it's something that has a strong potential to happen.  Anyhow, got some scallops from here and they were super fresh.  I still needed to rinse them and they still had a slight metallic taste but for the price they were great.Last time I got baby octopus.  Two small ones were five bucks and I consider this an absolute steal since one at a restaurant is usually $15 or more.  Really fresh tasting and tasted amazing cooked.  I also got some black cod - If you haven't had black cod you have no idea what you're missing.  It's a tad expensive ($23/pound) but it's so worth it.  They have bigger pieces here and you will think you won't need it but trust me, you do. Get it and cook it and then let it melt in your mouth and realize you did need those bigger pieces and you'll probably get 2 pounds next time!I love this fish store and the prices are A-OK considering the quality and selection you get.

11.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! We've gone there quite a few times and I never leave disappointed. The staff is very helpful, the prices are good, and the seafood... oh, the seafood!! If you like the sea creatures, do yourself a favor and go here ASAP!!

39.description: I have come here a couple times with the boy. We've also visited Rubino's down the street on Lake. The selection is wider and cheaper compared to Rubino's because you get everything whole. If you want fish already cut into filets and don't mind the extra cost, go to Rubino's. But at Isaacson, you get whole fish, squid, etc. You can ask them to gut and scale the fish after you purchase it. They also provide styrofoam boxes and ice if you have a large order. I don't know if they will filet the fish for you. I'm used to seeing my parents buying fish in Chinatown so this is different. However, I like what they offer. Plus they have fish bones available in case you want to make a stock!

37.description: This place is my seafood heaven! Fish, octopus, shrimp, clams, lobsters, they have everything! I bought Chilean sea bass from them and the filets are so tender and fresh. Also tried octopus and Black Sea bass. Maybe I will try some shrimps next time.They can clean your fish for you - after you pay of course. And this place is clean - no bad smells like some other seafood places may have.Hearts to this place - I can't believe I just found out about it this year!

0.description: Wow, what an awesome place!We needed some Chilean sea bass for our Christmas dinner and due to questionable quality and general unavailability at our supermarkets, a cousin recommended we make the trek up to the West Loop to check out Isaacson's.This, friends, is a real-deal no-BS fishmonger. Put the gloves on, grab a bag, and help yourself. Then, weigh and price everything at the scale, receive a ticket, pay at the window, and you're on your way!  The selection is vast. Everything from frozen to as fresh as can be. They have fish from all over the world, some you may have never heard of before. We were not only able to find the exact fish we needed, but watched as it was filleted moments before being put out for sale. The entire process you really have to appreciate. It seems like today's consumers are separated from the sourcing and suppliers of their foodstuffs, but Isaacson's bridges the gap between the two, creating a no-nonsense fish market that people like myself come all the way from the suburbs for. Not to mention, the employees are friendly, helpful and patient. The prices are also pretty good, just from some quick price comparisons we did while we were inside.There needs to be more places like Isaacson's!

38.description: I have lived within walking distance of this place for 6 years and only just recently ventured in...shame on me.  So far all I've bought is sockeye, sockeye, sockeye.  Well, it's summer and you have to get it while the getting's good, right?  The prices are much better than Whole Paycheck (no surprise there) and the sockeye quality has been  just as good.  One bummer is that they won't scale filets for you, so I have to scale them at home.  Scaling at home=mess.  But it's a small price to pay for great wild salmon at a good price.  I'll definitely have to try their black cod/sablefish/butterfish (whatever name you happen to prefer for it) because it's one of my favorite fish ever, but it's previously frozen so I'm guessing they'll have it a lot.  My advice, which shouldn't be a surprise considering it's a fish market, is to come early so that you aren't left with picked-over goods, especially since everyone's pawing through the fish with their gloved hands.

51.description: Ok seriously how the fuck do you live a couple blocks away from this place and never check it out?Oh right... utterly constant "travel" for "work."  Good excuse.They have steamers.  en.wikipedia.org/wiki/So…That's all I have to say.

27.description: The ONLY thing about this place that sucks is that its only open till 4pm on weekdays... I can only make it out there on saturday mornings which totally blows since I really do love their fish, and wish I could get more fresh stuff to cook during the week instead of having to only eat on weekends or freeze it.  Who knows, maybe someday they will be open till 5 or even 6pm and they will get my elusive 5 star rating :)

32.description: This is really quite phenomenal - it supplies fresh fish to lots of restaurants in the west loop and elsewhere in chicago.  They have chilean sea bass, octopus, prawns, scallops, cod, skate wing, you name it, they have it.  a must if you love seafood.  All fresh, some wild caught.

54.description: This spot is not only a fish market...it is also an EXPERIENCE! The selection is super fresh and the prices are very affordable for what they offer. We purchased scallops, tuna steaks, and shark and a day later we had a seafood festival on our hands. Check it out!

48.description: I am very impressed with this fish market for a few reasons:1. I got red snapper, baby octopus, and scallops and all three were of exceptional quality and freshness. 2. the store looks very clean. 3. baby octopus cost $5 less per pound than the other fish market nearby.4. awesome selection of fish and other sea creatures. 5. super-fast checkout becauses the weighing and payment is very well-organized.

44.description: We went to get fish for homemade sushi, and we left with fish for homemade sushi.  Despite the sign that said "we recommend cooking all fish," we ate it raw later that night and everything turned out okay (as far as I can tell).  Tuna steaks were something close to $17.99 a pound, and salmon fillets were about $7.99 a pound.  Both were great.  I'd like to go back for their cajun spiced catfish and calamari, both for frying.  We'll see.

24.description: Fresh fish, great prices! I went last Saturday with my family to check the place out. You put on plastic gloves and get to pick out your own fish. No more glancing behind display glass checking out if the fish's eyes are fresh or not. We bought a whole pound of Chilean Sea bass, 5 mackerels, 1 huge Spanish mackerel, squid and oysters. All for the very reasonable price of 67 dollars. I am definitely coming back here again!

7.description: The best damn fresh fish in the city. They have everything except live crabs, which you could easily get in Chinatown. The selection & service is always worth it. If you have ever eaten at a fancy seafood restaurant in Chicago, chances are they bought your meal here before they prepared it for you. Check out the seasonal shellfish and fresh fish specials.

49.description: EXCELLENT fish and prices. Got some sushi grade salmon & Ahi that was just as good if not better than other well known places & for less, in the case of the salmon, HALF the price. Really a unique experience, when you walk in, you feel you just stepped onto the poop deck of a ship. Not cuz of the smell, but because everyone is in waders and long white coats. Avast! Whar be the marinated fish? Starboard? You lost me at Avast... Really a fun experience that I will be frequenting more often as they feature a Swordfish steak for under $15 per pound! Amaze-balls, try it, you will not be disappointed.

40.description: This is a no nonsense, no frills store, and I love it. If you want good fish (fresh or saltwater) this is the place. Put some gloves on and grab those babies for yourself...tuna! pike! skate! octopus! butterfish! mackerel! scallops! snapper! Clams! Bronzino! trout!....Pay for them and then ask the workers to scale, gut, and filet to your desire. Seriously, if you like fish, you will lose your mind walking in here. Excellent prices on fresh fish. Oh, and when they close, they close, you sloths! For instance, they close at 1 on Saturdays. And by "close" I mean CLOSE. At 12:59 a worker comes around and removes all the price signs. You, my friend, are DONE. Pay and be GONE. And if you are outside--as we saw one poor soul, begging for 5 minutes with the fish--too bad. You are done. Haya terminado (or so says Google Translate.)  Can't blame them. Long day on the docks, as it were. Meanwhile, I am officially hooked...so to speak. I can no longer buy fish anywhere else.

53.description: Everyone says that we need to eat more fish...well you have no excuse not to because that is all this place sells.I love walking into this store because all of your fish is right there.  I can take a plastic bag and grab what I want.  I do not have to tell the guy to grab me the second fish in the third row...if I want it, then I just grab it and throw him into a plastic bag.  There is no catch and release program here...it is called grab and buy!!!There are many different kinds of fish available plus you can get a whole fish, a fish fillet, shellfish, fish heads and marinated fish.  Honestly I am assuming the fish heads are for a fish stock...being Sicilian if there were horses heads here then I would be worried.During the holidays...Christmas to New Years this place is just crazy.  In fact, last year they had a guy directing traffic and parking cars three deep on a city street.  Personally I choose not to take part in this circus and found my own spot on the next street over.  I didn't trust that the guy in the orange vest was going to stop the Chicago Police from writing me a ticket for parking illegally.We love making my own calamari so we will buy the squid from here and then I watch my wife clean it and cook it...then I taste test it...oh wait...I think I love that my wife can buy me squid here and we can have fresh calamari...if she had a page on Yelp I would give her 5 stars for all of her hard work and the quality of the dish.I love that this place exists and I can come over here at any time to get some fresh seafood.  If you have not experienced this place then you are missing out on a fun and healthy experience.

30.description: My husband and I decided to make steamed clams for a special dinner. Isaacson's had big, beautiful clams for $.50 each. The quality was excellent and the shopping experience was shockingly easy -- it has dedicated free parking spaces right out front. The place is a kind of crazy sight to see with all of the piles of fish and guys cleaning and gutting them right in the open. Not for the squeamish!

46.description: I'm a fisherman,  I fished thousands of fish in my life. I know exactly what fish eyes look like and in many whole fish there is a layer of silicone or plastic gel  added to the eye. Next time I'll take a picture and post it!

1.description: Still great, still fresh, like me!Since my last review, I have been eating more fish. There are fewer places to buy fish (the other big chain place that starts with M).Selection, cuts, service, freshness, all downtown - this is what I like and prefer. See my other earlier review - it pretty much sums it up.

55.description: This is some of the freshest fish that I have come across. This was my first time coming in here and left very impressed. It's pretty straight to the point with you having to put on gloves if you want yourself some fish. It is also fairly cold, so that needs to be expected as well. The prices are pretty good as I was able to get halibut for about $5 less per pound than I would at a place like Whole Foods. They had a lot of frozen seafood as well and there was a nice selection of clams, mussels, and other shellfish. While everything was really good and the selection was great, the limited hours and smallishness to I&S Fish Co. was a slight distractor for me. It's more a bit of a nit-pick as I really liked it here. The selection of fish here is demanding a return.

9.description: As a lifelong coastal resident, I have high expectations for seafood. I've been mostly sorely disappointed by the seafood selections and prices in the Midwest, but Isaacson and Stein is a bright spot in the otherwise lackluster seascape. I heard a rumor they supply some local sushi restaurants, though I admit I have no idea if that's true. However I will say I have attended a sushi party made from fish purchased here and no one got sick (if you know what you're doing with sushi, of course). Prices here are pretty good; fish can be pricey, but it's definitely a better deal than the grocery store or Eataly, and at least half of what you'd pay for it prepared in a restaurant, which would be the only other places I can think of that you could get similar products. I've purchased: mussels, rainbow trout, salmon, shrimp, scallops, swordfish, catfish, red fish, blue fish, one fish, two fish. One time I woefully did not notice that the bass I purchased was not already gutted like some of the others and mangled it trying to do it at home, but if you pay attention, once you pay for your fish you can ask to have it cleaned and gutted for you I believe, or do it yourself there if you have the skill, which, sadly, I don't...yet...There are also lots of other fishies I haven't yet had the opportunity or sense of adventure to try: snapper, octopus, clams, unrecognizeable fish, many fish, suffice to say. I wish they had slightly longer hours and were open on Sundays; it leaves me trying to schedule a Saturday morning fish market trip in all the time, but it's worth making my schedule work to go here. Plus, in the nicer weather, there's a farmer's market in the lot across the street - 2 birds one stone!

26.description: As a lifelong coastal resident, I have high expectations for seafood. I've been mostly sorely disappointed by the seafood selections and prices in the Midwest, but Isaacson and Stein is a bright spot in the otherwise lackluster seascape. I heard a rumor they supply some local sushi restaurants, though I admit I have no idea if that's true. However I will say I have attended a sushi party made from fish purchased here and no one got sick (if you know what you're doing with sushi, of course). Prices here are pretty good; fish can be pricey, but it's definitely a better deal than the grocery store or Eataly, and at least half of what you'd pay for it prepared in a restaurant, which would be the only other places I can think of that you could get similar products. I've purchased: mussels, rainbow trout, salmon, shrimp, scallops, swordfish, catfish, red fish, blue fish, one fish, two fish. One time I woefully did not notice that the bass I purchased was not already gutted like some of the others and mangled it trying to do it at home, but if you pay attention, once you pay for your fish you can ask to have it cleaned and gutted for you I believe, or do it yourself there if you have the skill, which, sadly, I don't...yet...There are also lots of other fishies I haven't yet had the opportunity or sense of adventure to try: snapper, octopus, clams, unrecognizeable fish, many fish, suffice to say. I wish they had slightly longer hours and were open on Sundays; it leaves me trying to schedule a Saturday morning fish market trip in all the time, but it's worth making my schedule work to go here. Plus, in the nicer weather, there's a farmer's market in the lot across the street - 2 birds one stone!

25.description: I have been a faithful client for years. My dad used to take me here as a kid on days we would have company over because he wanted the best for them. The Fulton fish market is definatly one of Chicago's hidden gems. Restaurant quality seafood for the grocery store price.

12.description: I do like this place if I'm in the area.  They always have something I want.  You can ask them for cut your fish up a little or descale it after you've paid for it.

59.description: Huge variety and good pricing, i can't complain. Just don't go there early Saturday morning. The place gets so packed, there is no room to move.

21.description: Went here for our NY eve dinner prep.WHOA, its busy...like really, really busy.They have a HUGE selection of seafood.  Be prepared to reek of fish..duh.They have plastic gloves to be able to scoop up whatever you want.Two separate lines...one to weigh and one to pay.Have to spend over $100 for credit card...however, its pretty easy to do here.Parking...plan on getting lucky and getting one of the 5 spots in front...OR slap on your hazards in the street like every other Chicagoan.

17.description: Before I dive (HA!) on into what is Isaacson's, I'll start by explaining why it's a 4 and not a 5. I bought mussels and clams...which are alive. I was not given any ice and they wrapped my products up and tied it so when I got home they were suffocated and not on ice so they started opening. Many of them were "dying" by the time I got home which pretty much sucked considering I took the subway and made the trip all of the way out here FOR the mussels. Maybe that's my fault for assuming my bag was heavy due to the ice and I should have checked, but other reviewers mentioned ice in their bags so I didn't think twice. This is super close to the Grand blue line, now if you're like me and you were considering the subway, yes it's totally safe. I wasn't familiar with the area, Google Maps says its just over a quarter of a mile and it was just that. You walk under the overpass, cross the bridge, and boom it's right there to the right. When you walk in, it's very fishy. If you were me and just walked in was attacked by the smell and yielded right, you missed the bags and gloves. I read about the gloves, but I realized "hey. where the f are the gloves?" so I made a glove out of another bag and turns out the gloves are by the cash register near the shopping baskets. You're welcome, I just saved you from looking as stupid as I did.  It's about 3 rows of fresh seafood. For those who were interested in prices here are some I roughly remember:No Chemical Scallops: 15.95/ lbShrimp: 19.95 or 9.95 the lb can't remember the "Type" sorry! Crab Legs: 12/lbClams the HUGE scary ones are 50 cents a piece and the Golden Neck Ones are $3.95/lbMussels 3.95/lbBuffalo Fish 1.85/lbBaby Octopus from Spain was $7.95/lbThe "full grown" octopus is $4.50/lbSquid $3.95/ lb The floors were soaked in water, kind of tight in here and there's guys running around with hoses and mops so it can get kind of tight and awkward. Make sure you ask for ice with your purchase. The people otherwise are nice. And yes, my mussels I purchased from here were far superior than the ones I had been getting at my grocer.

10.description: Freshiest Fishiest place around. Fab selection of everything. A gem , will be going back for sure!

5.description: This is the best fish market in Chicago and it's not even close.Grabbed a 3 pound bag of the peeled and deveined 12 count shrimp and a pound of the Chilean Sea Bass.The shrimp were awesome and the Sea Bass was one of the best cuts of fish I've ever had.Can't wait to go back.

3.description: Great place, picked up some sashimi grade Tuna here, $19.99/lb. Made an incredle tar tar dish with it. The place is pretty standard. Walk in, huge tubs of fish in an assembly line, grab your gloves and a bag, walk up, pick out the piece(s) that you like, bag it, then take it to the counter to price, then to the register to cash out. I mean if you want to have samples of wheat grass shooters, someone in a hemp skirt and dreadlocks assisting you and walking you through the sustainability and foot print of each fish, which by the way there's nothing wrong with, I'd like that lol, but you'd be better served at whole foods, this place is just fish and shellfish, ZERO frills, but it was really good stuff in my opinion, do yourself a favor...

35.description: Before I dive (HA!) on into what is Isaacson's, I'll start by explaining why it's a 4 and not a 5. I bought mussels and clams...which are alive. I was not given any ice and they wrapped my products up and tied it so when I got home they were suffocated and not on ice so they started opening. Many of them were "dying" by the time I got home which pretty much sucked considering I took the subway and made the trip all of the way out here FOR the mussels. Maybe that's my fault for assuming my bag was heavy due to the ice and I should have checked, but other reviewers mentioned ice in their bags so I didn't think twice. This is super close to the Grand blue line, now if you're like me and you were considering the subway, yes it's totally safe. I wasn't familiar with the area, Google Maps says its just over a quarter of a mile and it was just that. You walk under the overpass, cross the bridge, and boom it's right there to the right. When you walk in, it's very fishy. If you were me and just walked in was attacked by the smell and yielded right, you missed the bags and gloves. I read about the gloves, but I realized "hey. where the f are the gloves?" so I made a glove out of another bag and turns out the gloves are by the cash register near the shopping baskets. You're welcome, I just saved you from looking as stupid as I did.  It's about 3 rows of fresh seafood. For those who were interested in prices here are some I roughly remember:No Chemical Scallops: 15.95/ lbShrimp: 19.95 or 9.95 the lb can't remember the "Type" sorry! Crab Legs: 12/lbClams the HUGE scary ones are 50 cents a piece and the Golden Neck Ones are $3.95/lbMussels 3.95/lbBuffalo Fish 1.85/lbBaby Octopus from Spain was $7.95/lbThe "full grown" octopus is $4.50/lbSquid $3.95/ lb The floors were soaked in water, kind of tight in here and there's guys running around with hoses and mops so it can get kind of tight and awkward. Make sure you ask for ice with your purchase. The people otherwise are nice. And yes, my mussels I purchased from here were far superior than the ones I had been getting at my grocer.

19.description: This place has the best sea food in Chicago - uncontested.  The sea bass and cod there are incredible, and prices are very reasonable.  The sea bass here is better than anywhere I've ordered in the city.  Definitely a fun time to throw on some gloves and pick out some fresh fish!

28.description: the worst shrimp. ever. I can honsetly say you are better off saving yoir money for the frozen pack at the grocery store.

45.description: Step inside, walk this wayPut some gloves on, hey, hey!Pour some seafoood on meOoh, in the name of lovePour some seafood on...actually, no don't do that. It will get your ass booted from I&S and likely get you banned for life and that would be a shame (unless you had a seafood allergy or something).I love fish and seafood, but as much as I love it, I don't really buy much of it to cook myself - I'm trying to change that. I've heard great things about Isaacson & Stein on Yelp and knew it was our go to place when we got the crazy idea to make two kinds of ceviche for a party. We were a little nervous about a dish not cooked with heat and wanted to make sure we had the best possible ingredients.It can feel a little intimidating on your first visit, but walk in grab a basket and don some gloves; don't be afraid to ask for help - everyone is very nice. On our first trip we went with scallops and shrimp. Our ceviches were a hit and the seafood was so fresh, my partner in crime said the waste from peeling and de-veining the shrimp didn't even start to smell for a few days (although I personally wouldn't recommend testing that theory)! When we decided to make another batch of what's becoming our signature ceviche for a dinner party, returning to I&S was a no brainer. Our scallop and tilapia ceviche garnered rave reviews. Our dining companions, the ones who sold me on the place, also served scallops from I&S and they were delicious.Great selection, great prices, across the street from Glazed & Infused - what's not to love. Just try and go early, it's always crowded and once items are gone, that's it.

33.description: If you're looking for a specific item that you can't do without, this is probably not the place for you. I like to swing by (early on Saturday before the items are picked over) and inspect what fish looks good - then plan a meal around that. Isaacson has a great selection of whole fish and has fish bones available for cheap - great for making fish stock. The pricing is definitely very competitive and the quality is good (but not necessarily consistent, though, as a function of the season and availability of certain fish). As I mentioned above, go early to get the best selection and avoid over handled fish.

43.description: I really thought, coming from the East Coast, that my moving away from the shores of the Atlantic would lose me my source for any abundance of fresh, quality seafood. I will be the first to admit now, that I was wrong, happily so. Isaacson & Stein's is top-notch! They have an abundance of varieties of fresh fish and their associated shelled brethren, and even some wild caught options too. Deep ruby Blackfin, caught in its natural habitat - no farmed product could ever stack up! Sure, it was pricey. It costs $20/pound, but what are you paying in the supermarket? And who does your purchase support? The have cheaper options as well, so you don't have to buy premium product if you can't, or don't want to.Their baby octopus is delicious. Shrimp options, many. Halibut, Sea Bass, Chilean Sea Bass, Striped Bass, Snapper, Swordfish, Stealhead Trout, Sockeye Salmon, Blue Fish, King Crab, Dungeoness, Blue Crab, Maine Lobster, Brazilian Lobster Tails, Squid, various clams et al - the list goes on and on... all fresh.They'll clean anything you pick out, so don't say to yourself "I don't know how to butcher fish" and miss this opportunity. You really shouldn't be buying your fish anywhere else.

2.description: If you want fresh and affordable fish come here.  I always ask what is sashimi grade and they always point me in the right direction. I have used their fish for tuna tartar, ceviche, grilling, sushi, ect and I have never had a single complaint about the quality.  It does smell a bit when you walk in but the fish is definitely super fresh and affordable.  If you are looking for a specific cut you should call ahead as I have been let down twice when looking for ahi tuna.

18.description: Luv the place. Trust me, walk into this place on a Saturday morning before having a Cup of Coffee, take a deep breath and once you get a solid whiff of that Fish Market Aroma---WHEW, you won't need a cup of coffee or anything at all. :) The place is GREAT. Came here a few times with my mom as a kid and now in my mid 40's continue to shop here when I'm looking for Freshest and or Hard to find Seafood in town. Arguably the largest selection in the Chicago area. Want Nigerian Shrimp (PRAWNS), Baby Octopus, Calamari, Chilean Sea Bass and more this place has it and the price are very reasonable. Definitely worth the trip. Yes, they'll clean your fish after you've purchased and will answer questions you have about your selection. These are the guys supplying many of the top restaurants in and around Chicago and have been for decades. Give them your business and you won't be disappointed.

41.description: Great fish market, they have pretty much everything!Got octopus here at a great price!Service was good and fast, we were in and out in less than 5 minutes.

52.description: Clean and extremely fresh. Bought the best Chilean sea bass I have ever eaten from there. Love this place. Miss it now that I live in LA.

50.description: This is a really outstanding place. Its clean and the fish seems ultra-fresh. I also like the fact that they tell you whereabouts the fish comes from. They will de-scale and fillet it on the spot for you at no charge. The people are nice and knowledgeable.

4.description: I'd best describe my first visit to Isaacson & Stein's fishery akin to my first time pumping gas in New Jersey. Oh wait-- that's right, you DON'T pump your own gas in New Jersey. It's ILLEGAL. You park there with your window slightly drawn as you mutter what you want and the attendant dutifully scrambles to and fro from the pump machine to your car. If he/she's in a pleasant mood, they'll maybe go the extra mile and wipe your windshield and crack a smile as you hand them your monies. While I'm not going to get into the politics, it was that experience which left me with a bigger apprecation for self service. Here at Isaacson & Stein's, I...was...liberated.  At first I didn't know what to do with myself, staring into the rows upon rows of fish piles. I looked around to see if there was someone cloaked in an apron to assist with the handling. Nope, based on social cues I was to glove-up and grab a bag. There's a station if you need further "primping", a station for weighing, and then a window for paying. I ended up getting a large fish head for less than $2 and a halibut filet. The total cost was less than the usual filets of wild caught B.S. I'd usually shell out for at "Whole Paycheck". While there are certain things I'll still get at Whole Foods, I'm leaving the seafaring to Isaacson & Stein!

6.description: Really a nice place! I am just sad that it took me 4 years in Chicago to find out this place. There is a lot of variety of fish and seafood. You are definitely going to find something that you like as long as you eat fish. The prices are decent especially given that we are quite far from the coast.

22.description: Can you spell FISH?  Well this is the place where you can smell it, and not in a bad way.  So much fresh fish and seafood you can eat something different every day.   It all is so fresh you can still smell the ocean.  Giant tank with lobster and a huge freezer with frozen varieties of crab, shrimp and almost anything else you could think of.  There's people to clean and cut your fish however you want it.  They even have bones and heads for a stock or soup.  Reasonable pricing with a helpful staff.  According to one of the attendants the variety is constantly rotating dependant on what's in season.  They carry farmed and wild varieties.  The even had mussles, clams, and oysters.Highly recommended unless your squimish.

15.description: Fresh fish, great prices! I went last Saturday with my family to check the place out. You put on plastic gloves and get to pick out your own fish. No more glancing behind display glass checking out if the fish's eyes are fresh or not. We bought a whole pound of Chilean Sea bass, 5 mackerels, 1 huge Spanish mackerel, squid and oysters. All for the very reasonable price of 67 dollars. I am definitely coming back here again!

57.description: I've always gotten excellent seafood here, from the red snapper to the fish heads and bones for stock.  Fast paced place too; they get you in and out, if that's what you want.  Wish the parking situation was better, but I usually park a couple of blocks away and walk over.  Prices are very good for what you get.  Go early on a Saturday and you'll feel like you've accomplished something big and important.  Just getting up early on a Saturday might do it too, but it wouldn't involve fish heads, now would it?

20.description: Really good selection but terrible smelling. A good seafood shop smells like the ocean. This place smelled like decomposing fish, ammonia and bleach. Though I may have caught them on an off day, there's no excuse for a lack of sanitation with such a perishable product

36.description: Fantastic place for fresh fish--been going for nearly ten years.  Quality is great and the staff is always very helpful.  I really love that I can put on a pair of plastic gloves and pick out my own fish.  Great prices as well.

14.description: Can you spell FISH?  Well this is the place where you can smell it, and not in a bad way.  So much fresh fish and seafood you can eat something different every day.   It all is so fresh you can still smell the ocean.  Giant tank with lobster and a huge freezer with frozen varieties of crab, shrimp and almost anything else you could think of.  There's people to clean and cut your fish however you want it.  They even have bones and heads for a stock or soup.  Reasonable pricing with a helpful staff.  According to one of the attendants the variety is constantly rotating dependant on what's in season.  They carry farmed and wild varieties.  The even had mussles, clams, and oysters.Highly recommended unless your squimish.

58.description: I was looking for a good place in the neighborhood to get hair color and I decided to try FM Hair Studio. Tina did a fabulous job coloring the hair. I haven't tried any of their other services but I would go back for hair color service again. Also, really liked that they call you 24 hours prior to your appointment for a reminder.

56.description: Tina did an awesome job with my hair. I am always afraid to try someone new, especially with Asian hair. She did a great job of figuring out what style I wanted even though I couldnt express it very well.Gave me a great cut and awesome texture. Loved it and will be back

29.description: I came her for the first time yesterday and had a great experience with Erin!  She is easy to talk to and does her best to make you comfortable.  She eased the pain as much as possible and helped to keep my mind off of the duty at hand.  She is great.  I will be going back there again as I have just found my new go to girl - thanks Erin!

42.description: 2 stars for the wax....and 1 extra for the cute salon, tasty coffee they offer and small plate of treats.I purchased the pretty city special and have to say this was one the MOST painful and unpleasant waxes I have ever received (other than doing my under arms one time, which was accompanied with some tearing of the eyes).  She was running late, and the receptionist let me know and apologized - probably about 30 minutes.  She used both hard and soft wax.  No small talk or pleasantries to make me feel comfortable - it was my first time there.  I was basically trying to force a conversation to make myself feel more comfortable and relaxed - odd.Now down to the actual work...I hate to say it, but it was pretty shabby.  There was literally a line of hair left over and a bunch stragglers.  Pretty unimpressive. There was no double dipping, she just turned the sticks upside down.It was pretty dark downstairs, maybe that added to the problem.I would not come back here for a wax.

23.description: The staff is very friendly and helpful. Meghan is probably one of the best stylists I've ever had. I appeeciate her honesty...if it's not a good choice to maintain healthy hair she will straight up tell you so. The salon is very clean and well maintained. They also have groupons available & give first time discounts. You will leave loving your hair!

47.description: Went for a brazilian wax.  I'll never be back...I'll leave it at that.

8.description: Can't say enough good things about this place. Amy has been cutting my hair since day one and she rocks.I was getting half the treatment at other places for the same price. Guys if you want to get a relaxing cut with some extras (and you're not so insecure that you think a hand wax and a mini-facial is for women only) go here.

31.description: I tried FM Hair and Skin Studio for the first time today and had a great experience! I found it through a Bloomspot deal, and purchased a haircut and Keratin treatment. The salon is in the West Loop right off Randolph street, and is super easy to get to on the green line. Its a very modern, cute, unpretentious salon, I liked it immediately when I walked in the door. My stylist Madeline was wonderful, she has a warm outgoing personality that immediately put me at ease. She expertly knew how to manage my difficult curly hair, and gave me a sleek sophisticated cut that was exactly what I was looking for. Definitely check this place out!

34.description: went for a Brazilian yest and def not going back. they are supposed to generally use hard wax but she rarely did and was  a little too quick and sloppy with the job and careless. the end result was more painful and neither did she take out any ingrown hair. my wax was done by Nicki.

16.description: Polite and friendly service! The ladies at the front desk were very welcoming and upbeat. I was offered beverages and spoken to by all of the employees I came across during my visit. Amy did my waxing and she was wonderful. Extremely knowledgable and comforting. The entire facility is clean, bright, and cute. I'll be back for sure!

13.description: This is my go to haircut place, unless something happens to them this is the only place I will get a haircut.  I have been going there for about 1 year now and I love it there!  I get a haircut directly from the owner, Amy, and she is awesome!  Haircut comes with wash, hand dip thing, face massage, hand massage and more.  Great haircut, great service, great people and good prices.  I highly suggest!

11.description: I came here for the first time with a Groupon and saw Diane - great experience! The staff is super nice and Amy, who I think is the owner, is very personable and provided great service. Appointments are easy to make and they confirm the day before as well.  It was really easy to use my Groupon and I've already received a coupon for $20 off any service via email. Highly recommend!

39.description: got a great service here, and my hair is growing out nicely from my cut - always a sign of a good cut!

37.description: The salon is a few blocks from my office do I was tempted to try it because of the ease and proximity. They were able to fit me in the same day I called. Very polite and accommodating. Madeline was consultative and worked with me to decide on the right approach to the style I wanted. Proof was in the compliments from my co-workers when I returned to the office. The decor and aesthetic is on par with what I would expect from a salon in the neighborhood, yet not pretentious. I'll definitely try it again.

0.description: I went there for the 1 st time last week-end. The staff is very nice and welcoming. The place is clean and beautiful. I got my appointment with Michelle, she was very friendly and professional. I'm happy with my haircut and will definitely come back for my color.I came back today ( 11/21/15) for my color and Michelle did such a great job! My grey hair vanished away and my color looks so natural! I'm really happy and will come back for a new hair cut in a few days. By the way, I do recommend the Kevin Murphy products: they're amazing and they smell so good!

38.description: Amy is amazing! She gives a great haircut at a great price and their online booking is super convenient. Highly recommended.

51.description: I just moved to Chicago and found FM Hair Studio after searching Yelp for a nearby, highly-rated salon. I read several good things about Madeline, so I made an appointment.FM was fantastic and Madeline gave me an AWESOME hair cut and was a delight to talk to as well. She listened to all of my hair preferences and tailored my cut based on how much time I want to spend in the morning, how often I blow dry, ponytail-ability, etc. The salon was clean and fun and happy and bright. They offered me a cold diet coke during my cut! What a delight on this 95 degree day. The products they use are great (i love Moroccan Oil!) and they give really good suggestions, with no pressure to purchase. Everyone was great and I look forward to going back for a wax and lash tint!

27.description: After 7 years of living in Chicago, I finally decided that I needed to stop traveling back to my hometown in Ohio to get my hair cut and find a salon in the neighborhood. After recently moving to the West Loop, I read reviews for FM Hair and decided I would give it a try. I booked an appointment with Marco (male, early 50's) based on the receptionist's advice. It was a WONDERFUL experience. They have a very polished salon and a cute waiting area. Parking was a breeze! The receptionist was super friendly along with everyone else who worked there. I was offered something to drink as soon as I walked in. There was a selection of up to date magazines laid out. It was the perfect combination of a stylish salon without any of the pretentiousness that you often find in bit city salons. Marco, my stylist was SO great. Full of energy but also down to earth. He asked me all about how I wear my hair on a regular basis and what I wanted to do differently. He made suggestions for what he thought would work best while keeping in mind what my personal preferences were. He explained to me what he wanted to do and what products he thought would work best. He made sure I was comfortable with everything he did! The shampoo session was amazing! I received a scalp massage while at the shampoo bowl-so relaxing and a wonderful added bonus. Marco took a lot of time while cutting my hair making sure it was just as he (and I) wanted it to be. He also paid close attention while styling my hair. The blowout was FABULOUS! I rarely like how anyone but me styles my hair, but he did a great job!Marco told me about each product that he used (which I loved-but didn't buy...YET), but he also asked me about the products that I currently used. And he actually complimented me on them rather than suggesting immediately that I buy the ones he used-I appreciated not being pushed! It was the best Chicago Salon experience I have had to date! I most certainly will be back!!!

32.description: Diana did a great job on my "creative color" - subtle ombre with a few highlights to brighten up my strawberry blonde hair. This was my first visit to FM and she really took the time to hear my hair history and look at pictures, and she made sure I understood how she was planning to execute what I wanted to make sure we were on the same page. The salon is bright and clean. I was offered refreshments as soon as I walked in the door and even ended up with a glass of sangria!! I left with a coupon for $20 off my next visit - and will definitely be returning!

54.description: I got a Yelp deal for FM Hair and Skin Studio. First of all everyone is really friendly and helpful. there was no wait. I walked in and in a minute or so they were ready to take me in the room. I had an appointment with Whitney for a full face waxing-she is great! More than everything it was hygienic.I got no breakouts afterwards. She also applied some olive oil stuff at the end which really sooth my face. The whole time she was chatting with me -making me feel comfy. Some people might not like it but I think it's important. The whole process was as painless as it can get. I mean pain is  always involved when talking about waxing but with Whitney it was endurable.As I got a deal I can't complain about the price :)

48.description: I bought a groupon for a keratin treatment. I called right after I bought it and they were able to book me an appointment within a week or so no problem, despite the limited time slots I had available. My appointment was with Madeline. She is so sweet and was very knowledgable. I loved the treatment and she even gave me a card for 50% off a keratin treatment the next time I visit. Overall my hair looks great, I had a wonderful experience and I would go back and see Madeline anytime!

44.description: I LOVE this salon! I moved to Chi about eight months ago, and had no idea where to go to have my hair done. My hair was totally damaged, and in need of a lot of TLC. I searched Yelp for salons close to me; in or around the West Loop. I came across FM and decided to give it a shot because of the great reviews it had received from other users. I was lucky enough to get Madeline as my stylist. She is so knowledgable, and was extremely gentle with my damaged hair. Not to mention she is one of the sweetest people I've met! I've since been to FM three times, and of course plan on making this my permanent salon. My hair is back to being healthy thanks to Madeline's care and recommendations for products. If you're looking for a great new place to have your hair done, go see Madeline at FM. She'll take awesome care of you! :)

24.description: Since I was just getting a trim, I decided to take the risk and buy a Groupon for a haircut. Chose FM based on these Yelp reviews. Everything was great: they had appointments available at convenient times, free parking, and a great haircut from Diana. I appreciated that they didn't try to upsell me with products or future services, though they did send me off with some coupons for spa services :)

7.description: Michele was very friendly and did a great job cutting my hair. Looking forward to booking future appointments.

49.description: I called Saturday morning to see if FM could fit me in for a wax, and they got me right in that afternoon.Amy was very professional and nice...and it was seriously one of the least-painful waxes I've ever had. She used the hard wax that I prefer, and was very meticulous. I appreciated that she didn't double-dip (yes, I've seen this before, and almost ran out...). I will definitely be going back!!

40.description: I used the $35 for $50 Yelp deal and got a great haircut. Diana was friendly and did a great job.

53.description: A recent deal on Bloomspot brought me here. I came in, slightly freaked out, for a brazillian wax. Until today, I have only done sugaring, which supposedly hurts less, but still hurts like hell if not more. So needless to say, I was expecting to be tortured. And in that state of mind, I walked into this cute salon, was greeted right away and offered a beverage.The salon is very clean and everyone was friendly. The wax itself was so much better than I anticipated. Amy used hard wax on the more sensitive areas and in all honesty, the pain was very manageable for the entire thing. She was very professional, gentle and there was no double dipping. I immediately prepaid for my next waxes and will definitely return.

30.description: I went to this place initially on a Yelp deal to get my younger brother a nice haircut and really liked the place. He's 15 so his haircut was $35. The hairdresser was patient with him and his cut looked good. We were really excited about the place and decided to come back for his next haircut. The second experience wasn't as great (thus the 3 stars). My brother went with my mom. They came with a $10 off coupon that we got after the last haircut and ended up paying about $40. Apparently the hair dresser offered my brother a "complimentary" $10 facial and then forgot that she made it complimentary. Either that or they charged him as an adult. My mom wasn't familiar with the prices, so she just paid and left. $10 isn't a big deal, but if we go back, we'll just be very careful to check exactly what they charge us for.

46.description: Quality service friendly and professional staff, clean and chic.  I love the hard wax they use for the waxing makes it less painful will definitely go again.

1.description: Really great, friendly staff - very accommodating. Very clean. Received a facial (which was amazing!), manicure and pedicure. Such a relaxing atmosphere and really enjoyed all of my appointments. Will definitely return!

55.description: I needed a haircut badly and searched Yelp for a good place in the West Loop.  Previously I would only get my haircut in NY when I visited family, but that got a bit expensive... and I am so glad I found FM Hair and Skin Studio.  Madeline was my hair stylist and she took really great care in her work.  I explained to her that I was torn between chopping all my hair off, but that I had been growing it for the past year in anticipation of my wedding this September.  She convinced me to keep it long for the sake of having great wedding hair.  My issue with the long hair was how flat it was.  So Madeline decided to give me more layers in the front and slightly shorter layers in the back so I had more flow and volume.  Before the cut, she carefully explained what she would be doing with my layers in the front and back, as well as how she would cut my bangs.After my cut she even spent a good 15 min explaining how to properly blow dry/style my hair and how to use a curling iron.  Yes, I know, how sad that a girl doesn't already know how to do these things.  (The ponytail is how someone can go 26 years and not know how to style their own hair.)I also got the Wella hair conditioning treatment, which they put in your hair and then let it sit under this heating contraption - really cook looking.  My hair felt incredible and smelled great for DAYS.I will definitely be back here again!PS - They are dog friendly. Gotta love that.

9.description: I came here for a spray tan (cannot comment on hair or wax services). Erica was very professional and the tan was fast. She did provide exfoliating pads to prep and used barrier spray on my nails, knees, and elbows. The actual process was standard and very simple. My main complaint was the outcome. There was a 3-4in area near my bikini line that was completely missed. Looking somewhat silly, it defeated the purpose of getting the tan in the first place. In addition, the "tan" was very faint and came out as more of a sun kiss than an actual tan. Because of this very light application, it was worn off within 2 days (even though I kept my skin very moisturized). I will definitely not go back for a tan, but have not experienced other salon services.

26.description: Can't say enough good things about this place. Amy has been cutting my hair since day one and she rocks.I was getting half the treatment at other places for the same price. Guys if you want to get a relaxing cut with some extras (and you're not so insecure that you think a hand wax and a mini-facial is for women only) go here.

25.description: Purchased a Life-booker deal for a brazilian wax. I'm always kind of timid going to a new place for a yoo-hoo wax, because lets face it, shit can go wrong! However, I did my homework and it seemed like an okay place.The space is clean. Everyone was gracious and friendly. My aesthetician was waiting on my arrival (even though I was early), so no waiting, which was fantastic. I'm terrible with names, but, she was great, super chatty, and really fast! I am almost positive it was by far the quickest wax I have EVER received. I'm talking 10-12 minutes tops. I took off one star because the room could be more visually appealing and warm. Its downstairs in the basement area of the salon. Perhaps, its just personal taste because I'm use to Mario Tricoci. P.S. The girl that did my wax was a former manager of Mario Tricoci, so your in great hands!

12.description: I think I found my place to get my haircutt! They did exactly what I wanted them to do, showed them pictures and everything, and are reasonably priced. A huge plus.

59.description: According to my husband, I was in dire need of getting my underarm hairs removed (it's winter?)...so I called Amy. She did an excellent wax job. It was quick and less painful than anticipated. Hard wax was used on my underarms and soft on my eyebrows. Service was friendly and the place was clean and bright. Parking wasn't an issue. I would come back and try other services. The prices were reasonable too.

21.description: I received a phone call from Amy, the salon owner! She went above and beyond to clear up the Gilt City voucher issue. I got in to see Meghan F who wasn't just a FANTASTIC stylist, but kept me laughing for the two hours she worked on my hair. Happy to say that two weeks later, my 'do is still frizz free and looking amazing! Thank you for helping a wavy/curly haired girl's life a whole lot easier! Y'all have cut my blow dry time down to maybe 10-15 minutes (blow drying used to be a 35+ minute ordeal for me). THANK YOU!!!

17.description: 2 stars for the wax....and 1 extra for the cute salon, tasty coffee they offer and small plate of treats.I purchased the pretty city special and have to say this was one the MOST painful and unpleasant waxes I have ever received (other than doing my under arms one time, which was accompanied with some tearing of the eyes).  She was running late, and the receptionist let me know and apologized - probably about 30 minutes.  She used both hard and soft wax.  No small talk or pleasantries to make me feel comfortable - it was my first time there.  I was basically trying to force a conversation to make myself feel more comfortable and relaxed - odd.Now down to the actual work...I hate to say it, but it was pretty shabby.  There was literally a line of hair left over and a bunch stragglers.  Pretty unimpressive. There was no double dipping, she just turned the sticks upside down.It was pretty dark downstairs, maybe that added to the problem.I would not come back here for a wax.

10.description: I had a facial with Erika and it was really great. I get really nervous about new people touching my face because I have very sensitive skin but she took all of my concerns into consideration and used products that made my skin feel great. I ended up even purchasing different face products and my skin hasn't ever looked this good! Can't wait for my next appointment!

5.description: Wonderful!! I used Yelp to find this place based on the reviews and all of them were correct. Great experience from them taking my coat and offering me coffee to a great hair cut and product advice. I'm pretty picky when it comes to my hair and it came out wonderful. Two thumbs up!

3.description: Thanks to Yelp for helping me find Amy at FM Hair and Skin Studio.  She gives the best men's cut and style out there.  Hands down.I would rarely get compliments on my haircut.  Now it's an exception if I don't after a visit to the salon.If that weren't enough, she has the best personality.  You don't feel like you're at a salon.  Rather, you're a guest in her home.I used to live about half a mile away.  I'm now closer to 10 miles away.  I still go to Amy.  She's just that good.So, if you're looking for a new place to get a great cut and style each and every time, you simply can't go wrong with FM Hair and Skin Studio.

35.description: I agree with the comment below -- I feel like a lot of the reviews must be written by friends. The woman who did my wax literally pulled the skin off my eyelids, so instead of looking fresh and well-groomed the next day, I have a scab on my eyelid.She also reused the strips, which is weird and gross and definitely not something I've ever seen before...I also found it incredibly telling that this place, despite being in an up-and-coming neighborhood, was entirely empty over the lunch hour when I arrived.Absolutely never going back.

19.description: I needed an updo last minute on a Saturday in August, during wedding season, and when I called FM I was lucky to snag a 1:45pm spot. Diane was fabulous! She was sweet, creative & personable and gave my do the perfect flare! I will defs be back!

28.description: Great experience.

45.description: Unfortunately, I moved away from Chicago, but if I were still there, I'd be going here. They are nice and do a great job. They also have great hair products!

33.description: I'man out-of-towner who isn't willing to trust my hair to a barber or a haircut under $20. The men's cut here is $45, but with yelp you can get $50 for $30 deal. It includes a wash, scalp massage, face massage, heated facial towel, paraffin wax and lotion hand dip, hand massage, a hair cut, a rinse, and styling. For $30 plus a tip,I think this is a great place to go.The staff is amazing, prompt, and good conversation while you're getting your cut.I would highly recommend.

43.description: I went to FM for the first time today and LOVE! I will warn you the location is a little bizarre (a lot of factories near by) but totally worth it. I had Diana cut and color my hair, I brought a picture and we talked about it and all of my options, she was so sweet and very talented! She told me about the up charge for color because my hair is longer than shoulder length which was really considerate. And the salon is really clean, tidy and just had a great atmosphere. I would recommend this salon to anyone looking for a stylish cut and color!

2.description: I am a repeat customer of this business because of the excellent and friendly customer service. The staff is also professional and well-skilled in their craft.

18.description: A recent deal on Bloomspot brought me here. I came in, slightly freaked out, for a brazillian wax. Until today, I have only done sugaring, which supposedly hurts less, but still hurts like hell if not more. So needless to say, I was expecting to be tortured. And in that state of mind, I walked into this cute salon, was greeted right away and offered a beverage.The salon is very clean and everyone was friendly. The wax itself was so much better than I anticipated. Amy used hard wax on the more sensitive areas and in all honesty, the pain was very manageable for the entire thing. She was very professional, gentle and there was no double dipping. I immediately prepaid for my next waxes and will definitely return.

41.description: I usually do not write reviews, but had to leave some feedback after my last experience.  I have been struggling to find a new hair salon after moving to Chicago, since my stylist back home is so inexpensive.  I went here numerous months back for the first time after buying a yelp deal to save a little, and Madeline did a fantastic job.  This time she wasn't available but they were able to get me in when I wanted still just with Diana.  I almost cancelled my appointment, which I think caused there to be a mix up in their books because my appointment wasn't even scheduled when I got there.  After waiting 30 minutes they gave me paraffin wax and a hand massage for free to make up for it.  On top of that, Diana did a fantastic job on my hair.  She spent time to make sure it looked great and I got what it needed.  I greatly appreciate the excellent customer service on top of the wonderful cut and color.

52.description: I recently moved to the West Loop and wanted to find a local salon to be able to walk, so consulted Yelp and found FM Hair Studio.  I made an appointment easily and was scheduled with Madeline.  What a doll!  She was so pleasant and took her time matching my color and explaining about the salon and products they use.Honestly, my hair has never looked so good.  I will definitely be back and it looks like Madeline has won over another loyal customer. :-)

50.description: I came here to get a brazillian wax and being a first-timer I wasn't sure what to expect with the wax but I wasn't pleased at all. I still had strands of hair everywhere! I feel like it was her job to make sure she waxed thouroughly and use the tweezers for the rest. I wasn't pleased with her work, but the staff was friendly.

4.description: Michele provided the best men's haircut I've received in the city! In the eight years I've lived in Chicago I've gotten my haircut by probably 10 different people. I recently moved over to the West Loop and was in search for a new stylist. Michele was by far the best. She did an excellent job of asking great questions, paying attention to detail and using her skills to give me the perfect haircut! Highly recommended!

6.description: 3.5 starsI had my first Brazilian there a few months ago. It was my very first! The waxing room is located downstairs. It was a very tranquil place. I really liked my aesthetician. She was super friendly and she made me feel comfortable (even though I wasn't one bit nervous!). My session didn't take very long; she was efficient. The end result was fine, but not terribly impressive. Without saying too much, things weren't "straight". Haha. I told her to make adjustments but they didn't make much of a difference. Hence the 3.5-star.Would I come back? Yes, if I was in the area again. The aesthecian did a decent job. She could've done a better job, but hey, it was a good Yelp deal.

22.description: GREAT first time experience with Diane.  Hand wax, mini facial and a great cut.  Parking available and the price was very fair. I'm very satisfied with my cut and highly recommend you check it out -

15.description: I've been to the salon for both cut and color by the same stylist, Michele. I have wanted a new look for a while and she's been great with me talking everything out so that it's exactly what I want! I get compliments all of the time. It's a great salon too with great art and music in a great location. See you soon ladies!

57.description: My generous freind gave me a gift certificate for a European facial at FM.  I had never been there before and (other than reading the other Yelp comments) didn't  know what to expect.  The other Yelpers were right on the money:  overall it was a great experience!  After I filled out a somewhat lengthy questionnaire, Tina reviewed my answers with me and developed a personalized facial.  The place is sparkling clean, with nice-smelling candles in the treatment room.  Tina did a wonderful, relaxing facial,  and I felt and looked terrific when I walked out.

20.description: The salon is very nice and clean! Upon entering I was greeted nicely by the receptionist and quickly attended to. I was seen by Dani. I had my haircut from long to mid-length and dyed from blonde to black. Dani made me feel comfortable throughout the whole experience! She was friendly and knew exactly what she was doing. I will definitely set my future appointments with her!  I was very happy with my end results! The only reason why I gave a 4 star rating out of 5 is because I did feel it was pretty pricey. I purchased a $35 voucher for a $50 off haircut and with the discount the overall price still came out to $135 not including tip.

36.description: I have very long hair and Madeline was amazing at taking off the dead ends while salvaging the length.  Low pressure to buy products, cute place and sweet staff.  Plus, you get coupons for 15% off your next visit.

14.description: Purchased a Life-booker deal for a brazilian wax. I'm always kind of timid going to a new place for a yoo-hoo wax, because lets face it, shit can go wrong! However, I did my homework and it seemed like an okay place.The space is clean. Everyone was gracious and friendly. My aesthetician was waiting on my arrival (even though I was early), so no waiting, which was fantastic. I'm terrible with names, but, she was great, super chatty, and really fast! I am almost positive it was by far the quickest wax I have EVER received. I'm talking 10-12 minutes tops. I took off one star because the room could be more visually appealing and warm. Its downstairs in the basement area of the salon. Perhaps, its just personal taste because I'm use to Mario Tricoci. P.S. The girl that did my wax was a former manager of Mario Tricoci, so your in great hands!

1.description: wosrt customer service you will ever experience. do not go here. ever!

9.description: I recently went to Lustre for my 2nd time....and I loved it! I stopped in to have my eyebrows arched a couple years ago and remembered warm and inviting feel.  I recently returned because I wanted a facial and needed to select a new line of products.  I tried a couple other places, but I was unimpressed by the places I tried.  My facial at Lustre was the best! Jennifer worked with me she was exactly what I needed! She was warm/friendly and I was impressed with her knowledge. We relaxed on the couch for a consult, and she truly listened to what I needed before performing my facial and helping me try some products. The facial itself was phenomenal, and I could immediately tell she knew what she was doing.  It was a great experience overall! I will be a "regular".

23.description: Just went to this location for the first time and will definitely be back. I had Cynthia who did a facial for me and a waxing, which were both very comfortable and professional. She spent time talking to me about my skin and recommended some products to help me with my acne. Nice space as well where you can really get one-on-one treatment.

5.description: There are just not enough positive words in the world to say about. Jennifer and Lustre. I've been going here 7 years and to Jennifer for 5. I have been many other places, in Chicago and on the road when I travel, and it just doesn't get better than this. Jennifer personalize sand customizes my facials every time, depending on the season, and what's going on with my skin. She takes her time and always makes it the most relaxing experience.  I am on the go all the time and there are few things I look forward to like a facial with Jennifer. It's 60 minutes of pure heaven.

25.description: Hands down I love this place!  I go to Cynthia and she is fabulous.  I know her business partner Jen is great too, as one of my friends goes to her!  I get facials and brazilian waxes there and I love the organic line they use.  Cynthia gives the best wax I've ever had.  She makes me feel very at ease and I only experience a little amount of pain because of this nice oil that is applied right afterwards, it's very soothing.  I love the microderm facial, it makes my skin feel so smooth and clean and helps in eliminating bad breakouts.

12.description: Great facial in a super cute and cozy little space!Had the 60min Custom Facial with Cynthia last week....I just wanted to relax during my treatment so I asked her not to give me a play by play of everything she was doing to my face. It seemed pretty straightforward.....some cleansing....a mask or two....steam.....extractions (which were quick, easy and painless....yay).....and a  fantastic shoulder rub. I really liked the products that she used....they smelled great and felt good.....I believe it is an all natural organic line called Eminence. The table that they use for facials is incredibly comfortable....it was the very first thing I noticed when I laid down.....more like a bed....mmmmmm! Afterwards.....she gave me her opinion of what my skin needed etc....but wasn't at all pushy about products....which I definitely appreciate.....she did give me a few samples to take home of things I was interested in trying.....which I appreciated even more :)I've been getting facials for the last 15 years.....I've had some pretty horrible experiences and some pretty fantastic ones as well....this one falls towards the latter. My skin looked great when I left and continued to look great....their prices are reasonable.....and Cynthia was super nice and welcoming but professional.I will def be back!

21.description: We wander around like lost puppies with ingrown hairs and uneven eyebrows to salon after unsatisfying salon. We stop and wonder, "Does it exist? Is there really a place where I can be waxed, extracted and massaged with no attitude and amazing service?" The answer is yes. The salon is Lustre. Your days of worryin' and wanderin' are over.  This salon is super cozy and you'll always receive a warm welcome with your unbeatable service. The custom facial is great for trouble skin, or any skin for that matter. Their skincare line,  Eminence, is completely organic and free of chemicals.  These products are used for the facials. You will love/buy them. Cynthia gave me a handful of samples for products she thought would work well with my skin type (the epitome of combination skin) , so I didn't have to buy them then stick them in the 'not-exactly-what-I-was-looking-for-but maybe-for-another-season' drawer. They also do some top-notch waxing. Of course it hurts, you're ripping hairs out of your skin, but they're quick, sanitary and give great maintenance tips.  My roommate loves their massages as well, so that's next on my list. It definitely beats every other salon in the 'hood, including the pricier/snobbier ones. AND you can get 20% off your first service w/ the city search coupon!

16.description: This place is the hidden gem in the city I've been searching for!  I dont review alot on yelp but  I had to share what I found.  I am in the fashion industry and have to have perfect glowing skin all the time.  I have recently started a regimen of using only organic products on my skin which I would suggest to everyone. I have had many skin issues and by switching to a completely organic regimen my skin has been awesome!  Jennifer was so sweet and knowledgable and gave me the best facial I have ever had.  I am so happy I found this place and I cannot wait to get my next facial!

17.description: I have been going to Lustre for a monthly facial for about six months. I don't know what I would do without it. Patricia is a talented esthetician and I feel like I get a great deal between the enzyme mask and two others every time. I have been plagued with pimples since I was 12 and I have discovered a good facial is the best way to heal and prevent them. Sometimes our skin just needs some love, and Lustre provides it. I am completely taken with their all-natural Hungarian product line, Eminence. Every time I visit, I am sent away with a few samples and a feeling of total relaxation and renewal, and my skin is always soft and glowing for days afterwards.

10.description: I love this place!  I started going about a year before my wedding and Jennifer (who is amazing) helped customize a regimen for me.  I have done both microderm and glycolic several times and it really helped clear up my skin over the course of a year.  Jennifer was very careful with my sensitive skin and the organic products she uses are really great.  About 2 months before my wedding I also did a medical grade peel.  It did help get rid of brown spots, but not much outside of that so I will probably just stick with microderm.  Jennifer is really awesome and I won't trust my skin with anyone else!

11.description: I bought a Gilt City deal to Lustre because it was in my neighborhood.  I was hooked.  I have tried facial waxing, facials, microdermabrasion and glycolic peels.  Weekend and evening appointments are available.  Jennifer, the owner and aesthetician, is top notch.  She is helpful in answering questions and recommending products and services.

26.description: Jennifer and Cynthia are awesome, as are their services.  I love this place!!
