27.description: This place simply rocks.   There's not a conveyer belt full of bad attitude walking through the door.  I almost look forward to getting a brazilian wax just so I can hang out, browse their products and chat with the owners.

0.description: This is something that I'm really ashamed of. Like serious, character-flaw level action. But here it is:  I love Lustre and highly recommend it and think that it is one of the best places, by far, to have skincare things happen to you. And yet I purposefully did not review it because it was a hidden gem and I was scared that if it got too popular it would cease to be the perfect place that it was. And is. It's probably because I've been traumatized by it happening so many times. A place is great for awhile. Then it gets a write up in whatever blog/mag, people start flocking, stuff starts changing, and soon all the good is gone. But that's no reason not to give credit where credit is due. Because of Lustre, people actually think that I have good genetics. I don't. What I had was a facial and mild peel once a month for a year. By a knowledgeable and skilled professional who knew what the hell she was doing and didn't play around (she's also really nice).  So if you have some problems that you want to start solving, this is where to go. Then, pretty. Sorry not to say something sooner.

20.description: Great facial in a super cute and cozy little space!Had the 60min Custom Facial with Cynthia last week....I just wanted to relax during my treatment so I asked her not to give me a play by play of everything she was doing to my face. It seemed pretty straightforward.....some cleansing....a mask or two....steam.....extractions (which were quick, easy and painless....yay).....and a  fantastic shoulder rub. I really liked the products that she used....they smelled great and felt good.....I believe it is an all natural organic line called Eminence. The table that they use for facials is incredibly comfortable....it was the very first thing I noticed when I laid down.....more like a bed....mmmmmm! Afterwards.....she gave me her opinion of what my skin needed etc....but wasn't at all pushy about products....which I definitely appreciate.....she did give me a few samples to take home of things I was interested in trying.....which I appreciated even more :)I've been getting facials for the last 15 years.....I've had some pretty horrible experiences and some pretty fantastic ones as well....this one falls towards the latter. My skin looked great when I left and continued to look great....their prices are reasonable.....and Cynthia was super nice and welcoming but professional.I will def be back!

19.description: If you are looking for a place to start your skincare regimen this is the place to do it! Cynthia's facials are out of this world and her Glycolic facials are a must for any one that wants skin that glows!

2.description: I have been going for 3 months for facials and microdermabrasion. I have become a fan. The place is tucked upstairs in a cool loft space.  There are two people who would do facial treatments, Jennifer and Erin. I got Erin to start and have been happy with her. The environment is soothing and relaxing and she focuses on using natural products. This place is everything I need to slip in a midday facial.  Not quite a big spa place with locker rooms and waiting room, more like visiting a designed conscious loft to see your friend who will also give you a facial. When I finish my treatments, I usually stop by the juice place downstairs. Perfect!!

18.description: I have been going to Cynthia for almost 7 years now. I will not let anyone else touch my face or come near me with hot wax! Her facials are out of this world (the back facial is even better - the most relaxing experience ever) and she does amazing waxes - brazilian, regular and lip too! I have super sensitive skin and she knows just how to take care of it. Her partner, Jennifer is awesome as well.  I HIGHLY recommend this place. I have referred all of my friends!

13.description: Lustre is fantastic.  It's the only place I trust to get friendly care and top-of-the-line organic facial products.  Other spas around town just don't go the extra mile to research or don't want to spend the money on good material.  If I'm going to go to the trouble to get a facial, I'm not going to have it compromised with toxic or second-rate stuff put on my face.  Jennifer is AMAZING.  No attitude, friendly, helpful, and extremely well-informed on what is clearly her passion.  Highly recommended.

4.description: I'm often skeptical of businesses I find through deals on Gilt or Groupon, but Lustre was an exception. I had two facials with Jennifer and absolutely loved my experience both times. She took the time to listen to my concerns and customized a treatment for my needs. She was patient and attentive and the service was very thorough and relaxing. Not to mention the space is gorgeous - very light, bright and clean. I will definitely be back.

24.description: If you are looking for a place to start your skincare regimen this is the place to do it! Cynthia's facials are out of this world and her Glycolic facials are a must for any one that wants skin that glows!

6.description: Wonderful, relaxing environment and Jennifer is amazing.  Really knows what she's talking about and makes you feel very comfortable.  Great place!

22.description: I have been going to Cynthia for almost 7 years now. I will not let anyone else touch my face or come near me with hot wax! Her facials are out of this world (the back facial is even better - the most relaxing experience ever) and she does amazing waxes - brazilian, regular and lip too! I have super sensitive skin and she knows just how to take care of it. Her partner, Jennifer is awesome as well.  I HIGHLY recommend this place. I have referred all of my friends!

15.description: 4 stars on my first visit!  Jennifer is a pro and somehow managed to make my tired face look amazing after a glycolic peel and microdermabrasion.  I found her on Living Social and will definitely make this a monthly occurence.  Thank you Lustre!

7.description: Love Love Love! As a mom of 3 little ones Lustre was everything I needed today! The last time I saw Jennifer I was getting married, 5 years later she still remembers me. Her new space is inviting and beautiful!

8.description: I will not have a chance to check out their services since they will not honor my living social deal. This is really my only recourse since I am not going to waste more time for $40. Here is what happened: I called to cancel and reschedule my appointment. I specifically asked if that would be a problem since I know some salons have a policy about 24 hr cancellation. The woman told me no problem, so I went on with my day. Later I got a phone call from another woman telling me I lost the appointment and $40. I am fine with policies, but how is it fair to inform me after it was too late? They must be the only or best salon in the city to feel justified in being so inconsiderate. Oh wait, there are tons of other salons with great reviews.

3.description: I went to see Jennifer after finding her on lifebookerMessage me if you want the code.I had an appointment for a facial that I booked online from above.I showed up and used the buzzer.  I realized this is one of those places that its just the facialist and you.  No front desk, etc so if she is with another client, it might be a second (learned that from calling like 3 times on the buzzer, ha)The space is super swanky white and bright.  I loved it.The room/table is excellent for relaxation.  Jennifer asked me my concerns and then told me her plan.  She did a Jessner peel and then extractions and massage.  I have to say, the peel took me by surprise.  After a few minutes, my face felt like it was burning off.  But she neutralized and all was well without me even saying anything.  Hey, I will do anything for great skin.  Next up the extractions.  I had some acne that was hormonal and very deep :(  She did an excellent job at getting this out.  I was really impressed.  While she was extracting, I was extremely hesitant because there was a lot of pressure.  Alas, this chick knew what she was doing!  She got everything under, out.  I was extremely pleased.  Great massage and pressure for the facial after as well.She really did a great job.  I am definitely thinking about having Jennifer be my new facialist.  I think with her skills regularly, I can get rid of some skin problems I have been having.I am sure after next time, I will be updating my review to 5 stars.  I was really impressed with her thus far and hope to continue my love affair with her.

14.description: We wander around like lost puppies with ingrown hairs and uneven eyebrows to salon after unsatisfying salon. We stop and wonder, "Does it exist? Is there really a place where I can be waxed, extracted and massaged with no attitude and amazing service?" The answer is yes. The salon is Lustre. Your days of worryin' and wanderin' are over.  This salon is super cozy and you'll always receive a warm welcome with your unbeatable service. The custom facial is great for trouble skin, or any skin for that matter. Their skincare line,  Eminence, is completely organic and free of chemicals.  These products are used for the facials. You will love/buy them. Cynthia gave me a handful of samples for products she thought would work well with my skin type (the epitome of combination skin) , so I didn't have to buy them then stick them in the 'not-exactly-what-I-was-looking-for-but maybe-for-another-season' drawer. They also do some top-notch waxing. Of course it hurts, you're ripping hairs out of your skin, but they're quick, sanitary and give great maintenance tips.  My roommate loves their massages as well, so that's next on my list. It definitely beats every other salon in the 'hood, including the pricier/snobbier ones. AND you can get 20% off your first service w/ the city search coupon!

58.description: A meat eaters paradise!   I loved this place.  The first time I went there, I was surprised by all of the people there and was annoyed by the wait time.  However, once it is your turn, it is nice to get that attention and not feel rushed just because they have a store full of people.  We got a bunch of different things to grill and were happy with everything.  It was definitely worth the wait and I am so glad we discovered this place.

56.description: The meat here is amazing, but very expensive. We often go for the other things they have which are more reasonably priced and also wonderful. Especially their hand made frozen tortellini and their prepared foods. They also have amazing gummy bears and some really delicious honeys, cookies, and bread/muffin mixes.They have a tiny parking lot but there is a ton of street parking around and they are easy walking distance from the Paulina Brown line stop. Definitely worth trying!

29.description: How did I not know this place existed so close to my house???  Hello, you walk through the front door and are greeted by a pig carrying a "Welcome" sign.  Then you take a number from the mouth of a smiling pig face.  This is my kind of place.  They sell quality cut meats.  We bought their prime rib, and it's the best cut of meat that we've cooked ourselves.  Hubby has been eyeing the Tomahawk steaks, so now he knows where to buy one since they are hard to find.  I like how each aisle or shelf focuses on a particular item, mustards, hot sauces, seasonings, olive oils, cheeses, pickles, etc. with so many varieties of each.  I bought the frozen chicken pot pie and the frozen ravioli to cook during the week.Service is friendly and patient - just be patient too since there is a wait.  It is definitely worth it!!

42.description: This butcher has the best fresh cuts of beef or any meat in the city.  The Tomahawk steak is to die for, and if you have a big green egg, you can cook it to perfection.   The staff will cut your steaks to order and you will not be disappointed.  I send my assistant there every few weeks to get some of the cured meats as a treat for our work force.  This is always a happy Wednesday (or as the kids say "hump day" treat).  All I can say is to go to Paulina and go often.

23.description: This is a classic meat market with hipster prices. The quality of their products is top notch and the guys know their stuff - they live and breathe meat. Some of the frozen options have some freezer burn and their prices don't necessarily match their substance, but the fresh meats and cheeses is where it's at. It's tough to make a recommendation, as I've sampled enough here to know it really doesn't matter what you get; it'll be worth the extra dollar. Oh, and grab a jar of homemade pickles and hand it to one of the mustached cashiermen - tell him you've waited your whole life for this jar and it's high time you two are introduced. He'll get it.

47.description: I honestly don't know how I could have possibly not been in here before.  Like everyone else in Chicago, I had of course heard of this spot, but had never been inside.  Admittedly, I was a bit nervous to go inside as I had heard their ordering method was a bit 'particular', but I'm so glad I visited.First of all, the meat and poultry selection is unbelievable.  They have all sorts of regular and unique meats and lots of fun grocery selections.  While you grab your number and wait, it's really easy to fill a basket of other nibbles and fun items.  I picked up some interesting pickles which were wonderful.The meat itself was great - we mostly picked out some brats and Italian sausages but they were all delicious and really reasonably priced.If I had had more time, I would have investigated more fully, but for my first visit, I was very happy to walk away with a bag of meat and a few other tasty treats.If you haven't been here, you definitely must go, but perhaps you could go when I'm not trying to as I imagine this place is packed during grilling season.

8.description: Welcome to the amazing sausage life. As a general life rule, I attempt to limit my intake of animal flesh. I'm not a vegetarian or anything of the sort, but it seems within reason to only have meat around 2 times each week. The amazing sausage life changes that now, though. I won't be satisfied merely eating ALL of your sausages. I want to BE your sausages. I can't help but wonder what these sausages are laced with, what kind of delicious wonder is encased in these tubes.  I always thought that upon my passing, my ashes would be chopped up with a credit card on a mirror and snorted by my best friends. They'd high five each other afterwards, thankful for the jolt I provided them, thankful I released them from their day languishing in ennui. Now, I want my body taken here so I could be stuffed in one of these delicious brats and sold to some lucky Chicagoan, maybe grilled out on a beautiful fall day when the Cubs actually make noise in the playoffs. Serve me in one of their delicious pretzel rolls, cover me in the gourmet mustard that you can conveniently purchase next to one of a hundred different kinds of animal flesh. Ensconce my ashes--my spirit, even--in these fatty tubes abundant with flavor. I haven't been able to stop thinking about the cheddar brat since I first tasted it a week ago. Actually, I'm not sure I tasted it so much as it jumped inside me, oozed its goodness directly into my soul, and took at least half of my freewill hostage. I'll be coming back, more often than I should, begging for more meat tube deliciousness and eating them until my t-shirts are drenched from the meat sweats, that precious after-fluid that flows from being over-sausaged. Perhaps I take the shirts, shred them, and put them in bottles of water to release some of those flavor remnants, ready for a second round.  Or maybe I just come here and buy more sausage, like a normal human. I'm putting you on notice, Paulina: I will be back. You may never get rid of me. Please put me inside your sausages, feed me to all of chicago  and let them ingest my remnants so I can be closer with them all. Let them chew until they can swallow me, recycled for the next one and on and on so I can live forever.

31.description: Anything you need meat-wise: they have it.  Great old-school butchers and these guys are super friendly and really know their stuff if you have questions!The meat quality is the best I've found in the city, blows the Whole Foods or similar away!

34.description: Easiest review to write, ever. If you need meat for literally anything, go here. Everything is high quality, delicious and the staff is incredibly helpful. Jerky, cold cuts, steaks, you name it, they've got it. Chicago's been called "The Hog Butcher of the World"- this place contributes to that old adage. Paulina Market truly lives up to the hype.

16.description: I love having a real, old-fashioned butcher shop near me.  I wanted a strip steak for new years and there were only 3 smallish ones in the case.  When I expressed disappointment he asked how big I wanted, then went in back and custom cut me a perfect, 1.5 lb prime one and showed it with obvious pride.  He also fresh ground some chuck for ground beef for me while he was back there.  No, I'm not a regular or someone they recognize, but this is their standard of service.  Excellent.

13.description: Not sure how I neglected to review the Meat Wonderland of Chicago before now.  This place is loaded with fantastic items I'd never heard of, like gyro bratwurst, duck sausage, chili wieners (hot dogs seasoned to taste like a perfect chili dog), and so much more.  Their smoked duck or chicken breasts are fantastic.  Don't miss the corned beef hash in the frozen section, it's phenomenal.  If I listed every great thing I've had here, I'd basically be listing their whole inventory.  I often get whatever item they have on special and end up with yet another favorite.The people are very friendly and helpful.  They won't hesitate to come from behind the counter and grab something for you if you didn't spot it in the aisles.  I expressed concern as to whether a pot roast I was eying would have enough fat, and the butcher immediately offered to go to the back and get me extra fat for no additional charge.It's not easy to recommend the traditional items like steaks since the prices are quite high and I don't really taste a difference (though the hanger steak is a good bargain), but all of their sausages and other homemade items are well worth the price.Paulina Market is worth a long drive, since they offer great meats you just can't get elsewhere.

11.description: Reminds me of the German shops back in Ingelheim where my family is from.Best cuts of meat anywhere in Chicago. Hands down. Everything from the roast to their bratwurst and sausages. Even their dried meats are amazing.

39.description: Getting a Groupon for this place was the best gift ever! The store has a huge selection of...jams, seasonings, chocolates, cookies...and MEAT. Steaks, sausages, chickens, turkeys, seafood...you name it.Don't be intimidated by all the meat! The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable about everything they've got. We're so glad to have discovered this place and love going here!

37.description: I love Paulina Meat Market, the selection of steaks are great, not to mention the lamb chops. They have a great selection of home made wieners, which are great for grilling. Their deli doesn't fall behind with the bone in ham for morning breakfast. I love that the steaks are good quality and are always fresh. They potato salad is great, they also have a huge selection of homemade  sausages which are delicious.

0.description: I worked at a butcher deli shop in the burbs for 10 years and know good quality when I see it.  I am so glad we found this place near our apartment in the city.  We ordered a huge brisket and it was excellent.  Better quality than what you will find at chain grocery stores.  Can't wait to head back for more.  My husband said he wants to set up a cot and live there. We are in literal hog heaven.

38.description: The best butcher in town, period.  Excellent selection of meats, cold cuts and sausages.  Great for that prime ribeye for grilling in the summer.  There is veal sausage, duck sausage, and several kinds of Italian sausage, both cooked and uncooked.  Also a great selection of smoked meats.  If you like the Brazilian meat picanha, it is also available here, they call it rump cover and it is fantastic.   Another hot item is their corned beef hash, which is made in house and the best I've had.  To top it off, the staff is very knowledgeable about their product, and can help you select the right meat and provide some tips on how to best cook it.  As you would expect for a place do this caliber, the prices are above what you would pay at Costco or your local grocery store, but you get what you pay for.

51.description: I really wanted to like this place because I drive by it frequently. I had a Groupon so I decided to check it out. First of all, it is very EXPENSIVE. I'm sure they would say that's because everything is fresh, but therein lies the problem. I purchased a $25 rack of ribs along with some other items like bacon and sausage. This purchase was on a Tuesday. On Sunday I decided to make the ribs. As soon as I opened the package there was a foul smell. Not to mention the slimy feel fo the ribs. Ugh! They were super spoiled. I was pretty upset so I decided to call Paulina, but guess what, they're closed on Sundays. Go figure. On Monday I was ready to bring the ribs back to the store, but I decided to call first. I asked for the manager and the guy who answered said I could talk to him. Perhaps I should have insisted on a manager, but I decided to plead my case anyway. Basically this guy said that their meat only last 2 days tops. What??? He went on to say that I should have asked about how long it would last. Who on earth would do that? I actually told the butcher that helped me in the store that this was my first time there you'd think he would have said something if spoiling is an issue. In any case, this guys said NO REFUNDS. So now I'm out $25. Needless to say I will not be going back for inferior quality at high prices.

27.description: This place is amazing!  I bought a turducken loaf, old fashioned German hot dogs and smoked pork butt.  All of it was delicious!  And reasonably priced.  I was also very impressed by how varied their selection of meats is.  They had more meat preparations than I ever knew existed.  I will definitely be a regular now.

32.description: Excellent quality.  The tomahawk steak is easy to make and can easily feed 2-3 ppl. Every time I'm in chicago I stop by this place.

54.description: Bought the cajun beef jerky several days before our road trip, and only left half of them when we actually hit the road. It's that good.Also found some fantastic smoked bacon and sausage. My go-to place for nice meat in Chicago.

48.description: I picked up our Thanksgiving Turkey today as well as a spicy lamb stick and sweet pork stick. The place was packed and looked like it had been for awhile and was going to stay that way. Everyone knows the meat here is the best and the product selection is fantastic. You know why I'll keep coming back? When I was checking out, the employee that was helping me asked how the roads were and told me to be careful on my bike. He expressed actual concern about the door zone and about how a lot of folks treat cyclists poorly. It was so busy in the store he could have just flown through checking me out but he didn't. I'll be back as often as I can be! And thanks for lookin' out!

44.description: Wow. Meat as far as the eye can see. Amazing.As this was my first time here I wasn't sure what to expect and it absolutely blew away any expectations I had or could have possibly had. My goodness...As I was hosting a dinner party and wasn't really sure what I wanted to serve, the guys behind the counter were super helpful. The place was packed and despite that, the gentleman serving me focused only on me and made me feel like I was the only person in the place. I appreciated that given there were at least 50 other people in there waiting. No lie. Probably closer to 100 but didn't want to exaggerate.The place is a meat wonderland. Everything I bought from the homemade sausage to the thinly sliced steak for bracciole was fantastic and a big hit with my guests. Complimenting the fresh meats you will also find a store filled with European specialties such as sauces, pickled items, mustard's, and my favorite find Kronung coffee from Germany. A favorite of mine from when I used to travel there. There was a nice selection of gourmet cheeses as well and a small produce section. Various breads, crackers and other dry goods round out the place. A true meat lovers emporium. They even gave me a meat calendar. Awesome.Yes, it's a bit pricey but to be honest, it's worth it. You can buy the prepackaged stuff in the supermarket that comes from God knows where of you can find locally sourced, fresh meats and go for quality over quantity.

24.description: Love this place- I've been buying meat etc. from this market for probably 15+ years.  Very knowledgeable butchers will answer all of your questions- akin to free BBQ consulting!

7.description: I think I've died and gone to meat heaven.This is going to be short and to the point :  AMAZINGLY friendly and knowledgeable staff,  out of this world selection, and beyond fantastic quality.   That's it.How I existed in Chicago for 4 years before venturing into this carnivorous paradise before, I have no idea.  But now that I've discovered the wonder that is a bevvy of mouthwatering steaks, chops, ground meet, racks of ribs, cuts of drool-worthy oxtail, veal bones ready for my homemade stocks, whole chickens standing at attention like little poultry soldiers, a wide variety of house made sausages, and enough deli meat and prepared mains and sides to last well until the Cubs FINALLY win a World Series, I will be back more often than my bank account would want me to admit.Paulina Market... I love you.

49.description: This place is expensive.But you get what you pay for. The guys cut all of their own steaks and provide top quality meats. The customer service is off the chain. I apparently came at the wrong time, but the butcher spent all the time with me that I wanted despite the 50 or so people standing (pushing?) behind me.That all said, if you wouldn't know the difference between or know how to cook a $7 ribeye versus a $18 ribeye, you'll be flushing your money coming to this place.

40.description: This is a very cute market selling various kinds of meat, frozen goods, as well as prepackaged goodies such as jam, cookies, chocolates, etc.  When I stepped in, they had samples of chocolates, gourmet caramel wraps, as well as turduckin sausages (mighty tasty to sample).  The place isn't as congested, and there was a small handful of customers.  Price-wise, it is a little more steep than your typical chain of grocery stores (to be expected, of course), but the meat seem fresh and the butchers themselves, nice!+fresh meat

53.description: Paulina Market is somewhat out of the way for me (3+ miles), but a recent Groupon deal brought me back for a first visit in several years.  No question, the meat and prepared foods selection are far-ranging and uniformly first-rate, and priced accordingly.  The meats include some hard-to-find game meats, and a wide selection of flavorful sausages.  Prepared foods include pastas (I got the shrimp/garlic ravioli), pot pies, crab cakes, picnic-type side dishes, varied meatballs, and on and on.   It's very well-run by knowledgeable folks who were helpful and kept the full house moving.  Given the distance for me, I wouldn't make it my regular meat market, but it's sure to be my go-to place whenever I have company;  I also imagine they'll have terrific special offerings around holiday season.

30.description: The beef jerky here is amazing!  In addition, the people who work at the Paulina Meat Market are very helpful.  As a former vegetarian, I often need more help than average when it comes to making the right choices at a butcher.  The men (usually all men) here are fabulous- they give opinions, cooking instructions and explain what to look for in the future... All without making me feel dumb for not already knowing.  I highly recommend!

46.description: Go here, place is the real deal. All the butchers are very helpful and respectful to their customers, regardless of one's knowledge of meat. They have an endless amount of cuts as well as a ton of specialty products. It's definitely an expensive outing but you get what you pay for.

1.description: One of my favorite places in Chicago.  I don't know if its the old school Chicago crew behind the counter, the variety of prepared foods or the quality of the meats that makes this place so great.  It does always feel like I stepped back in time when I walk into the place imagining this is what is has been like for years.  If you have questions they are always really helpful and will even help put special cuts together depending on what you are cooking.I was in for Thanksgiving this past week and thought it was time to give them some love.  For the first timers be warned on holidays there can be a line, but it is worth the wait!

55.description: Had a GREAT first experience at Paulina. I've been to other neat markets in the city of Chicago and although they r more expensive Paulina definitely is worth it, mostly. I went cause of the groupon a few weeks back. Hope u got one cause they went pretty quickly. Anyway I knew they were expensive so I figured I'd get a few things for the grill to them out without going overboard.Man, those brats were fantastic. I got the regular ones and the jalapeño and jack. They cooked up great on the grill. Very tasty and flavorful. I won't give commentary on everything I bought that day but between the brats ground sirloin burgers, and prime ribeye steaks I was a happy camper when all was said and done on the grill. Hell no i didn't share those $27/lb ribeyes. She, got a small slice, he got a small slice and that was it. U ain't put in on this high quality meat, man! also, I wanted to give a shot to the butcher that helped me. Don't know his name but a teddy bear looking guy w/ a bushy mustache (wait is that all the guys that were there? I'm not sure). He gave me the info on their brats how they stuff and make them as well as the info and suggestion in the sirloin burgers. Oh yeah they were great. so very easily beat out the WalMart burgers that the kids got to eat. Hey, their palettes aren't that refined yet. so, I enthusiastically give a good review of paulina. They r expensive but the quality of the meat, knowledge and customer service of the butchers are top notch.One suggestion though, put the ticket # dispenser closer to the butcher area I didn't  see it when I came in as its right by the front door, so several ppl after me got served first til I learned where it was at. Happy grilling ppl!

9.description: I have ordered their meats and sausages before via online delivery services, but had not visited the store until the last month.  I have come a couple times to get a variet of their sausages.  Every one of their 5+ sausages I have tried have great flavor and come out very juice even if I overcook them a bit.  Definitely recommend checking this place out!

26.description: Terrific place, definitely my first choice for meat market.  Spices, sauces, frozen prepared, bit of produce and dry goods, besides all the fresh meat. Don't forget to get some jerky for the trip home.And almost as importantly, remember to take a number from the pig when you walk in the door.

25.description: I like to grill, and when I grill I like to head to Paulina Market to pick up my meat. Every single meat at this place is high quality, I have never had any kind of qualms about it and even if it's a cut like pork belly (which I like to make my own bacon with). I will come in here and order baby back pig ribs and other cuts of pork and beef and I have never had a complaint, and they are very nice and can explain things to you if you ask what the best way to cook it (or smoke it in my situation). By far the best butcher shop in Chicago.

12.description: 15$ each to debone a chicken is totally unreasonable. I'm new to Chicago from NYC, but I was surprised to learn that butchery is not something you can automatically expect from a butcher

59.description: Everything about Paulina Market is awesome! There is a wide choice of meats to pick from including beef, chicken, Bratwursts and sausages. I found the location convenient with ample parking to match. Once inside, my wife and I were served by staff who had all the experience in customer service and understood what we wanted. Actually, we were planning a barbeque and a colleague at work suggested we look up Paulina Market. We are forever indebted! This was real succulent meat that our guests complimented us for.What I loved most is that we were spoilt for choice and the glass displays were wonderful. It gave us the opportunity to make a quick decision on what to pick and we even added some seriously fresh bed to our cart. Moreover, the butcher suggested some wonderful recipes that my wife tried out and we will definitely be frequenting Paulina Market for out meats and more.

21.description: This place is the real deal. Super authentic, old-timey butcher shop. Tons of cuts of meat, exotic meats, homemade sausages, home-cured coldcuts. I would argue that it's not overpriced at all, and just top notch quality. I highly recommend the cheddarwurst. It's german style brat, with really creamy cheddar, so when you cook it up it gets all goozy and amazing. Take a bite and this sausage literally bleeds cheese. When I was in Vienna, they had street carts that sold Kasekreiner (sp?), which is essentially what this sausage is. I've never experienced anything like it in the states, UNTIL NOW.

17.description: This place is the real deal. Super authentic, old-timey butcher shop. Tons of cuts of meat, exotic meats, homemade sausages, home-cured coldcuts. I would argue that it's not overpriced at all, and just top notch quality. I highly recommend the cheddarwurst. It's german style brat, with really creamy cheddar, so when you cook it up it gets all goozy and amazing. Take a bite and this sausage literally bleeds cheese. When I was in Vienna, they had street carts that sold Kasekreiner (sp?), which is essentially what this sausage is. I've never experienced anything like it in the states, UNTIL NOW.

10.description: How did I not know this place existed so close to my house???  Hello, you walk through the front door and are greeted by a pig carrying a "Welcome" sign.  Then you take a number from the mouth of a smiling pig face.  This is my kind of place.  They sell quality cut meats.  We bought their prime rib, and it's the best cut of meat that we've cooked ourselves.  Hubby has been eyeing the Tomahawk steaks, so now he knows where to buy one since they are hard to find.  I like how each aisle or shelf focuses on a particular item, mustards, hot sauces, seasonings, olive oils, cheeses, pickles, etc. with so many varieties of each.  I bought the frozen chicken pot pie and the frozen ravioli to cook during the week.Service is friendly and patient - just be patient too since there is a wait.  It is definitely worth it!!

5.description: Great selection of meat and condiments. Hands down the best jerkies- tried the original beef jerky and they are juicy and almost tender. Definitely not the kind that breaks your teeth! The duck pastrami was amazing- so tender and delicious!!Can't wait to try more products from here!

3.description: What's on Lincoln Ave., in between CTA Paulina and Addison a Brown Line stations?  There's a meat paradise and has been there since 1949.  Rosa J. and Daddy J. were there, looking for some top-quality sausages and steaks.  Paulina Market also has a wide variety of cheese, frozen meat products, and light grocery items.  Please head to the piggy receptionist station to grab a number before proceeding to the counter.  Well, I should say take a close look at everything Paulina Market has to offer before getting the number.  The venue is much larger than what I have originally imagined.  Out of all the amazing inventories they had, Daddy J. and I went with the ribeye steak ($22.50/lb.) and veal brats ($9.85/lb.).  Our total was $48 and some change.  Mama J. was the chef for the night.  Without any seasoning, the ribeye steak was juicy and flavorful.  I didn't add even one (1) pinch of salt and pepper...at all!  It was really an experimental trip to PM.  I'm now officially hooked with this place.  Did somebody mention the chicken pot pie?  I intended to look for it but this agenda slipped off my mind accidentally.  It will be my next mission.

35.description: I love that this market has been an asset to the neighborhood for so long, I only wish I would have discovered it sooner. It's very clean and organized, the staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and they serve quality products at a respectable price. Overall great market. I will definitely be back.

19.description: The place is wonderful. Always great friendly service and high quality products. If we're making a nice meal we always make sure to buy our meat here. The beef jerky is magical. Never had anything like it - so good.

28.description: Sure it's a bit pricey, but for what you get at this location it's worth it. As a BBQ fan, and weekend warrior, it's nice to find a butcher that knows what a whole packer brisket is - with a point and a flat. Supermarkets in the area are just not on the same playing field meat wise and staff wise. Next time you're looking for steaks or great meat to smoke, Paulina is your place.

45.description: Wow!  They have a great selection of quality meats here!!!  Come here for all your meat needs!  We got some Ox Tail and Short Ribs here and they were really delicious.  Above Par Quality.  And the service is great too!  They are so nice and friendly.  People definitely know about this place because you do have to wait a little.  Great place!  Check them out!

33.description: Best butcher in Chicago! Best brats in Chicago! Anytime I want to grill out I go to Paulina to get the best quality meats. The variety of items is off the hook and the staff is the friendliest. Make sure to grab a ticket from the pig's mouth when you get in or you will be waiting longer. On busy days you can be waiting up to an hour, but it's definitely worth going here instead of your standard grocery store. My all time favorite is their pork brats! Try everything though. You can't go wrong at Paulina.

43.description: Friendly staff and wide selection of meat products (steaks, sausages, poultry, and much much much more). Their bologna is the best! I love coming here.

2.description: After seeing so many 5 star reviews, I decided to try this place out. Beyond disappointing meat, overpriced, and underwhelming service. I looked through everything they had and not having any filet mignon, which is what I was looking for, and everything being pre-cut should have been a giveaway to their lack of quality. I figured out what I wanted and took a number.Let me preempt this with something to stop you from even walking in the door. They do not have most cuts of beef you probably want when thinking "I'm going to grill a steak". They didn't even have my top 3, so I should have walked out the door. If you want something other than beef or low quality beef at high prices then this is the place for you. You can get the same quality meat at half the price at Jewel and honestly better quality at the same price at Whole Foods. Otherwise, there are much better butchers in the city.They had a lot of people working behind the counter and half of them weren't checking ticket numbers, they were just taking the person in front of them so I ended up waiting longer by not being rude. Then when they call your number they do it twice and if you don't immediately tell them what you want they move on to the next person, which I had to scream out "excuse me I'm right here trying to talk to you".Once I finally got help, I asked a very simple question for someone who should be a butcher. "What is the difference between YOUR choice and prime". Because we were talking a $12/lb difference, which is drastic for a ribeye. Now a real butcher should be able to give me specifics, where it came from, the specific cut, fat content, and so on. His answer and only answer was "well a lot". I asked if he could tell me anything about the meat and he told me "we're very busy so what do you want". I should have walked out.From my point of view their "choice" cuts and "prime" cuts looked exactly the same. No difference in redness or fat content. I opted for the prime as I would assume it's higher quality and I paid over $50 for two pieces. Which is completely insane after tasting it.When I got it home and put on a dry rub I noticed it was very very firm. Before I cooked it, it was a 3/4 inch steak. After, it was like a pancake. I cooked it medium rare and did a somewhat perfect job along with the same preparation I do every time I cook steak. Hard to perfect cook a steak when it deflates to half the size. It was slightly chewy and not very soft. The flavor was horrible. It tasted kind of like skirt steak, but really cheap skirt. It was honestly the worst steak I've made and I've purchased from Jewel. I always do very minimal spices so I can taste the meat... I had to smother it with spices to even enjoy it.All of their prices are extremely high and their food does not look good. It all looks overly prepared and low quality. I didn't see a single thing in there that made my mouth water. My go-to butcher has meat cuts that look beautiful, but they are on the other side of the city. They put this place to shame in quality, price, and service. A butcher should be able to tell you every detail about a cut, how to prepare it, and cut the meat fresh based on what you're looking to do with it. This place is a glorified grocery store meat case.

18.description: This is a very cute market selling various kinds of meat, frozen goods, as well as prepackaged goodies such as jam, cookies, chocolates, etc.  When I stepped in, they had samples of chocolates, gourmet caramel wraps, as well as turduckin sausages (mighty tasty to sample).  The place isn't as congested, and there was a small handful of customers.  Price-wise, it is a little more steep than your typical chain of grocery stores (to be expected, of course), but the meat seem fresh and the butchers themselves, nice!+fresh meat

41.description: I scoff at any north side Chicagoan who shops at the grocery store for their meats and seafood when Paulina Meat Market is right around the corner.  If you want a good meat and seafood, get it from these guys.  The butchers are knowledgeable about the products, can make suggestions for any type of meat you need from filets to seafood to pork chops.  A friend of mine gets her Thanksgiving turkey here every year and since they grill it, Paulina chops it up for them ahead of time.  There is nothing these guys won't do to ensure that you not only have a pleasant experience, but that your meal is one of the best because of the quality meat in the center.The even have great choices in the freezers if you aren't ready to cook that meal later. Side dishes? you got it.  Sauces?  Yep. Appetizers? Indeed  Snacks? Can you say beef jerky?I'd love it if this place could be open a bit later during the week. That would be my only gripe.

52.description: Its worth the drive. Living near the historic Fulton Market District I should be good to go but no place has encased meats like Paulina Meat Market. I have not put a wiener or sausage from them in my mouth that I've been disappointed with. Sure, there's a long line and yeah its expensive but the meat is fresh and flavorful and the staff is excellent. Just go and dont worry about being disappointed, cause the only way that will happen is if your afraid of amazing meat.

50.description: Premium meats and sausages at a premium  price.  The latter is in no way a bad thing.  Essentially you get what you pay for and Paulina Market delivers.  Outstanding service from the butchers that ask you how you will be preparing meats and offer suggestions to sausages that are hard to find.  I only wish that this  venerable north side institution were  closer.

4.description: Absolutely the best brats of any butcher shop in the city.  The Koval bourbon smoked bacon is also to die for.  Service is somewhat traditional old-school butcher style, but still friendly.  Prices are more than justified by the quality of the product.

6.description: I love Paulina Meat Market! I have been coming here for years to get sausages and steaks for grilling, and their beef jerky is second to none.  It's a wee bit pricey but everything is very high quality, so it's worth it to me. I'd rather eat meat less often and save up and buy my meat from here for those special meals.  The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful.

22.description: This place is just the bomb diggity. I read 2 reviews on here that were ridiculous. One person complained that this store doesn't have cookies or many sweets. It is Paulina's Meat Market. My goodness, they aren't supposed to carry candy. The other person complained that they carried too MUCH meat.... I have no words for that. The service is flawless, like others said. Ask a person behind the counter anything, they will have the answer. They have so much awesome stuff. They have every kind of sausage and brat, they have different bacons, they cut things to order, they have samples, they have fabulous pepperoni and lamb sticks and beef jerky... Oh my goodness I want more now. They have duck and chicken fat and different stocks to cook with, they have some cool juices like peach and guava and pear, they have SNAILS for crying out loud. Awesome cheese selection. Great Gouda and Brie. Run there, look around, pick some stuff out, and when you see the final cost, just remember you get what you pay for: perfection.

15.description: Good quality. We enjoy the meat but the service leaves something to be desired. If you order online it doesn't save you any time.  More9ver, the process of retrieving your order is disorganized and time consuming. What should be simple and quick is a laborious, painful process. So don't waste your time ordering online. Just go in and be prepared to spend the time;especially around holidays.

57.description: Terrific selection and very helpful staff. They have everything from fresh meats to sausages, frozen quail and even European mustards.

20.description: The place is wonderful. Always great friendly service and high quality products. If we're making a nice meal we always make sure to buy our meat here. The beef jerky is magical. Never had anything like it - so good.

36.description: The best butcher around.  Great brays and sausages.  Very tasty ground beef for burgers and amazing steaks!  My go to favorite is the bone in NY (aka Kansas City) strip.  The flavor can't be beat.  It can be a little crazy on a Saturday in the summer but it is well worth the wait!

14.description: This place is just the bomb diggity. I read 2 reviews on here that were ridiculous. One person complained that this store doesn't have cookies or many sweets. It is Paulina's Meat Market. My goodness, they aren't supposed to carry candy. The other person complained that they carried too MUCH meat.... I have no words for that. The service is flawless, like others said. Ask a person behind the counter anything, they will have the answer. They have so much awesome stuff. They have every kind of sausage and brat, they have different bacons, they cut things to order, they have samples, they have fabulous pepperoni and lamb sticks and beef jerky... Oh my goodness I want more now. They have duck and chicken fat and different stocks to cook with, they have some cool juices like peach and guava and pear, they have SNAILS for crying out loud. Awesome cheese selection. Great Gouda and Brie. Run there, look around, pick some stuff out, and when you see the final cost, just remember you get what you pay for: perfection.

12.description: They're under new management and it's absolutely awful, not to mention their prices are inordinately inflated. Since they switched management and decided to raise prices and will likely continue to do so, after 12 years, my family and I are going elsewhere, for better care and more competitive prices. Not to mention, depending on your insurance provider you may or may not receive decent service.

7.description: The staff here is amazing!  They are probably some of the friendliest people I've ever met in any healthcare situation.  Dr. Boldus was super nice and helpful. He tells you how it is and that's pretty refreshing nowadays.  I really loved this office and would recommend anyone to try them out!

3.description: After scouting places that were closer to my house than the 45 minutes I was driving to see my eye doctor, I happened upon West Loop Eye Care (thanks yelp!) and couldn't be happier with the decision to head over.  My husband and I bought some cool frames from Labrabbit Optics and needed an eye exam in order to purchase lenses with our insurance plan.The staff was amazing--professional, warm, knowledgeable--and was able to schedule us the same day I called for an appointment.  At our previous place, we would have to schedule at least a week out and then ended up waiting at least half an hour before being seen by the doctor.  Here, we were able to go into the examining room (spacious, exposed brick, clean and cool) together right away, hence saving time.  The doctor was very laid back, indicating that my prescription was in fact too strong (!) and my husband's floaters were nothing to be concerned about.  He answered all our questions patiently and competently. The vibe of the place and everyone involved is very welcoming and warm; the exam was easy and well-explained; the insurance coverage and payment were thoroughly and thoughtfully expressed.  Turns out they offer a 20% discount on sunglasses--bonus!Only somewhat confusing part--there are no signs out front and the place is tucked back into a parking lot.  Looks more like the entrance to a condo than a business.  They need more signage out front if they're going to attract new clientele.  However, if you look for the address and not the (lack of a) business sign, you'll have no problem finding it.  They're on the third floor and are next to a dentist, don't let that confuse you.

1.description: Fantastic place and service! This was my son's first appointment here, and he thought that the doctor did an amazing job. To quote him, "she explained everything very thoroughly and articulately". So, I'm a happy mom since he got serviced well and at the same time, he learned something about visual physiology. I'll be making my appointment next!Oh, I forgot to mention; the coffee and snacks were an added bonus! Additionally, we got some free goodies to take home. Slam dunk!

2.description: Great and friendly place! Everyone is so welcoming and helpful! The doctor made sure my two younger kids were comfortable and explained the process to them in "kid terms". Karina was extremely helpful! She matched my boys with some great glasses and made sure they were fitted for their frame. Would definitely recommend this place!!

9.description: I recently picked up my new pair of anti-reflective glasses and sunglasses and I couldn't be happier!! Getting lots of compliments from my friends and family. I love this place. They always seem to have a great selection in stock.  I continue to get my eyewear from them despite no longer needing prescription glasses. Their employees have always been helpful, especially with helping me pick out frames that look good on my face. (They tend to be too small for me AND I'm picky, so it takes time to find the right pair).I just wish this place was closer to my work.

18.description: I visited Eye Care Center a few weeks ago and was pleased with the immediate assistance and kindess with which I was treated. When I had a emergency situation with my eye the optometrist attended to me quickly and took time out to assess and evaluation my issue. The staff proved to be extremely helpful and provided me with great service in a very friendly atmosphere. I was so thankful and have now made plans to return for a regular examination.

10.description: This place is really great! My family and I have been going here for years and we are more than satisfied. The doctors are very knowledgeable and the staff is more than helpful. They are very efficient and there is no long waiting. Also they have an amazing selection of glasses and sunglasses. I definitely recommend going here first!

13.description: I've been coming here for 20yrs, and recently began wondering why I can't leave this place without spending AT LEAST $600 WITH insurance coverage. I was informed that Local No. 1 and other union members are to be treated "differently" according to new management. This entails inflating prices, and poor customer service. Thanks for the information, I will be sure that none of my 9 immediate family members ever come here again.

16.description: The staff at West Loop Eye Care are incredibly friendly, helpful and honest.  They truly look out for your best interests. I was just in to pick out frames and the manager was fantastic at helping find the frames that were just right for me. You never feel rushed or pressured to make a decision and they make you feel like family. I've only had outstanding experiences at West Loop Eye Care and will continue to only get my eye exams done there.

17.description: I live right across the street from Vision Boutique and figured it would be a convenient option to get an eye exam/contact lens refill. I stopped in to make an appt and it turned out they weren't yet set up to accept my vision insurance. However, their sister store - Eye Care Center (located only two blocks away) did in fact accept it so they directed me there. Vision Boutique is what you'd expect from any indy eye place - nice selection of frames, boutique atmosphere, etc - the staff was really friendly and helpful even though I wasn't going to be utilizing them directly so I had good expectations for Eye Care Center. I made an appt for a few days later and one for Amy as well who decided after all these years to finally have her eyes checked. (insert joke here...) Anyway, ECC was a complete 180 from VB. It was located on the 3rd floor of an office building and shared office space with a dental practice (weird). It also had the appearance of what I would expect gov't subsidized health care for illegal immigrants to look like. The selection of glasses were decent (definitely on the lower end but they did have an ok selection of designer frames for Amy to check out while waiting for the Dr). The Dr himself deserves 5 stars. He was friendly, knowledgeable, etc and even seemed out of place in his own store. Both of our exams were standard, quick, and efficient and then it was time to move on to one of the sales associates for my contacts and Amy's glasses ... The girl who "helped us" was probably one of the worst sales people I have ever had the displeasure of working with. Maybe she's used to working with a different kind of clientele - one that is uneducated or unfamiliar but after 30 seconds of me giving her background (been wearing contacts for 15+ years, able to get them online, etc, etc) - she should have gotten the hint and shut down her bs. Instead, she tried to railroad me into spending money over and above my insurance plan which was completely unnecessary. I know how many fk'n boxes I need to last me a year and I also know that I can pay $19 online for the same thing you're trying to rob me for $31 for. Long story short - I left with 2 boxes of contact vs 6 boxes as she claimed my insurance didn't cover anything else (which I knew was completely false). Went home, spoke to my insurance company - called her back livid, and sure enough 4 more boxes were going to be available to me in a few days. She tried to roll me for $200+ and the whole thing ended up costing me $6. It's pretty pointless to try to scam someone who is clearly knowledgeable and although I truly liked the Dr/owner - I wonder if this is a reflection on him as well. (I'll give him the benefit of the doubt).Amy's glasses were less of an issue but took over two weeks to make which seemed excessive. Although I liked the Dr - there's just too many options in the eye care world to be a repeat customer at a place that left such a bad taste in my mouth for something that should have been clear cut and dry. I just feel badly for their customers who don't know any better.

15.description: I was very pleased with my experience at the West Loop Eye Care. The doctor and staff were very friendly and helpful. They also have a nice selection of glasses in the office. The place was pretty busy on a Saturday afternoon, but I still finished my appointment in less than an hour. I needed some new contacts and had to replace my old lenses on my glasses. I received the new contacts via mail in just three days and they called me two days later telling me my glasses were ready. Service is fast here so I definitely recommend them.

0.description: The entire staff, from front desk to my technician and Dr. Noreen, is so pleasant! Everyone is professional, personable, and really informative including the exam itself to explaining my benefits. The office is clean and spacious. I felt really comfortable here and it's going to be my regular spot!

5.description: Doctors are good; glasses did not work out so after a couple discussions they decided to refund the frames and not lenses.

11.description: What a disappointment!!! I was a regular patient at this eye center but after my recent visit I couldn't be more dissatisfied. My go to person Areli is no longer there and now I hate this place. So different!! They are so rude and slow in helping you. They're so insistent on getting you to add something that is unnecessary to your purchase or purpose of the visit. I will definitely not be returning to this place ever again. Service is definitely not the same! It doesn't even deserve one star.

8.description: Everyone here is so welcoming and eager to help.  I even received a thank you note after my exam and purchase of two frames reminding me to submit my rebate, which was pretty cool.

4.description: I have been going here for 3 years, ever since I moved to the neighborhood and they are terrific !  I have been wearing glasses and contacts for most if my life and tend to wait until it is an emergency before I make an eye appointment but with the helpful staff and easy appointment schedule I make it 2x a year. I can see better than I have in years ! Thanks WLEC

14.description: Have been going to this place for many years now, maybe 9.  And everything was great.  Doctors have seen different ones during the years I have been going to them.  However they used to, yes USED TO, have the best customer service ever.  Areli was the best thing they had.  Alejandro is great too!!!  However I called to make an appointment and asked for Areli to find out she had been let go.  Very disappointing.  Seems to me maybe prejudice or maybe doctors just didn't like her but they are so wrong and I am sure many will agree with me.  Doctors should worry about the customer service than their service.  Areli and Alejandro spend more time with patients than doctors themselves.   Result of this..... West Loop Eye Center has lost not only myself, but my husband and my daughter.   3  less patients they have.  Too many places out there that  are not prejudice that all people white, hispanic, whatever nationality or race they are get the same offers and coupon specials.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.

6.description: Outstanding job with both glasses and contacts. Good follow up, things that needed to be ordered came in on time.

58.description: Not really getting the hype for this place!  Having a real bad craving for fried chicken, yelp reviews for this place had me brave the weather for pickup.  I only live few blocks so the chicken were still warm, so can't blame the disappointment on takeout.  I like crispy chicken and guy's chicken is far from it.  Blend flavor unlike the reviewers comments about the spices.  Staff were friendly and decent coleslaw,  but for $26. for 8pc dark and slaw...

56.description: At the rate that West Loop is filling in with new eateries, no one who frequents that area will have a reason for complaining about what to sample. And a bit of Memphis has made its way up to Chicago and into the West Loop neighbourhood.Hell,, Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken.I ordered a plate of chicken, baked beans, fried okra, potato salad, and a slice of sweet potato pie. The chicken is spicy and I love that. The sides were good. The sweet potato pie was not quite a smooth/creamy as I have had it at the Memphis location, but I devoured it just the same.Great service. This is one of those restaurants where you order at the counter and then take a seat, after which your food is then brought out to you. I went shortly after the restaurant opened for business, so it was not quite stuffed to capacity. It's definitely worth checking out if you want a sampling from Down South.

29.description: Just as good as the original! This is the best fried chicken I have ever had, and all of the other reviews speak for themselves. Juicy chicken fried with a buttermilk batter that has just the right amount of kick. Great prices on food and full bar for the area. Fairly large seating area. A group of two can seat right away at most times. You might need to wait for a large table.

42.description: Wow, this is probably the juiciest, tastiest fried chicken I've ever had.  I had the spicy white meat chicken - it was just the right amount of spice.  The accompanying baked beans and cole slaw were just the right portion size and also very good.Prices, including wine/drinks, are reasonable.My only knock is that there is very limited parking in this part of the West Loop/Fulton Market area.  It is surrounded by warehouses where street parking isn't allowed.  We actually tried to go one night and ended up going somewhere else when we couldn't find parking within a few block radius.

23.description: My husband and I regularly go to Memphis mostly to eat at Gus's. We have been joking for years that we needed to beg them to let us franchise in Chicago. Then, it happened! Well, someone else convinced them, anyways. We've been in 3 times now and here's my best summary: absolutely delicious, just as good as Memphis... but more expensive. The fried pickles are what my dreams are made of. I absolutely love them. They're spears, not chips and that's what makes them perfection.The chicken is spicy. For me, that's a good thing. It's fried to perfection and the pieces are big. The mac and cheese is also very good. My kids inhaled it last time we were in. I can have sweet tea without leaving the state! But I go half sweet, half unsweetened. I can't hang with real sweet tea. Service is slow. The waitstaff are not in a hurry. It gets crowded. The first time we were in was 6pm on a Friday and it was PACKED.

47.description: Went in to place a to-go order.  I ordered chicken with macaroni and cheese, fried okra, greens, and French fries.  The chicken was very tasty and flavorful, but there sides were just okay.  They were bland and lacking flavor.  The service was poor as well.  The staff seemed slow and didn't have a sense of urgency.  I waited for about 10 minutes before I was even greeted and then an additional 30 minutes before I received my order. Next time I will order ahead and only get the chicken!

8.description: At the rate that West Loop is filling in with new eateries, no one who frequents that area will have a reason for complaining about what to sample. And a bit of Memphis has made its way up to Chicago and into the West Loop neighbourhood.Hell,, Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken.I ordered a plate of chicken, baked beans, fried okra, potato salad, and a slice of sweet potato pie. The chicken is spicy and I love that. The sides were good. The sweet potato pie was not quite a smooth/creamy as I have had it at the Memphis location, but I devoured it just the same.Great service. This is one of those restaurants where you order at the counter and then take a seat, after which your food is then brought out to you. I went shortly after the restaurant opened for business, so it was not quite stuffed to capacity. It's definitely worth checking out if you want a sampling from Down South.

31.description: Our group of 5 ordered the 16 (?) piece dark meat selection, but oddly enough, my brother-in-law bit into a breast with his first piece. Hmmm....The chicken was crisp and lightly battered. I liked that the batter had JUST a hint of spice. Clearly it wasn't enough for my dining guests since they doused their chicken with hot sauce. ;)Although the food is good (sides were generous and flavorful), if you have a heart for the Earth, this may not be your choice dining place. Think: styrofoam plates, styrofoam cups for drinks and sides, just styrofoam everywhere. The Green Fairy in me died a little that night.

34.description: Finally made it to Gus's.... so glad I did. The bartender on Thursday afternoon was great. The chicken, the beans and the slaw were perfect. Good beer selection.

16.description: Overall: Good fried chicken at a good price!The good: Great fried chicken. Crispy with a spicy under-flavor. Great moisture. Service was friendly and overall great. The atmosphere is cool, picnic-y feel with some flair. Full bar and TVs. Great music selection of older tunesThe bad: Our fried pickles app came out AFTER our main meals. Only big complaint. Small amounts of sidesAtmosphere:8/10Service: 7.5/10Food: 8/10

13.description: My husband and I regularly go to Memphis mostly to eat at Gus's. We have been joking for years that we needed to beg them to let us franchise in Chicago. Then, it happened! Well, someone else convinced them, anyways. We've been in 3 times now and here's my best summary: absolutely delicious, just as good as Memphis... but more expensive. The fried pickles are what my dreams are made of. I absolutely love them. They're spears, not chips and that's what makes them perfection.The chicken is spicy. For me, that's a good thing. It's fried to perfection and the pieces are big. The mac and cheese is also very good. My kids inhaled it last time we were in. I can have sweet tea without leaving the state! But I go half sweet, half unsweetened. I can't hang with real sweet tea. Service is slow. The waitstaff are not in a hurry. It gets crowded. The first time we were in was 6pm on a Friday and it was PACKED.

11.description: Chicago's first taste of the world famous fried chicken!Fried chicken is still the in thing for new restaurants in the city.  First opened in in October.  Prior to this outpost opening, I was willing to drive the 9-10 hrs all the way to Memphis for this chicken.   It is that good.   The best in the World. If you're in Memphis definitely try it!With this knowledge and experience in hand, I came across Gus's as I was just walking to another restaurant just one block away for a late lunch.   Once I saw the sign, my choice was made, Gus's it is!  It was completely packed for late lunch 1:20pm on a Saturday.  We were seated within 10mins though.  The staff is down to earth, attentive (almost like southern hospitality).  It's a simple menu, you come here for chicken and standard southern sides.  Price point is $3-4 per piece with a whole bird at $20.   Platters come with two sides, snacks come with white bread.  Be prepared to wait for your chicken ~15mins, they batter and drop only after you order.  The chicken is steaming hot when it arrives to your table.   Sweet tea is legit southern style and dangerous (scared to see my dentist next month!).  The restaurant offers full bar as well.  My original Memphis Gus's experience was spicier (sweat inducing), but this Chicago version was relatively mild.   Perhaps the server didn't mention I had an option...if there is a variance in spice level, I was not made aware of it.  In any case, you still get the steamy hot fried chicken with a skin so crispy you'll leap for joy.  Spice aside, its a good piece of chicken on crispyness alone. Try it with Crystal hotsauce and honey - now get messy!  I'd put hot sauce on absolutely everything. Kids meal is a good offer (2 legs and a side for $6.60). Located within a couple blocks of Morgan Green line.  Much better option than the 10hrs of i-57.

39.description: I'm from LA and the best fried chicken to me out there are Roscoes chicken and waffle and the fried chicken over at Disneyland. This place hands down owns both of those places combined. The flavoring on top of the perfect crunch was unbelievable. The seasoning wasn't too spicy but gave it enough flavor and kick, and the chicken itself was beyond juicy. I wish there was one closer to home, I would be there every week.

37.description: Unbelievable fried chicken. Sweet tea tastes like they trucked it up here from the South. Made me miss home!

0.description: My first time trying this place out! It was pretty good. Parking isn't the greatest, but after a couple of circles around, I eventually found a spot.Once inside, we were able to seat ourselves immediately, and greeted by our server. The food took an expected amount of time to arrive, and the portions are decent. I got the 3 piece white (should've gotten 2 pc, it was sooo much chicken) and Mac and greens. The sides weren't bad.  I really like the fact that they sell alcohol. The prices for everything are also reasonable, so those were pluses!3 meals, 4 mimosas, under $60!! Overall, it was a pleasant experience, and I'd definitely return for another!

38.description: Great restaurant the chicken was great and probably some of the best chicken I have had. Only problem is I think it's a little pricey for fried chicken.

51.description: Very good chicken, but a tad bit cold. Seemed pre fried. The greens and okra were also fantastic. Good service. I would say great service, except my diet coke was a regular coke. Also, pies aren't great. Just ok.

27.description: Picked up from Gus's on a weekday.  Food was ready in 10 minutes.  Everything I ate was amazingly delicious. Ordered the white pieces and there was so much meat on the bones (unlike some other fried chicken places in the area).  Batter was on the spicy side, but manageable.  The Cole slaw and beans that come with the dinner were the bomb! Also tried out the sweet potato pie- if you like pumpkin pie spices this would be great for you and the crust was magic!

32.description: Hands down best fried chicken I've ever had! Better than the famous Prince's Hot Chicken from Nashville! Served fresh out of the fryer, the skin is so crispy and the spices/seasoning adds a nice kick. And the meat inside is the juiciest ever! The sides are great as well and they make a mean old-fashioned (full bar). Everyone working here is super friendly with great attitude. Overall, a wonderful dining experience!

54.description: this place was great.  it wasn't too crowded so we were seated, right away.  i ordered the fried pickles and the fried green tomatoes.  the pickles were okay, the tomatoes - delicious.  i also had the fried chicken, mac n cheese, and beans.   it was all-around amazing.  the breading on the chicken is very light and spicy.  it was different than a lot of other fried chicken i had.  the chess pie - bomb.com.   service was great.  our waitress was on top of things, friendly, and gave great recommendations.  i will definitely come back.

48.description: Soooo, the chicken doesn't disappoint, it's delicious. I grew up outside of Memphis, TN and visited the original Gus's Chicken in Mason, TN several times. I also visited the 2nd location in downtown Memphis a few times. The Chicago Gus's is true to the original, from the chicken recipe to the atmosphere. However, I do appreciate the cleanliness/atmosphere of the Chicago restaurant. It's true to the original Gus's "vibe", but much more inviting if you want to eat in.I have to admit, the lackluster customer service made my experience start off on a slightly sour note. I called in my order,with an expectation to not have to wait when I picked it up. I arrived 20 minutes later and still had to wait 15 minutes for them to prepare my order???? Soooo, what's the point of taking phone orders?? The place had just opened and there was 1 couple eating in when I arrived, so the restaurant wasn't busy. No explanation or apology was given, the cashier just let me wait, then handed me my food.

44.description: This was downright delicious!! The service was excellent and the entire staff were very friendly and welcoming. The chicken is drop dead tasty and I couldn't get enough!! The starters from the fried pickles, to the fried green tomatoes, to the fried okra were out of this world!! I am definitely coming back to this place again and again and again!!

24.description: Stopped in not long before closing time. Ben was awesome. Definitely one of the best fried chicken meals that I have had in my life. Just the right hint of heat (meaning spice) to it. WOW! The Mac N Cheese was incredible. The Slaw was perfect. The beans were awesome! and yes...i ordered the greens too! and they were damn good! (not better than your's Dex) I recommend everyone give it a try. A great meal without all the fuss! Ben even joked that the "meatballs" were good. What meatballs? This is a chicken joint. I'm gonna leave that one alone. Right!!  Seriously....put this one on the list for sure! You will not be disappointed.

7.description: Located in the west loop Fulton Market.Free street parking.I love fried chicken but I tend to stay away from it to somewhat try to be healthy if you know what I mean. When I saw that Gus's was opening near us I knew I had to give a try. We got the 8 piece dark special, large greens, medium mac and cheese and fried pickles. Like, how is the skin of the chicken so crispy and the meat is so tender?? And the skin had some heat to it which made it even better. We decided the chicken is worth returning for but the sides? eh.

49.description: Amazing! Coming from Memphis this is right on point! Food made to order, great customer service clean!!! I had sweet tea mixed with lemonade- Amazing! And I ordered the 3 tenders with slaw and beans..... Ugh!

40.description: Gus's, we meet again! I've been to the Gus's location by the bluffs in downtown Memphis, last year, on my son's spring break actually. It's not divey, as others have said- it's basic, but quite a normal restaurant in an up and coming area with great service and kick ass fried chicken- the best I've ever had, actually. Gus's in the West Loop had the same great service I experienced in Memphis. And since it's a brand new place, there are some nice touches like refurbished wood and a long section of counter/bar seating. Is it fancy? Definitely not, just new. Came here with my son to retest the waters, and met Dan G. as well. No line, no waiting at 11:30 but if you're driving here for lunch, expect tight parking around here. Got the two piece meal and the chicken was great (but not as great as when in Memphis, for some reason, my son agreed). Still, it was a good meal in a nice atmosphere, service was top notch, and I really liked this place. I'll definitely return often.

53.description: Crispy, fresh and juicy friend chicken made our weekend better. It was a little bit salty, but it was a good balance with side dishes that were sweet.

30.description: I've been to the original in Memphis and I was worried that the food here would not live up to the real deal.  The food is on par here and the service was great. The decor fits into the Fulton Market neighborhood, yet still has a Memphis vibe. The only thing that was off putting was the club music that was blaring. It was hard to talk over the music, but the food was so good that it didn't really matter. This is a must if you're in the mood for some hot chicken.

46.description: Pretty decent fried chicken. Probably better than Popeyes but nowhere near as good as other local Chicago fried chicken spots, most notably Parson's Chicken and Fish in Logan Square. Parsons is definitely spicier and much more flavorful. This place is only really worth it if you're already in the area. But not worth trekking more than a couple blocks for. Pricing: $15.50 for 4 pieces of fried chicken and 2 small sides served on a plastic plate. $7 for 5 pieces of a very average fried green tomatoes appetizer. Not terribly expensive, but I do think it's a bit overpriced for the level of quality and bare bones decor / silverware.

1.description: This review is well overdue as I have patronized the Chicago Gus's 3 times now.  I've also been to the Memphis location, which serves the chicken the same way, on styrofoam plate with bread, beans and coleslaw as the default sides.  Post industrial venue with excellent brews and great blues music to accompany your quick taste of the South.The service is excellent, and the fried chicken is preeminent.  Best fried chicken in the city is right here in Fulton Market.  I have enjoyed all the staff here, but have to give a shout out to Q who took great care of my boyfriend and I last week.  He was busy and working hard at the lunch time rush hour, but kept our drinks full.  Mine never even got past half full!I liked the baked beans and coleslaw the best, but my boyfriend prefers the mac 'n cheese and greens-I tried as well, also delicious, but the sides aren't really important because the chicken is the MVP here.

55.description: Probably the best fried chicken I've ever had. Perfectly spiced and salted. The sides were a little small and the prices were pretty inflated, but I'd go back for the wings again. Ordered the coconut pie, it was actually quite awful. I ate it bc I paid $3 or $4 for it, then I regretted it bc it so was not worth the calories. Wouldn't get dessert there again but damn that was good chicken.

9.description: I grew up an hour from Memphis, but Gus and I didn't have the chance to meet until we both ended up in Chicago. And boy, I'm so glad we did.This is, without a doubt, the best fried chicken in Chicago. Unlike so many others that are thickly battered, greasy, and fatty, Gus's fried chicken is light, crisp, flavorful, and moist.No gross, flubby skin sloughing off the chicken here, folks!I also love the atmosphere, which is casual but fun. Wide open. Clean. Not greasy and grimy like you might expect of a fried chicken joint.The okra and fried green tomatoes were both good--but not fantastic. They need some kind of sauce aside from the bottled ranch, which wasn't so tasty. Wish they made some homemade sauce!The chicken dinner, though, was FANTASTIC. Even my wife, who doesn't love fried chicken as much as I do, was impressed.It's flavorful--must be brined. And spicy!
