The way she folded her foils should have been a dead give away that she was incompetent. Huge mistake on my part for not listening to my gut instinct  to get up and leave. Once we washed out the bleach, the "highllights" were rusty orange and other parts were bleach blonde. I freaked out !! I had my jacket on and ready to walk out when she told me she still had to put the toner on. Once again, I sat down. Stupid me. The toner grabbed on to my virgin hair and turned it redish with a pinkish hue and those "highlights" stayed rusty orange. I refused to let this imbecile cut my hair. I got my jacket on and asked to speak to the manager/owner, Sasha. She did nothing to rectify the situation. She said since Keke rents the chair, she's not really her boss. How ridiculous !! I paid for the color and left. Left to the East Bank Club Salon were they neutralized the hair color and was given a proper haircut. NEVER WILL I EVER VISIT SALON CHICK AGAIN !!! MY HAIR WAS RUINED !!!!

0.description: For a long time I had been visiting many salons in the Chicagoland area, but for the past year I have been coming back over again to Salon Chick  and I am not planning to trade it for any other salons I've ever known. Modern, pleasant ambiance, and very friendly and professional staff. I have been getting lots of compliments for my hair color and style done by Marta, hairstylist, and the best ever pedicure with pretty designs done by Alexandra.  I always feel welcome and get an excellent customer service during my visits. I strongly recommend this salon for all the beauty services it offers. Come and check it out yourself, and I assure you, you won't be disappointed.  Mariana

7.description: This review is for Ivona at SalonChick.  I bought a Groupon on Tuesday, and called Wednesday to schedule an appointment. She was able to schedule me for that Friday. I absolutely LOVED my cut and blow dry!!!!! She did exactly what I asked for. I have never been happier with a haircut! Thanks Ivona!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: Grabbed a groupon special and it was the BEST massage I've ever had in my life! My massage was with EVA. She asked me where my problem areas were and specifically worked on those problem areas until they weren't problems anymore. The best part about it was she still had some time to complete the massage and I didn't feel shorted at all. The massage was so great I have booked 4. For those interested in a total spa experience they offer that as well.

1.description: My husband and I had massages from Maria today and they were excellent - some of the best we've ever had. Maria was especially good with the upper back and feet. I've had massages from chain massage places like Massage Envy all the way up to $1,000 spa packages and the quality of this massage is top rank. This isn't your full service spa with a relaxation room, steam rooms, slippers, robes, and other amenities, but if you are looking for a less-expensive but fantastic massage in a well-decorated but quaint atmosphere, then this is your place! I cross-checked all the massage Groupon offerings with Yelp, and this place was the clear winner. Although it doesn't have a ton of reviews, all of them are glowing - and for good reason!They sometimes have two massage therapists in the office, but I think that was just Thursdays at the time we were booking. Therefore, if you are two people you might have to take the massages in sequence, but it's worth the wait! There's a groupon for $49 for a 60 minute massage. I think if you call and ask they will honor the groupon price without having to purchase it.I highly recommend Maria and Lotus Touch to anyone!

0.description: I have been here a few times for a full body deep tissue massage. Maria is more than kind professional, and good at her trade. I left feeling relaxed, less stressed out, and ready to book my next appointment. I highly recommend her for her excellence at her craft, kindness, and professionalism.

2.description: Highly skilled massage therapy.The deep tissue massage is excellent.Very zen space.One of the most professional massage environmentsI have experienced in many years.Glad I found them.

5.description: AMAZING! Wonderful staff, very friendly, helpful and thorough. I arrived on time and they were ready. I got the groupon for the 30 minute foot massage. This was heavenly! I run quite often and this was exactly what I needed. I had the pleasure of having Maria and she was very professional and hit all the right spots. Before I left, I bought another and made another appointment not just for myself but for two other girlfriends as well. I will gladly return and become a frequent customer.

6.description: I have dealt with chronic neck problems for the past few years. Shera was my massage therapist, and did an amazing deep tissue massage with neck stretches that left me feeling like a brand new person when I left! I had been once before for a Swedish massage with Maria, it was so relaxing that I fell asleep. The room is tranquil and welcoming, I definitely recommend Lotus Touch whether it be for clinical massage or just to relax.

7.description: On my first visit to Lotus Touch, I received a 60 minute Swedish massage and a foot scrub. Both were heavenly. Maria was my therapist and she was excellent! Technique, pressure and manipulation were all on point. Give yourself a treat.

8.description: Today I had the most amazing massage by the massage therapist Maria at Lotus Touch. The atmosphere was very relaxing and calming. Maria was extremely polite, gentle and informative. Her technique was great and I made sure I scheduled my next massage before I left. The total experience exceeded my expectations and I can't wait to go back.

9.description: Had the most amazing massage by Maria earlier this week! The room is designed beautifully with a great Zen feel. The smells of the oils and lotions she used were heavenly and her technique for massaging was amazing! All of this together made an amazing experience! I loved it so much I had my boyfriend set up an appointment with her today and he absolutely loved it too! We will definitely be back!

10.description: Maria was great! I had a Hot Stone massage today, it was very soothing, it's been around 7 hours since I left and I still feel as if she just finished!!! Awesome hospitality and professionalism Will Go Again

4.description: I was lucky enough to get a massage from Maria as a gift from a close friend. The atmosphere was relaxing and comfortable, and Maria made the experience one to remember! I can't wait to go back and get more massages in the future!

12.description: I really wanted to love this place, and looked forward to my trip back here for a haircut in the future...... Unfortunately, my Brazillian Blow Out didn't even last a week! My frizz and waves are all back like I hadn't gotten a blow out at all! Such a shame :( Benito seemed very knowledgable with his techniques he was extremely informative on the products. But the outcome wasn't nearly as exciting as I had anticipated...........

3.description: CUSTOMERS BEWARE - I fell victim to the dreaded BAIT AND SWITCH and my hair suffered for it!!I purchased a Groupon for a deep conditioning, haircut and blow dry to this salon. I called ahead and booked an appointment with Benito (I specifically requested him). When I arrived Benito walked me in but then passed me off to an inexperienced stylist (she mentioned having recently completed beauty school). Benito then proceeded to sit in a corner of the room flipping through a magazine. I explained that I wanted a fairly simple cut (even in the back with some face-framing layers). The newbie stopped several times during the cut and acted confused; Benito barked some orders and she continued chopping. Just when I thought the experience couldn't get any more unprofessional and uncomfortable, the newbie attempted the worst blow dry I have ever experienced. Not only did she pull out chunks of my hair with her bumbling brush maneuvers, she also hit my scalp several times with a flat iron. The torture resulted in a frizzy, puffy mess on my head that was part "I stuck my finger in a socket" and part bride of Frankenstein. To round off SoHo's "cheating the customer" experience, the newbie did NOT deep condition my hair (which was supposed to be included in the Groupon). Instead she stuck some cheap leave-in garbage in my hair, hoping I had been previously lobotomized and wouldn't notice the difference.Moral of the story - AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!

1.description: I usually dread haircuts because I hate the salon environments...but Soho Atelier was a welcomed break from the norm! The salon, while clean and professional, had a much more casual vibe in a really cool building.  The area itself is a little sketchy, but the interior didn't reflect that at all.  Sarah was awesome! Super personal and gave me a great haircut.  I used a Groupon, so it was an amazing deal for a haircut. The only real complaint I had was some confusion scheduling and difficulty contacting the salon. The salon has two locations-- one of which is in Michigan.  It was a little confusing trying to figure out which salon I had actually booked online with.  But they called and cleared everything up within a few hours.  Just be careful if you book online :)

2.description: In love with Soho. I first came here from a groupon I got for a Brazilian blowout with Sara. I recently moved from Los Angeles and needed a new salon. Sara did a fantastic job on the blowout, exactly what I was used to and wanted. Perfect and saves me plenty of time in the morning. Sara has also done my cut and color since and I am always extremely pleased! Benito is also a rock star and makes sure I always leave happy and with beautiful hair :) I would definitely recommend this place!

9.description: I found this place when I was desperate for a haircut and found them through groupon. I called and Sydney was able to get me in that day. My hair was very much past due for a haircut. I have very long hair and it's tough to make it do anything except be straight and heavy. Sydney gave me a fantastic dry cut that has given me tons of body and movement, yet I was able to keep the length I love. She was also very knowledgeable about the products and explained what she was using and why. After working for a few salons and being on a hiatus from a regular stylist because I just couldn't find someone whose style I liked and that I gelled with, I will definitely be coming back!

10.description: I walked into Soho Atelier with fried over-processed light blonde hair, with an orangey brown bottom layer, and an ash medium brown 2 inch strip of outgrowth at my root. I also had a hatchet job haircut that looked like I did myself with kitchen scissors after I got drunk (I didn't! I paid a lot for that haircut in Lincoln Park).I showed Benito a few pictures on Pinterest of the wavy ombre Sarah Jessica Parker hair of my dreams.He comes across almost gruff at first because he's a business man, and you can tell he treats making people look good as a very serious business. As it turns out he is not gruff or serious all the time. He's lovely, fun, and funny. My hair was such a project that I saw a few other of his clients come and go while I was processing and what not. He's super fast without ever compromising quality. Everybody left looking way better than when they walked in.I got a complete hair make-over. He did the color exactly like one of the pictures I showed him. He fixed my hair cut, so it looks awesome now, but will effortlessly grow out exactly the way I want it. He did an express Brazilian blow-out, and my frizzy damaged hair looks totally different. It looks healthy!I feel super pretty. I have that awesome feeling like I just got a new present that I love.

4.description: Benito IS Edward Scissor Hands! He is amazing with cuts. I have friends who have traveled up to 5 hours for his haircuts for years and when I heard he was finally just blocks from me I gave him a try. His specialty is Brazilian Blowouts and I tried it the first time I saw him. It was incredible. I didn't need a flatiron for months! He's also done amazing things with my color too. The only downside is that cloning isn't legal. We need more Benito's in the world! Lol. He splits his time between Holland Michigan and Chicago. His schedule is great for me since my days off are usually at the beginning of the week and it's rare to find a (good) salon open on Sundays and Mondays. If you can work around Benito's crazy schedule you will NOT be disappointed!

6.description: I was very disappointed in my color service that I went to Sally's and dyed over it the next day.  Knowing how dry my hair was, they decided putting bleach in my hair would get me the color I wanted. Terrible terrible mistake. Now my ends are just fried and keep falling off. A week before this, I was in to get low lights. Since I dyed my hair black previously they had to strip the color before putting in color. It came out to be a light brown/red color and Benito told me to come back in to get it toned/lightened-free of charge. The following week after several phone calls, one voicemail, and no call back I decide to just drop by.  They were not answering their phone, even trough the dial pad outside the building--I only got in because someone was walking out. I walked in and reminded him that he said I could get it toned, where he replied saying "toning won't work we'll have to bleach it." Without me knowing how terrible It would be for my hair I agreed. I was charged $80 for something that ruined my hair! Not only was it damaging, it was chunky and a yellow/orange brassy color. So disappointing. I put blonde in my hair last summer at a different salon and it turned out fine and not damaged. Sadly, I liked my cut the first time but will not be returning because of the color service and because of how hard it was to get ahold of them.

0.description: I really enjoyed my visit to SoHo. First, I had a car issue which got me 20 minutes late to me appointment but the owner promised to wait 30 mins before he would leave since I was his last client. When I got there, I was confused on how to get in but when I called the owner thought I was calling to tell him I was going to be even later and that he wouldn't stay. Since he sent that in a text, I couldn't get him on the phone I just figured out how to get up to the salon by myself. Parked right in front of the building, no problem, but then I had to be buzzed in, someone was leaving so I just snuck in, Inside, it's more clear. By the elevator the business names and floors are listed so I made my way up to the third floor and wandered around until I found the salon. After the difficulty getting inside, me running late and having a groupon, I prepared for a bad visit. I got the opposite. B (the owner) was friendly, talkative, and passionate about his businesses. I chopped 14 inches of my hair, which he straightened and measured so the hair could be used by others for extensions. Such a drastic cut didn't freak me out because he angled and styled it in a way that suits my face and is easy for a girl like me to pull off since I can't style hair.Everyone says my hair look better now and think with or without the groupon this place is a find.

5.description: I used a groupon that my friend gave me.  I requested on my reservation for Sydney because of the great reviews she had on yelp.  Love my haircut by Sydney!!!  I can't wait to come back for my next one.

13.description: I had a really great experience here. Finding my way into the building was a little confusing, but once you get inside the salon, it feels totally hip and professional. Benito is very sweet and gave me a really terrific cut, explaining what he was doing every step of the way. I found my way here via Groupon, but for once the Groupon scheme actually works - I will gladly return and pay full price.

11.description: I met Sydney Williams through a groupon when my stylist was unable to do my hair.  She trimmed, conditioned and styled thus leaving me with lush, sexy hair!  She is my new go-to girl and does a mean Brazilian blowout! Check out Soho Atelier and book with Sydney Williams!

8.description: I purchased a Groupon for the Brazilian Blowout Treatment.   I absolutely loved my service, Benito (what a treat!), Gunther (his dog-so cute and well behaved!) and the results (smoothe 'Victoria Secret' Hair.)  I can't wait to try him for a haircut- he gave me the most incredible, effortless blowdry.  It's been 3 months since my service  and  my hair is still extra smoothe! You can't beat that... Although the space itself is this gorgeous, industrial-urban design, it's a bit of a hike for me.  That's my ONLY downfall which has NOTHING to do with his skills or expertise (THAT IS 5 STARS WORTHY!), It was just farther than im used to traveling. I guess I can put that aside for Benito though :)

14.description: Benitzio (sorry If I spelled that wrong) is amazing! He cut my hair and styled it and I think it might be the best hair cut I've ever had. Next time I will go for a brazillian low out!

7.description: What a superb experience! From the moment I walked in, Benito made me feel very comfortable and gave me full attention  (even in a late evening Saturday appointment). He has over 15 years of experience and have worked with top celebrity hairstylists around the world and performed in hair shows across the U.S. His energy is contagious and his talent outstanding! I got a haircut as I never had in Chicago and I'll definitely be returning! West Town is very lucky to have such a hipster salon and amazing hairstylist!

12.description: I went there today to get a turkey and a duck to smoke for Thanksgiving this year.Robert Heinlein once wrote that an example of a "man with unintegrated values" is one "who eats meat but would rather somebody else did the butchering."  This is only one step removed from that--you walk into the store and the smell is what you'd expect when there are a large number of live animals waiting to be turned into food.  You're offered the opportunity to look your "prey" in the eye and approve its "termination with extreme prejudice".  Deal with it, or become a veggie.That said, it's the ultimate in fresh food for the carnivore or omnivore.  Chicken, duck, goose, turkey, rabbit--heck, they had *quail* for only $3/each.  (I'll warn you--they're all eyeing you with extreme suspicion.  I think the rabbits really know what's going on...)  They'll slaughter, clean, dress, and pack it for you quickly, at a remarkably low price.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that I have yet to prepare and devour my critters; I have every expectation that it's going to be excellent.When I expressed some curiosity concerning how they got such a quick featherless bird, the owner offered to take me in the back.  I accepted, and am glad I did.  Yes, it stinks, and the floor is wet--they clearly wash it down frequently, and the aroma is certainly from the live animals, which are kept out of the processing area.  The equipment looked clean, and it's as humane as such a process can be.Oh, and someone commented about them being packed into cages--yes, most are.  But at the rate I saw customers coming and going, I'm sure they're not there long.  There were also some chickens and ducks wandering around loose--I figure they got out when someone opened a cage--and I did comment to them, "If I were you, the door is *that way*.  Make a break for it..."I intend to go back--those quail are too tempting.  (Sorry, birds--that's what being a top predator means.)ADDENDUM: I ate the birds.  They were Very Good.  This is a definite go-to.

7.description: I've been in this joint twice now & love it! There are bunnies hopping about & animals that are clearly in excellent health. My friend purchased a live chicken for me last summer; she got 2 days in chicken heaven before I slaughtered my first non-marine animal. She was delicious! The shop owners are extremely friendly helpful & knowledgeable about butchering humanely. Will be shopping here again soon!

3.description: For anyone who thinks it's "jarring" to see your food before you eat it, you might want to stick to vegetables. Fred and Wally are super friendly shop keepers and make the (intimidating) process of buying, butchering, and cooking a formerly live chicken as easy as possible. You can select sizes or individual birds, get your poultry prepared or take home a whole hen - with or without feet. The chickens look different than a grocery store chicken because they're not weighted down by oversized breasts, and they taste different too. They're so much better and fresher! Hard to believe people would leave Yelp reviews about a place without actually sampling the product. Other pluses: - Capons and turkeys at holidays - Fresh, super cheap, organic eggs - Quail eggs (if you're into that) Support a neighborhood business, eat well, and save money. What more could ya want?

1.description: I needed a whole fresh chicken for this recipe and I had no clue where to. What do you do in this case?? Turn to yelp. After reading some great reviews I decided to go in and check it out. Wow was I in for a treat. Never before I have I picked out a alive chicken and then moments later ended up in a grocery bag.When you first go in, the place doesn't look like much just some refrigerator s full of eggs, fish etc. But then you notice the clucking of the chickens in their cages! The gentlemen asked med or large. Next thing you know a live chicken is on a scale breathing his last breath. 5 mins later he was in a bag ready for consumption!! Wow was he delicious! The only downside was the cleanliness of the shop, it looked really rundown and kind unsanitary but then again you are running a mini chicken slaughter house in the city.

2.description: I called in a pickup order for three medium chickens, butchered in pieces, no heads. $28 bucks for everything. We were 40 minutes late picking them up, and they kept the birds on ice for us. Thank You very much!

9.description: There is slaughter of live animals in the middle of a  major urban area occurring here. No, they don't practice santeria here but you can get some rather fresh chicken here.I admit I am used to getting my chicken on a plastic tray wrapped in plastic wrap. My parents used to patronize places like this when I was a kid. Sunday was always homemade chicken soup day. The things I remember is 1) the smell, and, 2) the sound of the chicken being slaughtered. The place does  have a barnyard aroma to it which is to be expected. You order your chicken live and it is weighed and then slaughtered.The chickens are billed as organic Amish birds. The proprietors are middle eastern and the service is pleasant. A middle sized chicken is about eleven bucks.

10.description: Saturday afternoon. Live chicken. Owner is friendly and we chatted for a bit while chicken is slaughtered and cleaned.Muslim owner, muslim butcher I asked if the chicken were zabiha. Yes. And they told us which farms they got their chickens from.Price is not any more expensive than grocery store like Dominics or Jewel, if not cheaper. $1.69 a pound. I did not see any already butchered whole chicken in the display case, just parts, feet and stuff. Mostly things that people did not want. They'll freshly slaughter the chicken per request.we asked what to do with feet and he told us we could make soup. Now I remembered that's how my grandma used to put chicken feet in soup. The owner also gave tips about working with fresh chicken, you have to let it sit, chill to relax the muscles its best to cook it the day after or after at least 2 hrs refrigeration.They also have eggs, quails, ducks, rabbits, and around festivities, turkey.Overall I am a big fan and I should come more often. It's hard to justify a trip just for chicken, I wish they had meat, too.

13.description: Get live poultry here. No fresher than that!! Chicken on this date was $1.99 lb. They will prep your purchase however you prefer...just let them know first. If you can't stand strong poultry odors, this place is not for you. But, if you like fresh and juicy...when cooked right that is, this place is for you. Just bring a clothes pin for your nose.

16.description: This chicken is delicious, organic and CHEAP!

17.description: My mother has been going by alliance poultry since i was a little kid . Now i am  26 and me and my wife and our 2 year old take a visit from Orland park to the poultry shop . All the chickens are Amish bread , they have rabbits , ducks , geese , quails , sometimes fish  , turkey on thanksgiving , and every now and then, they get some funny looking chickens and pigeons , I only order chicken from there , and every thanksgiving i get 2 turkeys , 1 for me , and 1 for my in-laws . The price for chicken is around $1.69lb . Its a little more then jewel or Dominick but to me , theirs no price on healthy organic food . You will taste a difference in there chicken , In the other post Elaine H posted they didn't have any chickens , I always find chicken when i go there , once on thanksgiving day i was late on buying a turkey and they didn't have any left . So now i always buy a day early , because fresh chicken like that needs to sit on ice for at least 3 hours before you cook it or else it will be tough to chew . I gave alliance 5 stars based on there great friendly atmosphere , there product of course , and of course healthy Amish chicken , Also , on the Jewish holiday they have a rabbi come in and butcher the chickens because they don't sell pork . And Jews don't eat pork , so it works out for them . Also for Muslims there is a Muslim butcher always on duty there . And of course for Christians there's always a christian butcher there also . So everyone wins .

15.description: I only get my chicken from here now.  Anyone that doesn't is just crazy.  It is the freshest chicken you can get in the city.  Upon walking in you state the size of chicken that you would like.  They then pick a live chicken for you to approve and proceed to clean and butcher the meat to your specifications.  It is some of the juiciest and flavorful chicken I have ever had and its cheaper than going to Jewel or Dominicks.  Don't be afraid to walk in and let Sam or Fred serve you up a great bird.

0.description: Allow me to step off my soap box and say this place scared me, but I plan to be a long time customer. So I was a chain store grocery shopper. After finally getting fed up with the quality and price of Jewel, the hunt began for better meat. This place was close, promised high quality, had low prices and most importantly wasn't Jewel. I rolled over on Sunday and found easy parking on Chicago Ave. Street parking is free on Sunday, so I felt like today was going to be my day. Then I walked into this place and the shoulder high counter made no effort to conceal the floor to ceiling chickens. The chickens are in cages stacked against a very visible wall.Okay, time to put my big girl pants on. I walk to the counter and the man asked me what I wanted. At that moment a chicken clucked and my big girl pants fell off. I humblely told him this was my first visit. He asked if I wanted " big or small." I said small. He then disappeared into the chicken wall and returned with a bird squawking and squirming beneath his grip. He weighed the bird and told me the price.He asked if I wanted the head and feet. I nearly tripped over my big girl pants in terror. I said no. He I nodded in agreement and the next time I saw the bird it was in a plastic bag. That's right. He gutted, plucked, and diced the bird into pieces within minutes. The entire experience took no more than 15 minutes and cost me 8.60. While I was nervous because shit got real real, I must say the chicken was delicious! Way better than the frozen bags. Way better than that rib meat added shit. Keep in mind the bag will be hot as the chicken was alive mere moments ago. Your nose may be a bit hot from the smell, but if you are a meat eater you aren't going to beat the service or the price. I hope going forward they list the price per pound, but I am coming back either way!

5.description: This place stinks. Like, really stinks. When the temperature is pleasant and the wind is just right, I get a nice noseful of rotten chicken. The stench is heavy and hangs in the air. It's so bad in the spring/summer I have to keep my windows shut if there is a breeze. I like the idea of fresh chickens in the city, but it really sucks being near this place.(Not to mention, it seems to attract an unusually large group of rats in the alley. Freaking gross.)Isn't there some city regulation about stuff like this?

11.description: Wanna become a vegetarian quick?Ask to tour the back of this joint!Walking through shit and retching at the ammonia stench of fowl waste is a nasty thing.  Do yourself a favor and see where your food comes from and show your kids.I'm not knocking Alliance, the whole eating meat thing is just nasty.  That said, I still do it and came here to get some rabbits slaughtered for a meal with my friends.They were out but had chickens, guinea hens and turkeys that they would slaughter on the spot.We went for a tour.  It was gross.So yeah, haven't successfully eaten anything from this place but it is a definite trip.Check it out!

8.description: Incredible staff and great livestock.We get our turkeys from here every year for Thanksgiving.Pricier than a frozen one but a billion-times better taste and whatever.Also, it really makes you appreciate meat and where it comes from. The owner is completely open about the farms they ship from and it's far much better than mass-processed poultry.

4.description: Hey. They have fresh live chickens, turkeys, and ducks for sale for food. You buy them, they snuff them, you stuff them. Capische.

14.description: It's pretty jarring to see so many live chickens right in West Town.  Not really what you expect to see in a major American metropolitan area. I should first make the disclaimer that I have not actually eaten the chicken from this place, so my review is not based on the food itself.  The one time we went in, it was just to inquire about the prices ($1.69 a pound), and they only had one butchered chicken available.  The second time, my boyfriend actually went to purchase one because we were having guests over for dinner, and they didn't have *any* available. So, I guess staying stocked is not their strong point?There is, however, an abundance of live chickens which presumably eventually get butchered and sold, though not on demand. This is where I'm feeling kind of torn.  My understanding is that a freshly butchered chicken is orders of magnitude better than what you can get at the supermarket.  On top of that, I'd sooner eat one butchered here in a small local business using old fashioned methods rather than in some massive scary processing plant hundreds of miles away.  At the same time, the store touts that they sell poultry that is both "organic" and "Amish."  If you've seen an Amish farm, you know that the animals are generally raised quite humanely in farms that look like picture book farms, and not in giant mechanized facilities. And of course, everyone loves organic, right?  So this is why it troubles me that the live chickens here are crowded into stacks and stacks of cages with the chickens practically on top of each other (think lobster tank) behind the counter.  There certainly isn't outdoor access or sunlight or anything you would associate with a humanely raised animal.  And just because the animals might have been sourced from an organic farm doesn't necessarily mean that they're receiving organic feed once or humane conditions in the store. Are they still organic then?  Do they arrive at the store as chicks or full-grown? How long are they in these conditions?  Anyway, like I said, I'm torn because organic, Amish chicken butchered locally is better than commercially produced poultry for so many reasons, and yet somehow the store doesn't seem to be living up to its promises.If I get the opportunity to purchase from there, I'll write an update.

6.description: I live in the near west suburbs but made the trip here to have my 3 backyard egg laying hens "readied" for the stock pot. Friendly service and as clean as a poultry shop in the city can be. I would definitely bring my chickens here again.Regarding some other reviews of the cleanliness of the back room, all I can say is that I went back to see my chickens butchered and I don't think anything was unusual.  The floor is wet, there is blood on it, and it smells like animals because they are in the room next door.  I'm pretty sure that they kill and process animals here so I don't think that anyone should expect to be eating off the floor.

1.description: Easy, fast, friendly, and open late!

0.description: I've used Saucey regularly in California and had the opportunity of trying it out in Chicago. It was my first time seeing snow and I decided to take photos until my phone didn't register my fingers. It was time to warm up with some whiskey... no wine... okay both. My friend suggested using another app, so we bet on which one would arrive faster. Loser pays for everything. I won by 15 minutes and demanded him to Venmo me my winnings. #suckaThe experience was identical to CA and I found a tag with a quote that I've never seen before (Saucey puts tags on each order with a fun quote on the back). It was something like "Roses are red, so is wine. Poems are hard. Wine." I die every time I think of it. I have to say, I'm a busy ass man... and I have better things to do than walk around a grocery store asking a manager to unlock the whiskey section. It's really neat when they slap your hands for reaching for a bottle and then ask for what you want. Are you serious? I'm a 30 year old man and I want the bottle I was reaching for... Suck it grocery-store-manager, I have an app for that.
